title: Worst hotel ever. DON’T  BOOK THIS HOTEL
text: The hotel is a disaster. Rooms are so small you have to walk sideways. The grout in the bathroom was moldy and the shower flooded the bathroom. The breakfast was a joke. 300 rooms and very few tables and the food looked terrible. . We were forced to go out and pay for our breakfast. Room cleaning 5:00 pm after multiple calls. Management was indifferent to our complaints. The gave us a handful of Hilton Honors points for compensation enough for a cup of coffee. We’ve stayed at multiple Embassy Suites and always had a nice stay.

title: Just book it!
text:
The  front desk was friendly and accommodating. Davely was helpful and friendly. Great front desk crew. 
We checked in early and the room was ready. 
The only area needing a better system is the breakfast. It was confusing and guest running around with their food looking for seating and guest waiting bunched up for their omelette. 
Overall great location, clean hotel, and friendly staff.

title: Muy buena elección.
text: Hotel excelente,buenas instalaciones y personal 10 puntos,llegamos antes de la hora para nuestro check,y nos dieron nuestra habitacion anticipada,lo cual fue formidable ya que llevavamos mas de  15 horas viajando.Excelente ubicación,habitacion muy cómoda,la verdad quedamos muy conformes, con nuestra elección.Sra.Yolanda que nos atendió, a nuestra llegada, se merece toda nuestra gratitud.

title: Is that really Hilton standard?
text:
We were very disappointed with the service we received. Rooms are small but comfortable yet the service is poor. Finding a table for breakfast is not very likely no matter what time you go downstairs. The queues to literally one toaster for that large a hotel were huge, eating standing up was a norm. Overall the hotel doesn't provide a 4-star rating while changing for it. The staff was mostly unfriendly, verging on rude. The only great service with a smile we received was from the reception and one person clearing plates from tables during breakfast. 
We would not recommend the hotel especially if you find somewhere else at a similar price.

title: Excelente lugar para vivir la experiencia 10/10
text:
Si estás pensando visitar NY deberías considerar hospedarte en Embassy Suites By Hilton NY.

El lugar está cerca de Times Square, sus instalaciones son muy cómodas, la cama es muy cómoda cuando necesitas descansar.

El desayuno incluido es siempre muy completo para que salgas con toda la energía a conocer la ciudad.

title: Not quite 5star rating
text:
Mostly positives with one or two negatives.  
The hotel was in a great spot.  Handy for Broadway, Times Square, 5th Avenue and shopping. Also not too far from subways so basically great spot for reaching everything.  
Room one was a good size King Room. Room 2 was the junior suite with a pretty decent sized  double sofa bed. (Family of 4) 

Downside - room 2 was a little cramped. Both rooms lacked decent storage for clothes etc. 
Bathrooms in both rooms had broken plugs. King room had chipped sink, black marks on the side and an odd square of paper on wall as a patch up job. Still liveable though and clean.

Breakfast is buffet style but could do with more choices.  Plus for 300 rooms and only about 30 tables, they really need a bigger dining area or at least on 2 floors. We went at different times each day and struggled to get a seat every day regardless of the time guides in the elevator. 

Staff however were great. Mercedes was an angel when we were missing some of our dinner order. We may have confused them when we ordered 3 burgers and a chicken sandwich though for one room of 2, but I was taking 2 meals for kids in their room (18 & 21- not toddlers on their own) She very quickly resolved this and was such a lovely person. Kudos Mercedes. 

Would I stay here again. Yes but just as a base. Only cos we were pleased with the size of the king room, location for price and staff attitude.

title: New York City Manhattan  Embassy Suites April 2024
text: This hotel is in good proximity of Times Square, Broadway Theaters and JP Morgan Library/Museum. We received excellent customer service from Front Desk staff Luis and Dinu, and 4th floor reception staff member Caesar, who oversaw our HH meals, even though it was always very busy. We plan to return again.

title: New York  city
text:
Hotel in posizione eccellente. A pochi metri dalla metropolitana, a 5 minuti a piedi da Times Square, dall'Empire State Building e da tutti i principali punti di interesse.
Pulizia e confort sia nelle camere sia negli spazi comuni.
Colazione varia e abbondante e free drink dalle 16.30 alle 18.30 con ampia varietà di snack inclusi nel prezzo.
Ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo
L'hotel dispone anche di una piscina coperta.
Personale gentile

title: Girls Trip
text: We had an amazing experience.  They have a great evening reception, their customer is great, and the free breakfast is a plus!  I highly recommend if you are looking to stay within walking distance to everything!  We even got lucky enough to participate in a special Friyay wine tasting experience while we were there!

title: Amazing staff
text:
We had an amazing experience at this hotel. It was my husband’s birthday and our first time in New York. I called a few days earlier to confirm everything and Miss Denaya took great care of me over the phone. 

Upon arrival we met Luis at the Front Desk and he truly went above and beyond to make sure our stay was memorable. It really was indeed! As a courtesy we were upgraded to an amazing room overlooking the Empire State Building! 

The daily evening reception was a very pleasant surprise and Mr. Scott at the bar  showed such wonderful customer service! 

Thank you all for a wonderful experience!

title: Vacanza in famiglia
text: Hotel molto carino personale super professionale e gentile camera piccolina ma molto accogliente con letto king size super comodo ottima la pulizia camera,colazione molto buona e varia per non parlare del happy hour davvero fantastico una bellissima sorpresa top devo dire,a due passi da Times Square ,se dovessi tornare sceglierei senza dubbio questo hotel.Thank you so much Embassy suite Hilton

title: Great Service!
text: The front desk clerk Khadija was extremely professional and was very helpful. Made the check in seamless. Room had a great view. Will be back.

title: Not up to the Hilton Brand
text: I have stayed at this property several times before but the last time was about 3 years ago. This Embassy Suites needs a renovation and is not on par with other Embassy Suites properties. The evening reception had 1 bartender working and we gave up trying to get a cocktail on 2 occasions. The breakfast area is small and what makes matters worse is they don’t have enough staff working to clean tables which is necessary because it is small. We sat at a table that had used dishes from the previous customers. The mandatory “Urban Destination Fee” ($30.00 per night) went unused because the bar area where you use it was only open in the evening when we were there. The “streaming” TV local channels did not work during our entire stay. We called several times to be told they would send someone to look at it and no one ever came to our room. The bed was very comfortable which was appreciated. We come to NYC often and will look for another property in the future. We like the Hilton brand but this property needs some work but in appearance and customer service.

title: Exactly what we wanted and more
text: Great hotel. The room was spacious for nyc and tasteful. Convenient parking garage. The staff were all exceptionally friendly. One concierge told me that they all love working together because they’re like a family. I think their overall happiness created a really welcoming atmosphere. Rating: all the stars.

title: Outstanding Service from Silvia!
text: Silvia provided exceptional service during my check-in. Her warmth and attentiveness made me feel genuinely valued as a guest. Silvia's dedication to ensuring a great experience was evident throughout, from helpful recommendations to prompt assistance. I highly recommend her to anyone looking for a memorable stay. Thank you, Silvia!

title: Excellent experience
text: We could not say enough good things about our experience staying at the hotel. Luis at the front desk and Adam at bag check were especially helpful--and they went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable and amazing. The room was wonderful, the food at breakfast and at Happy Hour was excellent, and the hotel itself is inviting and exactly what we needed for a wonderful stay. We will not stay anywhere else when we go back to New York City. (And this was already our second time staying there. Each stay gets better and better.)

title: Kadija and Adam are THE best!
text: Where do I begin? From the moment we walked in the door, Kadija and Adam at the Embassy Suites in NYC made our stay one of the best ever! After a very long flight cross-country, they found a room for us to check into and welcomed us with open arms! Every time we saw Kadija and Adam, they asked how we were, if we needed anything or if they could do ANYTHING for us! Each of them went above and beyond, and we’ve stayed many nights at Hilton hotels! Thank you both, very much!

title: Comfortable and quiet hotel
text: Yedidia, one of the front desk concierges,  is fantastic. Super helpful, friendly, and gave me an upgrade with an amazing view. The junior suites have very comfortable couches. Definitely recommend staying here if you need to be in midtown.

Diego , Dánae , y Viannel sos atendieron Exelente 
Pedi mi omelette y me equivoqué y amablemte la chica chef me lo cambió amablemte dando así mi experiencia espectacular . Venimos desde Texas y seguro que seguiremos viviendo a este hotel .
:) .

title: Vacances en famille au coeur de New York
text:
Nous avons voyagé à 4 en famille deux ados et deux adultes.

Nous avions demandé deux chambres sur le même palier, notre demande a été acceptée sans soucis. :)

L'hôtel est super bien situé rendant accessible quasi tout à pied.

Le personnel était très disponible, courtois et sympathique.

Le Happy Hour gratuit était apprécié.

Pour New York la taille des chambres étaient spacieuses.
la literie était confortable, les finitions par contre super médiocres.

Le prix par nuit reste cher.

Dans les points négatifs:

1) Ménage très médiocre.
Notre lit n'a jamais été fait deux fois de la même manière, oublie de draps sous le couvre lit deux fois et aspirateur pas passé... 
Je trouverais bien qu'un politique green soit installée car on nous lavait les draps de bains tous les jours donc gros gaspillage. On les laissait pendu et ils les prenaient quand même. Pensez à la planète!
Une ampoule ne fonctionnait pas sur une lampe de chevet.

2) La salle pour le petit déjeuner et minuscule donc c'est le brouhaha tous les jours et des batailles pour avoir une table. La qualité du petit déjeuner et super basique et n'y cherchez pas des fruits ou crudité ou quoique ce soit de sain.
 

nous pouvons le recommander en familles avec enfants. :)

title: Great place to stay and Adam rocks!
text: This was terrific stay - food was good and the connecting rooms were a lifesaver for a single mom.  Everyone was so helpful in the 4th floor.  And Adam is the GOAT.  He helped was incredibly helpful with our bags and helping us get around. Thank you Adam! Great place to stay and in walking distance to practically everything.

title: First impressions are important! Thanks Jiniah! !
text: The young lady who checked me in Janiah, was so sweet and she helped me get from the train station to the hotel and was so sweet and patient! I loved everything about the stay from the check in to my awesome room!! Thanks Hilton! I’ll be back soon!

title: Great hotel, odd policies, mixed opinion on staff
text:
We stayed here as a family for 4 nights. The hotel was well-maintained and in a great location. Just a few issues:
1) They charge a mandatory $30 fee each night, which can be redeemed for food/booze at the restaurant/bar, but has to be used that day or you lose it. I understand why they do it - they want the guaranteed revenue flowing in the bar. The problem with that strategy is it messes with free market economics. If you wanted food, you had to go down to the bar (they never answered the phone), place the order, then wait for it on the 4th floor. It took quite a while and the kitchen staff were not the friendliest. Management knows they're getting the money anyway, so they aren't incentivized to do better. Good for the hotel, bad for the guest. 
2) The included breakfast space is way too small for the number of rooms and you had to fight for a table each morning. There were long lines at the buffet. Just not a pleasant experience. 
3) The suites are not suites. They were small hotel rooms with a little partition in the middle. I know it's NYC and space it limited, but calling it a suite is a stretch. 

For the positives: front desk staff was great. Property was clean and well-maintained.

title: Very good
text: The hotel is really nice, it lies very good in the centrum of New York. The staff is really really nice. Kevin is a very nice, hardworking and friendly employee but everyone here has a very big heart ❤️!! Thanks to all the employees at embassy suites by Hilton.

title: Kevin
text: Kevin has taken care of us very well during all these days and has been very nice to all of us.///////////////////////////     Jdjfhdiwbfishckwbfisbxiwfjowjfojwfojwfiwjfijwfiwhifjiwfhiwfhiwhfiwfhiwbifbwifjwigjwijfiwjfiwbfwinfiwnfijwifjwifjiwjfiwjicbeicbie

title: Pls treat the workers at this Hotel Good because they work so hard!
text: The workers especially at the breakfast were amazing! Also Adam helped us get safe ride to the airport and at a great price! It being our first time in New York we felt extremely safe at this location and also taken care of! Thank you Embassy Suites NYC, your workers are the best! They all deserve raises!

title: Decent Manhattan hotel.
text: We came for a weekend stay at this hotel and overall it left a positive impression. Check-in was quick. The rooms are small but clean. We liked the breakfasts, but it is better to come as early as possible, otherwise because of the crazy crowd you just will not sit at the table (because of this I do not give the highest rating). The staff was friendly and they did their best to make us comfortable. Special thanks to this guy Kevin, his courtesy made our breakfast really comfortable.

title: Annoying AC unit
text: This was an amazing stay, my only complaint is that in the room that I was staying in, there was a building next door and the AC unit on the top of the building kept me up all night. Their pantry was also not great. Other than that, it was amazing, thank you Hilton!!!

title: Excelente todo menos la limpieza de la habitación
text:
Excelente todo.
La atención de Caesar única y excepcional! Habla español y es muy gentil ! 
Nos ha hecho sentir como en casa !!!
Ubicación (cerca de metro) buen desayuno. Excelente Front desp. 
Excelentes los meseros 
Happy hour de bebidas alcohólicas, 
Lo único malo es q x 3 días no nos limpiaron la habitación x errores internos

title: Great! Adam was a great help!
text: Very good hotel. Floor gave me rash on my legs although just don’t sit on the floor. Hotel is walking distance from alot of places like Times Square, and the Summit Vanderbilt. We loved this experience and it was so fun. Also Adam, the gentlemen helping with baggage storage was so helpful and so sweet to us. He immediately helped us and stored our luggage’s while we were out for 4 hours before our flight.

title: 5 start team
text:
Adam provided exceptional service. I believe it was Miss Wanda who checked me out with a great smile and professional. Miss V worked at The Heist the evening I arrived and maintained great composure considering people can be difficult to manage. She is a true professional. Unchecked in and Mr. L (manager) was more than accommodating. He knew I was early and my friend was late. 
I am grateful and appreciate people in service. It's a difficult job and this team was 5 start. They want you to be happy and cared for. 
Keep them!!! ♥️😎☮️

title: Agréable séjour à recommander !
text:
Accueil chaleureux  de Silvia et surtout Yedidia qui parle français ! Situation géographique idéale, hôtel très calme!
Belle chambre , propre et confortable, dans la salle de bain il y avait du lait pour le corps , ce qui est très rare dans les hôtels !
Petit Déjeuner correct et le cocktail d’accueil au 4eme étage sympathique !
 Bien cordialement 
Mr et Mme Nicolas MATVEIEFF- BRIMAUD Dominique

title: Good value and location, great breakfasts, helpful staff.
text: The location is great if you’re in town for theater and the staff work all hard and are very nice and helpful. At breakfast restaurant, Supervisor Joe was outstanding, as were cooks Danny and Jairo, and servers Kevin and Vianel. The lobby restaurant which opens at night has good food and desserts and the staff could use more help as it gets busy.

title: Breakfast was Terrific
text:
The breakfast  staff was fabulous.  Especially Joe. And Danae, Jaira, Kevin and Vianel. Such a great variety of food and the staff is so attentive. 
The rooms are very nice and had everything we needed. Check in staff and other staff are also so very helpfull.

title: Muito Bom!
text:
A localização é muito boa, perto da Times Square, Empire State, 5a avenida, Bryant Park (que é belo e muito agradável) Biblioteca Publica, Grande Estação, conseguimos nos locomover com muita facilidade. 
Cama boa, travesseiros muito bons, banheiro grande e um café da manhã razoável. 
O atendimento também foi muito bom, parabéns para o Bruno, excelente na recepção e atendimento,  para a Keyla (server do Restaurante) para o Joe e Kevin (supervisor e server do café da manhã) super atenciosos. 
Ah, e por fim, ainda podemos contar com o transfer Hotel /Aeroporto por preço super justo (valor que pagaríamos pelo Uber) 

Ficamos muito  satisfeitos em nos hospedar no Embassy Suites By Hilton

title: NY state of mind.
text: We stayed for a week. The staff was great. Helpful and all that but  so very kind. We have stayed at many Hilton properties.  This one was small but clean and great location. Between 5th and 6th. Can't beat that. Highly recommended this property.

title: Embassy Suites
text:
Adam was fantastic, helpful and went above and beyond.  He is a shining star!

The hotel itself had issues with cleanliness.  We also had to have maintenance for 2 separate issues.  Our bathroom sink stopper broke and our bathroom sluder door completely fell off the hinges (hardware failure).

title: First time in NYC
text: Location is great. In close proximity to Times Square and the Empire State Building, but not necessarily in a spot where it’s overwhelming the second you step out. Included breakfast is nice as it’s one less plan for those of us who don’t care to go out looking for a meal first thing in the morning. Staff has been great to us, especially Bruno for keeping in contact throughout our stay!

title: Worst hotel stay!
text: Embassy Suites located at 60 West 37th Street New York, New York 10018 is not what you would expect if you stay at any other Embassy Suites nation wide.  This property lacks leadership from General Manager and assistant managers.  The hotel entry was dirty and smells of urine.  Our family spent 9-days at this hotel and that was the beginning of our horrible experience and nightmare in New York Time Square area.    Our stay dates were March 8-17.   Check-in was a nightmare, the room was extremely small with the tiniest closet (not able to accommodate clothing for two people staying for 9-days let alone one person).  Bathroom ceiling was caving in and we had to be moved, (speaks volumes about the property) we were moved to another room on the 5th floor above the Sky Patio on the 3rd floor...  Second night in our new room we were awakened at 5:30am by a loud bang that sounded like a gun shot, looked out the window and couldn't see anything so we went back to bed, got up at 7:30am looked out the window again at the Sky Patio and saw a dismembered half naked body that had been laying there since the loud bang at 5:30am...  (NO SECURITY GUARDS, NO STAFF AND NO CAMERAS, NO ONE PAYING ATTENTION!!!)  Terrified, we called the front desk and 911 and were the first on the seen.  We have been traumatized and the lack of concern by this hotel and management is beyond deplorable!  No reasonable compensation was offered by this hotel and management.   Star rating for the hotel is ONE!  Star rating for the staff is a FOUR...  Star rating for management is ONE.  Recommend spending the extra money and stay at a well staffed and professional location that provides comfort and safety.

title: lack of maintenance to windows in the restaurant
text:
We had problems in the restaurant once while we were having breakfast, two windows opened out of nowhere due to lack of maintenance and it started to get too cold for us.
An employee who works as a waiter at the restaurant named Diego tried to help us, but he couldn't close the window.

title: Decent and good location
text: Decent enough and a good price. The breakfast is basic but included which is good. There is a restaurant in the lobby if you need. The room itself is small by world standards but apparently decent by NYC standards. It was reasonably clean but the floors could have been better (there were a few sticky gunk bits) and they didn’t have bedding for the pull out. We had to call for it. When we called it arrived quickly. There was hand soap missing but other basic amenities in the bathroom. Location is good. Walkable to subway and lots of other tourist areas.

title: Great customer service
text: Great stay!  Excellent customer during breakfast from Joe, supervisor and  Kevin, wait staff. Both were very attentive to customer needs and requests and very pleasant to encounter. Sylvia at the front desk was friendly and accommodating.  Thank you all!

title: Fun
text: The breakfast was very nice and and Kevin was the best server. He was very nice. Also the heist was delicious. I love that they have a bar and nice clean tables. I hope if your reading you should choose this as your hotel there are tons of food near by and Times Square you must visit

title: Super recomendo! Atendimento agradável e amável por parte dos funcionários
text:
O atendimento é maravilhoso, destacando o Dinu, Luis e a Iolanda que fazem de tudo para atender as nossas solicitações, sendo sempre gentis e prestativos. Chegamos o quarto estava bem limpo, mas no decorrer da estadia acho que ela poderia ter sido melhor.
O café da manhã é farto e variado mas o local oferecido é pequeno então causa um pouco de tumulto.
Super indico o hotel que além de tudo é muito bem localizado!

title: Great Hotel.. Amazing Staff and Cesar is the BEST !!!
text: It’s a great hotel and very convenient but the person who went above and beyond to make our trip memorable is Cesar. What a great man and please give him a raise. He takes such good care of all of us and so attentive to all of our needs in NYC. I will be back because of Cesar. My first time back in 24 years.

title: 좋은 위치, 아늑한 방.
text:
체크인 첫날에 바닥이 조금 더러웠지만 이후에는 깨끗이 청소되어 있었습니다. 그래서 위생적인 면은 만족했습니다.

피트니스센터&조식 모두 좋았고 위치가 매우 마음에 들었어요! 

브로드웨이를 중심으로 여행하고 싶다면 매우 좋은 선택입니다. 근처에 공원도 있어서 여유로움을 만끽할 수 있어요. 

방은 2인이 사용하기에 다소 협소할 수 있으나, 가격 대비 좋은 선택이라고 여겨집니다.

12층의 뷰는 옆 건물의 치과와 마주해있어서 사생활을 보호하려면 커튼은 필수입니다.
 
직원분들이 친절하고 나이스했습니다.

title: Great value for New York City
text: Great room the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was delicious and we also enjoyed the evening reception . The staff was very nice. The hotel was in walking distance from a lot of attractions. Close to subway stations and very convenient. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent stay
text:
The location was convenient because we were able to walk to most spots in Manhattan. The hotel is close to subways, stores, shops, and plenty of restaurants.  It is very convenient if you are in NYC to see a show.

The bed and sofa bed was very comfortable. The room was quite comfortable and useful. Most of the staff were very nice and helpful.  The breakfast was awesome as usual and the breakfast staff was awesome!

Make time for a lot of traffic during breakfast which is not surprisingly with 33 floors.  I felt the breakfast process went smoothly and food was brought out quickly.

The $30 dollar credit for the hotel restaurant was confusing and had a lot of rules, so I did not use it.  Don’t let this deter someone from eating there because there was a lot of customers eating there every night

As a Gold member, it felt like home.

title: Great stay!
text: Hotel ammenities are great! We loved the toiletries included, great products and smelled great. The room was comfortable and it was nice coming back to a clean room every night. There is a great breakfast selection included and the reception happy hour in the afternoon is nice as well. The staff is very friendly, Luis checked us into our room early and he was very pleasant. He also checked in on us to make sure we were enjoying our stay. The locaction is perfect, so much near by and easy to walk to. Will definitely be back in the future.

title: Top Lage......
text:
Sehr gute Lage, Weg zu Subway und Brodway perfekt. Isolierende Fenster ( NYC ist überall laut). Klimaanlage laut, habe ich ausgeschaltet. Frühstück habe ich im Hotel nicht konsumiert. Kaffeemaschine auf dem Zimmer vorhanden.
Die Complimentary Veranstaltung (Gratis Snacks und Drinks) von 17-1900 Uhr haben wir ausgiebig genutzt.

title: The Heist was a miss, but the breakfast buffet (starring Jairo) was great!
text: Everything went smoothly, except for dinner at The Heist. After over an hour, we didn’t get our food. Yolanda looked into the issue and was very attentive. The complimentary breakfast buffet was great however. Jairo was amazing in the kitchen, whipping out omelets and other made-to-order meals. He was extremely friendly and attentive, and deserves kudos for his skills and competence!

title: Shame on you!
text: We did NOT stay here.  We booked and paid for a room (from overseas) for my son and his girlfriend. When they arrived - exhausted from International travel, they were turned away because it appears that if you're 18 you cannot check into a hotel!  They had to leave and find another hotel that would admit them (surprised that they did??!).  Is 18 not an adult at this hotel?  Why, when I mentioned on booking (on the telephone - NOT ON LINE), that I was booking for my son, did the operator/front desk not mention: oh...if you're booking for a "minor" they are not allowed to check in without an adult.  Nobody has the time to comb through your fine print.  The rest of the 1st world: 18 is adult enough to be an adult!  It's disgusting that you did not even bother to help them at that late hour to find you alternate accommodation, or to even find a manager to book them in since we'll make a plan since you have paid already!" Shame on you!

title: Great hotel great location great customer service!
text: The customer service was amazing. Luis was very accommodating and helpful. He made great suggestions for recreation in the city and checked on us to make sure we had all we needed. The hotel was always clean and in the perfect location. We will definitely visit this location again. Thanks Luis!

title: Avis mitigé
text:
Note globale : 15/20

EMPLACEMENT : 10/10
Situé non loin de monuments tels que l’Empire State Building (0,3 km), le Top of the Rock (1,0 km) et Times Square (0,8 km), l’Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Midtown Manhattan est idéalement localisé pour découvrir les différentes attractions de New York.

SERVICE : 9/10
L’hôtel dispose d’une bonne connexion wifi gratuite et d’une conciergerie. De plus, l’Embassy Suites est doté d’un centre de fitness. Le personnel est aussi très sympathique et attentif aux souhaits de la clientèle.

CHAMBRE : 6/10
Bien que notre chambre (suite triple) était correctement meublée et agencée, la propreté laissait vraiment à désirer : le sol n’a pas été nettoyé une seule fois, mon lit d’appoint n’était pas fait et le matelas était très mauvais; j’ai dû le préparer moi-même en demandant des draps à la réception. Par contre, la chambre était bien isolée des bruits extérieurs comme de ceux provenant des chambres voisines.

PETIT-DÉJEUNER : 6/10
La salle du petit-déjeuner est trop petite pour accueillir l’ensemble des clients correctement. Etant des lèves-tôt, nous n’avions pas de problèmes à trouver une table libre. Quant au buffet, quoiqu’un peu pauvre, il était suffisamment varié pour nous.

En somme, cet hébergement est une bonne alternative pour visiter la ville, mais plusieurs points sont à revoir.

title: Wonderful
text: The service was wonderful,  kind friendly staff. Adam was exceptional at service, kindness and hospitality.  The food, perfect! Omelets were like being at home! I observed the manager stop in during the busy time at breakfast on Sunday,  March 1st and asked the cook how he was doing and if he needed any help. This made made it very important.

title: Perfect
text:
Super expérience grâce au personnel et notamment César ainsi que les 2 personnes du bar.
Véritablement aux petits soins pour nous, serviable et très drôle .
Chaque jour un petit mot, il se rappelait même de nos prénoms .
L'hôtel est super bien placé,les petits déjeuners sont incroyables les apéros sont parfaits avec de nouveaux cocktails tous les soirs  et les burgers sont fous !!!

title: Great Location. Fine Rooms. Crowded Breakfast
text:
The location is great- really close to everything that tourists and non-tourists alike enjoy doing in NYC. So easy to walk to many places from here, we really enjoyed exploring the city we used to live in as a tourist!

This hotel is fine, for sure. I wouldn't really say its a proper Embassy Suites. Rooms are small, but bigger than NYC average and fit three guys well. Unless you're high up, you just get a view of buildings and nothing special.

"King" bed is not a proper king, it has smaller dimensions and is what I would call a "NYC King" lol. 

Breakfast is a disaster at any hour we went. SO Many people, things out of stock, no seating, blech. it was gross. 

I don't think something should be marketed as an Embassy Suites when it doesn't have the space to be a proper one. 

I guess I'd stay again, the staff were great and the lobby has some nice nooks and crannies to relax. Nice to have a bit more space, but would rather just get breakfast at a great diner or from a bodega on the corner.

title: Excelent
text: Breakfast, drinks, discounts on food, the cook in the omelette was amazing (jairo), everything was super good, etc.  The room was very comfortable, good view, everything is close. The front desk was friendly. Great experience Thanks you.

title: Great Omelets
text: Jairo R....great omelet maker...cooked to order and served piping hot...he was instructive on ordering process, polite and courteous, prompt on preparing the omelet, and served with a smile...thanks Jairo R..........................

title: Definitely recommend
text: The staff are brilliant,complimentary breakfast,drinks,discounts on food etc rooms were big and comfortable..and a fantastic central location..everything was clean,we were on the 8th floor and were facing the street but still a great experience

title: Great front desk and very convenient
text:
Rooms have fridge and microwave. Beds are comfy and top floor views are nice. There's an ATM inside (didn't use so can't vouch for it). Located 5 mins walking from subway station.

Bruno and Yedidia were very helpful multiple times! Would visit again

title: Excellent
text: I have an extraordinary experience Cesar is a great man very kind. All the person who work here are wonderful !!!!!the food is exquisite . But de room wasn’t clean every day …. The elevator takes a little time to take you to the lobby,  but is  very common   In this city

title: Recomendable
text:
Pequeños inconvenientes con el desayuno 
La gente q atiende hace la diferencia 
César especialmente 
Muy servicial 
Relación precio y producto muy buena
Ubicación excelente cerca del subte y todos los puntos de interés 
Volvería a elegirlos

title: Hospitality
text:
Cesar in the hospitality room is helpful and a perfect host.  Thank you for answering all of our questions, Cesar! 
Everything else about our stay has been pleasant. True to NYC, there is usually a wait at the elevators, so plan a few extra minutes for your outings.

title: Great time in New York
text: Great experience in New York and the hotel was a big part of that. Clean and comfortable with very friendly and helpful staff. A special mention to Adam who was so helpful with our bags on arrival and departure but also just brilliant in between too. We booked several car journeys via him and he really made our trip.

title: NYC♥️
text: Where do I start! The Hotel itself was at a perfect location. The Staff♥️ was Absolutely Amazing!!! It was a special occasion for me! Yolanda and Neville went over and beyond to help me. Michael’s kindness won’t be forgotten. Sylvia and Wanda♥️☺️ Best Front Desk team ever. I can’t say enough great things about these individuals. They greeted me with a warm smile, positive energy and helped with any questions I had. I will be coming here always, the next time I’m in NYC. Thank you all for the lovely balcony room , but most importantly, Thank you for the BEST EXPERIENCE EVER ☺️💯♥️ I am forever grateful!

title: Terrific value
text: Friendly and helpful staff -- and a terrific value. The breakfast was sumptuous, and the happy hour (the appetizers and two glasses of wine!)  can substitute for a light dinner if you're headed to a show. Can't beat the location just off Broadway and a short walk to Times Square.

title: Excellent
text: The experience was excellent. The organized room, comfortable bed and bathroom too. The food service, specifically breakfast, good and varied. The employees, attentive, very friendly. On my next trip to New York, they are my first choice.

title: Great stay - thanks Luis and Adam
text: The Embassy Suites New York Midtown - Manhattan was a great visit. Luis and Adam went above expectations to ensure my sister and I had a great stay. The room, free daily continental breakfast and evening reception was outstanding.  Thanks so much.

title: Excellent service
text: Excellent check-in and v comfortable suite. Breakfast was hectic, but was very comprehensive with good choices and helpful staff. Evening cocktails were a superb bonus and Mercedes was the ultimate hostess - immensely helpful and wonderfully friendly.

title: AMAZING. 100% RECOMMENDED
text: This hotel is amazing. I was supposed to stay here for 5 days, but because of the amazing staff I extended my stay for 10 days. I would like to thank Joe, head of staff, he was doing an amazing service. I have food restrictions and he was taking care of that every morning and making sure I had the food I needed. Also a special thanks to Yedidia at the front desk for helping with the check in and making me feel like home!

title: Wonderful Experience
text: Great location. Rooms were very comfortable and clean. The staff was exceptionally friendly, courteous, and professional. Adam went out of his way to make our stay great. If you’re looking for a great hotel that’s affordable be sure to check out this hotel. Definitely will come back!

title: OK experience at this Embassy Suites
text: This a busy hotel in a convenient part of Midtown. Lots of guests coming and going, mostly families it seems. Had a somber junior suite with a window overlooking the building next door. The restaurant offering free breakfast is a madhouse with people almost fighting to get tables and eggs (not enough tables).  Would do again, but not as a first choice.

title: Good times
text: Place was great.  Breakfast was nice.  Clean rooms.  Luis was great.   When asked for something it  arrived shortly. It was near many things.    No issues at check in and when I needed something from the front desk they provided great service.  Hot water and good pressure.

title: An oasis in the busy city.
text: This little gem of a hotel tucked onto W. 37th St. surpassed all expectations. Kadija at the front desk worked diligently to find us a room, even though we arrived early at the hotel after the redeye. Our room was clean and extremely functional. It had a great sitting room and a very comfortable bed. Joe in the breakfast room made sure that we had everything we needed every day, and the omelettes and overall food was extremely high-quality. I am a Hilton Gold member, so I stay in many Hiltons, and this one was a genuine oasis in the busy city.

title: Enjoyable weekend NYC Getaway
text: Very nice staff and great amenities. Check in was fast and we were allowed access to our room well prior to stated check in time.  Room was clean.  Bountiful breakfast and the happy hour was an added treat.  The cheesecake was the best I've ever had.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Staying January 27th-28th
text: Great ambience. Friendly customer service. Room is clean and breakfast is included. I feel that is well located and it is really convenient for tourists since it’s super close to the Times Square. I highly recommend embassy suites and price is worth it.

title: Amazing customer service!
text: One of the best experiences we have ever had at a hotel! It was a busy week leading into the holiday season, but the staff went above and beyond to help our family. They adjusted rooms so we could stay next to each other and when things got a little crazy with our parking situation, they did everything to make it right. This Embassy team manages a lot, but they did it with grace and a smile. Truly impressed and look forward to staying here again! A big thank you to Lianna, Silvia and Adam for making our trip to the big city a great one!

title: Underwhelming
text:
Great location, but that’s about the only plus. Reception and dining rooms are tiny and crowded. Breakfast was complete chaos (so we skipped it) and every time we tried the lounge, the door was locked. Room was ok, small even by city standards, with the closet in the bathroom (?).
The shower had a small, unfilled hole right through the tiles. Sure, maybe that’s where the body wash container used to be (because there was none), but seriously - a peephole size hole in the shower?! Also, the bathroom sink had a slow drain and filled up every time. Wanted to give this place a try, but won’t be back.

title: Pretty view & kind service
text:
I had to find a hotel quickly after my flight was cancelled and this hotel seemed like a good option. I saw online that there was a $30 credit available to use in "all hotel outlets," but it turned out that this credit can only be used at their bistro/bar, which is strictly open from 5-11 pm. Unfortunately, by the time we arrived and went for a quick bite, we didn't get the chance to use the credit. That was disappointing.

However, I would like to mention that Adam, the doorman, was amazing when it came to greeting us and carrying our bags. He even called a professional private taxi for us to go to LaGuardia Airport, which was a great experience!

The room was pretty and the skyline was BEAUTIFUL! Breakfast had a lot of options & kind service.

title: Manhattan for Christmas
text: This is a great hotel for all the best spots in Manhattan!  Walking distance to everything. Parking at the hotel. Dine was so helpful with questions about the area. Rooms were spacious for a city hotel.

title: Embassy not a bad stay
text: The Embassy Suites was a nice place to stay.  The breakfast area was a bit of a frenzy, but had a nice selection for a quick bite before exploring the Big Apple!  The only hiccup was the shower door kept sliding open and they need to make sure the toiletries are checked each day in the shower.

title: Exceptional Service!
text: The service was excellent! Adam working in the lobby was the nicest most helpful person.  Overall the service provided by everyone at the hotel was exceptional.  The room was clean and so comfortable.  Breakfast and evening snacks were very good.  Highly recommend this hotel. I’ll be returning for another visit soon!

title: Great Location
text:
Booked a couple of rooms at the Embassy Suites for the first of Jan, 2024. Expectedly, the rates were really high at this time all over the state (not just the city), but we got a (relatively) good deal via Hotwire. 
Baggage: The problem with most hotels is they're less than 24 hours, since check-in is around 1 pm and check-out at 11 am. That's where the helpful concierge steps in. We reached NY at 10 am, and handed over 6 pieces of luggage to the Bell-desk. We were not sure if it would be an additional cost or not, but thankfully there were no costs to it. Tipping is always welcome anywhere in the US. 
Front Desk: We were checked in by a helpful young gentleman. When asked, he looked up possible upgrade options and gave us a room with a view of the Empire State building. Check out isn't in person, unless you want it to be, so very painless and quick. 
Unused $$$: Based on our room rates and number of rooms, we had $60 of complimentary food and beverages to use - which we couldn't, given the duration of our stay and the fact we wanted to be out exploring the city instead of sitting there to avail their F&B. While the offer is great, I suspect only business travelers actually get to use it. 
Food: Breakfast was included and is served buffet style between 7 and 10. Plenty of hot and cold options, lots of seating place. The hotel also offers an evening beverage and snack service, but we weren't able to check it out because of time. 
Rooms: Clean, neat and not as scarily small as my other NY hotel experiences. For the room that was booked for 3 people, we had a long comfortable couch, and extra pillows, quilts for a makeshift bed. I used the couch and had a comfortable sleep. 
Location: Excellent! This was the primary reason (and the cost) for the booking and we were not disappointed. In warmer weather, one can hop to and from the hotel multiple times for sight seeing + rest, but because of the early Jan weather, we avoided multiple back and forth trips. 
Overall: definitely worth repeat stays!

title: Wonderful, Friendly, and Fun!
text: From the time we arrived till the time we left, the Embassy Suites at 60 west 37th Street staff was welcoming, friendly, helpful, and they went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. They have bag holding areas if you arrive before checkin or you have a flight late after checkout. Adam not only made sure our bags were taken care of but was thoughtful enough to suggest the car service they provide for our ride back to LaGuardia. Embassy Suites cleaning staff kept our room clean and towels changed out. The bed was comfortable, the couch had a  full size fold out bed, which great for our 21 year old and provided a barrier between us and her. The room had a nice bathroom walk-in shower, clean towels, and blow dryer. You won’t need to bring Shampoo, Conditioner, or Body wash. They have full size bottles attached to the shower wall. They also provide individual bar of soap and a full size bottle of lotion by the sink. There is a small refrigerator that you can keep snacks and beverages in. The closet has a safe, iron and place to hang a jacket and some clothing. Our room also had a television in the bedroom space and in the living space over the desk. We used the foldout table to eat our takeout pizza at night. Each morning we enjoyed a full hot breakfast, The buffet included fruit, cereal, bagels, yogurts, pastries, fruit juice's, & coffee with all kinds of soft drinks, milks and creamers. Served between 7:00-10:00am, They also do made to order Omelets on top of all that. Can not say enough about the service, especially chef and the wait staff. We enjoyed the complimentary bar service where you receive 2 tickets for alcoholic or non alcoholic beverages. The free options were varied beers, wine, and Piña Colada was delicious. They do change out there free options and of course you can purchase additional drinks. Non-Alcoholic beverages and sodas are available for those who do not drink alcohol or are underage. The snacks were not the best on Sunday night. The Cucumber salad was good but the Hummus was not kept cold and was not how we liked it. They have a nice waiting area  and bar on the first floor, and a small store for purchasing anything you needed. I wish we had taken advantage of the $30 credit at the restaurant, if you stay here please use it.  We did enjoy how close to everything the hotel was. There is so much to see, do and eat! 10/10 will stay again. Again, Thank you to the whole staff and especially Adam for making our 3 nights and  4 days in NYC a fun experience. Lots of Love and Lagniappe from Louisiana. See you next trip! - The Meshell’s

title: jan 2024 stay
text: Staff was very kind and helpful. Made our stay very pleasant and attended to all our needs. Room was modern and clean compared to most other nyc hotels we’ve stayed in. great location and great staff.

title: The Hotel Shuttle is NOT a Deal!
text:
Hair dryer blew cold air, refrigerator was NOT on. Front desk was very busy with little staff. $30 daily comp was eaten up by $24 drinks with only 1 person waiting on everyone. We’ve stayed here before and came back twice since but will
be moving on for now. Adam was very pleasant indeed however when we found out that the shuttle deal he talked us into was NOT a deal with us but with the limo we were very disappointed. He assured us taking the hotel shuttle would be less expensive than an Uber or Lyft we found this not to be the case. We were up charged by the shuttle service and he dropped us off at an outside checkpoint at the airport  where another tip was required as well. This is probably an inside arrangement they all have and shamefully they got us twice!

title: A great experience- and I don’t say that often!
text:
Excellent service. I really appreciate the warm welcome and the personal service. 
I was greeted warmly, given a full explanation of the hotel services and my requests were honored. Thank you Bruno and team.

title: Location is everything!
text:
Positioned on 37th Street, embassy suites is very good & location central. Room a bit small & a little tired in a few spots- bathroom floor couldve  been a little cleaner. But overall, bed very comfortable , good tv with fridge & microwave incl. Maids serviced most days. Staff were fantastic- especially breakfast staff (Kevin) . Breakfast was great, had to wait sometimes for a table- but first world problem when u get breakfast included. Would stay again but get the larger room. Was on level 8- which was handy when fire alarm went off. 
Overall 8 out of 10.

title: The lifts are really bad lol.....
text:
We stayed here over the xmas week and it was ok. Was a base for our days out. The price was the best part about it. A close second was the guy that worked in the lobby that helped us with our bags on check out day. 
Breakfast food was ok we skipped 1 day and didnt miss it. 
The lifts are the biggest issue with this property. There are 3 lifts for 40 floors. If you take out the gym, restaurant lobby and such forth that leaves you with roundabout 35 floors of guests with between 8 and 12 rooms a floor thats a lot of rooms and alot of guests. Breakfast was between 7-10 ish. So we'd go down for breakfast then back to our rooms to go out for the day that would put us back to the lifts for about 0915-0945 but by then everyone else was coming down for the last half hour of breakfast and the all 3 lifts only travelled between the upper floors and the restaurant(4th floor). After about 35 minutes of waiting on the first day i rang the front desk and this was explained to me, i was told to use the stairs instead. Luckily for us we was on the 6th floor. Just something to think about if there are mobility issues. My kid broke her back 6 months ago so obviously we didnt want to overly stress her back , she took it slow and was fine, but the front desk didnt really seem to care.
A plus is the location was pretty good to be fair easy walking to lots of places.
Shame really.
Overall wouldn't spend my money here again.

title: Great hotel and experience
text: Embassy Suites is a great hotel and is in a great location. We went for a Christmas time visit to the city and had a great experience. Janiah was the best staff member who provided my family with an upgraded room.  We couldn’t have asked for a better stay!

title: Location is not everything
text: Location is great but that is the only positive with this hotel.  We had no hot water in our room from December 22-25.  We asked the Front Desk staff who said they did not know why we didn’t have hot water.  The conversation ended there.  The food area on Floor 4 is small, tiny, unkempt, dirty.  Staff were overwhelmed with the crowd of people and could not keep food stocked or tables cleaned.  Staff just stood and watched people.  The fire alarm went off on December 23 at 8am.  Front Desk said they were not sure what was happening because they do not have a report of the full incident so we are not sure whether it is real fire or not.

title: Attention vue sur la ville on voit les murs des autres bâtisses
text:
Cet hôtel est surévaluer
Chambre très petite,pas d'eau dans la chambre une petite bouteille à la réception $4.00
Sur 4nuits le ménage à été fait 3 fois,manque de serviettes.
Le petit déjeuner il n'y pas de place pour  s'asseoir 
La réception ils étaient rudes sans aucune manière. Hotel à éviter

title: Great hotel for New York Famkly Visit
text:
Great hotel in a fantastic location. 
The family suite was great for 2 adults and 1 child. The "sofa bed" was so big that my 11 year old could sleep on it without opening up with plenty of space. The beds were so comfortable and the room was nice and clean. The views was fantastic. 

All staff were welcoming, helpful and kind throughout our stay. Breakfast is worth it - so delicious and plentiful everyday. 

Last but not least, the location of this hotel is superb for brilliant time in New York. Subway stop round the corner, 2 minutes from Macy's, 5 minutes walk from Bryant Park, 10 minutes walk to Times Square. 

I would happily stay again!!

title: Great location for NYC
text:
This Embassy Suites hotel was perfectly located for our visit to NYC. It's close to many main attractions.  It's clean and beds were comfortable, the staff was very welcoming, friendly and helpful, the rooms were small but the space was used efficiently, and the free breakfast included many choices... even made to order omelets. The only reason I didn't give the hotel 5 stars was thtimes.
 sliding bathroom door in one of our rooms was off track, didn't work properly, and got stuck closed several times. It was reported and the staff said it would be taken care of, but it wasn't fixed while we were there.

title: Great Staff and Good Breakfast, But Not a Comfortable Stay
text:
For all of its good qualities, there are a number of reasons why I would not stay at this hotel again.

Let me start with the good:

LOCATION: This hotel is located only about 1.5 blocks from Macy’s, and an easy walk from many of the main sites in the city, including Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, and the Diamond and Fashion Districts. There are numerous places to eat within a two-block radius.

ROOMS: As other people have noted, the rooms are not as large as one might find at other Embassy Suites. The room in which my wife and I stayed had a large bed, desk, flat-screen TV, small refrigerator, and microwave, as well as two chairs, side tables, and a large bathroom. The bed itself was comfy, and, with some unfortunate exceptions – see below – we found the room was quiet.

AMENITIES: The hotel offers a full breakfast that includes various breads, cereals, juices, fruits and yogurts, as well as hot dishes (scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon, and waffles/pancakes). One can also request made-to-order omelettes that are delivered to you.

WORKOUT FACILITIES: There is a gym on the second floor, where one can find cardiovascular equipment (elliptical machines, treadmills, a recumbent bike, and a standard bike), dumbbells up to 50 pounds, a multi-use Precor machine, an adjustable bench, medicine balls, and yoga mats. One note: The room is quite warm.

STAFF: The staff (with one minor exception) are wonderful. They are kind, responsive, and will bend over backwards to make sure patrons have a terrific stay.

But there are reasons why I would not stay here again:

ROOMS: When my wife and I arrived, the first room we were offered had a smoky smell to it, so we requested a different one. The staff member with whom I spoke said that the reason we were offered our room was that others that we might have been given did not have working TVs in them. To us, that was not really relevant information, for our concern was simply being put into a room. 

On the last morning of our four-day visit, my wife was in the shower. The other mornings, the water had not been as hot as she would have liked, but this time, it was perfect. In the middle of her shower, the smoke detector in the room went off. (I cannot overstate how loud it was.) I stepped out of the room and called the front desk while she hurriedly got dressed. When a member of the staff arrived, he asked if she had been taking a shower. So apparently this is something about which the hotel is aware. It did not make for a comfortable morning for us, and I feel terrible if others were woken up just because my wife took a hot shower. 

Unrelated to our room was a fire alarm that went off in the hotel on our third morning because of something that happened on the fourth floor. That made for another unhappy morning.

STAFF: As I mentioned, we found virtually all the staff members were wonderful. The one exception was the first morning of our stay, when I asked someone at the front desk for a toiletry to be delivered to the room. The staff member said housekeeping would bring it up, to which I responded that my wife was still asleep. The staff member then said again that housekeeping would bring it up, to which I said “okay.” I apparently needed to add, “But do not bring it now,” as within about five minutes, someone from housekeeping came knocking at our door and woke my wife up.

So, out of four mornings, three were most uncomfortable, especially for my wife. 

BREAKFAST: Breakfast is served from 7-10 am each morning, and patrons are told that the best time to get a meal is 7-8 am, as it is the least busy. My wife and I found that it did not make a difference, as I had breakfast anywhere between 7:45 and 8:30 each morning – and my wife between 9:00 and 9:30 – and each time, seating was in short supply. The problem is that the hotel, which has rooms on 37 of its 39 stories, simply does not have enough seating for the large number of people who stay there. (While breakfast and most of the seating is on the fourth floor, there is additional seating on the third floor. However, that additional space is not opened until later during the breakfast period.) My wife and I also found that some utensils ran out.

I do give kudos to the breakfast staff. They deliver omelettes to those who order them – do be prepared for them to yell out your name as they try to find you – will replace utensils that have run out if asked, and keep the food stocked up. The point is that when going for breakfast, one must be prepared to deal with a mass of humanity and the possibility of not finding a place to sit. (I guess it’s good practice for hitting the tourist spots in town!)

TO SUM UP: My wife and I cannot say enough about the staff at this hotel, and the location is nice, especially if one wants to be away from the most-highly-traveled areas of the city. But the problems with our room and the difficulty in having a relaxing breakfast convinced us that when we return to the city, we will stay elsewhere.

title: Always a great time here :) their team/staff is the absolute best! My favorite place to stay in the city
text: We always have a really great experience at this hotel! The staff is so polite, specifically Janiah at the front desk. She really made our stay special this time for the holidays!! I know that the next time we are in the city, we will definitely stay here again!

title: Great staff.
text: Dinu at the concierge stand was terrific. He helped us all 3 days we were there. His smile and personality are wonderful. He made our stay a great experience. He should be rewarded for his hard work. It is good to find folks who take pride in their service.

title: Fantastic service from the whole team!
text: The service was outstanding! Everybody was very friendly, helpful, and efficient. The entire staff was amazing and everybody genuinely seemed like they cared and wanted to be there. We will definitely be back!

title: Great location! Would stay here again!
text: The hotel was in a great location and close enough to fifth Avenue and Times Square and convenient to subway stations. We arrived early in the morning and they were able to accommodate us with an early check-in.  They held our luggage in a safe space until our room was ready. The breakfast buffet also had a lot of options to choose from. I would say that the alcoholic beverages may be a little pricey, but hey, it’s NYC.  There is also a bar on the third floor with an open roof deck, which is pretty cool.  You get a nice view of the Empire State building . We took an Uber from both airports and it was about a 30 to 45 minute drive. I would recommend taking the subway or walking if you can as the traffic is crazy. We would most definitely stay here again. The customer service is great from check-in to the cleaning staff. The junior suite was perfect for my husband and I and my teenager who had her own space and TV in the room.

title: Great experience
text: Clean rooms and comfy beds. Central location to all New York has to offer. Enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. Service was fast and friendly. Adam always greeted us with a good morning and was very helpful. We used the Hotel vehicle service to get to JFK airport and is was priced the same as Uber around $100.00 leaving at 1 PM. Glad we took it the vehicle was new, clean Honda SUV and the driver was well dressed and polite.

title: Good for the price
text:
For the price, this was a fine choice. It was "Embassy Suites light," meaning that other ES have larger rooms and nicer furniture. 

But the service at this hotel was outstanding, both the front desk and housekeeping. And the bed was superior. And besides breakfast, the room came with a $30 a day bar credit, which was a good perk.

title: Great 40th Birthday Celebration
text:
Fantastic location, high quality staff. 

Le-Ann was amazing and made my girlfriend's 40th birthday celebration one to remember. We really appreciated her down to Earth conversation and location of the area.

Will be staying here in the future. Doesn't get much more centralized than this! 😁

title: Very Good
text: The hotel is within walking distance to quite a few attractions and the front staff was friendly. We especially cannot recommend the concierge, Adam, enough! He was always very welcoming and accommodating to our needs. Would definitely stay here again!

title: Terrible Experience!
text: I do not normally complain, but the stay at this hotel truly warrants it. Not only were the staff at check-in, rude and short on every question asked, the hotel was poorly maintained. The breakfast was a disaster with empty trays and pans. They also had a major water leak that went from the 4th floor (dining area) to the lobby.  Interesting, because they also did not have a single bottle of water for Diamond members or even to purchase. This hotel needs a major refresh and some staffing changes. I have been a loyal Hilton customer for years, but lately Marriott is looking much better!

title: Amazing
text: My husband and I had a great stay at the Embassy suite Hilton. Marcus checked us in and provided excellent service. He was courteous, professional and friendly. We enjoyed breakfast and cocktail hour. From our room, we were able to view the Empire State Building which is amazing. There was so many things to do such as time Square, central park, Rockefeller center and the Empire state building. We would definitely recommend.

title: Viaje de Grupo a Nueva Tork en el Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
text:
Viajes Boomerang de Torelló llevó a un grupo de 20 personas este año a este hotel.
Laura de grupos nos dejó todo preparado puesto que llegamos muy tarde. Le agradezco su paciencia y atención
En recepción el trato es impecable, te ayudan hasta para ponerte el wifi. La situación inmejorable. Las habitaciones son pequeñas pero perfectamente equipadas y con buen colchón. Desayuno gratuito básico pero correcto. 

Pocos ascensores para lo grande que es el hotel y el espacio del desayuno pequeño, no hay problema si vas a primera hora de la mañana

Repetiremos el año que viene seguro!

title: Midnight False Alarm
text: It has a great central location, but I regretted and did not appreciate the 1-2 am false fire alarm interrupting my stay. The staff member did not apologize for the inconvenience of the false alarm at midnight. This is not OK.

title: Underwhelmed
text: Location is perfect, can’t beat it. Elevators take forever, rooms are run down, breakfast is lacking, and during my stay a false alarm went off all night and they did nothing to make up for it and I was up all night. Very disappointed

title: Passez votre chemin!!
text: Hôtel qui profite de son emplacement car le rapport qualité prix n y est pas du tout. Une chambre trop exiguë pour 3 ( impossible d ouvrir les valises excepté sur les lits!), ménage négligé, une salle de petit-déjeuner trop petite, la cheffe de la réception désagréable et pas arrangeante, les ressort fees accessibles à des heures impossibles.. en résumé je ne recommande pas.

title: Totalmente recomendable
text: Muy buena experiencia!! El personal excelente, cordiales y muy dispuestos  en la atención! Luis en la recepción un crack y  destaco el personal del restorán, todos muy amables y serviciales!! La gastronomía muy buena! Te ofrecen como cortesía todos los días, dos tragos y snacks  de 5 a 6.30 pm, hace la diferencia!!!!!!

title: Altamente recomendable 😃😃😃
text: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐Excelente experiencia, desde el trato del personal hasta los servicios del hotel.Luis en la recepción muy servicial. Excelente desayuno. El hotel ofrece a los huéspedes un cócktel y snacks diarios de cortesía. Devuelve 30 dólares por día por habitación para gastar en el restaurante del lobby. Las habitaciones son correctas y cómodas para dos personas. Excelente ubicación. Muy recomendable

title: Great checkin
text: The checkin experience was amazing LiAnna was so friendly and offered several tips on places to visit. She even gave me tips on future stays at Hilton hotels. Looking forward to the rest of your stay!

title: Would absolutely stay here again.
text: Loved the reception, the beds are comfy and the staff are super nice! Dino was a ton of help with our bags and arranging our ride back to the airport for our large group! It’s convenient and close to so many places on our list to visit!

title: Loved my stay!
text: Absolutely loved my stay here! I came to the city to run the NYC marathon, so I wanted to make sure I found a great and comfortable place to stay. The rooms are a great size for NYC hotels, and they were very clean! Every staff member I encountered was extremely friendly and welcoming as well. The complimentary breakfast and happy hour were the cherry on top of my wonderful stay. Thank you, Embassy Suites!

title: Great location.  Ehhh to everything else.
text: Good location but there was a jackhammer noise coming from the bathroom walls the first day and night (pipes?), the pillow case, bed linen, and curtains were stained, the shower handle was broken (safety issue), and there was food on the floor when we first arrived (so it wasn't ours).  There was never a supervisor on site who could address our concerns.  The associate on duty stated that there were no other room types like the one I had so she couldn't move me.  No one ever came to change the pillows/linen or fix the shower handle. I met another guest on the 26th floor who stated that there was a leak in her ceiling.  Don't pay for upgrades for the city view or anything else.  You can see the city from any hallway window and the outdoor seating area (we took selfies with the Empire State Building while waiting for the elevator). Also, it may be cheaper to park at any garage vs the "discount" for Embassy guests.  The garage inflates the price so that the "discount" is about what you would have paid anyway based on their posted rate signs. Signs for other garages in the area had lower overnight rates posted.

title: Carino e comodo
text: In generale giudizio positivo. Posizione strategica e bene la colazione. Questi sono i punti forti. Localizzato vicino a Times square si può girare a Manhattan a piedi . Hall carina con bar e personale gentile. Viene bloccata una cauzione all’arrivo. Le camere sono piccole ma molto calde . Questo alla fine è lo stile di New York , tutto molto concentrato in poco spazio. La colazione a buffet molto piacevole e variegata con pancakes, panini caldi , frutta, succhi, dolce e salato. Pulizia media, le camere vengono fatte su richiesta. Tutto molto carino.

title: Nettes sauberes Hotel
text:
Schönes Hotel, gute Zimmer, Service auch gut. 
Frühstück könnte besser sein, Frühstücksraum viel zu klein.
Nettes Personal, Koffer werden bei später Abreise untergestellt. 
Vor dem Abendessen gibt es ein kostenloses kleines Buffet und zwei Drinks gratis.

title: Thank you Jolanda, Kadija, Li-Anna,Luis plus many others
text:
Amazingly helpful and professional staff. Jolanda (so amazingly funny)..Kadija…Li-Anna…Luis… plus the other staff who are just so friendly,helpful and will go extra to make you feel special. 
We came back to a clean room everyday, the hotel has an unrivalled view of the Empire State Building. 
Located within a few minutes walk from Times Square, MSG and a lot of other places, this is the hotel to stay at.

title: Misnamed
text: Firstly it's not really close to Times Square (10-12 blocks). We walked all the way to the M&M store and had to take a cab back because it was too far.  The name suite really doesn't apply either.  When the sofa bed was opened we had only a narrow walkway to get to the bathroom.   The room was small and cramped.  The breakfast area is horribly mismanaged; too small and cramped for the number of guests staying there. You had to stand around letting your food get cold while you waited for a place to sit down.  At the managers reception I set a full plate of food down and went to get a drink.  When I returned my plate was cleared and someone else was sitting there.   At checkout there was only one person at the desk (9:00 am).  But the absolute worst was the alarm clock.  The display was completely dead and every night the alarm would go off at 3:00 am.  We unplugged it but the battery kept the alarm alive.  You needed a Phillips head screwdriver to get to the battery.  It was wired through the night stand so I couldn't even yank it out and flush it like I wanted to.  We complained and someone came to the room and did nothing.  On the plus side everyone was very friendly and the hotel was reasonably clean.

title: Excellent
text:
This is my second stay at Embassy Suites Manhattan NY, both times I have completely enjoyed my stay. From the manager (who I saw in the reception area, making himself accessible to guests) to the front desk staff who were all very accommodating, Lianna especially helped us out on this recent trip. 
The rooms are clean and comfortable. The breakfast is good and gives you the option to eat in the hotel before setting out for your day. The evening reception is a light snack, a nice touch if you want something to keep you going before a show and dinner. 
The hotel is a short walk to Time Sq and all the surrounding ding sights. Central for that area of Manhattan. 
I would definitely recommend and return when visiting NYC.

title: Location Great! The rest, not so much.
text:
Have you stayed at Embassy Suites before?  This isn’t that. It’s not a suite in any sense of the word. And their service is not up to the level of other ES I have stayed in before. 

It took two hours to finally get my room. Of course it was ready an hour earlier, but no one bothered to let me know. My daughter waited an hour. They told us it would be a half hour.  Once she got her room, I sat in my daughter’s room for another hour.  Oh and you are lucky if more than one front desk computer is working at a time. 

I got to my room to find the TV was out of service. It seems the system is being upgraded, and they didn’t get to mine yet. Again, no one bothered to tell me. 

On the plus side, the room is comfy - bed is excellent -and kept very clean. and the location is amazing. 

When I complained about the wait and the TV, they offered to take off the resort fee, which is bogus anyway. I would rather not have them charge me $30 a night for a credit I will never use. Their bar and restaurant close too early if you go to a broadway show. And it opens too late if you want a snack before you head out for the night. I am sure they know that. 

Finally, breakfast is good but so crowded, that they couldn’t keep up with demand for silverware, eggs, sides or pastries or seats. But it was “free” so I guess I shouldn’t complain.

title: Wonderful stay but slow elevators
text: The check in went exceptionally well. We arrived early and were able to check in early. LiAnna at the front desk was very nice and told us she was giving us an upgrade. When we got to our room on the 37th floor, we looked out the window and saw we had a wonderful view of the Empire State Building!  The manager’s reception was very nice and the breakfast was delicious. The only negative was the very slow elevators and the long wait times to get on an elevator. We waited so long for the elevator at one point that we finally just took the stairs down from the 37th floor! If not for the slow elevators we would have given this hotel 5 stars.

title: check in was a disaster
text: "checked in" at about 230.  was told room not ready you will get a text.  430 still no text so i called.  i was told "your room isnt ready"  no kidding that is why i am calling when will it be ready "we will text you when it is ready".  this hotel was $500 a night and i had plans, needed to get to room check in, etc.  no one seemed to really care.  i was told "that's friday night in nyc".  wow that makes me feel appreciated....i can't tell you how the room is because i havent gotten in yet...

title: Nice hotel in a great location
text:
We booked this hotel for 3 of us. Two people slept in the very large King Bed and I used the sofa bed. The sofa bed was surprisingly comfortable, as many aren't. The room was a little tight and we ended up taking the small table out as there was no room for it with the sofa bed open. We found the hotel comfortable and a great location. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. They let us know how to get to the closest subway station which we found very convenient. 

Breakfast  was good. We all tried one of the cook to order omeletts. It was nice that they deliver them to your table. Everything else is self service. 

We did have some issues with cleaning. One of the days all of our towels were dirty, trash was over-flowing and we needed more cups. We didn't need our entire room made up, just the necessities taken care of. We ran into our maid as we were leaving. I asked her about the things we need and she said "No english" and walked away. I figured that since she knew which room we had just left, she would service it. When we returned a couple of hours later, nothing had been done. We spoke to the front desk about what we needed and he said that he would make sure it was taken care of. When we got back in the late afternoon, nothing was done. We spoke with the front office again and she sent someone right up. It should not be so difficult to get a couple of things.

At the end of our trip we debated how to get to the airport. We had taxen a taxi to the hotel and had issues. He said he couldn't find it and drove around in circles to find it, costing us additional money. We ended up reserving an UBER for our return trip. We were waiting for our Uber when one of the hotel staff asked if we wanted to use the Hotel's Car Service to get to the airport. We hadn't known this was an option and we have used that service both ways if we had. We would loved to have been informed about that when we booked this hotel. 

All in all, we enjoyed this hotel and would recommend it.

title: Don’t take their offer of a fixed fare taxi to the airport. It’s a Con and you will get ripped off. We did.
text:
Front desk / concierge offered to arrange a fixed all inclusive price to the airport of $95, about $15 dollars higher than elsewhere but, seeing as it would all be booked we thought it was a good offer. 
We were expressly told this included everything, taxes, tolls & tips. 
When we arrived at the airport we were told the price was $100 however, the female driver said our payment had not gone through and asked for our card again. It wasn’t until we were home that we saw she had in fact run through $120!  Complete tourist rip off and the sort of action that gives NYC a really poor name. 
Shame on you

title: Perfect location
text: Stayed for three nights while attending NY ComicCon. The room was clean, people were friendly and location was near some great restaurants. We go to NYC at least twice a year and we will definitely consider booking here again.

title: Great first
text: first trip to New York!  From Jamela helping me book my room with an adjoining room. I travel with my helper because I’m disabled, and she helped me with that. Laquan helped me set up transportation to and from the airport.  Them Dino what the most patient and accommodating with me! He brought up a few of our DoorDash orders. He even helped set me up and making sure that I had everything I needed on a day that my son and husband had an event to attend (I didn’t want to go to their boys event).  he even opened up the adjoining room door so I wouldn’t fall trying to do it.

title: Embassy Suites Manhattan
text: Great stay at the Embassy Suites on 37thin Manhattan. Great location. Dinu at the bell desk was great. Highly recommend this hotel. Close to great restaurants and subway stops. Easy to book and breakfast and happy hour are included in the room.

title: Davely is the best
text: Davely is super amazing and is the person you look for for great customer service  and understanding 10/10 !!!!!  Is accommodating wilve solve any issue or problem that you might have , happy attitude when checking in.

title: Scott Parker the Food and Beverage goes overboard to help!
text: Let me tell you that this is the PLACE TO STAY while in New York Manhatten!  We went for my sons 30th birthday and the staff from beginning to end were outstanding!!  The food and beverage manager Scott Parker was extremely helpful and went above and beyond to make my sons day special on our arrival.  If you are in need of any specialty need while staying they will make it happen!  Thanks, Embassy, for the wonderful experience!

title: Embassy Suites Time Square -- Helpful Staff
text: The hotel has a great location and is very comfortable.  Great breakfast and evening reception are included in the room fare.  A special shout out to Dinu who was very helpful and knowledgeable about places to eat and directions. Dinu went beyond what was expected to answer our questions and to help us.

title: Did Not Meet the Hilton Standard, Terrible Experience
text: I completed check-in on the Hilton app & selected my room.  When I arrived at the hotel the app said it was sending me the key for my room. I waited 5 minutes for the app to send me the key & then went to the desk to ask what was going on. The woman at the desk was very, very rude & accused me on not completing the process & basically washed her hands to me by saying, you can say you finished the process, but I don't see anything on my end.  I then asked for a manager to help because I knew that was not correct. The manager said that the guest staying in that room, decided to extend their stay & they gave my room away. They only had a room left on the 5th floor, but I selected the 10th floor with a view.  The woman at the desk said that's all I have left, or you can cancel. I told her I had nowhere to stay, so basically, she told me take it or leave. Terrible customer service and a lack of professional etiquette. She did nothing to try to make a bad situation better, or make me feel as a valued guest, only worse. I feel it was totally unacceptable the way I was treated.  I think this hotel has some potential to be a great hotel.  However, some improvements would need to be made with the front desk staff, cleaning crew needs to do better with cleaning bathrooms & floors, replenishing coffee/tea/cups/soap/lotion, etc. My TV was broken, bathroom door didn't open/close. The breakfast wasn't so great, or fresh & the restaurant needs to have a better variety of food and answer the phone to accept orders. The happy hour was chaotic, long lines, crowded with no place to sit. Not the best experience & not the Hilton standard I've become accustomed to as a business traveler.

title: Not worth the price I paid
text:
I was a little disappointed given the fact that this was a 4 star, highly rated hotel. I'm stayed at 2.5 star hotels that were comparable in terms of aesthetics and service for much cheaper.

The good:
- the location was great
-Concierge was friendly and efficient
-Breakfast was pretty good and included
-Evening reception was a nice touch. Make sure you take advantage of the $30 daily credit

The not so good:
-My room windows were disappointing. I wanted the floor to ceiling windows and booked a skyview room for this purpose (as the pics shown on site showed floor to ceiling windows). Unfortunately that room category doesnt have those windows. (Clearly the person at front desk wasnt sure either, because when I asked, they told me that the room did come with floor to ceiling windows when it didnt)
-The lobby and dining areas were underwhelming. They were very small and not very fancy for a 4 star hotel
-The smoke alarm went off twice while we were there. They were false alarms but disrupted our sleep
-Room service was not responsive to calls. We called front desk who advised that we come down to the restaurant instead (kinda defeats the purpose of room service)
-The elevator was down on our last day. Nobody informed us till we tried to operate the elevator (with all our bags in tow) and had to call front desk to find out what was the problem. This delayed us by at least 15 mins

All in all, it wasn't terrible. I just had better or comparable experiences for much cheaper. I feel like i was cheated out of the great NYC experience that I wanted. I probably wont be staying here again

title: Great location and excellent staff
text:
