Stayed at this hotel for a girls trip to NYC. The weather delayed our flight so we arrived later than expected. Once we arrived to the hotel, although we were exhausted from our flight delays and cab ride in the rain from JFK, we were greeted by the friendliest staff. Adam and Moe made us feel welcome and excited to be in the city.

 Since it was late and we didn't want to venture off in the rain, we decided to dine in the bar area. My friends got the spaghetti and meatballs and the orecchiette pasta. Both entrees were delicious. I ordered the tacos, which coming from southern California, wasn't the best I've had but it did it's job. 

Each of us had different room types. The king room was a small room but sufficed for the my friend who was in her own room. I had a jr suite which was slightly bigger and I enjoyed the separation to be able to sit in another space other than a bed.

The next morning we enjoyed the hot breakfast and enjoyed the bacon, potato, and eggs. We were curious about the omelette station but it was a long wait so we decided to pick the hot food that was available. The seating was limited and it was hard to find a table at 8:30am. We eventually did and the remainder of the stay had better luck with seating at 7:30am. Also, elevators were slow during these times but that is understandable. I should mention that there was an elevator issue on one of the days that didn't affect me but it did affect one of my friends who had to call the front desk a few times to get her using the service elevator since the elevator was not going to the higher floors. Even with this hiccup, the staff was apologetic and quick to get her down to the lobby. 

The staff is a gem in this hotel. Adam especially who would greet us each morning, laugh with us and run the elevator up to get my friend with a smile. For the situation, my friend still came out of the elevator laughing at the situation. we were sad to leave and sadder when the staff said they didn't want us to leave. So sweet! Location of the hotel is perfect and walkable to subway and all the attractions. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Overall wonderful experience!!!
text: I chose Embassy because the price was right for time square and they include their scrumptious hot breakfast. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION !!! The hotel is walking distance to any broadway show you wish to see, the red steps and so much iconic dining. My daughter and I had a blast. The Embassy staff was friendly and accommodating and that made our stay even more enjoyable.

title: Great experience
text: Comfortable bed with great pillows.  The breakfast and evening reception were very nice.  Location has many advantages in midtown Manhattan.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  I am looking forward to another visit.

title: First time in NYC
text:
Embassy Suites Times Square is located in walking distance to several subway stations and sights. We could see the Empire State Building out of our window. Anna was great when they were working on the elevator. She made sure everyone got to where they were going on the service elevator. Adam did an excellent job answering questions and giving directions and Danu helped us get a ride to the airport.  The breakfast and social hour was nice too
Would recommend this hotel.

title: Amazing, personalized check-in process
text: Janiah created an amazing check-in experience by wishing me a happy birthday, providing some bday treats, and being an overall delightful person to interact with. After a long day of travel it was nice to engage with someone who truly seemed like their goal was to delight the hotel guests. Really appreciate the extra effort to provide a differentiated customer experience.

title: Mediocre - ok for a night or two
text:
Staff was very kind and attentive. Similar to what a few reviewers say, the hotel is in just ok shape. Clean enough to enjoy a night or two. I would have loved it more if my room had a little more attention to detail when it was being cleaned. Nice view of Empire State Building. Breakfast was a hit, dining area, food area and the cook to order area were super clean, well staffed and managed. Great variety of food for anyone. 
The rest of the hotel again, could just use slower more thoughtful cleaning practices to make it a better stay.  Oh and… curtains are very big and heavy and sadly stained. Note to Hilton, more simple shades could add inches of space and not make for so many negative reviews of dirty curtains. Might stay again if I go with family.

title: Bra hotell
text: Ett bra hotell med närhet till stadens begivenheter. Enkelt att hitta och parkering i garage endast ett par hundra meter bort. Trevligt stort rum för att vara Manhattan. Jag uppskattade mitt besök på hotellet.

title: New York Spring Break Vacation
text: Lianna and Bruno were two wonderful employees that were incredibly kind and accomodating. Some of the nicest hotel staff I ever had the pleasure of interacting with. Our room was lovely and had an excellent view of some of New York's awesome skyscrapers. While the breakfast was nothing special, the late night complementary room service was helpful when we wanted food but not to go out that night. Great experience over all.

title: Great location and great staff.
text: Overall a great location amongst all the main attractions. The staff were excellent from front desk to breakfast and housekeeping. For those who enjoy a cocktail or beer. There are free drinks and nibbles at 5pm to 6.30pm each day. The breakfast was good and set you up for the day. Overall I would recommend this hotel and we will be back when we visit New York again.

title: Adam, bell captain
text: My nieces and I were thrilled with the location of the hotel. But we were thoroughly impressed by Adam, the bell captain. He was extra friendly and just made us feel so comfortable. He asked about our interests and offered suggestions. The hotel had great amenities and we would definitely return, especially if we could see Adam again!

title: Not worth it
text: Although my trip was awesome . I paid a lot for a small room with balcony .  And the $30 a day amenity’s is a bit much.  I’m not a drinker so cocktail hour didn’t benifit me . But overall you couldn’t beat the location and the 3pm staff was awesome

title: Great Hotel/Convenient Location
text:
We visit the city on a regular basis and this is our go-to hotel.  The location is great and the staff even better, especially Dinu and Adam.  They always make us feel so welcome and are very helpful - it's like we're coming home each time we visit.  Thanks for everything and we'll see you in November!          
- Cheryl and Bill

title: First Trip To The City
text: We had a very smooth check in process and shopped while we waiting on our room. By the time we got back our room was ready. Our room was actually a little bigger than I expected, and  it was very very clean. The food is great.

title: 便利で小綺麗なビジネスホテル
text: JFKから帰国するたフィラデルフィアから移動して一泊。夜着いたので夕食はロビーのバーで。ちゃんとしたメニュー頼めました。サーモン美味。部屋は小ぢんまりして小綺麗で洗練された感じで良いです。朝食も結構充実してました。良い選択でした。お勧めです。

title: Great customer service
text: Janiah checked me in after a long and trying day. She made a difference by turning my frustration into a great experience. Than you for going the extra mile to make a difference Janiah. Much appreciated!

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: Upon arrival we were pleasantly greeted by Adam and were assisted by Louise at the front desk with all our immediate and future needs. Our room was not as clean as it could have been and we would stay again. Elevators at mealtimes and checkin are quite slow. Roof top deck and bar were a nice alternative although rained on us. Upon our check out Adam again assisted us to expedite our departure to JFK. The people shined brighter than the facilities.

title: Disappointing Hot Room
text: Never had such terrible air conditioning in any hotel. We read several reviews before we came and thought the posts were exaggerating about it being hot and paid the price! Had maintenance come once and also went to the front desk and complained. Both said that 68 is their lowest setting and it was more like 80. Your hot walking around the city all day and come back to a hot room. It shuts off when you are not in the room and even sleeping! If coming with family or friends, don’t count on breakfast and  happy hour. Too small for the number of guests. We are AMEX diamond member and have stayed In Embassy Suites all over the U.S.  and never experienced this before. Look at another location! Also, the resort fee is a joke.

title: Not Times Square
text: Don't be influenced when booking by the complimentary breakfast and happy hour.  Shop for rate because the expectations on food and bar service is minimal.  The location is good if you are heading downtown.

title: Good location. It’s not a resort
text: Great location. Clean hotel great breakfast although often very crowded. The resort fee is a joke and a rip off. There are no amenities for this add on   Otherwise this is a good property and easily accessible to midtown

title: Great value, but front-desk staff can be uninviting
text:
We stayed for one night in the King Bed Junior Suite w/ sleeper sofa. Overall, we were happy with the stay, and will stay again. A room this size, and in this area, is hard to beat at this price-point.

However, one of the front desk staff was rude to us, when we told her that there was an aerosol can on our mattress when we got to our room. It ended up being a scent-spray, and when we asked what it was and inquired about a different room available, she scoffed and replied "so... that's it?". I realize it ended up being negligible and we're all adults here, but our inquiry was met with disdain, and we weren't being demanding or rude. 

Also, the bedsheet was too small on the king bed. Kept coming off and barely fit.

title: Visited NYC to meet with friends and family
text: Great location just in a middle of Manhattan, walking distance to the most POV. Very friendly staff, clean and good organized lobby. Small, but cozy room with view on Avenues of Americas. Free full breakfast and happy hours. Adjacent garage with inside passage to the hotel.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: Our stay at the embassy suites was wonderful. When we arrived, Lianna greeted us and checked us in. She was amazing at answering questions and greeted every guest with a smile. The breakfast was delicious. The location is great and a short taxi, subway or taxi ride to other neighborhoods in the city. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Embassy Suites in Manhattan a great stay!!
text: I stayed before in this hotel during March 2023 and decided to repeat my stay because of how well we were treated and its proximity to so many attractions.  Service was impeccable and this time we booked three rooms as i went with additional family members. From Adam who takes care of your luggage and transportation to all staff at breakfast area everyone takes care of you.  A sure bet of where to stay when in NY.

title: LiAnna, staff, and hotel were great
text: LiAnna was great and made us feel right at home. She did everything to make our stay comfortable. The staff was great at this facility, and the breakfast was a nice reprieve from the noise from the city. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Great home away from home experience!
text: Great hotel!  Rooms/beds were comfortable.  The staff was extremely accommodating and friendly.  Thanks Bruno for putting my ice pack for my knee in the freezer everyday.  Also, thanks to Adam for arranging our transportation to the airport and giving us information for riding the subway.

title: NYC Girls Trip 2023
text:
All the super friendly & helpful staff/friends at the front desk, the group of concierge men who were always in the lobby anxious to steer us through the NYC subways, ubers, etc., the bartenders and cocktail servers were always there us ladies on our non stop comings and goings for 5 days.  The Hotel was clean, we never had to ask for anything - clean rooms and towels were magically there when we returned after each long day of adventures. 
Breakfast was always delicious - we were just too on the go to get a minute for the Happy Hours darn it.  In all, we seriously appreciated each and every one of you - you really were the icing on our NYC cake - THANK YOU!!!  We'll always recommend you and we'll be BACK!! signed...
Mary, from the 'who let the girls out" bling shirt group from So Calif...

title: Impeccable Guest Service. A New York City Gem.
text:
We loved this hotel. Rooms were clean and well appointed. They are small but remember, it is New York City, rooms are all smaller there.  Hotel is in an excellent location to Time Square area, subway, Central Park, Empire State Building, and the hop on hop off Big Bus tours.  We walked everywhere. Safe neighborhood and great restaurants.
Li-Anna  at the front desk was amazing. She was extremely sweet and very professional. She worked hard  to get us exactly what we wanted in the perfect room.  Thank you for your help Li-Anna. 
Dinu the front door man was so kind and always greeted us with a smile and a water. He took time to really interact and get to know us. 
Guillermo, supervisor of food and beverage runs a tight ship. His employees are very kind and very helpful. Good job Guillermo. 
We’ve stayed at several NYC hotels and this place is our favorite.
Thank you for a wonderful visit to your hometown.

title: Do not stay here
text: This is the worst hotel I have stayed in when visiting Manhattan - and I've visited 30 times. Sorry Hilton but this Embassy Suites is not living up to brand guidelines and should have the right to use the brand removed. The lobby is higgledy piggidely, the bar prices are astronomical. The team members on front desk look like they are dreaming of being anywhere but serving customers. Quite possibly the worst thing is the breakfast area on the fourth floor. It is so cramped that it's not fit for purpose. It's grubby and the food is far below average. It's enough to put you off wanting to eat at all. Such a shame - Embassy Suites are generally good but this was not even one star. DO NOT waste your hard earned money staying at this 'hotel'.

title: Great place to stay ❤️
text: The entire staff was absolutely fantastic.  Adam, at the front desk, was so welcoming and helpful. And the clerks at the front desk, as well as the bar staff, were delightful and entertaining. The room was exceptionally clean, housekeeping prepared our room each of the six days of our stay. The breakfast and happy hour was a huge help!

title: Would have been one star but saved by some nice staff
text: While the room was comfortable, and the location perfect for sightseeing NY's main attractions, the breakfast process was chaotic, and the charging scheme close to fraudulent. The hotel adds a $30 charge pulls taxes for each day of your stay, the idea being that you then spend that money in the hotel.  What's wrong with that? 2 beers and two cocktails on the first night came to $78. Bad enough, but only $30 of the bill could be set against that charge despite us staying 3  nights and having no other charges. Mid-Manhatten is expensive, but we found nothing comparable to the bar prices of the hotel. Luckily the hotel had three redeeming features in the form of receptionist Davely and Janiah, who both worked hard to look after us, and a hotel porter who was very helpful but I didn't catch his name. In short the hotel felt like a rip off and was certainly not good value for money.

title: 4 day stay
text: The room was pleasant, great smell and very clean. The pillows were very fluffy and the bed was comfortable. The AC worked great, which was nice because it was in the 90’s here for a couple of the days. The staff was very easy to work with and room service or maintenance came up very quick if called upon. Davely and Janiah at the front desk were extremely helpful and accommodating, easily some of the best front desk staff I’ve ever worked with, definitely will be coming back.

title: Great Hotel!
text: This hotel has great service and a super friendly staff. Our room was cleaned and we received fresh linens daily. We had plenty of room in our suite for 3 of us. Of course, you can’t beat a made-to-order omelet!

title: An Experience
text: Dinu was amazing! He took care of my friends and I so well. He was the best part of the hotel. As the other reviews stated, the hotel is quite smaller compared to the other Embassy suites around the country, but it’s NY; everything is small.

title: Not perfect but absolutely will recommend ...
text: We've visited NYC many times but this was our visit stay at this Embassy Suites.  First, if you are going to use the subway regularly, note that this hotel isn't right by a station.  (We always ride the subway everywhere, and our failure to recognize this resulted in us walking a lot more than anticipated.)  That being said, our room was comfortable and clean.  (Our only real disappointment was in the weekday housekeeping staff.  Weekend staff was great, but weekday staff left a dripping black plastic bag in our room with a dirty cleaning cloth and missed a few things they should have done in our room.)  Breakfast was very good - hot items (eggs, potatoes, meats, french toast/waffles), breads (regular and sweet), cereals, yogurt, oatmeal, and made-to-order omelets.  It was an incredibly busy area with not quite enough seating.  However, the staff was amazing - efficient in replenishing food, replenishing dishes, answering questions and delivering omelets to guests - all with a smile.  Wish the dining seating area was a little bigger but I realize they only have so much space to work with in NYC.  Finally, the front desk staff deserves the biggest shout out.  Specifically, Bruno and Mo were the most stellar examples of courtesy and professionalism.  As we were in the lobby area at different times, we watched each of them interact with non-English speaking guests who were asking for something or, in one case, being quite demanding - they never raised their voice, never lost their patience (though these situations lasted much longer than they should have) and exhibited professionalism on an extremely high level.  We were soooo impressed!

title: Great experience!
text: Great service! Dinu the concierge was amazing at helping with our bags and getting us a cab to the airport. The rooms were spacious and clean. Will definitely stay again! I loved the rooftop cinema as well.

title: Breakfast Bomb
text:
Great location and a nice front desk here. The hotel is only around 5 years old, so everything still looks good. I cannot understand why they never update HVAC when renovating. It was so loud that I was waking up every 20 minutes when the system turned on. 

Breakfast was a total mess. Unlike other Embassy Suites, they have a warren of small rooms to sit in. Empty boxes were scattered about, and tables were not cleaned. For these prices, they should try a little harder.

title: Not great service
text:
First off, the name of the hotel. They are not on Times Square. Not even very close.
My wife and I booked to stay there twice, a week apart (we visited friends outside the city between stays).
We booked identical rooms for both times. On our second stay we were given an accessible room with a shower that could only be used with a second person to hold the head, there case nowhere to fix it. When we queried the room we were told repeatedly that we had booked an accessible room. We did not. I do have to say that both rooms had an exceptional view of the Empire State Building. 
Breakfast is included. I enjoyed the breakfast and the people who made the omelettes were quick and efficient. The breakfast room was often crowded but we always found somewhere to sit.
I was dismayed by the lack of green awareness. In the rooms the coffee cups were single use disposables individually wrapped in plastic. At breakfast the fruit juice glasses were disposable plastic. All of the towels were washed and replaced every day. There was a bit of paper saying that if we didn't want our room serviced (are all) we should put out the ' Do not disturb' sign. Neither of the rooms we stayed in had one and when we asked for one it did not appear.
It is a tall building, we were on the 35th and 33rd floors. There are only three elevators. The wait could be long. As was the wait to check out. With a lobby full of customers the staff preferred to answer the phone than serve the people in front of them.
Even though the hotel is not on Times Square, it is in a good location and only a 20 minute walk to most of the Broadway shows. There are lots of good shops nearby.

title: Great location for all things mid-town
text:
Great location for all things midi-town - our view from 35th floor was stunning
Breakfast was okay - not much for vegetarians except eggs, but the made to order omelettes were fabulous. Everything else was high fat, high carbs!  Breakfast staff were all very friendly - but the room was very crowded at all times. Many people loaded up their plates and took them back to their rooms. Lovely large, comfy bed. 
The big bug bear was the elevators - only 3 of them and they took ages to get to us on the top floors. 
Lots of little things they need to sort out - haridryer that didn't work took 5 phone request and 2 days to replace, fridge froze solid everything we put in it, room service was promised for 20 minutes and still hadn't arrived at 45minutes. 
Look out for the 'destination fee' which adds up over a stay, then 2 sets of taxes!!

title: Great place to stay
text: From the time we checked in the staff wass very nice the manager Jamila and the other helper Laquan i think were very helpful. The rooms were clean and the location was great! Close to everything.....

title: Great place for family visitors to Manhattan
text:
Great location! Close to subways, shopping and theaters. Two small rooms with expected amenities, each with a couch separated by a divide to use as an extra single bed. Great hot breakfast buffet. Staff was very friendly and helpful.   Good value.

Staff was slow, at times, with room service, refreshing breakfast buffet and bringing extra blankets but always accomodating.

title: Good but…
text: The accommodation is perfect if you visit the city of NY. You’ve everything around it! However if you plan to go to another destination just afterwards and you’ve a lot of bagage, then there is just not enough space to get rid of your bagage in the room as they are “NY size” rooms. Also during holiday periods, the breakfast area is quite occupied and it might be that you’ve to wait until someone else has finished.

title: Understaffed and over worked
text:
Stayed two nights in two small but clean rooms. Thursday and Friday nights. Rooms were of identical size and yet our bill showed FOUR different rates ranging from $280 to $302. 

The front counter staff never had all three positions staffed even when there was a long line of customers waiting to check in. Same for the breakfast area along with happy hour, which served a delicious assortment of potato chips, some sort of rice and of course red pickled beets topped off with a cookie. Seriously. 

Hotel looked like they were hosting a group of seriously overweight folks who hadn’t seen food in a while. Pretty unattractive unless you love folks in tank tops. 

Their three elevators were incredibly slow and we walked down stairs couple times after waiting fir elevators. TIP— ask fir a low floor room so you’ll only need to walk a few floors. 

On a positive note the hotel is well located inky a couple short blocks to Time Square and a major subway line connection center. Finally the bellman was extremely friendly in storing and retrieving our luggage. He also arranged transit to LaGuardia considerably cheaper than either Uber or a cab. Hotel was quiet and albeit quite small rooms worked as we mostly slept there. 

On balance a disappointment.

title: Booking Again
text: Great location! Walking distance to Time Square and restaurants! The staff were Awesome! Dinhu helped a lot! Plane was to leave at 5pm but he suggested we leave to the airport around 12:30 pm to avoid possible traffic delays. So grateful for this insight! The Dominican Republic parade  was happening on 6th street on the day we were to leave! What a great surprise!

title: Great Service
text: We had a great experience at Embassy Suites in Manhattan Time Square.  The bell service with Adam was outstanding, always willing to answer questions and arrange travel for us.  If you are ordering room service plan ahead as they were very busy and most of the wait time was an hour.  Room was clean.

title: Service disappointments and letdowns at ES in Manhattan
text:
I booked our family’s vacation at Embassy Suites in Manhattan near Times Square in early August 2023. We stayed in two connected mini-suites with king size beds and a small living area with another TV and a pull out sofa.

I am a loyal Hilton Honors member, and I have stayed at dozens of different Hilton Hotels in the last 20 years. My 5-night stay in August 2023 was by far the worst experience I have ever had at an Embassy Suites. My low rating is NOT about the three small 5’ x 5’ elevators getting overcrowded, the tiny lobby, or the very crowded breakfast and evening reception – those are symptoms of a 39-story hotel with a Manhattan-sized horizontal footprint. The low rating I’ve assigned for my vacation at this Embassy Suites is about the apparent short-staffing, overall poor customer service, and a lack of maintenance in the guest rooms. I will highlight the examples I experienced. 
  
1. My check- in was delayed for both rooms well past the promised 400 pm check in time. I was told that the previous guests in that room requested late check out and they were behind with cleaning and inspecting. I was told I could check in to one room at 500 pm. I got in line for the check-in again at 515 pm, and the room was still not ready and I was told without apology that it would be another 10-15 mins. I finally got into one of the rooms at 545 pm and the other one after 600 pm. Why does Hilton charge guests a $150 fee for checking out even 1-hour late, but incoming guests are not compensated in any way for being denied a room for 2+ hours? I requested to speak to the manager to ask him/her this question and I was told by the front desk personnel that a manager would come up to my room in 15 minutes to chat. The manager never showed up as promised and I did not speak to a manager during my 5-night stay. My impression of the front desk personnel: when something goes wrong, they will mislead you with a promise that they cannot or will not keep in order to temporarily appease you. 
The Customer Service ethic was severely lacking with all front desk personnel I interacted with during my stay. While waiting in line at the front desk and during my personal interactions with front desk personnel, I never heard phrases such as “Thank you for staying with us”, “We apologize for your inconvenience”, etc.  that are staples at every other Hilton hotel . Maybe this is the “New York” culture of Hilton hotel customer service? I expected more from an Embassy Suites.

2. The air conditioning was not cooling sufficiently in one of our two rooms. I reported this to the front desk after our first night and they said they would send someone to take a look. As far as I know, no one ever showed up to address the problem. We had to endure a warm room (approx. 78 degrees) during our stay despite our thermostat being set at 70. When I tried to report the problem a second and third time I could not get an answer at the front desk. Part of the problem may have been related to accumulated dust/lint in the bathroom vent (see pictures) which pretty much blocked all airflow.  Since the situation was not unbearable, I gave up with trying to get the AC fixed.  That turned out to be a mistake when the AC failed completely and started blowing warm air on the last day of our stay and the temperature in our room got up to 85 after we took a shower. Luckily, the AC was working nicely in our 2nd room so we were able to spend time in there to avoid sweating. We were within hours of checking out so I never reported this last-day AC failure. 

3.  We got locked out of one of our rooms, and it took almost 2 hours for us to get back in. This was 10% our fault for letting the connecting-room door close when we walked into our other room and 90% hotel’s fault for designing connecting rooms to make it easy to lock yourself out without a quick and easy correction. 

4. We ordered self-serve ‘room service’ one night after we got back from Times Square and just wanted to relax and eat dinner in our room. We ordered our food at the downstairs Heist Bar from a limited menu and took the food upstairs to eat. The $28 chicken tenders (see pics) I ordered were severely overcooked and inedible. I wouldn’t say they were burnt --- more like fried or re-fried/cooked too many times with very dry/tough meat. I immediately tried to call Room Service for a replacement meal using the hotel phone in my room, but there was no answer and the call went to voice mail. I then called the front desk to help me reach room service/restaurant, but the person at the front desk told me it was their busy time for room service and they couldn’t answer the phone --- if I wanted room service I should go down to the hotel lobby and place an order at the Heist Bar. I didn’t have the energy or patience to deal with or even explain the issue, so I gave up and ate some of my wife’s order and called it a night. 

5. The $30 food and beverage credit that is offered to all guests as an offset to the mandatory destination fee is an example of the classic bait-and-switch tactic that businesses use to make money. IMO, this is a fraudulent tactic since the Hilton website says “daily $30 food and beverage credit for use in ALL hotel outlets” but when you look at your bill when you get home you find out the Cokes and bottled water you got from the lobby store does not count toward the $30 credit. I feel this is a fraudulent practice, or misleading at best, and Hilton should at least clarify this on their website. 
6. I had other issues during my stay that I did not report. These were relatively minor and I didn’t feel like it would be worthwhile to spend my time reporting them. When you are spending $300+ a night for rooms, you should not experience these types of ‘routine maintenance’ issues.  
a. One of the two TVs in one of our mini-suites was not working. 
b. There was no soap to wash your hands in the bathroom sink. 
c. The sink stopper did not work in my bathroom sink. I had to use a washcloth as a stopper while cleaning my contact lenses.  
d. We were unable to get service at the Heist Bar on the last evening of our stay on 8/6/23. The single bartender was overwhelmed with 6 full tables, another 5 folks sitting at the bar, and a line of impatient customers waiting to get a drink at the end of the bar. After a 20-minute wait, we gave up and went elsewhere for food and drink. This was extra frustrating to me since that Heist bar is really the only way to use the $30 food and beverage credit! 
e. We were given inconsistent information on housekeeping services. There was a sticker in the bathroom (see pic) that mentioned you had to request all housekeeping services. But the information sheet given to us at check-in mentioned routine housekeeping for everyone unless you requested otherwise. I had to call the front desk and housekeeping to clarify that, in August 2023, all guests receive routine housekeeping services during their stay. 

There were a few examples of good customer service during our stay. I interacted with the housekeepers on several occasions and they were very accommodating with providing clean towels and extra coffee. The staff working at the breakfast on the 4th floor were working as fast as they could to clean tables and bring out additional food for the buffet.  The bartenders serving the free drinks at the evening reception were friendly and fast with their service.

title: Best hotel!! You must book a room
text: So we ended up arriving super earlier than planned to nyc and they were more than happy to let us check in early. The front desk is AMAZING!! I always stay at embassy suites anywhere and I go this hotel has the best customer service/ workers. Top notch always helpful and going beyond. The room view was incredible as we got the balcony. I highly recommend this hotel it’s worth every penny. Very clean and high scale

title: Great place to stay!
text: Great value and accommodations. Staff are all fabulous. Breakfast happy hour and daily food voucher. My only complaint is there food area is set up very poorly. Need to make some changes there. Could easily do so. But I’d recommend them highly

title: Fint hotell dålig frukost
text:
Fint rum, bra läge, betalade extra för att bo högt upp. Bra och rent på rummet. Servic vara bra men saknade roomservice.. 
Det stort minuset var frukosten som var en katastrof. Ingen plats att sitta, flera gäster stod upp och åt sin frukost. Alla kom ofta samtidigt.. Bröd saknades, fylldes inte på… mycket rörigt och ingen ordning alls…

title: private use from the hotel employees of an hotel room
text: we arrived at the Hotel at 1:00 AM , The concierge give us the room key but when we arrived at the room the we found a woman bag on the bed and a security member appear from the balcony. He check our key and he told us to follow him to the concierge. After this was a nightmare.

title: Great stay
text:
Very nice hotel, small room to be expected in NYC elevator waits can be long but no other complaints 
Staff was absolutely grand very personable and accommodating!
Breakfast and cocktail hour is a huge bonus

title: Poor conditions
text: I went to the embassy suites on a bachelorette party visit for one night. We didn’t have anything big planned. We arrived at 11:15 am on Saturday morning as a group of 10. As we were checking in, we got cut off by a large group of obnoxious people (not an issue with the hotel just to clarify) who cut us in line. Whatever. Upon checking in, the front desk clerk informed us our 4 rooms we had booked would be on separate floors (we were told prior to arrival that all the rooms would be on the same floor). Another thing to note—it was very dusty in the lobby and one staff member sneezed three times behind the counter (very respectful of him, but still gross). None of the four rooms were ready so we headed out to start the activities. We returned back to the hotel later that night at around 6 to get ready for dinner and drinks. We were split up into 4 rooms so I was staying in a room with 2 other bridesmaids. As we entered the room, I was appalled at the size of the bathroom. For a three-person room, the bathroom could not even hold one of us (to clarify, we are fit and healthy, not large people). When one of the bridesmaids was on the toilet, I opened the door and it slammed into her. Literally millimeter space between the door and toilet seat. The shower was filthy. Shower gel had a nasty odor. There were only two towels and three of us so we had to call the hotel services to get another towel. They didn’t pick up the first time, so we called back five minutes later and finally someone picked up. The person was rude and hung up while I was asking him to send someone to pull out the couch. On our way out of the door, 45 minutes later, someone finally arrived with 2 extra towels. We asked him to pull out the bed, and when he did, the bed broke and he had to leave it half open until he sent someone to fix it!!! One of the bridesmaids was forced to stay out of the shower until someone came back to fix the bed (which was after we came back from dinner). Finally someone was able to fix the pull out couch. Later that night, we went to bed and me and my friend noticed the comforter had brown spots all over it. Disgusting!!! Regardless, we were so tired we passed out. At around 8 am, when I was still asleep, my friend informed me someone knocked on the door. When no one answered, the person ENTERED THE ROOM, stood there for a minute, and then left. Totally unprofessional and frightening. What were they doing in that one minute? And why were they in our room after no one answered the door? Huge security breach. Understandable if it was noon and cleaning staff etc. But it was not, it was 8 am. As we left later that day, checkout was horrible. It took 30+ minutes and stressed out the bride. A man working in the parking garage was acting ridiculous and hitting on the bride (she was flattered, but weird). He almost ran us over when pulling the car out. Overall, these were small issues in an overall good stay but they added up and caused stress for everyone. Since there were so many issues in just one night, I’m concerned what would have happened in a longer stay. Wouldn’t recommend this hotel.

title: Great hotel for an amazing NY experience
text:
The hotel is perfectly located in Midtown Manhattan, walking distance from Times Square, Broadway theaters, Empire State Building, Bryant Park and the iconic Fifth Avenue. If you arrive in NY before check-in time, you can leave your luggage at the hotel and start your adventure through this wonderful city. 

Our room was clean, confortable and the service was great throughout our stay. Breakfast was ok, the space is small for the amount of guests and it makes it difficult to find space to eat. At the end of your stay, you can book an airport shuttle directly at the front desk and they’ll manage everything for you. I would totally recommend this hotel for a great Manhattan experience.

title: You have to meet Adam!
text: Very enjoyable stay, you get 2 free drinks each night each, and you can take them back to the room if you wish. Breakfast was good, they mix it up a little each day. They have Captain Crunch, which made my day. Location was good, great little store close by called Bistro with a great salad type bar, hot and cold food. Adam made our trip very enjoyable. Very attentive, with a great personality. Be sure to ask him who has the best pizza, and take his advice!!!!

title: Moyen et Cher
text:
Hôtel très bien situé ! A 2 block de Time square.
Hôtel et prestation moyenne au vu du prix. 
Pas de ménage pour les séjours inférieurs à 5j. Les lits ne sont pas faits les poubelles pas vidées.
Le petit dej est assez moyen.
La chambre est minuscule pour une « suite » par Hilton
Il faut éviter le supplément vie sur l’empire state building c’est une arnaque

title: There are better options in NYC
text: Small Rooms, Tiny Closet, Small bathroom, Slow check-in, Unreliable elevators, Great location, Good city views, Outdoor movie theater (pricey), Expensive snacks available, Car service available, Bar items not worth the price

title: Abysmal food and beverage service
text:
Food and beverage are solely lacking. The room was small, but for the location, acceptable. The real challenge is both how cramped the property is and the lack of service from F&B trams. Firstly you need to plan on a 10 minute delay for elevators, in the morning and hopefully you’re not trying to avail yourself of the complimentary breakfast as it is a zoo in there. I struggled to find a table and there’s barely any room to maneuver to get food. I got some
Pancakes for my daughter and even after they had been refilled they were rock hard. I decided to try room service on a Monday night to take advantage of the $30 food credit my booking had, but I couldn’t reach anyone in room service. After five attempts, to reach someone on the phone, the front desk suggested I try the bar. It’s been 45 minutes since ordering two entrees and still nothing. I guess I with anything “complimentary” you get what you pay for. I would literally be better off at any of hundreds of restaurants within walking distance. Just a shame they can’t get it together.

title: I don't recommend
text:
Don’t recommend
The hotel is a 39 story building and the restaurant (breakfast) area is so tiny and crowded, always uncomfortable to have your meal there.
The air conditioning is a little loud because the motor is inside the room.
Not a good deal. Will not come back and do not recommend.

title: Thoroughly enjoyable!  Perfect location!
text:
I'll be back!   We spent 9 nights at the Embassy Suites Times Square and thoroughly enjoyed it.  It's in a great location - very near many landmarks/attractions and transportation, but on a fairly quiet street.   (Exterior noise was not a problem.)   The hotel is quite walkable to lots of restaurants/eateries, too.   

The staff is amazing!  They are all welcoming, attentive, pleasant and accommodating.   Luis (front desk) and Adam (bell captain) provided incredible service!  They were SO helpful and made us feel genuinely appreciated.   We arrived early, and they happily stored my luggage, allowed me to have breakfast, and hang out until they could arrange for an early check-in.  It's a bit cramped in the lobby because the hotel has a narrow (but tall) footprint, but there are other quiet places to relax on the 1st floor.  It's hectic at check-in and check-out times, but they do their level best to make everyone happy.

The free breakfast (on the 4th floor) is quite good!  And, they serve until 10:00AM on weekdays, and 10:30AM on weekends, so you don't have to rush in the mornings.   Yes, it can be crowded (more so on the weekends), but we always found a table.  I noticed that some people took their breakfast back to their rooms.  

We were on the go so long every day, that we only made it to the complementary Happy Hour (from 5:00 - 6:30 PM) once, but it was well done with a good assortment of drinks and appetizers.   

We were charged in advance $30 per day for food/beverage at the restaurant, which was enough to cover a couple of cocktails/wine every evening at The Heist (which is the hotel restaurant/bar off the lobby).   The $30 charge is 'use-it-or-lose-it' each day, so it was actually a good motivator for us to take a little time to unwind each night.  The bartenders were very friendly and affable.  The Heist (hotel restaurant/bar) is deceiving.  It is very small space, but the menu is delightful.  You can use the $30 credit for room service, also.  

I've read the complaints about the elevators.  It's true that there was sometimes a backup at the elevators, so you do need to plan for that during peak times.  But, everyone seemed to take the wait in stride.  

The City View Room had a great view of the skyline.   (I personally preferred the layout of those rooms vs. the Empire State Bldg Rooms.)  It was clean, nicely furnished, comfortable, modern and the maids were accommodating.  We had absolutely no problems in the room during our 9-day stay.  

Thank you to all the staff that made our stay in New York so thoroughly enjoyable!!!

title: Great location. Clean and comfortable.
text: Though the room was small, it was comfortable. We needed additional towels, and they were delivered right away.  The staff were friendly and professional. Adam, the lobby person, was especially helpful and welcoming.

title: Nice hotel, people but poor service
text:
We were a family of 6 staying in 2 rooms for 5 nights. At check in time, 4, one of our rooms wasn't "inspected" but if we wanted to go to our daughter's room they should have our key up in about 10 minutes. After 3 calls it was nearly 2 hours before we got a key for our room. When we got back to our rooms late that night the rooms were both warm. We turned the thermostats down, but both rooms were hot all night. I reported it to the front desk before we left the next morning. Then I called to check in the middle of the afternoon. When we got back around 10 that night neither room was cooling. I called again. Someone will be right up. No one came. I called 4 times before someone came up after midnight! They got my daughter's room cooling, but not ours. The next morning I asked to be moved to another room. They couldn't get us into another room till 4, but we had to move all of our things out of the room that morning if we wanted another room. So we packed up and moved things to our daughter's room. Our new room that evening was cool!
We had a couple of other issues I wouldn't have expected at an Embassy Suites.
All the people we dealt with were very friendly and tried to be helpful. Adam, the concierge, was extremely nice and helpful. The breakfast is the best I have ever seen in a hotel. It was very nice and clean.
Be aware that there will probably be a wait for getting a table to eat the nice breakfast. There are only 3 elevators for 39 floors, so there will be waits on the elevator.
The hotel is very centrally located. About 3 blocks from Times Square and the Empire State Building.
I hope this review helps. It is a nice place, but still has some issues that needs addressed.

title: Great customer service.
text:
Amazing customer service. The hotel staff was able to resolve my booking problem quickly and will now ensure that I’m a customer for life. 

The staff were thoughtful and assisted me in fixing the booking issue. They were just absolutely a pleasure to work with.

Thank you.

title: Nightmare
text:
The worst hotel I've ever been. All so bad that looks like a nightmare.
It's my thirs time in NYC and I've never been in such a terrible hotel. Wifi almost never working. Staff rude. Dirty, small room. Avoid it!

title: Great Stay
text: Stayed here for three nights at the end of June. It was the perfect location to see all the major sites.  We pretty much walked to everything.  The morning breakfast is great, good selection of items, an easy way to have breakfast and not waste a lot of time.  It’s on the fourth floor.  Make sure to get there early as it gets very busy. There is an overflow room where there is additional seating.   They should make use of the outdoor area that they use for the movies.  They should do boxed breakfast that you can take outside at least in the summer months.   Their afternoon reception went from 5 to 6:30.  It had long lines.  We were pleasantly surprised they put out cheese, fruit, nachos.  We only made it there two nights and what they put out was slightly different.    The 30$ resort fee gives you a 30$ credit to spend but you can do that in a limited time and only at the bar/restaurant in the main lobby and the restaurant on the fourth floor.  We loved going to Bryant park which was really close by, they had music on Friday and Saturday night, beautiful park.  The New York library is right there and it was amazing to see.   We arrived about 30 minutes before it closed.   What an amazing building.  We took the air Tran from Newark and then the subway to Penn station, it took a long time to get to the hotel.  Next time we will just get a car to pick us up.   We were going to port liberty in Bayonne to catch a cruise,we had a car pick us up and it was totally the way to go.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE - tiny rooms, gross sofa bed, slow elevators, understaffed
text:
This is NOT an "Embassy Suites" - the rooms are tiny (one room with a partition from the back of the sofa bed) unlike the typical, spacious 2 rooms.

We chose to stay here for the location, but even the location is NOT worth EVER STAYING HERE.

The A/C in our room was broken or faulty - you know it's bad when the hallway is cooler than your room.  Even at the lowest temperature and highest fan/air setting, the room was hot and stuffy.  When alerting the staff, no action was taken other than "ok."

The sofa bed in our room was absolutely disgusting (see pictures).  When asking the staff for a replacement mattress or room change, they responded no other mattress are available on the property and to change rooms, we would have to move out and wait to see what rooms might be available with no guarantee of this issue being resolved.

Additionally, the elevators are excruciatingly slow.  Whether you are going up or down, the elevator will stop on your floor.  Some guests shared they had to wait 30+ minutes for the elevator.  Given this is a high-rise with almost 40 floors, functioning and efficient elevators should be a must.

Do not be deluded by the location and free breakfast.  This hotel is not worth your money and the issues from our stay go beyond the staff.  While the staff was not particularly helpful, it is evident Hilton corporate needs to evaluate this property because it does NOT live up the standards of their brand.

We will definitely NOT be back and hope you take your money elsewhere to enjoy NYC.

title: My experience!
text:
Was a nice visit, very friendly and helpful staff overall. 
They resolved our issue and helped us have a comfortable stay. Special thanks to Li-anna and Mo.
The room is clean and spacious. They do ask of you to leave the room, when it is being cleaned. 
Breakfast was good. 

Area around the hotel is safe and close to tourist spots.
Would recommend.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE. ELEVATORS SLOW. POORLY MANAGED.
text:
Normally, I don’t leave a review, but there were too many issues here.
I was unable to check in with Hilton App and was forced to stand for 45 minutes at the front desk.
Within 5 minutes of entering our room, the fire alarm sounded. We weren’t certain if it was a real emergency or a safety drill. After it continued for several minutes, we walked down the stairs. The alarm continued for 5 minutes when an announcement was FINALLY made that the alarm was just a test and not an emergency.
The complimentary breakfast and Happy Hour events create an absolute quagmire, during those times, for the elevators. Guests were constantly complaining and waiting for up to 20 minutes for an elevator. This is unacceptable! Also, the hotel facilities and staff are overwhelmed and unable to adequately service the number of guests during breakfast and happy hours. There is insufficient seating, and the wait for custom ordered food is too long (over 30 minutes). This hotel is too small to manage complimentary meals and drinks. These inadequate conditions made the “free” drinks & meals an unpleasant experience. Guests would rather receive a reduction in room rates and have a more enjoyable stay by not waiting for elevators and service. 
Lastly, during our stay we were surprised by a hallway carpet replacement on our level (19th floor). We understand that routine maintenance/repairs must continue and cannot be avoided during guest stays. And we appreciate the hotel’s efforts to update and renovate. However, we should've been informed in advance of the date and time(s) of the intended repairs. The hotel must've known well in advance when this service was scheduled, and they should've properly notified us during check-in. There wasn't even a note posted on our floor's hallway wall. To add insult to injury, the carpet installers were rude and offensive. Overall, the hotel is clean and comfortable, but I will NEVER stay here again due to its mismanagement and inadequate complimentary perks.

title: Not worth the price
text: We didn’t get the room we had booked. Rooms are very small. No early check-ins even when we had requested 2days before traveling. We were charged hotel fees for already paid booking and nothing was mentioned at the time of booking. Lifts took forever and wasted lot of our time. Over all wasn’t a pleasant experience

title: Great value for NYC!
text: Upon arriving at the hotel I was not a very happy camper.  I felt like it was too crowded, the 2nd tv didn't work, there weren't enough towels, the room was too small, and the happy hour was too packed.  HOWEVER ... upon staying the night and experiencing a full day in NYC in July, I totally appreciated the fact that there was a delicious free breakfast AND an evening happy hour every night.  The drink selections were great and the food was fine (I couldn't get enough of the cucumber/onion/tomato salad)!  I compared this to staying at a hotel without these features and I soon realized how much time, energy, and money we were saving by being able to have breakfast and happy hour each day at the Embassy Suites.  Seriously - if I had to find a breakfast place for our party of 3, it would have been very stressful to please everyone AND it would have cost at least $75 a day (NYC prices).  Same goes for Happy Hour!  The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean, and every employee I encountered was SUPER NICE.  That goes a long way with me!  I would definitely stay here again!

title: Good Midtown Manhattan Location -
text:
This is a good tourist location for exploring  Midtown Manhattan and Times square. The room was clean and comfortable, with daily freshening by housekeeping.  There is a free breakfast offered, which seems well-appointed, but the space seems too small to accomodate the numbers of guests; so go early.  There is also and evening happy hour.
We were very impressed with Bell Captain/Concierge Adam. He will help you with any questions you might have. He's a super nice guy and the hardest working guy in Manhattan - always with a smile.

title: Great hotel and value
text: I was very pleased with my recent stay at the Embassy Suites. Location was great. I was treated so well and it started at check in with Luis. Free hot breakfast and appetizers in the evening make this place an amazing deal. Adam was another superstar that the hotel is lucky to have. Rooms were spacious for a family. Overall I have super happy with the place. Some negatives include that the elevator and lobby can get very busy during certain times.

title: DON'T.  JUST DON'T.   With all the other NYC choices, you can easily find better.
text:
Where do I even start!?!  I guess just bullet points:

* decent enough location
* bed was comfy

* mandatory $30 food and bev charge!!
* with barely one bartender and no servers handling their only restaurant,  it's almost impossible to get a drink or food (god help you if you're hungry), and too many flies to count with the door being constantly open to the street. 
* elevators are insanely inefficient.  There was a queue of people waiting at them constantly.   We had better luck walking down the 10 floors to the lobby (past all the trash bags in the stairways).   At one point over the weekend, we waited a 1/2 hour to go up, and the queue extended out the door of the hotel.
* no stopper in the sink (careful w that jewelry ladies!)
* no hand soap in the room
* air conditioner had a lower limit of 68deg only
* advertised a roof bar and it wasn't ever open (this is the entire reason we booked here!)
* wine and liquor selection was bottom shelf at best (and the bar was in the lobby)
* called embassy Suites and they aren't Suites.  And hallways are loud.  Ugh.
* breakfast ... omg.  It was like taking a regular sized embassy dining area and putting it in the smallest conference room in your office.  Powdered eggs, and 100 people in a room meant for 10.  InSANE.

In NYC, there are countless options.  Do yourself a favor and run past this hotel.  I guess what burns me the most is that the elevator wait made us late for the ballet at the Met and we had to wait til intermission and missed half the show.  Those tix weren't cheap, and I'm just sick about it.

title: Very rude front desk staff
text:
What ruined the experience for me was that 2 out of 3 front desk staff I interacted with were extremely condescending when I asked them simple questions respectfully. One of them didn't know their own hotel policy, giving me the answer to my question in a very rude and condescending tone, only to be corrected by his colleague later when I asked her instead. All other staff (bar and bell desk) were great though.

Elevators are impossible to ride if you're on a middle floor going down during a busy time, by the time they get to your floor they are always full. Better to take the stairs. Be prepared to wait in a lot of lines - lines for food, drinks, elevators back from reception and breakfast, front desk... It's a crowded hotel!

Bar where you can spend your credit is very overpriced. You are forced to pay for f&b and parking even if you don't use it. 

Would not stay again.

title: An average stay
text:
We stayed one night at this hotel in a junior suite.

The positives:
Good location, easy access to subway and local eateries. We walked to and from our theatre on 50th street comfortably. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was ready early and was a good size for our needs. AC only goes down to 68 but that worked for the space. 
The set up with a bed and sofa bed with a high back gave us the privacy that a Mom travelling with an adult son needed.

Breakfast had a great range of options and was delicious

The negatives 
No acknowledgement of Hilton membership, no water and we were charged for wifi.
The sofa bed sheets were stained and had a dirty sock from a previous guest in it. We called down about this but nobody picked up the phone (they are always busy down there and do a great job with the volume of people). We found spare sheets in the drawer in the king bed and changed them ourselves.
As others have said the elevators can be a nightmare. Sometimes ok-ish but we took the stairs a few times after waiting for over ten mins with each car full when it eventually arrived.

Overall it met our needs was a decent price for what we had and the staff were excellent.

title: Deceptive Advertising
text:
I will never stay at this Hilton again.  It is supposedly a 4 star hotel and it tries but falls way below the mark.

1) Most important is this.  I got a KING BED CITY VIEW room and made my reservation thru their website.  They show a largish room with floor to ceiling windows and a beautiful view and say the room is 293 feet.  I had done my research going over reviews with photos on TripAdvisor as well as Google and I saw over 5 different variants of the City View room with some yes being quite big and some with floor to ceiling windows while most were without.  Also many were tiny.  Some had a chair, some a couch.  Mine did have floor to ceiling windows but it was only half of the wall and the room was half the size of the larger ones.  It was just me luckily for I felt so claustrophobic.  No way was this room 293 square feet even if you included the bathroom.  It just in no way looked like the photo advertising the room.  If they said on the website that the designs of the City View rooms could vary then it would not be an issue but they do not.

2)  Now remember this is supposed to be a 4 star hotel.  I am a Hilton Member and got no water or acknowledgement of being a member at check-in.  I got a keycard plus the digital key.  The digital key would not work on the elevator but would on the room door.  The key card would not work on the room door but would on the elevator.

3)  The mattress was hard as a rock and pillows light as a feather.  Sleep was very difficult.  My room also had a very hard cushioned chair that could be a sofa bed but there would be no room to open it.

4)  The air conditioning was ridiculous.  It only goes down to 68 but my room was very very small and that room was no way 68 degrees.  And it was very hot while I was in NYC.

5)  The hotel lobby is verry small as is every floor.  This is just my personal preference.  I felt claustrophobic just being in the building.

6)  I did not have trouble with the elevators as many do.

I am trying to leave a honest review and you can make of it what you will.  I expected much smoother service and accountability for a 4 star hotel.  And I am tired of them saying the rooms are what you get in New York etc.  I have stayed at many other Hiltons in NYC that ran better and had better and bigger rooms.  Seriously I got no good sleep due to the bed and the poor air that I couldn't wait to get home.   Just know in advance the room you get may not be what you expect.

title: Wonderful experience
text:
Spent 4 nights in this hotel with my family to take in some Broadway shows. Arrived at noon on a Sunday after an early flight and our room was ready. The woman at the desk was very friendly and helpful as was every member of the staff we encountered during our stay. The room was small and compact, which in our experience is to be expected in New York but was clean and well kept, the beds were comfortable as well. We were on the 17th floor, so noise wasn't a problem either. The room for the free breakfast was small and crowded, but the food was great, and we just took our plates back to our room and ate. With the prices of restaurants in NY, this was well worth it and saved us a lot of money over our stay. I have read a lot of reviews about the elevators being slow, and we did experience some wait times but never more than 3 or 4 minutes. My advice would be to get on an elevator whether it is going up or down and "ride it out", it worked for us! :) 

I highly recommend this hotel, we would definitely stay here again!

title: AWESOME EXPERIENCE
text: My wife and I visited New York for our first time for our 21st Anniversary.  This experience was totally amazing due in large part to our stay at this hotel.  The entire staff was awesome.  They attended to all of our needs quickly and professionally.  Janiah was the best!!  She answered all of questions each day and even provided helpful instructions on how to navigate through the city and how to use the subway system which was foreign to us being from Florida, lol.  Janiah went as far as printing subway routes and schedules for us each day based on our routes.  We will definitely stay here again in large part due to the excellent service we received from Janiah and the rest of the staff.

title: Awesome location!
text: Could walk to many NYC highlights.(or short Uber ride away). Good breakfast variety. Evening reception was a great time to relax after a day of sightseeing. Friendly staff. Rooms were cleaned daily unless you request otherwise. We stayed on 7th floor where you still could hear traffic but we got used to it. Higher up floors complained about elevators being slow and stopping at every floor. But there are 39 floors. Staying on 7th was perfect! We could easily walk to 4th floor breakfast and reception. Rooms were small but in NYC. They were functional and  nice they had 2 tvs(with sleeper sofa) also fridge and microwave. Would stay here again!

title: First Choice Option
text: The customer service at this hotel is excellent. Each team member goes above and beyond the call of duty to ensure that you are accommodated. The location is perfect for walking to notable attractions like the Empire State building, Madison Square Garden, Times Square, and Macy's to name a few. The rooms are modern and spacious. This property is definitely a first choice option for me and my family for future visits.

title: Ok stay
text:
This was just a normal, okay hotel.
Pros: great location, close to the Herald Square -34th street metro. Employees very friendly.
Cons: AC didn’t work well at all. Room was always hot, really the hotel was just uncomfortably hot the entire time.

title: Pick a different hotel
text: Booked 4 days non-refundable. Arrived at 4:30 pm and waited another hour for room to be available. Long lines for elevators throughout stay. Each day witnessed jet lagged people waiting for their rooms / sleeping in lobby. Breakfast area too small for number of guests. Room itself was nice with floor to ceiling windows on 34 th floor. Cool and cleaned daily. I used the safe. Great location

title: Embassy Suites Times Square was great!
text: It was a great hotel, clean, nice, comfortable and the amenities they offered were great! The employees were very helpful. And Luis, the receptionist, was the best!!! The location was also very convenient

title: Excellent hotel ♥️♥️
text: It was an amazing hotel and I always choose hilton♥️ The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The floor we were on had an amazing city view. Thank you for everything.

title: Worst Embassy Suites Ever
text: This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed. Their service was totally frustrating. The housekeeping people never cleaned our room even after requesting for 2 days. They just did our bed on 3rd of our stay after requesting multiple times. Bathroom not even cleaned or vacuum. No dusting or mopping the floor.No body lotion or tissue paper even after 3 days of our stay. Hotel staff just keep making excuses. They don't even feel sorry after this worst service. Never ever going to recommend this placc to any of my friends or family. Absolutely a worst experience and customer service.

title: Never stay here
text: We visited this hotel for our 20 year wedding anniversary and both my engagement ring and wedding band were STOLEN from our room (with less than 11 hours until our 5am departure).  Originally, right after reporting the incident to the hotel staff, we were told that “Hilton has great insurance for these instances.”  And once we arrived home, the situation totally changed and we told the hotel is doing nothing to compensate us.  They also told us not to bother contacting NYPD, since they had “good insurance”.  And that for no urgent matters we would be waiting hours and hours for them to show up. Now we wish we had, as NYPD said they would’ve opened a thorough investigation with fingerprinting and interviews of suspects.  The customer service, given the situation has been HORRIBLE.  Never, I repeat, NEVER, stay here.

title: Poor, poor and very Poor
text:
Totally shocked at the attitude of some people. Having finally got a elevator to breakfast to find it was the end of the world! No food left, pushing and shoving. You should all be ashamed but it gets worse. Couldn’t get an elevator so took the stairs (21) floors fit and healthy so not an issue. I was passed on the stairs by a man carrying a baby in a car seat was clearly only weeks old, followed by the mum carrying the stroller because she was told that strollers are not allowed in the elevator that is the whole point of an elevator people! You should be embarrassed about making a young family take the stairs. 

The hotel itself is just not well catered. Breakfast is a joke 3 days out of 5 no food! No tables! Poor behaviour by guests very selfish greedy people.

Room was nice but really noisy you will need to pack ear plugs just to get any sleep at all.

Overall worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Never again!

title: Not up to Hilton standards
text: This hotel needs serious help. It is NOT up to Hilton standards. There is a problem with housekeeping, breakfast, happy hour, and room service. You name it, we had a problem. There is NOT enough seating or food to service t his hotel of this large. They run out of food all the time, and you're lucky if you get silverware or any food. we asked for towels and toilet paper 5 times and then asked a different person at a different desk for help. The happy hour food is good but you're lucky if they have beer of any kind and soda to go into your drink. room service never answers, so you can't use the 30 dollars they give you. The hotel has 3 elevators that cannot accommodate 30 plus floors of people. the front desk is so busy that you can't even talk to a live person to get any kind of help. I was very disappointed and paid ALOT for not much.

title: Perfectly Acceptable Hotel
text:
The hotel is modern, clean and well maintained.  37th Street is relatively quiet but you don't hear the street noise inside the hotel, other than the very loudest.  The bed is comfortable and the water pressure is great in the shower

The staff are working hard, friendly and very capable.

The hotel advertises Breakfast Included to differentiate itself from competitors.  The hotel is 34 stories tall and the room seats maybe 100 people.  The staff are working really hard, but the buffet is usually out of food, the tables are not bussed on a timely basis and it is hard to find a place to sit.  This made breakfast a somewhat stressful experience and something that I think the hotel needs to address.

I would stay here again for sure

title: Location great, but a lot left to be desired...
text: The location and access were great with this hotel, but those were about the only bright spots during our stay here. Our group booked a total of 3 rooms for a 2 night stay and none of the 3 rooms got any housekeeping service even though the 'destination fee' charged daily promises daily housekeeping. Our request to at least provide fresh towels went unfulfilled. In 2 of our rooms, the TV did not work. The breakfast was good, but super crowded and borderline claustrophobic due to the undersized dining area the 2 days we were there. The poor breakfast staff did their best under these trying circumstances though, and kudos to them.

title: Terrible hotel
text: Do not stay here or you will regret it! When we got here the sink was clogged and our room was absolutely boiling. There is no room in any room and you feel cramped and there is no place to put anything anywhere! When we got into our hotel at night our air conditioning wasn’t working when we called down they couldn’t fix it and didn’t change our room!

title: Eat breakfast another place
text: Nice place with all the necessary things for a hotelstay. The beds are nice, and the cleaning is fine. Unfortunately the breakfast was very bad and not enough seets for everybody, very chaotic in the morning. The elevators was very slow, and it took a long time in line waiting. The staff is very sweet.

title: Make it a point to visit this Embassy Suites Hotel!  Fabulous location and wonderful employees!
text: I had a great experience here from check-in to checkout!  Everyone, with only one exception, was polite, professional, helpful, and very friendly.  We were delighted with a very comfortable room looking out at the Empire State Building!  We made sure to thank our check-in professional!   I did not get all names, but Adam, Bellman, was delightful at checkout storing our bags while we went to The Met and helping us obtain a cab!  A fabulous experience!

title: Need a lot of improvements
text: First night we had no AC in our room. Called the front desk 4 times plus went down to the lobby 3 times, waited for the engineer to show up until close to 1am, got a runaround answers until I finally found out that the AC in that room has been broken since the day prior; and they still give us the room anyway. We got a new room the next day but it was a miserable hot first night. The elevators are really really slow. There are 3 of them and most of the times, there were lines of people up to the hotel entrance. When we checked in, the front desk told us that housekeeping will come every day, that didn't happen. They didn't show up and we had to ask the front desk for fresh towels and some supplies. Breakfast is not consistent. We were there 4 days and each day there's less item in the menu. On our last breakfast, there was no orange juice or yogurt; cut up fruit were not fresh, you can see the bruises on them. Most likely they were fruit from the day before

title: The kids LOVED this hotel!!
text: Thank you Embassy Suites - - especially Raheema - for making our NYC visit wonderful! She could tell that our teens were exhausted from traveling and immediately offered them a 'treat' and water. She asked the kids about our sightseeing adventures every day. Adam was also very helpful in storing my son's heavy duty sports equipment. The room, buffet, and location were perfect for my family. We were especially grateful for the food/beverage credit. Because of this experience, my kids now insist on Embassy Suites when we travel.

title: Junior Suite is a Joke
text:
Stayed in the King junior suite with an Empire State Building view. Room is a closet with way too much furniture. Could not move around this room without bumping into something else or someone else; and we only had 2 people. The closet barely has room for a single item of clothing. 

For a “junior suite” this is small. For a normal NYC King size room this is a small room. 

Rest of the stay was fine but the room quality and size left a lot to be desired.

title: Great experience
text: We had a great experience from the time we arrived. Front desk (Davely & Liawna) were very accommodating and so friendly. Every hotels needs a front desk worker like these ladies. Our hotel room was very nice and comfortable and we never had an issue. The location of the hotel was perfect and was within walking distance to the places we wanted to visit. We love happy, but the only draw back is one night there was only 1 bartender so it can get busy. The area where they have the happy hour is a lil small, but we still had a great time. We’ll definitely be back to visit.

title: Great staff!
text: I had a great experience thanks primarily to staff members Adam and Raheema. This was my first post-COVID business trip and I have legally changed my name since then. When I arrived, I found out that my company booked me under my old name. Raheema calmly and quickly worked with me to find a solution. During my stay, Adam was a reliable resource for a warm smile, a sincere compliment, and recommendations for places to eat around the area.

title: In love with Embassy Suites manhattan Times Square
text: Hola!! Fue espectacular mi estadìa en el Embassy Suites Manhattan Times Square!! Esperamos volver pronto!! NYC siempre serà un gran Destino a visitar. Gracias por todas sus atenciones. En especial a la muchacha del front desk,en recepción que ahora mismo se me olvidò su nombre,creo que es dominicana, que nos brindle toda su ayuda a la hora de saber que tren cojer en el subway para nuestros Destinos. Un abrazo a todos y gracias por su gran trabajo y hospitalidad. Love This hotel!! 🥰🗽🚕🚇✈️

title: Our stay
text: Our stay at the Embassy suites in New York, was absolutely incredible. The staff was very welcoming and attentive to all of our vacation needs. The inn hotel restaurant was also very good and the fitness center was just a nice add-on to the whole stay. The inclusion of our $30 credit went towards our meal at the hotel, which is a very nice buffer to the price.

title: If you want to make your flight on time don’t stay here
text: Most of our stay was fine, except on check out day which was a Sunday.  First of all there weren’t enough elevators for guests in general, but it was worse on Sunday when most guests had luggage. We had 2 rooms on the 24th and 29th floor. It took one of my daughters and hour and a half to get down to the lobby from the 29th floor. After waiting an hour for an elevator she had to walk down 19 flights of stairs with a suitcase and several pieces of luggage!!! She had asked for help from 3 different staff and they all refused to help her. Finally, the bellman helped her after she had walked 19 flights of stairs. Down at the lobby the front desk staff could care less about helping stranded guests. The manager said, “Bad things happen sometimes.” They were using some guest elevators as service elevators to get the maids to rooms to begin cleaning as well as well as accepting a large linen order and using the elevators for the linens. Leaving just 2 small elevators for a hotel with 40 floors during check out on a Sunday. Also, the front desk claimed their service elevator wasn’t working but I saw staff using it. Other guests were stuck on floors and some missed their flights.

title: Good Stay
text: Darely was amazing! I got to the hotel super early and she was able to get me a room in the morning. Then I was able to get settled before I went out in the city for the day! Thanks Darely for being so kind.

title: One Week Stay in Manhattan
text:
This Embassy Suites in Manhattan though is not typical.  Even the King Junior Suite was just one large room. The "restaurant/bar" was very small with only 5 tables and maybe 5 seats at the bar.  The breakfast area on the 4th floor was very overcrowded every morning.  I understand that many NYC hotel properties have been located in existing buildings with smaller footprints than is typical for a hotel, but there should be information about room sizes not being typical of Embassy Suites provided on the Hilton website. Had we known, we would have stayed at a different Hilton property in Manhattan.  We have previously stayed at a few other Hilton properties in Manhattan and been completely satisfied.

The staff at the hotel were very kind and accommodating, notably Janiah and Mo at the front desk, Sergio at the bar/restaurant, Adam the bellman, and the housekeeping crew.

title: Don’t second guess your choice to stay here. Stay here!
text: I had a super complicated reservation with several different confirmation numbers and was trying to stay in the same room the entire stay for both rooms. I was worried the FD person wouldn’t understand but Janiah figured it out within seconds and was able to get us checked in and my Diamond upgrade for both rooms. She was amazing. I needed a handicap room and she was able to get me one that fit my needs. She was so friendly and fun.  We looked forward to seeing her every night when we arrived back at the hotel. Then Bruno was awesome helping me get checked in for my last night while multitasking. He always kept a smile on his face. He was awesome. On check out Raheema was amazing getting me all my receipts and making sure we didn’t need anything else. She went above and beyond even though we were leaving. I will definitely be staying here next time I travel to NYC. The location is amazing and close to everything you want to get to, including the subway. Don’t second your guess to stay here. This is the best location and the best staff. And the rooms are spacious.

title: great visit
text: front desk staff and adam at concierge  were welcoming and helpful getting all needs met. rooms were clean, I spent 1 week there. breakfast was good as was dinner at the Heist. my only complaint is that the $30 credit daily can not be applied to the lobby store. if I wanted a bottle of water, had to get it thru room service, so with fees and taxes, a bottle of water was about$12. rooms were quit at hotel at night.

title: Highly Recommend
text: Raheema was so helpful and accommodating! I was so lucky to get an early check in and she made it super easy to sign up for Hilton Honors. Thank you Raheema, your energy is contagious, keep shining bright!

title: Decent hotel & great location
text: Excellent location, small rooms but comfortable. Staff we all friendly and professional. The floor in my room & bathroom had stains that I thought was dirt marks so I called housekeeping to come & mop turns out they were permanent stains. They charge a daily $30 fee that can be used in the restaurant and for room service but they charge an add fee to bring to your room.

title: Recomendable
text:
El hotel está muy bien ubicado y muy cerca de todo.
El personal muy atento siempre, especialmente Luis de recepción quien es de habla hispana.
El desayuno muy variado y rico pero el lugar para tomarlo es demasiado chico y casi nunca hay lugar para sentarse.
Solo hay 3 ascensores para todo el hotel, lo que se dificulta bastante acceder a uno  a la hora del desayuno.
Los espacios de las habitaciones son bastante reducidos. Estuvimos alojados en una habitación con cama matrimonial y un sofá cama el cual al abrirlo no quedaba espacio para moverse dentro de la pieza.
