Me hicieron  un cobro extra, además del total de las noches, de US400 el cual nunca me supieron explicar a qué se debía y ellos dicen que lo devuelven al momento del check out pero no fue así, mande muchos mail pidiendo la devolución el cual nunca me respondieron.

title: Embassy suites at the center of it all!
text: My husband and I had a great trip to NYC! Embassy Suites was gorgeous and in the center of it all! Lianna Rahemma helped us check in smoothly at the start of our day. Our room had a gorgeous balcony with the city’s best views!!!

title: Great Front Desk Service
text: I just arrived at the hotel and Lianna at front desk was amazing.  I have been a Hilton Honors members for over 20 years and Lianna’s service was memorable!!! Thank you!!!  I appreciate being a part of the Hilton family!!

title: Small Rooms
text: We came as 2 friends who wanted separate beds so we chose the jr . suite. for the sofa bed . I would not recommend this hotel to friends . unlike other Embassy Suites , this room is so small there is not room for even 2 suitcases. The breakfast area is small and cramped . The staff are friendly and helpful Good location

title: 5 stars for the Embassy Suites Times Square, NYC
text: A stay at the Embassy Suites Times Square New York City will not disappoint from check in to check out!  Front desk employee, Mohamed AbdelazimI was the first one to welcome us to the hotel.  He is an outstanding employee, professional and pleasant at the same time.  We enjoyed a standard room with a magnificent view of the Empire State Building.  Wow, what more can you ask for in New York City.  Every encounter with the hotel personnel thereafter was excellent.  I can't say enough about all of the help we received when needed.  The breakfast will keep you going on any long day in NYC.  It had everything you would want, and then more.  While we enjoyed room service one night, we did not have the opportunity to partake in the complimentary Happy Hour. Our loss! Our checkout was also seamless.  Adam, was right there to store our bags after checkout.  He also was able to grab us a cab right outside the hotel.  All this was done with kind words and a smile on his face.  Thank you Embassy Suites for an fabulous two night stay.

title: Check this place out if you are going to be staying in NYC.
text:
Our stay was wonderful & it started with the warm greeting from Janian. We had a long day & she was so cheerful & smart enough to tell us about the afternoon Happy Hour which we greatly needed. Someone told us the rooms were small at this Embassy Suites but it was quite adequate for our needs which was a place to sleep. We got much more from the breakfast in the morning & dinner one night when we weren't felt like staying in.
The only negative is that they had only one person working the bar on a Friday night after the shows on Broadway had let out. There was a bit of a line but the woman running the bar was upbeat & professional. I wish I had gotten her name. Our check out person, Lianna, was pleasant & checked us  out quickly.

title: Beware of management issues…look elsewhere to book
text: We are very experienced travelers and are presently at this property. Our room is very nice and has been recently updated, however we will never return.  Among the numerous service issues (many not mentioned here) seem to be caused by understaffing and management issues.  The daily reception is a disaster (how do you run out of white wine?, tables not cleared, one waiter/long lines), the property ran out of bottled water (we had to leave the hotel to purchase), only one computer operable for check-in at 4 pm, etc.  We are Lifetime Diamond members of Hilton. That has no value at this property.

title: Hospitality unmatched!
text: During a one night visit and my first time in NYC, I was warmly greeted by Rosa, and Raheema. Traveling as a team member, I was immediately recognized, and given a beautiful room with an amazing view. You have a gem in Raheema, she gave me my flowers as an Hilton GM, and introduced me to each staff member within reach. I was overly impressed with my accommodations, and the skilled level of professionalism from all staff I interacted with. I’ll definitely make this my go to home away from home when I visit.

title: Give this hotel a miss
text: For those choosing a hotel purely on the basis of location then this hotel might be OK albeit as an expensive option, however for those who want a nice hotel to return to after a day exploring NYC then this is NOT the hotel to stay at.  Guests feel like rats in a cage as the hotel is so small - including the reception area, the guest rooms, bar and restaurant.  The staff are friendly and coping well with a difficult work environment and I am sure many frustrated and disappointed guests.  Having returned to NYC from a few days in Washington DC and after staying for 2 weeks previouly in an Airbnb in an inner city neighbourhood, I can suggest that your tourist dollars could be much better spent exploring this type of option rather than a cramped and over-priced city hotel.

title: Never stay here!!!
text: I had my engagement and wedding bands stolen from our locked hotel room this past Monday.  I’m was originally told it would be a simple insurance claim and now that I’m home and out of the country, I’m being told they will not do anything to help.  I would never stay here again and highly advise you not to.

title: A very rough check in
text: We got to the hotel early due to our flight. Bruno checked us in and said our room wasn't ready yet that they would text us when it was ready. Leading us to believe that we would get in before the 4:00 check in.  so we left and went sightseeing.  We got back at 3pm to see if it was ready, he said it should be ready in 30 minutes.  So, we explored for another half hour.  Came back Bruno was gone so we went to another gentleman, he stated check in is at 4 and wouldn't get in before that. Now if Bruno would have been honest with us that we wouldn't get till 4 everything would have been. But being messed around with left very dissatisfied.  Also, we were staying 2 nights but under two reservations.  Also was promised that they would have it so we wouldn't get locked out of our room the second night.  But after sightseeing the next day guess what we were locked out and then had to spend a half an hour trying to get our keys reactivated :( Needless to say we did not feel appreciated being diamond members.

title: Ideally situated
text: While the room was very small, the space was efficiently planned out and the bathroom wasn't cramped. Housekeeping kept everything well organized and supplied. We were checked in by Bruno who was friendly and helpful. One day, one of the guest elevators went out of service during the breakfast rush and Raheema solved the problem by ushering waiting guests into the service elevator and taking us to our respective floors. The location is close to many Korean restaurants and the theatre district. My husband and I were pleased with our stay and the customer service we received.

title: Disappointing, there are better options in NYC
text: Very disappointed in this hotel. Lots of dirty dishes in the stairwell left over several days. Police officer giving tickets to Lyft, taxi and u we drivers out front so not convenient to connect with transportation. Hotel employees try to assist but the policies are restrictive.  Our room was dark and dingy.  We would not stay at this location again.

title: Awesome hotel and staff members
text:
First time staying at this hotel but it was awesome! From the Rooftop movies, bars, made to order breakfast and Raheema, janiah, Adam and Bruno at the front desk (personality, helpfulness etc
)  LaQuan is awesome with the luggage. I will definitely stay here again

title: Gran hotel y grandes personas trabajan en el Liana y Luis !!
text: Todo increíble, tuvimos un problema con el pago y Lianna nos ayudó mucho a poder resolverlo. Sin duda es la mejor !! También su compañero Luis es lo mejor !! Muy buen hotel y muy completo ! Buen desayuno y buenos servicios !

title: Julie
text: This was the worst place to stay. They charge you 30.00 per daily extra to use the amenities. The elevator would take 30 minutes to take u downstairs because they only had 1 elevator running. It’s was not a great stay. I will never stay here. Rooms were not as clean as I would like.

title: Great staff!
text: Great location and incredibly friendly staff! Also, the happy hour including drinks and appetizers is great. LiAnna and Davely at the front desk were amazing. They made an incredible first impression. I knocked off a star though because the floors in the room were not clean (eg crumbs).

title: Great hotel in central NY
text:
Very friendly staff all around - shout out to Adam.  Loved the free cooked breakfast and the free drink hour and half in the afternoon. 

Sure there were times when the breakfast area was busy and the drinks hour was congested but on the whole a great experience.

This hotel is located in central New York and so space and the cost of the space is at a premium.  So you have to bare that in mind when you go there.

title: Awesome!
text: My wife and I went for a quick weekend to go to a couple of Broadway shows.  From the moment we were checked in by LiAnna until check out (also by LiAnna) we had a great experience!  The hotel was very safe and the accommodations were clean and comfortable.  We splurged and got a room with a veranda and loved sitting outside overlooking the Empire State Building.  Everything we wanted to do was within easy walking distance.  Also loved the rooftop bar.  We will definitely be staying here next time!

title: A great experience at at Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
text: I have truly enjoyed my stay at Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square. Upon arrival, I received a very warm welcome from Janiah. She personally made sure I was aware of the many amenities which are included with my stay. Her smile made me feel very relaxed and her great personality assured me I was going to enjoy my home away from home. My bags were stowed away by Adam who made me feel assured they would be handled with much care. My room has a beautiful view of the world famous Empire State Building. I’ve appreciated the comfortable bed and clean room with contemporary furnishings. The breakfast buffet has been icing on the cake.The food has been very fresh and tasty. While returning to the hotel this evening, I was greeted by Raheema. She made sure my stay has been enjoyable and said if I need anything just as her. Thank you Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square for such a great time in NYC. I will definitely tell my friends and family about your great hotel and convenient location.

title: Terrible hotel in every way!!
text:
We arrived at the hotel at 12:00pm and were told that check-in was at 4:00 pm, so we went out and returned at 4:00 pm. A shift had been changed, and the new team wasn't aware of our room?!! They were so impolite and unfriendly. We checked in at 6:00 pm and stayed in the lobby for 2 hours! There was no available supervisor in the hotel!

We had the worst experience in this terrible hotel.

title: My perfect vacation in NY
text: The hotel has an excellent location, and the staff are the best specially Sergio the bartender  he has a great manner to satisfy the customer needs. Hope to come back again to this great city and hotel

title: Très belle expérience au Embassy suites by Hilton Manhattan
text:
Super hôtel près de tout au coeur de Manhattan.
Petit déjeuner inclus, chambre propre, accueil chaleureux et excellent service de Bruno à l'arrivée.
Stationnement tout près avec un rabais offert par l'hôtel.

title: Shout outs to very deserving people.  Outstanding customer service Embassy Suites!!!
text:
Wanted to give a huge thank you to some extraordinary empoyees at Embassy Suites Manhattan.  We arrived in very heavy traffic on a remarkably busy day and were pretty frazzled.  Upon arrival, with little to no place to stop our car and unload, we were immediately greeted by Raheema, who became our embassador of good will.  She quickly responded to our needs to get checked in and immediately found us a room with a professional, calm and welcoming demeanor.  This immeduiately relieved us of a lot of stress.  

Following Raheema's welcoming demeanour was Janiah. She continued, what seems to be an Embassy Suites NY attitude, with ongoing help, support and kindnes to continue accommodating our needs and making us feel like friends.

Lastly, unloading and loading in a busy NYC street is quite the chore.  Another shout out to Dinu for always having a smile on his face and being available, accessible and present at every turn to support our transitions in and out of the building.  

These three people are incredible assets to Embassy Suites and a reasonn I would return to this establishment without any hesitation.

title: Great Customer Service
text: Very nice Embassy Suites in a central midtown location. The volume of new guests created challenges with the check-in process that became very frustrating. Li-Anne on the front desk was great as were her colleagues. She stepped up in a chaotic scene, patiently explained how the logistics and processes work in NYC, answered all my questions with clarity and kept me updated on the status of my room, which I found spotless when I finally got my key. She’s a great representative of the Hilton Corp. and I share this as an informed opinion: I have Lifetime Diamond status with Hilton.

title: Great place to stay!
text: We had a great stay. Clean room and we organized it perfectly for 3 of us on a gals trip. Lianna checked us in and she was super accommodating and allowed us to check in early after a long flight. We were so grateful. We walked to shows in times square and the garment district. We felt safe and breakfast offered variety and was delicious. Don't miss the rooftop movies! We will stay again.

title: Some good, some not so much.
text: Location is great, close to Bryant Park, times square, subway. I would definitely ask for a room with some kind of view. We were put on the second floor and the view was a brick wall/building with a concrete patio that was being used for garbage, red solo cups, someone's underwear, food containers, really gross. I was too tired to do anything about it because we waited so long for the room. All hotel rooms in NYC are small, that's a given, but at least this room had a little separation with the pullout sofa and separate tv so my grandson had his own space. The free breakfast is always a plus here, but get there as early as you can because by 9:15 am it was complete chaos, out of everything, no plates, silverware, empty juice dispensers. Basically there was a couple of yogurts and some melon left--we waited 15 minutes for them to refill the food and then decided to leave. No one wipes down the tables after someone finishes so that's on you to get rid of their dirty dishes and napkins if you want to sit down. For the price, I probably would choose a different place next time. $969.00 for 2 nights is a lot for what you don't get here.

title: Great customer service, nice complimentary breakfast & happy hour and fantastic location
text: Sergio at the complimentary happy hour (and at The Heist Restaurant/Bar); Luis,Bruno and Davely at the Front Desk, Ana Balbi (and her colleagues) at the complimentary breakfast (that included an omelette), and Dinu (concierge) provided excellent customer service. Sergio was always very polite and friendly. Luis explained all the services available in great detail, and checked in regularly to make sure whether we needed anything. Ana was consistently attentive at breakfast time; Bruno and Davely were very helpful, and Dinu made our departure easy.  Overall, excellent customer service and fantastic location.

title: Positive energy
text: I flew into NYC but my bag didn’t make it with me and I had been traveling for over 24hrs at this point.  Dealing with the stress of getting my bag back in time for my presentation for the next day, Davely, was kind, supportive & positive.  She made my day instantly better by making sure I got a good room & even gave me some snacks as I mentioned I didn’t even eat yet.  It’s incredible people like this that make all the difference.  Thank you Davely!

title: Find somewhere else!
text: The pull-out couch was filthy (white stains on the cushions ""puke"") and the mattress consisted of just a set of springs and maybe a 6mil cushioning. Prisons have better mattresses than this. For a hotel that does not offer 2 beds, the couch should at least be of good quality and comfortable, especially for the price. The nighttime attendant was rude when I asked for blankets and sheets, etc., as there were none in the room (drawer under bed.) The night was MISERABLE. The rooms are so small that there is barely room for a suitcase, let alone a 2nd person. The floor was filthy. My socks were sticking to it. The A/C unit was under control by the hotel and could not be set below 68. We were on the 38th floor and it was stuffy and hot!! I absolutely would never stay here again. Honestly, as a long time Hilton Honors member, Hilton is just going downhill period and I think I'll be switching to Bonvoy.

title: THE BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE
text:
After what was an excruciatingly long morning flying in from Virginia for graduation, my day was completely turned around by Lianna and Davely.  I wish I could really put to words how above and beyond they went to ensure my comfort and peace of mind during my stay.  They were both supremely kind, helpful, and understanding. The check-in process was an absolute breeze and I was finally able to get a moment to collect myself because of the extra mile they went for me. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel just based on the two of them alone, not even including the awesome amenities you’ll have access to during your stay. 

Book here. Now. ❤️

title: Great hotel, unfortunate changes
text:
Overall I gave this hotel 4 stars. I have stayed here numerous times and it used to be my “go to” new york hotel, however with recent changes we may change. It is still a great option.
Let’s start with the positive.
+ The staff here is excellent. I have stayed here several times and each time the staff embodies what it means to be guest focused. This check-in Latesha went above and beyond to make my party feel welcome and a part of the family.
+ The location is hard to beat. This hotel is one block from Macys and Herald Square, a few from Bryant Park, 3 min from time square and right in the heart of Broadway. Everything is very walkable.
Good and bad.
+/- The continental breakfast is always delicious HOWEVER the hotel does not have enough space for guests and after April they close the additional 3rd floor seating only making matters worse. Because of the number of people they are often running out of food, usually they restock quickly, but sometimes its quite a wait. But when there is no seating, not having food makes sense.
Bad
- This hotel recently changed how they allow guests to use the $30 “resort credit” that you get. You are now only able to use them at the bar or room service. Problem is, the room service menu has 6 things on it total, and the bar has about 10 tables and only open from 5-10:45pm. You used to be able to use the credit on any food or beverage purchase and charge it to the room, but I assume they make significantly more money this way since most people cannot use it every day.
- The dreaded elevators. This has always been an issue at this hotel. They only have 3 elevators to service 39 floors so during peak hours (8-10 am and 4-6pm) it can take 15-20 minutes to get an elevator.

title: Outstanding! 😀
text:
We’re staying here for a full week, and I am so happy about our choice! We go out for the day, often walking a lot. We are tired and hungry when we get back, so it’s really great to be able to either go to our room first and get settled or just go straight into the restaurant area where Sergio is almost always there ready to help us with our dinner. Sergio is right at the top of my all time most positive, friendly, and attentive that has ever waited on me. And we highly value such qualities. That’s one reason we eat there every evening. Embassy Suites is fortunate to have him on its staff. 

We have also been very pleased with our entire experience. I would love to name all of the other staff’s names, but suffice it to say that everyone has been top notch! 

The breakfast buffet is excellent! I think it includes everything anyone would want. We love starting out the day with a meal that will easily hold us over until we get back to the hotel in the late afternoon. 

I already told Ryan that next time we visit NYC, we’ll definitely have no reason to even bother checking out other hotels in the area because Embassy Suites has been outstanding for us.

title: Sergio offers 5 star service!
text: Sergio has taken excellent care of us during our stay.  He has gone above and beyond in terms of the service he has provided us.  He was our server for the entire week and  gave us 5 star service.  He is the friendliest server we have had during our stay in nyc.  He made our stay at the embassy suites an excellent experience!

title: Great location… needs a bit of an update!
text:
Great location! Felt safe walking at night.
Incredible staff very kind and helpful!
Rooms a bit tight could get rid of the division wall thingy. Needs some loving care!
Housekeeping was disappointing at best. There was something by the door that was there til day 3!
Good breakfast!

title: Wonderful breath of fresh air in NYC
text: Just arrived in NYC from Virginia. Exhausted from the drive and dealing with NYC traffic and drivers. To our surprise, our room was ready early and had the pleasure of interacting with Latesha at the front desk. Warm, engaging and remarkably helpful. Really helped ease all the travel tensions. Thank you fot a wonderful kick off starting the weekend leading up to the NYC 5 Boro bike tour.

title: Feels so great to be treated VIPs if you have excellent and well experienced staffs
text: Our vacation feels so great especially if there are staffs who is extremely supportive and did their best to made our stays comfortable and relaxing special mentioned to staffs Janiah, Davely, Dino and Adam they are the kind of staffs that any organization should look for. Guys you are so friendly any amazing thanks so much and looking forward to stay in your hotel once again.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Overall experience here was nothing short of amazing. We came in on the train before noon and the staff was extremely warm and welcoming as soon as we showed up. They were able to make recommendations for lunch while we waited for our room to be ready. Thank you especially to Raheema  for getting us a room quickly and also for the amazing hospitality.

title: Embassy Suites NYC_Central Location
text:
arrived around 2 am and the workers were so friendly and helpful, they made the check in so quick and easy. That part was great. 
The rooms were super clean, small, but clean and the maid service made sure we had everything we needed.
Janiah at the front desk was the highlight of our trip. Her personality, smile and charm made us feel very welcomed and made the stay extra enjoyable. She gave us tips and ideas and even assisted us with room accommodations when needed. She's a great asset to the hotel.
The location of the hotel was great, walking distance to a lot of the tourist attractions which was very helpful and great. Only thing I didn't like was that we were told that we had $30 to spend at the hotel, but at the end of the stay, they charged us $30 daily for out of state taxes. We left a little lied to because we thought eating at the hotel and using the $30 daily money would save us on the food cost, but at the end it didn't.

title: Pros and cons
text:
First, I’d like to give 5 stars to ADAM, who was the mvp during our stay. He helped us with luggage storage several times since we had show tickets but our room wasn’t ready yet. 

Without Adam, I give this place 3 stars. The check-in experience took a long time. So many people waiting at the front desk at all times during the day. Do not expect an early check in as it’s nearly impossible, but 4pm feels a little late to me for check-in. 

The room itself is nothing spectacular, but I do wish it was cleaner.  It’s pretty roomy for NYC. The telephone in our room was pretty gross, there was a large footprint on my pillow upon arrival, and overall it just felt a bit stuffy. It’s pretty roomy for NYC tho and a nice bathroom. The air con only goes to 68° which was a little warm for us during sleep. We did open the window briefly but the smell from the alley was worse! The bed was comfy and room was quiet which was appreciated.

The elevators are probably the worst part. There are 3 or 4 elevators for all 20+ floors and they are slow. It could take 5-10 minutes to catch an available elevator, particularly during breakfast. If you’re on the 15th floor and trying to get to the 4th, best believe you will be stopping at almost all the floors, even though all you’ll do is open the door, tell the people the elevator is full, and move to the next. Frustrating for all. Doing this with luggage is a joke. 

Proximity to things was great and overall we probably won’t stay here again but it did work well for us for this shorter trip.

title: The best hotel
text: The location is amazing close to everything Comfortable rooms cleaned every day Really good service, always someone to talk to, really nice hotel to stay for families or couples I will definitely go back there Adam especially always smiling kind services I miss you already.

title: Great stay- highly recommend!
text: Fantastic service by Latesha!  She flawlessly handled our 12 room group reservation- very professional and friendly.  Breakfast was excellent- lots of selections- very crowded.  Afternoon reception was great as well.  Latesha continued to check in through out the weekend/ it was a nice touch.  Will definitely stay again!

title: Great experience
text: Stayed at the hotel in February  2023 and this week, 26-28 April 2023. Great customer service from the entire check in desk crew. Adam did a great job taking care of us. We will definitely stay there again.

title: Excellent staff, nice hotel
text:
I’ll review the hotel next, but first wanted to explain the excellent service I received from the staff, specifically Latesha. We checked in on a very busy Saturday during spring break. Traveling with my family of four it was important for us to have adjoining rooms, so we paid extra for the guaranteed adjoining rooms. Another employee checked us in and we arrived in our rooms which were not adjoining. After a long day of traveling, having the wrong rooms was the last thing we wanted. I returned to the front desk and explained the issue to Latesha. She calmly assured me she would do her best but the hotel was sold out. At worst we could move into the proper room tomorrow, but she kept trying and after a few minutes she was able to move something around get us in adjoining rooms right away. She also explained to her colleague that checked me where things went wrong. She was great in a stressful situation on a chaotic Saturday for the hotel. She was wonderful in a few other interactions as wel. Give her a promotion! 

As for the hotel, we really enjoyed it. The couch area was big enough to have a couple local friends comfortably visit. The beds were good. The location is fantastic, lots of stuff close by. The breakfast was really nice and a huge money saver each day. It’s not the fanciest place we’ve stayed at but there more than enough positives that I wouldn’t hesitate to go back.

title: A SUB STANDARD PROPERTY THAT DOESN'T DESERVE EMBASSY SUITE PROPERTY TITLE
text: i thought I reserved and was charged for a Suite.  What I got was a small room that was so small I had to remove items from my luggage to put on luggage carrier.  This is simply not an Embassy Suite property.  I have been to New York over 2 times and this is the worst property and the most expensive property I have experienced.  As a Lifetime Diamond with Hilton I expect my requests to be honored.  I requested a high floor; I was pit on 3rd floor and told nothing else was available even tho the property was not full.

title: Il peggior hotel dove sono stata.
text:
Non andateci. Booking lo vende come 4 stelle, ma ne vale 1.
Sporco, camere indecenti, lenzuola usate (con visibili macchie di , "liquidi" umani), servizio clienti ridicolo. Forse una visita dei servizi sanitari del caso lo farebbe chiudere.
Dico solo che davanti all'entrata c'era un casso e dei rifiuti. Il resto era adeguato a ciò.  Noi siamo scappati.

title: Great 2 night stay
text: Great location in Midtown. Rooms are pretty big for the city, hotel staff is awesome, and there are tons of social areas on the first 4 floors. All embassy suites have the free made to order breakfast and an evening social, which was one of the best I’ve had here. Will stay here again!

title: If you don’t mind waiting for the elevator or a table and don’t mind a small room then this is a perfect place
text:
Cons
Bathroom is small 
Elevator wait times can be long at times 
Not enough tables for breakfast and evening reception 
Don’t use their transportation 
Pros
Great customer service with Raheema being the star of the show 
Great food at breakfast and room service 
Location was absolutely perfect

title: Great service!
text: Such helpful and courteous staff! Adam was always available to help us … he helped to quickly load and unload our car! And answered all our questions!!  So polite and kind!!As busy as the hotel was during New York Fashion Week, everything went smoothly!!!

title: A good place
text: People were friendly and the service was great.  The buffet breakfast and reception drinks every evening where a treat.  Special mention to Adam from concierge who was very helpful and made us feel welcome.

title: Davely at the front desk is a gem!
text: Everything was absolutely incredible and Davely  absolutely made the hotel worth staying at! She was so friendly and helpful with an early check in and everything else.  I highly recommend it wholeheartedly, due in no small part to her in particular!🌃😜😎🥳

title: Camere molto piccole
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato dal 9-14 aprile 2023 ed eravamo in 3.
Camere talmente piccole che non riuscivamo a muoverci. 
Alla richiesta di poter cambiare camera abbiamo ricevuto un nulla di fatto se non che potevamo cambiare hotel e ci avrebbero rimborsato. Vacanza partita male.
Vabbè ormai eravamo lì e ci siamo adeguati ma non ci ritornerei

title: Yes, book it!!!
text: Treated my partner to a  birthday trip to see March Madness at The Garden. The hotel was within walking distance to Madison Square Garden, Macy's, The Empire State Building, Times Square and 5th Avenue. Upon arrival there were plenty of families waiting for check-in time throughout the 1st floor. Latesha was the best when checking us in. She was friendly, knowledgable and very accommodating. We decided to do a little shopping while the room was being prepared, at her suggestion. We received a text stating our room was ready. Rameesha greeted us when we returned and was just as pleasant and friendly as Latesha. She even gave the BF a bday gift bag, which was very kind of her. We booked a king suite and was not disappointed with high floor and stunning view of the Empire State Building.  The room was almost double the size of rooms nearby. I will definitely stay with the Embassy Suite team when I'm back in town.

title: Great property & location!
text: Spacious and very clean room. Great location! Good breakfasts, but need to reconfigure their current setup for a better flow. Everyone was very courteous and friendly. Even though I didn’t charged anything during my stay, I was not happy to see some extra charges in my bill, that apparently are made automatic. Those hidden charges are too much and unnecessary!

title: fronts desk awesome service
text: Davely was awesome and fast and helpful at front desk and got me all fixed up!  I had a difficult receipt requirement and she figured out a way to make it work.  I was a pain but she was patient and creative.

title: We came for a Broadway play
text:
Lianna was amazing! The room wasn’t ready when we got there but we were well taken care of! She made our experience an amazing one! Thank you so much Lianna!!️ We received complimentary drinks and dinner while we waited and our view was amazing!
The next morning Raheema was so helpful at the front desk. The delay in checking in and the hour we had to wait for our food at the Heist are the reasons I can not give this trip a better rating. Lianna and Raheeem are the reasons we will be back.

title: Terrible hotel in every way!!
text: Stayed in April 2023. the Empire state building view on 32nd floor Room was dirty, and SMALL. the sink was clogged, stinky and drained super slow, towels had stains on them. We could hear every movement and conversation from nearby rooms including flushing the toilet. The elevator was very slow specially during breakfast hours. If you are going there for breakfast just forget about it. It will take you 20 minutes to get to the 4th floor where the breakfast is served. The breakfast tables are filthy. there is not enough place for people to sit. The line for coffee and buffet food is 20-30 people long mostly because there is NO Clean CUP or Plates and once you are lucky to get a clean cup and a plate there is no food or coffee. I have visited NYC 12 times and this was the worst experience. Believe me it is not worth it specially if you are choosing embassy suites for the room size and breakfast this one is a no go!!

title: Li-Anna was so great it was bananas!
text:
Li-Anna was extremely helpful and, even though our room wasn’t ready at check in, she did a fantastic job of taking care of us and kicking our stay in NYC right.  Thank you!
Pamela was also very nice when we returned from our show and got our food order in in time, since we didn’t have time to eat before.  They made our overall experience a great success.

title: New York. Go figure…..sucks here.
text:
There has got to be a better Hilton property in NY. The rooms are tiny (NY…go figure), the breakfast was chaos….poor food, interminable long lines, even slower elevators, and not enough hot water. We are Diamond and will NEVER stay here again. The personnel are nice and helpful, but that is about it. The restaurant is meh….
Decent location though. Thanks but no thanks.

title: Excellent stay, friendly and welcoming staff.
text: We had a fabulous stay at Embassy Suites.  All of the staff were so friendly and approachable.  Our room was very comfortable and quiet.  The hotel is in a perfect location.  When we checked out Adam really looked after us and made sure that our bags and taxi were ready for our departure to the airport.  The entire process was stress free and very professional. We will be back!

title: Loved the hotel but the best part was the girl behind the counter.  Thank you Davely you are awesome
text: We had an awesome experience but the best part was the girl who worked at the counter Davely.  She was a ray of sunshine made us feel at home and the room she gave us, was beyond my wildest dreams.  Loved it we will be back for sure.  Thank you Davely

title: Everything was Fantastic. Thank you Janiah!
text:
We had an amazing experience. We flew into New York from Orlando for my mom's birthday and the staff went above and beyond to make our stay special.  Everyone was so accommodating and kind, offering fantastic suggestions and showing wonderful hospitality. I especially want to thank Janiah for going above and beyond for making mom's bday special. It really meant a lot to her and myself. 

The location is fantastic and puts you in walking distances from so many popular attractions, including a 5 minute walk from broadway, time square and more. Our room was also above expectations with a pullout couch that had a divider from the other bed, providing privacy for both of us.

 Honestly, our stay was a 10/10. One of the best birthday's I have had with my mother and a lot of it was from our experience here. 100% would recommened

title: Excelente!
text: Quartos amplos, limpos e atendimento excelente. Café da manhã muito completo, acaba tendo maior movimento nos finais de semana, ocasionando demora no elevador e pouco espaço, mas nada que atrapalhe a qualidade. Excelente opção em Manhattan

title: Nice place
text: We had a wonderful stay but I really want to thank a gentleman by the name of ADAM. He was there for us even before we arrived. We called to ask questions and to plan out trip and he always had the answer. If you stay there ask for ADAM!!!!

title: Thankful for people like Janiah!
text: This review could have went south from the very get go. We got into the city, got to the Embassy Suites and found out they have been overbooked. We were obviously frustrated and tired, but in this very moment the incredible staff at the Embassy saved our trip. They worked to get us a room for the night, with an amazing view, and to got us in our room the next day. There are many people I could mention, but I want to especially give a shout out to Janiah. She is quite literally the best. Simply because she was human, concerned about our experience, and caring for our family. Our teenager loves her as she has been so kind and generous. The Embassy made it right, and I have to say Janiah deserves a lot of credit. Also, Bruno. These two set us up and made sure we enjoyed our stay. Can't say enough about positivity and just that human touch. Janiah and Bruno, plus several other staff I am apologizing now for not mentioning, are the reason that we will be back to NYC as well as the Embasssy Suites Manhattan Times Square NY.

title: Not Worthy of Embassy Suites  Brand-Never staying here ever!
text:
Don’t stay here expecting Embassy Suites level of hospitality or Embassy Suites style rooms.  This property is in dire need of an undercover boss style, mystery shopper type corporate review.  Operations and management are a mess.  Luggage storage overflowing with bags all over the lobby and stored in the lobby bar unsecured every single day of our stay.  Will not stay at this property ever again.  Housekeeping does not start until 0930.  It’s amazing they can turn over rooms at all.  A Jr. Suite is just a small room with a divider sofa bed.  If you want extra linens.  They ran out.  Don’t  expect your mag charger to fit in the bedside outlet.  The connection is loose and won’t charge because there is no connection.  Maintenance engineer’s solution was to bring an extension cord.  Any other room I would just plug it in a wall outlet elsewhere in the room.  But with just 2 to 3 feet clearance around the bed edge to the walls on windows it was not convenient and I prefer to charge my phone at my befside.  Again not a problem at any other Hilton property but not this one.  Be prepared to ask for extra towels because the glass shower doors are not fitted properly and leak a river.  Oh and the solution to a fridge that is not cold despite the room being previously occupied and not ready for check in till 4 was wait for it to cool down.  I had medication that needed refrigeration.  If you like seeing your floor hallway filled with trash and room service dishes.  This is the property for you.  Left in the morning and the mess was still there…. Again not worthy of the Embassy Suites level of hospitality and service.  Just 3 elevators for 30+ stories can make for long lines and waits during peak hours.  Certainly not enough seating for breakfast.  Maybe provide takeout containers so you can just go to your room.  Manager’s Reception.  Again not worthy of typical Embassy Suites reception.  2 drink tickets per person.  Pre made cocktail of the night.  Pita chips.  Cheese cubes and cookies cut into quarters.  No hot item choice.  We only went to the reception on the last night of our stay because we left our room around 10 in the morning and when we returned around 4:45 our room had not been made up.  Called to ask for service and front desk said they were done for the day and had the gall to ask we put the do not disturb sign up.  No we didn’t…. So then housekeeping appeared so we had to leave the room and went to the sad managers reception.  Oh and if there’s a no kidding fire alarm at 1 in the morning don’t expect clear communication from hotel staff and management.  Thank God it was not an actual fire.  Just someone smoking in the lobby restroom.
Oh and if your toilet becomes unhinged in the middle of the night, maintenance won’t come.  We checked out at 1015 the next morning and no one came to fix it.  We just made do hoping that someone would come.  No one ever showed up so we proceeded to check out never to return.

title: Unexpected
text: Well worth the price. They provide credit and free beverages. The complimentary breakfast was amazing. They also has a dinner session with free snacks! Davely at the front desk was a great help to me!

title: Great location! Clean ! Plus free food & drinks
text: We are from NY, but decided to stay overnight because we attended the Billy Joel concert and wanted a clean convenient place close to Madison Square Garden. This was perfect! Room was clean and had all the basic ammenities. Staff was helpful - Especially Davely at the front desk !!! We enjoyed the complimentary Happy Hour and breakfast -- def a great choice when staying in Manhattan its in the center of it all !

title: Great place to stay!
text: Hotel staff is wonderful! Our room had a great view of the Empire State Building spire. Hotel reservation includes wonderful full breakfast AND a happy hour that includes 2 complimentary drinks and snacks. SO WORTH THE $$$$

title: The caring attitude of staff
text: Great up to date hotel with excellent breakfast, caring staff especially Dina!  Beds and pillows very comfortable. Bathrooms were excellent! I have enjoyed my trip to NYC because of the safety features as well as like I said, very caring staff!

title: Location Was The Only Positive Thing About Our Stay
text: We were in the NYC visiting with our grandson.  When we booked the hotel we expected a “suite”  since it is an Embassy Suites property but instead found ourselves in the smallest space you could imagine.  We called the front desk to see if we could get a larger room but the answer was that we were already in their largest room which is hard to believe.  We will admit the room was clean.  Housekeeping was non existent.  We asked to have our room made up and towels replenished on our second day and it did not happen until we called for the third time at 7:00 PM when they finally brought us fresh towels, shampoo, and soap.  We were told that there was no one available from housekeeping to address our needs so a lovely front desk clerk brought us our requested supplies.  Many of the offerings in the complimentary breakfasts were inedible.  The pancakes were literally like rocks; the oatmeal was mostly water, and the scrambled eggs and omelets were dry and tasteless.  The croissants and muffins were OK.  In addition, the hotel charges a ridiculous $30 per day “Resort Fee” which we are still not sure what this fee entitles a guest to.  For us, this hotel had only one thing going for it which was its location.  It was convenient to what we had planned to do.  We have stayed in other Embassy Suites and other Hilton properties in the past and this one was the absolute worst.  Luckily, what we did in the city far outweighed our experience in the hotel.  We would not recommend this hotel.

title: No Suite at this Embassy SUITES
text: I booked a suite at the Embassy SUITES but got one of the tiniest rooms -- not a suite -- that I've ever stayed in.  Interestingly, the front desk agent said she was upgrading me. Laughable!!! The people at the comp breakfast area were rude. There was no seating, everything was jammed packed. Will NEVER stay here again. Highly suggest you look elsewhere. As a Hilton Diamond, I was really disappointed.

title: Stay here!!  BEST STAFF EVER!!  EXCELLENT!!! An outstanding, quality experience
text:
Everyone super Friendly and accommodating… super clean place, LOVED the staff and the whole experience was wonderful!  JANIAH AND WANDA, YOU GUYS FREAKIN' ROCK!!!!!!!!

Room was great. Felt small on entrance but then when we settled in it was great. The complimentary drinks/snacks was a great touch. The breakfast was brilliant. Was hard to get a seat when we went down for breakfast our last day but was expected as hotel was real busy with it being weekend.  The quality of the food, the quality of the service and overall positive attitude - exceptional

title: Great Place, Great Customer Service
text: We stayed at Embassy Suites 3/17-3/19 and could not have been happier with the rooms and location. When we checking in on Friday we got up to the 26th floor and found we had the room next to the elevator. We called down to the front desk and Janiah was AMAZING. She was able to relocate us to another room on the same floor, came up to the 26th floor and personally checked us into our new room to make sure we were satisfied. That kind of Customer Service is unheard of today!!

title: My third stay, and will be back!
text:
This is my 3rd stay at this Embassy Suites, and I plan to come back again. This time, I ordered the food from the in-room dining and was pleasantly surprised. The burger and fries were delicious, as well as the cheesecake. The staff members who delivered the food were super pleasant to deal with! 

My only complaint this time was that I accidently left my chargers in the room, and called the front desk the very next day. They assured me that they keep track of such things, and referred me to a 3rd party service that is supposed to help, with no results. Unfortunately, my chargers will be hard to replace (because my tablet is very out of date), and that bums me out!

title: Great place to stay in Manhattan
text: Consistently an excellent hotel with great front desk service. This time Latesha resolved a reservation problem with cool, friendly professionalism. Among the many reasons to stay here. My view of the Empire State Building is also pretty great.

title: No such thing as a bargain in midtown Manhattan; pretty good stay but be aware of $30 food/bev fee
text:
Comfortable room. Booked a "studio" so expected it to be smaller which worked for us. Noisy at night unfortunately, but it is NYC. I think there was construction on the building across the street that was getting done at night??? Remote control didn't work, sink drain in bathroom didn't drain well. Also strongly object to the $30 mandatory food and beverage fee.
Good and thorough breakfast. Seating rather limited at 7:30am but everyone really friendly (staff and guests).
Front desk staff was great. Our room was ready on arrival (late morning) so we were able to check in. We left the following morning before 9am and they held our bags for us. Very accommodating and friendly. 
Would I stay again? I might. Conveniently located.

title: Lianna
text: Lianna was a joy to interact with at the front desk.  She was helpful and pleasant, and the hotel should feel blessed to have her working with them and as one of the first interactions a guest has.....

title: Unpleasant Experience
text: Would prefer not to write this here but just tried to check into this hotel and got sent to a sister hotel, 2 blocks away, had to walk to the hotel with 6 suitcases, advised to return to the original hotel tomorrow as this hotel would not have the amenities we booked. Got to the sister hotel and was required to give a card for incidentals, got to the room which we booked for 3 guests and we have been allocated a room with 2 single beds. When I questioned the receptionist he stated that they did not provide rooms with beds for 3 guests, which is what we booked so I am unsure as to why we would get sent to a room that is not for 3 people.

title: Great location and price in Times Square
text:
A gem in the city with a good price tag. Adam (concierge, service attendant, the man that does everything) was AMAZING! He stored our bags for us, gave great restaurant ideas to us based on our food & budget, and was probably the nicest person we met in NY. 
Besides Adam the rooms were decent size for NY, the breakfast was great and just what we needed to start the day and the evening Happy Hour was a nice touch. 
Hotel is in a perfect location for walking everywhere in Times Square. The AC worked and wasn't super loud.

title: Great Management!
text: I am super impressed with Latesha, Front Office Supervisor.  I have been trying to navigate an issue with our reservation through the Hilton Customer Care Department. Latesha was able to quickly resolve the issue. She was super professional, competent, and also the friendliest Hilton Employee that I have spoken with over the last few weeks.

title: Don't hesitate - just book this hotel!
text: Just finished a four night stay at this hotel and it was wonderful!  The staff from the minute we walked in until we left were super helpful!  The room was good size for NYC and we had a fantastic view of the Empire State Building.  It was a great location - close for walking to many of the tourist sites and the subway station was two blocks away.   A big shout out to Mercedes who helped satisfy my daughter's craving for milk at night. :)  Would definitely stay at this hotel on another visit to NYC.

title: Great Service!
text: LiAnna at check in was so helpful. Check-in on the Hilton app was difficult, but she efficiently fixed it with a smile and great attitude. Hotel is clean, modern and in a prime location! Would definitely stay here again.

title: We will be back!!!
text: This hotel  stay made all the difference for our NYC trip! The staff was amazing and so helpful!!! ADAM, who helped us with our luggage (and the other luggage attendees) were so friendly and accommodating! We will definitely stay here again! It is also an excellent location to get to the Subway and anywhere you want to go in Manhattan! Clean, large rooms WITH A CLOSET, and definitely get the Entire Empire State Bldg view room…. impressive!!!

title: Friendly Staff and Comfy Beds!
text: The hotel staff was fun and welcoming.  The bellman, Adam, was particularly friendly and helpful.  He graciously and with humor managed the luggage of our group of 7 women and even arranged a large vehicle to take us all to the airport when we returned to collect our luggage at the end of a long weekend. The rooms are clean and beds are comfortable.  This is not a negative, just a reminder, your are still in Manhattan and spaces it at a premium, so don’t expect a suburban-sized Embassy Suites “suite”.

title: Disappointed
text: We stayed at this hotel last week and were very disappointed. The staff was friendly, but we had to ask for more toilet paper twice during our stay. We were very disappointed with the evening reception offerings of chips and salsa and cookies, but breakfast was even more disappointing. We went to try to eat breakfast several times with no room in the dining room. They have an overflow dining room that stayed locked leaving the only option to take food back to your room. Rooms are understandably small given this hotel’s location, but that makes common areas even more important. The sky lawn was also locked to us every time we checked during the posted open times. This is a very expensive area to stay in, so we expected high standards. The room was also not as clean as we expected on arriving (with laundry not free of hairballs) and we were delayed an hour after the 4:00 check in.  We should have asked for different pillows because they were awful, but honestly, the staff were unapologetic about delayed requests (toilet paper) so it didn’t seem worth the effort to keep complaining. Hoping they receive this feedback and can make other’s stay better.

title: Girl’s trip to NYC
text:
Breakfast buffet and evening reception were both good.
The clerks at front desk friendly.
However, Adam was the best! We were able to leave bags with him on our last day. He secured a ride for us back to LaGuardia that was very clean and less expensive than cab fare.

title: Deceptive Billing practices and non-responsive customer service.
text: Not notified about the $35.00/day destination fee charge.  Was told that my credit card would be charge $ 100 per room for incidentals and that I would receive a full refund upon checkout if there were no damages / incidental charges.  We had 3 rooms and I decided that I would put all of those charges on my CC since I would be getting refunded.  Needless to say, I did not get the money back and called several times to complain without response.  When I did speak with someone, I was told that charge could not be refunded.   I went to corporate with still not luck.  I made a decision to give up but was very disappointed and felt deceived.  I have stayed at the hotel a few times but this will be my last.  Their complimentary happy hour and breakfast are overly crowded to where we gave up most mornings and evenings.  Not any fault of the staff, they only had one bartender on duty and they were working as quickly as possible.  Wish that this did not happen and my hope is that they train their front desk staff to properly inform customers of all charges being billed.  When you plan and save for a trip, especially during a time of higher costs and inflation, $300 really hurts.

title: Personal visit
text: The amenities were very nice and the personnel were very friendly and competent. In particular, I would like to recognize the service of Lianna,Raheem, and Dinich.  We booked through Capital Vacations, and the $150 resort fee was basically returned to us through $30/day/person to use at the hotel’s bar or restaurant or room service. Additionally, there was a very nice free breakfast every morning and a free happy hour with 2  free drinks per person each afternoon.

title: Fine stay at a good location
text:
Very good location while the cost is reasonable by NYC prices. top to bottom windows that open which is fantastically rare in NYC. Great towels and fine beds. 
Good breakfast terrible breakfast space, lovely Bar with a good small selection of food, especially welcomed at a cold February evening. 
Clean on the whole could be a bit more pedantic about less obvious areas.
Two outstanding front desk people
Lianna who went the extra mile to sort out some important issues.
Bruno who was attentive and super mindful.

title: Lianna at the frount desk
text:
During February my wife and I took Amtrack from Alabama to New York and had reservations at the Embassy suite in NYC.  We had arrived later than we had planned due to the train running late.

Lianna took the time to run get the manager even though she was covered up. She working thru the rooms to find the one we wanted. I travel 20 days a month and stay in Hilton hotels and Lianna went well and above to take care of my wife and I.

The hotel was the best I've stayed in Manhattan! Lianna is someone you need more like her.  She treathed the two of us like family!

title: Great stay in midtown Manhattan
text: I had an opportunity to visit my son in NYC last week and I stayed at the Embassy Suites in Times Square and I was most impressed. The room I had was very spacious for a midtown Manhattan hotel . The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable and I wound up getting 2 great night's sleep! The location cannot be beat. I was central to everything - NY Penn Station just a few blocks. It was an easy walk with my suitcase. I hardly even took the subway as the weather was good and I could literally walk everywhere from the hotel. The staff was super friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make me comfortable. The breakfast was fantastic! I could not believe the spread. I had eggs and bacon one day and pancakes the next. I will definitely be staying here again.

title: Major issue handled with Grace !
text: At first I had a major issue with my room that my wife and I stayed in for our anniversary(cleaning issue ) . However  after talking to Davely, she immediately upgraded me and my wife to an excellent room ( with a lovely balcony at no additional cost ). This improved my stay quite a bit thank you !!

title: 10/10 service
text: Great service easy check in and out. They were able to hold our luggage until our flight  plus they also have driver service to the airport. Will be booking again once we come back to New York again. Thank You!

title: Great location
text: Stayed here for a friends birthday and it was the perfect location. Staff was very friendly, the room was a great size, amenities were excellent. Easy to get to all nyc locations from here. Breakfast had a lot of selections and was great. Definitely recommend to stay here when visiting nyc.

title: Perfect night for my bday celebration with friends
text: I had the perfect bday celebration with a close group of college friends at Embassy Suites. The night started off here, we all got ready together and were visiting each other in our rooms. It was a chic room with an incredible view of the city - I appreciated all the mirrors as we were getting ready. The staff was friendly and welcoming, breakfast was great. 10/10

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: Best location, great rooms, best treatment of front desk👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻 Bruno and Sérgio at a bar FIVE STARS service 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻🔝🔝🔝. highlander recomended 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻💙💙💙 The next time and forever this gonna be my home in Manhattan 💙

title: Superb staff & Customer Service
text: We stayed at this beautiful hotel over the Xmas Holiday Season in December. The rooms were cozy & very clean.   The restaurant food & cocktails at the bar were delicious and plentiful. The location was perfect for our needs.   The location is close to all tourist attractions. We will definitely go back to this particular hotel later this year. The customer service was extortionately friendly and efficient.   Definitely 5 stars in every category.

title: Great hotel. Perfect location.
text: Perfect location. Right in the heart of Manhattan. I had a nice view from my room. You can open the window in the room for some fresh air, which is great. Good breakfast with a choice of omelette, sausages, ham, oatmeal, fruits, yogurt, etc. The gym is well-equipped and offers an outdoor terrace. Proper room cleaning.

title: Great stay in New York
text:
I had a great stay at the Embassy Suites by Hilton
The hotel is clean, the  staff is friendly, great location for sightseeing. The room was very comfortable. I would recommend the Embassy Suites by Hilton for short weekends or along vacation stay.

title: The best location!!
text: We loved our stay at the Embassy Suites - the location is excellent! The staff was wonderful and accommodating. Bruno, was amazing at the check in acknowledging my Diamond member status. All the front desk staff, were so kind and despite the busy hotel lobby, they were organized and efficient. The Rooms were very clean and comfortable! Natalia at the bar was very nice and the drinks were amazing!  Definitely would stay again next time I am in the city!

title: Stay in NYC
text: Exceptional staff!  LiAnne and Bruno greeted us upon arrival and sorted through a small issue with our room. Both were engaging and made sure to solve the issue quickly!  The rooms are clean and modern. The lobby has plenty of seating, a bar with food service. A great place to stay!

title: Perfect Mid-town location.  Book an Empire View Room!!
text:
Stayed at the Embassy Suites for just one night on a Saturday.  Arrived around 7:30pm and while the arrival experience was different from other Hiltons, the time for check in was quite speedy for NYC.  Janiah was the agent who assisted and provided a welcome for being an Honors member along with the customary arrival amenities.  

The lobby was quite when I arrived and their Heist bar area looked quite popular.  Sadly I missed the manager hour earlier in the evening.  After getting my key I headed up to my room on the 26th floor and wow.  What a view.  This room is amazing, the balcony/patio area can’t be done justice in these photos.  Trust me…if you want a one of a kind experience in NYC and happen to have peeps to hang with you…this is the location!   The room itself was smaller than your normal Embassy Suites…but hey, it’s the only one in the city, and compared to other hotels…the rooms are spacious.   You’ll see one photo from the bed….of the Empire State building…was I comfortable, yes, do I wish I took a daytime view, yes.  

Plenty of room to spread out and put away my items.  I enjoyed having a fridge and microwave as I got some popcorn and make that while watching TV.  I will say the TV options have the opportunity to be upgraded.  And despite being the only one in the room, I wanted to test out the 2 TVs going at the same time.  Quite surprised that unless you have them very loud, there was minimal cross over between the spaces.  

After I did my initial loop, ended up FaceTiming not once…not twice…but three times with friends to show them this room and the view from the balcony.  The Empire State Building was so close…felt like I could reach it!  

Room was very quiet and didn’t hear any outside city noise which means I slept wonderful, comfy bed and pillows.  Got up early to have breakfast and arrived around 7:30am.  Breakfast selection was typical of Embassy with the main difference having to write down your omelet order vs standing in line.  The attendants were very prompt to remove empty plates and keep the flow moving.  Coffee was good, took two to go cups back to the room with me.  Seating can be limited…and I recommend seeing it more as communal seating and share with someone.  

Shower was great too, water pressure amazing wished I didn’t have to leave.  Spacious bathroom as well, loved the waterfall faucet.  

Glad I woke early as I got the perfect shot of the Empire State Building before the clouds rolled in and covered the very top.  

Davely upon departure was wonderful.  Her energy was contagious.  Made the day start on a good note. 

Overall I enjoyed my stay and would return when in the city.

title: Girls night
text: It’s a great place to view the city, our room literally was in front of the Empire State Building!! Gorg!!!!! But the bathroom shower caused puddles and everything closed early then expected n opened late. Also the breakfast eggs looked so water down that morning

title: Great front desk service
text: The front desk employees were all exceptional.  Especially Janiah, she was able to take care of our immediate needs concerning a room that was adequate for our family and our 8 month old baby. Janiah was able to answer questions about the local area to include places to eat and visit. The rooms are small but I think that's how hotel rooms are generally in New York.

title: Amazing Staff with a perfect view! :)
text: The wonderful people that work at this hotel are amazing. Raheema thank you for making my birthday special.:) You went out of your way to give us one of the best rooms with the most prefect wrap around balcony I have ever seen . The views!!!!!Our room wasn't available the first night , but she went out of her way to make sure we had the most amazing room the next day. Everyone at the front desk was so sweet and accommodating. The guy who handles the luggage is the sweetest human I have every met. I think his name as Adam (I'm so sorry if that is wrong). The room was spacious for NY ,smelled good ,and clean. The pillows and bed support were okay , but the location of the place... you can't beat it.  Thanks again Raheema!!!!!!  :)

title: THANK YOU!
text: I loved everything about this hotel,  the cleaniless and views from right outside your window! Not to mention the staff, especially Davely and Kenny who went above and beyond to make sure my experience was nothing short of amazing. As a frequent business traveler, I will be looking forward to future stays with you all!

title: Adam was extremely helpful!
text: We stopped for a short trip to New York from Spain. Adam was a delightful porter. He gave us the best tips for navigating the subway with the least number of stops to where we were going. He was always cheerful and smiling. The rest of the staff was great as well. We did not realize that since Covid you still have to request service to the room. They remedied our need for towels quickly.

title: Great place to stay near Time Square
text: We had a great time! Location is great - 10 mins walking distance to Time Square; 2-3 mins to Empire State Building (you can see the building if you assigned Empire State building view room). Staffs were very friendly, especially Bruno!!! We enjoyed complementary breakfast and evening reception everyday. They provide daily $30 food and beverage credit which could be used at the restaurant and bar.

title: Bed bug infestation at this property!
text: The hotel has bed bugs. I was bitten my first night and told the front desk and manager on duty. They said they would send someone to the room and reimburse my first night. THEY DID ABSOLUTELY NOTHING! I went out to buy a very expensive can of spray to get rid of the bugs. I sent pictures of the receipt, spray and a picture of something I took in the room and didn't realize that a bug was crawling on the fabric headboard.

title: Bday Celebration
text: This is by far the best Hilton property I’ve stayed in!! Absolutely excellent location to tourist attractions. We were able to walk to and from Broadway to see our show just a few blocks away. The rooms are so freaking spacious!! Unbelievable for NY standards. I want to give a very special shoutout to Latesha, the front office supervisor who went above and beyond to help us with our reservation which wouldn’t allow us to modify but she was able to do it manually so that she could reimburse my points for a night we didn’t actually use. So thank you to everyone at Embassy Suites for being so helpful, courteous and professional. We’ve found our forever hotel every time we visit NYC!!!

title: Vacaciones
text: Nuestra experiencia excelente..la atención de Bruno (brasilero) impecable ayudándonos en todo lo necesario.  pequeño como todo en Manhattan pero con algunos plus interesantes para aprovechar. Volveria.

title: Stay far away
text: there’s so much to say that honestly I don’t even feel like typing it all. There were so many issues but the main one is they put us in a room  where the pull out sofa didn’t work (they were already aware of it not working) and my sister had no bed to sleep in for two days. no manager available the whole weekend to rectify it. I hated their property so bad I wanted to check out early and go to another Hilton but unfortunately I prepaid for everything.  I called the diamond desk to get the situation rectified and the manager of the property didn’t even bother to call. again, so much more happened but the unprofessionalism at this property is appalling.

title: Great hotel with awesome staff!
text: We requested an early check in and Davely was so great at helping with this! She was so friendly and made us feel welcome from the minute we arrived. She was the only employee working the front desk and was juggling multiple tasks and guests  while still being kind and helpful to all guests. What a great first impression!

title: Davely is amazing! 🥰
text: We arrived for the NYC leg of our trip on Valentine’s Day and Davely got us set up with our rooms with an early check in and was so nice. Despite how busy it was in the lobby and her being the only person, she took great care of us. She was able to get us set up with our rooms and gave us the full rundown of the amenities so we didn’t miss a thing.

title: Great hotel! Spacious room & friendly staff
text:
My daughter and I stayed here for her 15th birthday weekend. Location is great! Very safe! Staff were extremely friendly, especially the bellman. The hotel is updated and the room was spacious. Great perks in room like sitting area, fridge, and 2 tvs. Shower had great water pressure. Bathroom had good lighting and counter space. The evening reception was nice- 2 free cocktails per day and a snack. 
Breakfast was included and was also good with made to order omelets. I would stay here again and would highly recommend.

title: Stay in this hotel! Great location & service
text: Adam the concierge was amazing! He was courteous, outgoing, and very informative. He was great handling our luggage and went above and beyond for his guest. This guy truly needs a raise. The front desk staff was also professional and efficient in their work.

title: Great hotel and great location!
text:
My husband and I stayed at Embassy Suites Times Square in February.  We absolutely loved it! The location was perfect to walk not only to Times Square but also to the Theatre District, Bryant Park, Flatiron district, the Highline and so much more.  It was also an easy walk to Pennsylvania Station and Grand Central Station. It was so great to have everything so close. 
The hotel stay was very comfortable.  We had a beautiful spacious room with a separate space for office/living room/extra bed with a view of the Empire State Building, which we could see from our bed. The room was clean and very quite. 
The service was also great.  There was a hot breakfast included every morning and could order yummy omelettes.  There was also a $30/day credit to use at the bar/restaurant for dinner. There was a variety of food selection ranging from from bar food (wings, burgers, yummy fries) to pasta and seafood.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Hôtel à éviter - a ruiné notre anniversaire
text:
Chambre minuscule, frigo non-fonctionnel, bureau de travail presque complètement arraché du mur. Literie quasi-inexistante.
Ne reflète aucunement le standard de qualité auquel on s'attend dans un établissement Hilton.

Le personnel nous induit en erreur et fait des erreurs de facturation monumentales,
Surveillez bien vos transactions et conservez précieusement vos reçus!

À l'exception de Lianna et Adam, qui ont été irréprochables et infiniment courtois, personne ne m'a adressé une seule formule de politesse ou un semblant de sourire. Que ce soit par téléphone ou en personne, toujours le même regard glacial malgré mon grand enthousiasme!!! Ils ont totalement ruiné notre anniversaire à mon conjoint et moi :(

Par contre, super bien situé et excellent déjeuner

title: Deceptive Billing practices and non-responsive customer service.
text:
Booked through TripAdvisor & confirmation stated bill was paid in full and $0 was due at hotel.  Hotel charged me an additional $291 for destination fees that I was never advised of at check-in or check-out.    They charged my CC that I submitted for incidentals and was told that I would get the $100 refunded at checkout.  Very deceptive and hotel is not responding to phone calls or emails asking to discuss charges.

Saved for this trip to take my son to NYC for his 13th birthday.  Hilton should not treat their hardworking, loyal customers in this manner.  I am still trying to resolve this issue with them and hope that Hilton makes this right.

title: Great Stay at the Embassy Suits
text: The room was a perfect fit for my family, the couch divider allowed us to set up a crib for my son where he could sleep secluded and comfortable.  Lianna at the front desk was great and provided some snacks and milk for my son after everything else had closed.

title: Excellent location, very good breakfast
text: Perfect location walking distance to most of Midtown sights. Close to several metrostation. Room rather small but clean and functional. Very good breakfast included, with good variation even omelete to order. The open bar between 17-18.30 with two free drinks any type for every guest a very nice start of the evening in NYC!

title: Woke up with 20+ Bug bites on me
text: This is the second or third time I’ve stayed here for business.  Got a larger room on the 12th floor.  Before I went to bed I noticed 1-2 gnat looking bugs but thought it was minor.  I woke up with bites all over my body…some still itch more than a week later. The ceiling of the bathroom had about 40-50 of the bugs in the morning. I also think there was something in the mattress as I was bitten while sleeping. Took photos of the bites and the bugs and showed it to the front desk.  They said that manager wasn’t there but would note it and call back. Nothing. Mentioned it on Hilton’s website…and nothing as well.  I’ve traveled for work for 20 years and never had anything like this happen.

title: Shout out to Adam & Mark @ Embassy Suites who made my stay amazing
text:
Adam, thank you for making my stay from London amazing! You deserve a promotion honestly. Really hospitable & friendly. Also shout out to Mark (lovely black guy) who came in and covered from another branch. His customer service skills are A1 - him and his colleague helped out with a housekeeping issue me & a friend had. 
Those two are amazing representations of the embassy suites.

title: Nice staff
text: We are currently staying here for a few days. Has been a very good experience so far starting with very nice reception staff including LiAnna who very kindly gave us pointers for stay as we arrived late at night. Since then they have all helped to keep my medicines in their refrigerator , answering any queries. Breakfast is great : waffles/pancakes, custom omelette etc. with nice hot milk and coffee. The hotel is clean and room service always available.

title: Overpriced but in NYC.  Happy Hour not so happy.  Small but clean room. Good Location.
text:
Overpriced but in NYC.  Happy Hour not so happy.  Small but clean room. Good Location.
We are loyal Embassy Suites fans, so stay in them whenever they are available in the cities we travel to.  We were happy to try this NYC Manhattan Times Square area Embassy Suites on our recent trip.  It is not really in Times Square, maybe a half hour walk and a mile of more from there, but at least in the general area of midtown Manhattan.  We had flown on a long red-eye flight, so were very pleased when they let us check in early our first morning, upon arrival around 11 AM, rather than being stuck waiting all day for a typical 3 or 4PM Check in time.  GOOD JOB!!  One of us napped and the other did some walking around town in the area.  
At about $530 per night US Dollars, this is probably the most expensive hotel that we have ever stayed at, and Embassy Suites all around the USA are usually more like $135-$200 a night, USD.  There was also a “rip-off” extra $25 daily fee, like a resort fee, that was very totally unnecessary, since there were no resort features to the place, which added another $75 to our bill.  They said you could purchase snacks and sodas from the lobby snack corner, which we did to use up the $25 daily limit credit.  The bars were overpriced, so it was almost too expensive to get drinks there, to try to use the credit, and the credit had to be used daily or lost, could not be combined and used on 1 night, like at the bar.  The hotel room was also the tiniest room we have stayed in, in an Embassy Suites too, but of course we understand the real estate problems in Manhattan, but still, very small room.  The room had a tall padded back on the sofa in the tiny TV, refrig, sitting area, which they somewhat divided that area from the bed on the other side of the tall sofa “wall” (no real wall, so not separate rooms, not really a suite of two rooms, as is typical in Embassy rooms/suites.  The room was clean and modern, bed was comfy, but the Air Conditioner was noisy and rattled.  There was almost no room for out two suitcases in the room, without tripping over them.  The hotel is only 7 years old and was built as an Embassy, per the front desk clerk, but you would think if they were building to their normal styles, they could have made the rooms bigger, and just go higher up.
The Happy Hour Manager’s Reception was not very happy, it was only for 1.5 hours, not 2 hours, and you were limited to 2 drink tickets (unlimited drinks for 2 hours at all normal Embassy Suites Hotels).  And, to our negative surprise on the first night, drink choices were extremely limited.  There was only 1 choice of beer that night, not the typical 3-4 beer brands, with some on draft and usually something local, like a local craft beer, on draft).  There was only one wine choice that night, just 1 red wine, not white wines at all, no other red wine choices etc.  For Cocktails, the only offering was 2-3 fruity drinks he had made up in a few pitchers, and when the pitchers were empty, he had no more of those or any other drinks.  Also, the Manager’s Reception was held in the overly crowded space that they also serve breakfast, so it was hard to get a table in the bar, for the happy hour……  The HAPPY HOUR was VERY POORLY DONE & Management needs to improve this part of their Embassy service.  Even the nightly bar tender was unhelpful and was unconcerned that there were no choices or availability of standard drinks, that would be expected and standard at any other Hilton Embassy Suites property.
The included Breakfast was also problematic, in that the rooms were too small, so there was no where to sit and it was always very hard to find a table.  The Breakfast cooking staff and table waiters were working very hard and doing a great job, and the food, particularly the omelets were great/tasty, so they should be commended, but again, the lack of sitting space made breakfast difficult.
The room had two nice large newer Samsung flat screen LED TV’s, a safe, microwave, and refrigerator.  We had a nice view of neighboring high rise buildings out the bedroom window, including of the Empire State Building.  The front desk staff were nice and helpful as was the breakfast staff, but again, not the solo same Happy Hour bar tender.  The location is good, and it was a few long blocks away from the closest subway station.
Considering that this is the most expensive Embassy that we have ever stayed in (so overpriced!!), they should drop the daily $25 extra fee, and management could easily improve the very poorly run Manager’s Reception, and then also consider figuring out a way to improve or add or find extra seating space, for the breakfast and happy hours.

title: Great hotel and location
text: I stayed at this hotel Friday and Saturday night.   I was greeted upon arrival by a helpful, friendly, and attentive receptionist and bell hop.  My room was clean, had ample lighting, and was well laid out to make the most of the space.  I loved the brand of shampoo and lotion they had available in the bathroom and the beds/pillows were comfortable.  My room had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building and the hotel was a short walk from Penn station, major subway lines, Bryant Park and Times Square. The complementary managers reception(happy hour) and breakfast are a very nice add on and the food at the restaurant was delicious too.   I would without a doubt stay here again.

title: Birthday Trip
text: Janiah (front desk) and Adam (bellman) are definitely an asset to your hotel.
