I checked in on 1/26/23 with Janiah and she noticed my birthday was the 27th and greeted me with " Happy Birthday Eve!" and she also gave me a double dose of 2 of my favorite candy bars. Adam is funny and very helpful. The room was clean, the view was amazing, and the hot water did not skip a beat even with being on the 35th floor. Breakfast can get a little crowded but overall, my husband and I had an amazing stay. We will definitely stay here again when we visit New York.

title: Bruno saved the Day!
text: Our first time in New York all the way from sfo for my sisters 60th bday and our first hotel sucked! toilet not working, bar closed down since covid (false Advertising by the way), phone not working, room so small and noisy.  We escaped to embassy suites for the rest of our stay and Bruno ( I call him Bruno Mars lol) greeted us with a goodie bag of treats inlcluding chocolates and bottled water and such a warm personality to top it off we had free breakfast which was amazing cook to order omelettes and happy hour. And were so close to all of the sites!!  The entire staff rocked oh and bonus a great fitness center and bar/restaurant with amazing wine and food choices.  I will stay here everytime I go to NYC!

title: Great value for the money!!!
text: I had the pleasure of staying with my wife for two days at 35th floor of this hotel this month. There are a lot of positive things going on for this hotel. First, the location is unbeatable. This hotel is close to Times Square, the Theater district, the Empire State Building and many other tourist attractions. It also close to the metro. Second, the hotel room was spacious and clean. I was surprised that there was more than enough space even with a king-sized bed in the room. Third, the 35 th floor room had sweeping views of the city. At night, you could see the lights of the Empire State Building. Fourth, breakfast was a treat. There was a variety of hot food to choose from. Aside from that, you could order a freshly made omelette. I would gladly stay at this hotel again. This hotel is a great value for the money!!!!

title: Amazing hotel for the Thanksgiving Parade
text:
We used this hotel as a great way to take our kids to see the Thanksgiving Parade. Its hard enough to get in on Thanksgiving due to the parade traffic, but doing so with 4 kids sounds like torture. So we came in Wednesday night and left Friday morning, and avoided all of the Thanksgiving traffic.

We got a room on the 20th floor on the front side of the building. We had the most amazing view of the parade. We had tried to go down to the parade, but it was too crowded and the kids could not see, so we went back up to the room, and it was great. I highly recommend anyone going to the hotel to try this hotel.

In terms of the hotel itself, your breakfast is what you would expect from an Embassy Suites. The rooms themselves are all pretty much the same from what I understand. There are no true suites despite the hotel's name. However, the high backed couch does give you some level of separation.

title: Great Service
text: Lianna was very helpful at the desk. She was very friendly and getting my room together. I appreciate her service while I check in my room to relax and destress. I always enjoy my stay while I’m visiting the city for business or vacation

title: Great attention and support !!!
text:
I stayed 3 nights with a group of engineers from Uzbekistan, we were attended by Davely and Janiah,  they were very polite, warmful and efficient. The gruop had a great first impression of the city thank to the excelent service and attention.

Our trip started in a great way thanks to the attention of these staff members

title: Business trip
text: I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. Staff were awesome. The hotel from the reception office to the rooms were very clean. I like the fact that have the cold water with fruit in it available for all customers. We really enjoyed our stay.

title: キレイで便利。NBA 観戦にいいかも？
text:
タイムズスクエア周辺にはヒルトン系列が沢山ありますが、ビジネス目的で連泊するならオススメです。
便利。地下鉄近いし、スーパーマーケットもある。施設はキレイ。小さいながらもジムあり。embassy らしい朝食つき。オムレツも作って貰えます。スタッフさんも全員明るく、親切です。
夕方5時から、アルコール類1杯無料サービスもembassy らしいサービスですが、個人的には要らないです。けっこう混んでるし、お一人様で喧騒の中に飛び込んでいくのは、なかなか難しい。
マジソンスクエアガーデンには歩いていけるし、バークレーセンターには地下鉄で一本、30分なので、NBA観戦にもいいと思います。

title: Second to none 💯
text:
Spent 4 days at this hotel with my family in Jan 2023 - after it was highly recommended by a friend. We did not regret our stay here Excellent Service 
Superb Breakfast 
Location excellent 
Clean and Sanitized Hotel
Staff helpful and Friendly

title: Nice hotel, convenient location
text:
Hotel is conveniently located in midtown.  Staff is very warm and welcoming.  Spa water in the lobby was a nice touch.  Hotel was pretty quiet overall with no issues.  If souvenir shops are your thing there are a bunch of them close by on 6th Ave.

On the minus side - Wasn’t provided with any in-room information about amenities and found out after a long day away that you only get housekeeping if you request it, a trend billed as “green” but really only green in terms of saving money for Hilton by skimping on services.  I miss having a freshly made bed and clean bathroom every day when i stay in a hotel but it’s now the norm that it isn’t done.  You’re also not allowed to eat at the bar if you have food delivered, even after paying $20 for a vodka tonic (have to order hotel food).  I’d prefer a few complimentary bottles of water in the fridge over a free breakfast I never eat or a social I am never back from work in time for, just a suggestion for guests that prefer it.  Room was fine for one person but the bathroom is teeny tiny and the coat closet is in the bathroom, a first for me even  in NYC.

title: Very nice and  clean
text:
Estuve de visita con mi familia durante el fin de año y año nuevo, la recepción fue increíblemente buena, Davely Lianna nos trataron excelente, la habitación muy limpia, la cama cómoda y el baño estaba impecable.
100% recomendado

title: Nice Hotel in a great location
text:
The hotel was nice and the location was really great but the staff were not great hence the rating. 
The food was good and you can have en egg to order which was really nice start to the day. Another great thing was that you get to use your 'resort' tax money in their snack bar. Everything was overpriced but least you get to use it. The room was a bit on the small side as we had 2 big bags but apart from that it was fine. Really nice view.

The issue we had at the hotel was the fire alarm went off 3 times during our stay with no explanation from the hotel to us why. It also happened at around 2:00 am. This first time if happen we were so scared as we lived really high up. After 3-4 minute the fire brigade arrived and left soon after. We had no clue if we needed to leave our room. We were very scared. We asked the reception the next day and they just dimissed us as it was nothing that we had been woken up so early and it was a false alarm. This happened 2  more times , so 3 times total. Reception never even said sorry. We were informed it was probably someone smoking in their room but the ones we spoke to didnt seem to care . I would not come back to this hotel as the reception staff didnt care less. The door guy was really nice and helpful.

title: Stay here for great customer service and convenience to everything!
text: Latesha provided the warmest southern hospitality ever!  She made quite a positive impression during our check-in, making sure we had everthing we needed and set the tone a our wonderful hotel stay.  I will return to this property for my summer visit.

title: Great stay and staff !
text: The staff at this hotel are friendly and helpful in every way. From the reception to the breakfast buffet, we felt welcomed and appreciated. Upon check-in, Latesha Negron welcomed us and made sure we had a room with a wonderful view of the Empire State Building. Thank you for your kindness Latesha ! :) this was our second stay here in one year and we will be back !

title: A+++ customer service and great location
text:
Vanessa at the front desk is THE BEST employee Hilton has I’m convinced. I travel a lot for work and she handled a complicated, multi check in date, with 2 rooms flawlessly. Everyone who worked here was very attentive, helpful, and nice! I can’t tell you how much this elevated my experience for the better, right away! Bravo to you all!!! 
This hotel is in a great location, breakfast is on point and a nice glass of free wine in the evening is awesome too! Will be back for sure, especially if Vanessa is working

title: Excellent Customer Service
text:
January 12, 2023
We are Embassy Suites hotel regular customers and fans. This week we vacationed at the Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square at 60 West 37th Street.
 
 My husband is a pretty big person and is 6.6" tall. With our luggage it was very difficult for us to move around the room.  We decided we would check to see what hotels in the area were available with more space.  First, I thought I would go down to the front desk, explain our situation and inquire if there were room options before we checked into other possible hotel space in the Times Square area. I would like to commend your employee named Rasheeda who immediately provided us with a couple of room options.  Her customer service was excellent.  We appreciate her kindness and concern for us.  We wanted to let you know what an exemplary employee you have in Rasheeda. Please commend her for us.

Also we wanted to commend the bellman named Deni (Dinu) who helped us with online tickets for several New York tours and answered our many questions. 

We decided to extend our stay an additional night and signed up online for the stay.  We were told there was no record of our online stay request and were helped by your front desk manager named Ken or Kevin to resolve the additional stay request. 
 
The breakfast buffet in the hotel was excellent. Great omelets!

In essence, we are proud to be customers of the Embassy Suites and appreciate the excellent customer service shown to us by these 3 excellent employees. You have much to be proud of. Embassy Suites will always be our first choice when looking for a great hotel.  

Sincerely,
Mrs. Blanche Parks Jones & Darryl Jones
Topeka, Kansas

title: O hotel em NYC
text: Localização maravilhosa, hotel novo, quartos confortáveis e muito limpos. Café da manhã excelente. Ficamos com vista para o Empire State. Bruno da recepção foi fantástico nos mínimos detalhes. Jamais esqueceremos essa viagem. Voltaremos sempre.

title: Janiah !!!!
text: Booked this trip for my birthday and We arrived at the hotel early at 2 PM and didn’t expect to be able to check in yet but Janiah at the front desk was so kind and could get us in early, she also gave us extra candy and a room with an amazing view!! Would definitely stay again! Janiah made my birthday better!

title: Great place to stay
text: We had a great time staying here! The location was close to so many cool places and Adam was incredibly kind and helpful with our bags as we arrived as well as when we left. The breakfast in the morning was great too. Definitely would stay here again in the future!

title: Nice hotel with Excellent staff
text: A great stay with great staff.  A special shout out to LaTesha Negron who is a supervisor.   She actually helped us twice.  The first time she was kind enough to get Southwest Vacations to waive a fee on our reservation because we changed the dates of our stay.  She did this by telephone.  Second time she helped is when we arrived at check in the front desk showed we owed our full balance even though I had it paid through Southwest Vacations.  I asked for her help and she came out front and she remembered helping me by phone 2 weeks earlier.She was able to get my account credited and she proceeded to check us in.  5 star support all the way.  We are so appreciative of her help as she went above and beyond her job to make sure we were taken care of.  The hotel itself is a typical Embassy Suites in that they offer breakfast and a daily reception.  Location is convenient to the majority of activities in Manhattan.  The rooms are on the small size which is expected in NYC.  Overall stay was comfortable.  Would stay here again because of our favorable experience.

title: Anniversary
text: This hotel was the best. We had to caught a overnight flight in. Got there early, Lianna was amazing. Very understanding and helpful with holding are bags and getting us in. Love this Hotel. Our stay was great

title: Bruno is the man
text: We were booked to arrive today and looked forward to another visit to this great hotel. However, Porter Airlines had other plans for us. Hotel, restaurants and events were booked but they cancelled the flight while it was at the gate. Mechanical problems! Bruno from the front desk took care of us and eliminated some stress from us not making the trip. We will return at a later date but Bruno gets a big Thank You from us!

title: Latesha’s Warm Welcome
text: Latesha provided a warm and informative welcome. She even got me to register for Hilton rewards, although I advised I’m loyal to Marriott. She was definitely a great start to my trip. My room was available for early check-in, and she advised I had a great view, which was true. Thank you, Latesha!

title: The best hotel in NYC
text:
This is my favorite hotel in NYC. I stay here every time I go to the city. 

Amazing location right next to Herald Square and the Subway. The rooms are bigger than average, with tile floors that look like hardwood (no gross carpet here). The bathroom is big with a great shower

The room is always super clean, with great views. The staff is amazing. I have tried other hotels but none compare to this one! Special shout out to LiAnna for checking me in quickly and chatting on Christmas Day. 

The breakfast is great (but it ends too early at 10). The only thing I don't like is the mandatory $30/day "Urban Destination Fee" which is just some dumb fee, but you do get a $25/day credit to use on dining or in the snack pantry - but I always feel forced to use it.

title: Not reccomended!
text:
While on New Year's holidays, my family and I stayed at the Embassy Suites by Hilton. There are many things about their service that are unpleasantly surprising. The room was tiny and uncomfortable, and there was only one chair for three people. Although we travel a lot throughout the world, this was the worst room cleaning we have ever experienced. We repeatedly asked to clean the room and to bring shampoo and towels. Unhelpful stuff. Aside from its convenient location, this hotel has no other advantages.
We are not recommended to spend your money on this hotel.

title: New York before  Christmas
text:
Adam the concierge made the difference for us.  He was fantastic as we arrived and took care of us throughout our stay. Including walking us and our luggage half a block to meet our car to the airport.  
He was fantastic with all who stayed at the hotel.  No matter the issue he did his best to address the problem and ease any concern we had.

title: Pleased on all levels
text: I'm would consider myself a person that never give anything an excellent but, this hotel lived up to it's website. It was clean, the employees were all nice and the breakfast was outstanding. It was in walking distance of good restaurants and plenty of shopping locations.

title: Staff & Latesha
text: Very helpful, wonderful and a satisfying stay. Provided exceptional service, with no wait times. The hotel staff are so supportive & are here to support & help throughout the stay. I truly enjoyed my time.

title: Avoid at all cost
text: Arrived late on 22 Dec 2022. The room allocated to us had a flooded floor. Went down to reception again asking for another room. The next room was a standard room and fine. We were told that our room would be serviced every day by the staff on checking in. This turned out to be a lie as according to the staff member the next day nobody would have told us that the room would be cleaned every day. The reception staff had a bad attitude most days. How can a room not have just the basics done everyday? Daily bin cleaning,  replenishment of coffee, creamer and paper cups? No glasses in the room. Note on the mirror that room will be cleaned only after 4 nights….The breakfast area was beyond crammed, the staff tried their best to keep it clean. The complimentary drinks between 17h00 an 18h30 each night was yet another crammed and badly organised affair. Not enough glasses for the number of guests, the worst snacks imaginable. Staff in reception area despite their attitude deserve better/warmer environment. The doors leading to the outside and the ovedhead  heater were not working properly during the extreme weather experienced.  Some of the staff like Adam and Denu always had a smile. We have stayed in many a Hilton hotel all over the world (husband is  a Diamond member) and this was the WORST Hilton ever. To be avoided as there are many other and most certainly better hotels in NY. And the fitted sheets DID not fit the bed! And the shower in need of some TLC!

title: Good choice for value plus hotel in Midtown
text: The rooms are spacious for NYC but tight - small bathroom - and no maid service even if asked for in morning as instructed.  That’s a problem most places.  That said, staff and management were very helpful and gracious.  The breakfast is very good - there are made to order items included.  Evening reception with beer and wine and nibbles was great.  You could order good wings and great fries and other items.  The attached parking garage was full when we arrived around 12:30pm so beware.  If you park elsewhere ask for that $15 credit applied to your bill.  It is very good location - easy walk to Times Square and 5th Ave.

title: Great experience
text: Fantastic experience. Liamma was so helpful! I had so many questions and she was very patient and kind. It was Christmas Eve and it was busy and cold but she helped out enormously! Im so grateful! I will definitely stay here again!

title: Not my favorite Hilton family experience
text: I know it is New York, and it is very crowded. But the check in was very slow because only one person was working the week after Christmas at the time we checked in. There was a long slow line (but not the fault of the person working who has calm, cool, collected and doing a great job). There was luggage  everywhere so much so that the bar was closed because it was filled with luggage. The thermostat would not go below 68. I was actually trying to save the money by turning off the heat because I was sweating but they would not allow me to do this. The sink was clogged so every time you used it it would fill up with water and take a while to drain. The TV had issues to where we had a call technician to come in and get it working. There were cables coming out of the vents and dangling from the TV. We could hear conversations in the bathroom vents from somewhere either the room next-door or the staff. But it was very loud and clear. Your best bet is to pay $100 more a night, if you can, and go somewhere nicer. The staff was very friendly, however.

title: Highly recommend! Great place to stay!
text: My husband and I stayed at Embassy Suites in midtown Manhattan earlier this month. The front desk staff, Lianna, Davely, Latecia and Adam were amazing! Always smiling and helpful. They all made our stay much more enjoyable. We loved the fact that this location is close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park, all within walking distance. We enjoyed the free breakfast every day which was always stocked with good food. My only complaint is the mattress. They need to be replaced as they were very uncomfortable.

title: Great experience for our Christmas in New york.
text: We arrived back in the UK today from having Christmas over in New york. Well what can I say about this hotel, very clean, efficient and friendly. The service is fabulous and you do not have city taxes. We had a king bed suite with a view and ours was looking out of the window over at the empire state which was one of our favourite points of new york. The beds were very comfortable, I am currently 31 pregnant and the lady at the front desk sorted extra pillows to make my stay more comfortable for me. Very clean and you can have housekeeping included in your price, the same as a buffet breakfast which we only had one of the days but was still great for a buffet. They have shampoo, condition and body lotion in the bathroom which smell absolutely divine. We would most certainly recommend here and if we returned back to new york we would use this hotel again.

title: Not organized at all
text: I was told I could check in early. I get to the hotel early, not only is it not ready for early check in- but it’s not ready at check in time. The lobby is packed with people and suitcases and no one has their room ready at check in time. It’s chaos. Don’t think I will be staying here again. Can’t really rate the room- because I’ve been in the lobby forever

title: Great service
text: I stayed for 6 days with my family. I would highly recommend it. We had an issue with our sofa bed, but Lianna was extremely helpful, and moved us to a room with a better sofa bed. The hotel is located between 5th ave and 6th ave. They have buffet breakfast from 7am-10am

title: Sale et très cher
text: Le ménage non fait! Le linge de lit jamais changé! Pas de serviette de toilette propre! Pas de sèche cheveux! Même dans un ibis c’est plus propre et mieux! Sauf que ça coute pas 3000 balles la semaine! Bref bien placé mais zéro service et ultra cher! Vous avez bien mieux pas loin!

title: Could be so good
text: Frustrating would sum this hotel up, it has all the right things in all the right places but the attention to detail and customer service sadly lets it down. Out of 6 people spoken to you could tell only 2 of them actually wanted to do their absolute best and I'm ashamed to say i didn't get their names but a lady on the desk who seemed to be in charge on Thursday morning and the guy looking after luggage etc at the same time absolutely spot on! The main issue was asking multiple times for an issue in the room to be looked at by the other members of desk staff to give up after 2 days and sort myself. Customer service is everything when the little things let you down, like room standards i.e. faulty fridges, wires hanging down from tvs and god forbid toilet seats that might land you up in the shower but view wise and location its a great spot so just needs TLC along with some more of your top colleagues

title: Latesha is Phenomenal!
text:
I have stayed at this hotel 3 times since October. I first met Latesha in October. Her presence, kindness, and professionalism was beaming. It was an extremely busy day and she was the only one at the desk. With a long line and the phone ringing off the hook. I stayed quiet until everything calmed down because it was overwhelming for me as a customer, I can only imagine what it was as an employee. She appreciated my kindness and patience. 
I came back on the Dec 18th and she remembered me and the professionalism and kindness was every bit more there as before! The staff here is Consistent and Kind!

I will see you all soon!!!

title: Excellent option in the heart of Midtown!
text:
Great experience at this hotel! We stayed for one night only and found this hotel available at the last minute using Hilton points. 
Our room had a king bed plus a sofa bed for my teen. The room is a bit compact but it is super well designed and you have everything you need for a short stay! Good sized comfortable bathroom, comfy bed, desk, mini fridge and microwave, safety deposit box, spotless clean! 
We booked a Sky view room and got a spec-ta-cu-lar view of the Empire State Building!!  I just couldn’t get enough of this view!! We were on the 37th floor. 
Only minor downside of the room was the sofa bed, mattress was quite uncomfortable and springy. I’m sure it could have been resolved but as we stayed for one night we didn’t really bother. 
Breakfast was above our expectations. A good variety, quality and made or order omelettes. The hotel was quite full but we managed to find a good table. 
Every single employee we came in contact with was pleasant and helpful. Adam was great! 
Hotel location: just perfect! 

Overall a superb short stay experience and would definitely recommend and return!

title: December Not to Remember This Hotel
text:
Good morning, Kenneth:

My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites Times Square for a quick weekend trip to celebrate my birthday. The hotel fell far below my expectations of a NYC hotel (or quite frankly, a hotel anywhere I choose to stay). Below is a list of the issues we encountered. We stayed in Room 805.

1. We arrived around 12:30pm, understanding that check-in wasn’t until 4:00 and our room would probably not be ready. The bellman who checked our bags is quite frankly the one positive staff person I have to compliment. In the midst of chaos, other people experiencing issues, and a just generally poorly managed lobby, he was friendly, maintained a smile, asked us there was anything he could do for us, and was the only staff member I can say that I recall I remember having positive interactions with.
2. We arrived back at the hotel at 4:45 for 5:30 dinner reservations. Our room was STILL not ready. I was still in my sweatsuit from the airplane. Somehow, the staff behind the desk scrambled and found us a room. They were not friendly, apologetic, and did not seem to care about our plans (dinner and a show). I had know time to fix my hair or do my makeup and my husband had no time to shower.
3. When we returned to the room and used the shower, it was not sealed and water went all over the bathroom.
4. Someone locked the tv and/or remote in Spanish with Spanish closed captioning, so we had no tv during our stay, and I like to use the sleep timer, as I have a hard time sleeping. The maintenance engineer who was sent to our room could not figure it out.
5. Checkout was ok, but again, the staff member wasn’t friendly and I don’t even think she said, “thanks.”
6. I used 100,000 Hilton points for this stay. I wasted 100,0000 points on this stay. Quite frankly, the hotel was a dump and I wouldn’t recommend it to an enemy.

title: The Best Service
text:
Such a great experience dealing with Latesha.  She was so friendly and helpful.  

Great hotel in a phenomenal location.  Our family of four enjoyed our multi day stay.  The best free breakfast with made to order omelettes. This benefit alone saved our family at least $100/day.

title: Lianna help me over the phone
text: If you are looking to get help with booking a stay at Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square, call and ask for Lianna! I promise she will help you with anything you need about the hotel's surrounding areas and the best time to book. She was amazing. Because of her, I know my stay will be awesome!

title: Great location!
text: This hotel is in a great location if you want to see all the things NYC!  Close to Times Square and Macys and 2 blocks from the subway.  Lots of places to eat near the hotel as well. The staff was amazing, always available to help or give suggestions.  The rooms are small compared to other Embassy Suites but it is NYC I guess.  The space for breakfast and cocktail hour gets tight so get there early to get a table.  Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to familes or those that want to be close to all the sights!

title: SPECTACULAR
text: Our stay at the embassy suites was a dream. The staff was all very nice and accommodating, especially Dinu, he was very helpful and kind. We were allowed to leave our luggage until our room was ready which was very helpful and everything was returned to us in full tact. The rooms were comfortable and homey. I for sure recommend the Embassy Suites in Manhattan Times Square.

title: Family trip to NYC
text: The staff at this property made our trip!  LiAnna at the front desk started us off with trying to fix an issue with our reservation.  Latesha, Vanessa, and Bruno also assisted us. Adam had a smile every minute, and Mercedes and Ksena helped us with dining questions.  The way a staff handles questions/problems is key to a good stay.  They didn’t make us feel like they were doing us a favor by helping us—the actually made us feel welcome.   I wish I could name every staff person we encountered!  We would stay here again.

title: Amazing Hotel and Staff
text: Great stay. Great food. Great bar. Wonderful room on the 21st floor. Adam the Bellman was the best at his job. Loved thus guy and the wntire stay!! The breakfast space needs to be enlarged but the food provided is fantastic!! Seemed a little pricey but it was good for what you get!!

title: Warm welcome by davely
text: Spent a great weekend in NYC at a nice hotel with big room and phenomenal staff with a special shout out to Davely who went above and beyond the call of duty.  She warmly welcomed us and remembered us that made us feel feel special and appreciated throughout our stay . Greatly appreciated the complimentary breakfast

title: This hotel foes not disappoint - 5 stars
text:
Cannot say enough about how great this hotel is. From the start of our trip, every staff member we encountered, went above and beyond.
The complimentary breakfast was outstanding.  You don’t expect made-to-order omelets and heated milk for coffee - it was seriously a refreshing surprise. We were allowed to check in early and check out one hour later - and the $25 food credit was a treat.
Even when leaving, our uber didn’t show up, so Adam quickly secured us a car to the airport.
Hilton knocked it out of the park - well done.

title: Great Experience - In the middle of all the things!
text: This hotel is a gem located in the center of lots of action in NYC.  Walking distance to amazing tourist attractions (Rockefeller Center and the NYC Library) as well as all the shopping and eateries you could imagine.  The customer service is top notch, with water and snacks available at check in for Honors members.  The hotel itself has a bar and each night has "specials" for both food and drinks.  Make sure you see Dinu, who was amazing at helping us grab all of our transportation and always provided enthusiastic service and support.  Next trip to NYC, book here!

title: Enjoyed my stay
text: Didn't let first impression ruin a wonderful stay. At check  I was greeted by Davely.  New York attitude at it's finest. Hint - if you don't like your job find a new one. Now for the positives which were many. From location close to MSG which is reason for stay, NY Knicks game to sightseeing.  Empire State Building,  Times Square, Korea town, great BBQ and Rockefeller center a short walk. Hotel is very clean and rooms comfortable.

title: Great stay!
text: Had a great stay here- just 1 night! We were promptly greeted at the front desk by Lianna, who was the best concierge I have ever encountered! She was so friendly and informative, and extremely helpful! The view from our room was incredible, and the citrus water in the lobby was excellent! Thank you!

title: Nice stay at a crowded time!
text:
Great location.  Great service, especially Adam!  He was so pleasant and helpful.  The breakfast buffet was top notch, with pleasant service.  Very clean.  
The room was great with a king bed and a couch with a divider to separate the two spaces.  Two tvs!  Thamks Embassy, for a nice stay!

title: Excellent service
text: Some of the best customer service I have ever received! Vanessa and Davely gave me excellent service with professionalism, promptness and great energy! The location of the hotel was great. We where able to go sight seeing and get back to rest with great food choices around!!!

title: Quiet, friendly, great location
text: Location is outstanding. The room was quiet. The free breakfast, including omelette bar and fresh fruit, was outstanding. Staff very friendly and helpful, especially LiAnna. Bed was a bit firm and heating/AC was not as modern as at some hotels.

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
A long weekend in NYC for my wife's birthday, and because mom has never been.
We chose the hotel based on location.
The staff was was extremely pleasant and helpful,  especially Adam & Anna.
The only negative I saw was the cramped space for breakfast and the busy elevators.
We would stay again for sure.

title: Excellent Experience
text: My boyfriend and I really enjoyed our stay here in the city. Our check in process with LiAnna was pleasant and efficient and we were so thankful that we could access our rooms earlier than the original check in time. Until we could check in, we left our luggage with Adam. Both his and LiAnna’s delightful personality contributed to our awesome experience. The rooms were very clean and cozy, the beds were so comfortable, and the complementary breakfast was delicious. The location was excellent for us because it was within short walking distance to all the places we needed to go (e.g. NY Penn station, Radio city music hall and Rockefeller center). I would definitely recommend and would stay here again!

title: Great Location
text:
Convenient location, comfortable rooms, great staff. Complimentary breakfast that has a broad selection, our go to spot for NYC stays.

Adam is the best Bellhop in the city, if you need anything, ask him!

title: Amazing location is second to the amazing service that Adam & LiAnnia provided. Definitely assets to this hotel!
text: Do yourselves a favor and stay here. Amazing from start to finish. Arrived prior to check-in and Adam was awesome. Beyond accommodating and talk about a positive attitude! Well done Adam. Hopefully the Corporate office sees the potential you have and promote you to the level you deserve. LiAnnia was also super helpful and kind. Kindness is rare these days, especially in NYC. Well done Embassy Suites with these two. Well done. Hopefully you have plans for them. I will definitely book here every year when visiting Manhattan!

title: Viaje en familia a NYC
text:
Excelente ubicación, muy cerca del Empire State Building, Times Square,… Macys.
El hotel es muy agradable para ir en familia. Las habitaciones con todo tipo de facilidades para estar cómodo, microondas, tabla de plancha,.. 
nosotros estuvimos en dos habitaciones conectadas y perfecto.
Es un concepto muy agradable en la entrada con sitios para sentarse y planificar el día.
El personal, de 10!! Muy agradable y dispuesto a ayudar en todo

title: Buena experiencia
text: Han sido unos dias muy buenos en este hotel, ha habido algun problemilla con el tema de que no reponian papel de vater pero en general todo el servicio muy atento y amable. Sobretodo la recepcionista Davely que nos ha atendido excelentemente en todo momento.

title: Business/pleasure
text:
Overall, a good experience. The staff was warm and friendly and good to work with.
LuAnna was particularly helpful during our check in!! Gave us great information and helpful with area and how to access transportation better.

Restaurant was good, however the server failed to write down the order and it came out, as one would expect, incorrect.  This was the only real negative.  Breakfast and hotel hosted happy hour was good, a bit crowded, but good.

title: Being in NY, not a good hotel Experience
text: I always stay at a Hilton Hotel when traveling, especially at an Embassy. Our favorite hotel by far. But this hotel Experience was not good at all. The pullout couch was not comfortable, way to springy, hurt our g-kids, very noisy at night. Had to keep calling to bring towels, asked for 3 pillows for the g-kids but could only get 2. This was a family vacation, I paid for 2 rooms. There were no night meals, just finger veggies. No bacon in the morning breakfast. Very small dining room had to eat in the room. I raved about the Embassy and was very disappointed. Family was not impressed. I was charged $442 a night 2x for 8 days 7 night. Not worth it. I will not be staying at this hotel again. For this being in NY, it was disappointing. I would like my money back.

title: Stay Elsewhere!
text: We were assigned room 1909 that was not prepared for any guest expecting the basic necessities of any hotel. We were then reassigned to room 1209. Trying to get in touch with guest relations with the hotel room phone was not possible with no one answering our calls for help at many times. Strongly recommend staying elsewhere. Not a typically run Hilton property. Manager never responded to our complaint. Assistant manager just sent usual form letter of apology.

title: Pick Another Hotel Now
text:
We had many issues on this trip. I spent most of my trip wishing I had booked at any of the other choices we had. Everyday we had unpleasant surprises awaiting us when we returned in the afternoon. 
I have never had a worse hotel experience from Embassy. You have really bad problems at this location. Communication to guest is laced with lies, the communication between departments is poor, the accommodations are not good, and it seems there is no general management overseeing the hotel. What is it with the pile of luggage in the bar throughout the day? Why do they just pass off their shortages of supplies as normal? If there are problems, address them, but reading the reviews of the hotel reveals hundreds of unsatisfied guests in just the past few months. I SHOULD HAVE READ THE REVIEWS AND MOVED ON but I was relying upon it being and Embassy property. Now I suspect the Embassy properties and will think twice before putting myself through it again. 
The price was ridiculous for the service provided. I feel we were really taken advantage of. If I wanted to have maintenance issues and no services I would have stayed at a much less costly property.

title: Fast Check In!
text: Lianna checked me in quickly, and  was able to find an available room, even though I was early! Wonderfull suprise after traveling that day. The complimentary receiption was a great way to start my 1st night in Manhatten

title: “The WOW Factor”
text:
I called this evening and was lucky enough to speak to LIANA. I had a few questions in regards to my upcoming reservation. She was very professional, cheerful and especially eager to answer all of my questions. 
She made sure everything on our reservation was set and that I had nothing to worry about. I told her it was going to be our first time visiting New York and that I really appreciated her help! Without even asking, she offered great places to eat and drink that she personally frequents. Liana also gave me tips on shows, transportation and apps that would help us make the most of our time. It was almost as if I was speaking to the hotel concierge. 
Thank you very much for making me feel like a valued customer!!!

title: Wonderful experience
text: Will definitely stay here again!  Not only is hotel in great location, it is lovely and kept updated. But one of the best things is that every single person I had contact with was friendly and accommodating. Wish I knew all their names but I only know Adam, who went out of his way and was extremely personable.  So great staff!!!  Breakfast was awesome.

title: Fantastic hotel - Delicious breakfast and kind staff!
text: My son and I stayed here in December 2022 and we loved it. We travel a lot and I was impressed by this hotel. Great reception in the evenings, a beautiful made to order omelette breakfast, a safe environment, close enough to everything but still quiet in the evenings - it was a perfect experience. Special thank you to Adam, Leticia, and Carli for going above and beyond. We appreciate all that you do and this is an excellent hotel!

title: Hotel stay in New York
text: Hotel was in a great location. Adam was extremely helpful and kind.  Remembered us every time we came into the hotel and remembered what we asked for.  He was fantastic!!!!! Would recommend going to see him.

title: Great hotel in a fantastic location
text:
Had a great stay at Embassy Suites Times Square. Room was spotless on arrival and the staff were always professional and polite. Location is great also. Would highly recommend the hotel to anyone looking to stay in the area. 

Special thanks to the concierge Adam who was super friendly and helpful.

title: Fantastic staff and location!
text: Raheema really helped me out in a pinch. She is absolutely fantastic and I really appreciate all the time and effort she put into accommodating me and making me feel welcome! Her and the rest of the staff are absolutely fantastic. I highly recommend staying here, they will treat you like family!

title: A hotel to pass on
text:
No hot water

Food not ready at the start of breakfast time

Staff not interested in solving issues.

Expensive for a low-scale operation.

Suggest Folks pass until the Management gets the problems addressed

title: Nice hotel option for families in NYC
text: My husband and I brought our 2 daughters (ages 6 & 4) to NYC for Thanksgiving weekend to see the holiday lights. I'm a Hilton Honors Diamond member and we were upgraded to a room on the 23rd floor which was a nice touch. Additionally, we booked a second room for the grandparents to join us. The hotel feels modern/recently renovated and clean. The rooms were very small but typical of NYC. I appreciated the comfortable mattress but wish the room had 2 double beds but they seem to only have 1 king bed available. The breakfast the first morning was good with waffles, made-to-order omelettes, and fruits and breads but on Sunday morning, there were fewer options. The evening reception was a nice touch. All of the staff were friendly and Li-Anna at the front desk was by far the most helpful and personable. Overall, I would recommend this hotel as a good hotel that's centrally located and family friendly. The only con is that there are more elevators needed for such a large hotel--on Sunday morning we waited 30 minutes for an elevator to go to breakfast. Would definitely return on a future NYC trip.

title: Excellent Location - Nice Hotel
text:
I will stay their again when in Manhattan, close to the train stations (Penn & Grand Central) and all subway lines. Adam the lobby host is the best. The $25 a day extra fee I could of done without bot otherwise a nice place to stay. My room was a corner room (3909) on the 39th floor, what a view of the Empire State Building, Macy's, 
 and One World Trade, the view is south and east. Watched part of the Macy's Thanksgiving Parade from the room. They have a sitting area about the lobby outside the exercise/workout room overlooking 37th & 6th (nice place to sit outside to have a drink and people watch.

title: Exceeding Expectations
text: Check-in was a breeze and LiAnna provided a great overview of the hotel and its amenities. The studio room matched the description perfectly and it was in great shape. Overall the hotel is exceeding expectations.

title: LiAnna  was very helpful
text: Checking in the young lady that checked us in (LiAnna) went out of her way to make sure  we understood where everything was and the times the breakfast was served. She made us feel welcomed. First time staying in the hotel.

title: Great hotel
text: Everything was awesome.  Great continental breakfast and happy hour each day.  Adam was an amazing attendant at the front and very helpful with our bags.  Great location to all the major attractions and restaurants. Make sure and be back for the 5 pm happy hour.  The strawberry mojitos were great! We’ll done!

title: FYI, if using points or a free night
text:
FYI..  I recently planned a trip to NYC using a combination of points and a free night.  I checked in digitally the day before, however the morning of departure I was sick and unable to travel.  I contacted the hotel expecting to be penalized one night (according to their website a cancellation must be made the day before arrival)  I was told that since I checked in digitally I could not cancel.  Hilton did refund one half of the points, but I was penalized a free night and points.  I do appreciate the refund, however, I will never check in digitally again unless I am on my way to the hotel..  
Since the opportunity to check in the day before is available, I think this should be disclosed.

title: Much better places to stay
text: Hotel needs of a major remodel. Rooms are tiny, closet located bathroom impossible to use. Wifi and TV did not work, upholstery in room was torn, the lounge is hilarious,  6 stools and mostly luggage storage. Breakfast location so tight, surprised it meets a fire code.

title: Mr  steve
text:
Excellent service from Kenny 
And latisha
Very accommodating and went beyond their call
Clean property and friendly staff
Excellent breakfast 
Clean 
Good and Clean gym
Happy hour good variety of snacks with drinks

title: A disappointing stay
text:
Being a Hilton Honors member I have stayed at many Hilton chain hotels and always experienced the expected level of service and stay experience.
This was my first and definitely last stay at the Embassy Suites.
On arrival, wifi did not work and it took 24 hours to work. No apologies, no support - just a rude acknowledgement that it is not working and will come back sometime.
I was shocked that we had to specifically ask if we wanted the room made up and fresh towels. I of course requested this and was told they would do it if they had time, I specified that it had to be done. After a long day out, returned to find that nothing had been done, i had to ask 3 times; in the end I got towels but no room service.
The attitude of the front desk staff was very unpleasant and unprofessional ( this improved on day 3)
The highlight was Adam, the concierge- what a pleasant, professional and caring person. He was happy, customer centric and the only person who cared.
Breakfast had its limitations also with a sign - no omlette due to lack of staff.
I really feel for the staff in the breakfast restaurant- there was not an air of happiness at all. Management at the hotel needs to step up and improve; until then, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Not so great of a hotel experience
text:
We were there for a 3 nights weekend anniversary. Check-in was somewhat smooth as they could not find our reservation at first but were able to find it after. Upon getting into our room 709, everything looked clean and proper. The big issue was our TV was not working. We phoned guest services and they sent in maintenance but couldn't fix it. Maintenance then said he could not fix it now but will tell guest services and maybe they can change us room. Guest service called and told us maintenance say it will take a bit longer to fix and they could do it the next day on Saturday or they could change us room but no longer had the room type we reserved. We had traveled all day friday and just settled into our room. We were too tired and just wanted to rest and as we were to spend the whole Saturday out visiting we said ok and they confirmed it would be fixed the next day. Imagine our surprise that after spending a whole day out on Saturday and getting back to our room around 8pm and wanting to unwind watching TV  to find the TV still not working. We complained again and they said they would come and check but never did. By the end of our stay on Sunday, the internet was no longer working. So considering the hotel name and for the price , one would expect to have working TV and internet; but no. This was disappointing. We spent most days out but early in the morning and late at night we would have enjoyed some TV time. They just never bothered just saying sorry for the inconvenience. My husband was not impressed by that and he is not a TV guy much. That just goes to show. This made for a not really enjoyable stay at the hotel.
On a plus side, location is great to everything we wanted to do. They had breakfast. But also had a cocktail evening around 5 which was welcomed as we were hungry after long day traveling and it was raining outside. Restaurant at the lobby was also a plus as we were too tired to go eat out after long day walking and visiting. Also the lady at the bar in the lobby was excellent. She added a plus in the hotel experience. I have stayed at other Hilton and never had such issue.  It was our first time staying in that hotel and can't say we will stay there again when we go back to visit.

title: Nice hotel...but one bartender for over forty floors of guests waiting for drinks
text: rather pricey but nice rooms, good business center, nice breakfast and dinner....would be a 5 but....each night you get two free drinks...hotel has over 40 floors of people and only one bartender...takes a minimum of half an hour on line to get your drinks....food cools while waiting..not on par with the rest of the hotel

title: Great staff
text:
We are diamond hilton members. We were using points but once we arrived we decided to upgrade to a spacious balcony room. It was amazing. 
We spent almost a week here. Everyone was very professional, helpful and friendly. 
(I don’t know how to spell her name. It was hyphenated. Lea or something was super great. )Arianne front desk was great. 
Winston at lounge was always welcoming. 
David and Sergio bar tenders were exceptional. 
And Mauricio!  Thank you. 
George (gosh I think that’s his name) services our AC. He was so nice and efficient  and fixed it immediately. 
Hassan, the manager-ish man- was super kind and helpful and checked on us several times. It was very nice. 

This hotel is great. We will stay here again.

title: Adam--the best!!!
text:
The rooms are small like most rooms in Manhattan, but they were clean.  Adam, the bellman, made our trip to NYC!  He was so helpful, kind, and generous!  I hope the management is aware of his professionalism and pleasant and helpful demeanor. 
 Breakfast was very busy.

title: Great location but not good for meetings
text: Hotel is located in a great location with close proximity to lots of restaurants & shopping. However, it is not exactly equipped for meetings as the available boardroom was not private, allowing staffs to walk in/out of the boardroom when meetings were on. Rooms were clean and nice but if you are a light sleeper, you will easily be woken by the slamming door and chats along the corridor outside the non soundproof entrance/exit door.

title: 5+ stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️🌟
text: The hotel was very clean, the staff was amazing, the breakfast was delicious and our room had a beautiful, up-close view of the Empire State Building. We could not have asked for more. The entire staff was great, but Adam went above and beyond. He made sure we had everything we needed and provided excellent dining suggestions. 5-stars aren’t enough. We will be back!

title: Passate Avanti......
text:
Iniziamo dalla cosa migliore....  La Posizione (STOP)
Hotel Vecchio..... la nostra camera era molto rumorosa, sembrava stare su un aereo  e non si capiva da dove venisse il rumore, inizialmente pensavo fossero gli ascensori ma non erano loro..  poi malauguratamente dovevi accendere il condizzionatore era un concertino di rumori...Poi al nostro arrivo abbiamo dovuto fare noi il 3 letto (che usciva dal divano, anzi dopo che eravamo entrati in Camera ci hanno portato le Lenzuola  e NOI abbiamo dovuto fare il letto.. neanche in un B&B si vedono cose del genere...  pulizia non ne parliamo ( a parte che si deve prenotare il giorno prima) a noi doveva fare solo il bagno perché il letto lo facevamo noi il letto del divano lo chiudavamo noi... quindi c'era solo il bagno da fare, secondo me la signora se lo guardava..   comunque....
Colazione poverissima ( nenche un cappuccino facevano) Caffe Americano succo di arancia e c'erta roba rossa tipo colluttorio... Un giorno e' mancata l'acqua calda  sono sceso in reception perche non abbiamo potuto fare la doccio, un'altro po' volenano avere pure ragione.... CILIEGINA sulla Torta: (questa e' bella ascoltate):
Dopo aver pagato le notti + le tassa ci hanno addebbitato altre 300 $ di Tasse (dove Booking non le segnalava...   hanno detto che erano tassa locali...  vabbè una sola.
Pero' in compenso facevano l'happy hour.. dalle 17 alle 18.30  2 drink (innaffiati di ghiaccio) scusate ma uno mica alle 17 sta in hotel...??? io mi sono trovato per caso nel lasciare delle buste in camera. Morale della favola..  questa mia recensione vuole aitare a chi magari deve andare a New York....  state lontani da questo Hotel. Ce ne sono un miliardo migliori... Stanze minuscole, non so come diconono che sono 30 metri quadrati... forse misurano anche gli armadietti.

saluti

title: Bad Return Visit
text: I have stayed here before and had a good experience, but this time was the opposite. I had to call about the air in the room 3x, the maid didn’t really clean the room and kept forgetting stuff, etc, the breakfast was in a hot and crowded and disgustingly dirty room, and the front desk staff didn’t care. When I checked in I was told i had a $25 daily credit and when I checked out the charges were on my bill! So sleazy and the front desk guy was so rude! Will never stay here again and you shouldn’t either. Sleazy all around,

title: Very small rooms but pleasantly quiet
text: Our stay here has been satisfactory. It’s clean and room service was great. Everything is accounted for and we enjoyed the central location. The top issue was how small the rooms are. We had paid for one of the biggest rooms on offer up on the very top floors with floor to ceiling windows and it was only the size of our son’s bedroom at home. The king bed was comfortable but fit in very snuggly, and it meant you pretty much could not make any use of the full length mirror because you couldn’t stand in front of it.. The ironing board and iron did not work well. Iron board is bent and too unstable to use. Iron heat was unreliable.

title: Centralt bra boende!
text:
Bra boende centralt på Manhattan nära Madison Square Garden och Macys. Extra plus att frukost ingår och den var helt okej. Lite trångt i frukostmatsalen var det enda att anmärka på. Helt okej rum med sköna sängar!
Tyst även om man verkligen bor mitt i stan

title: Family left with no accom and no help from Hilton ot booking.com. Both still not helping
text:
Hi

Last Wednesday my wife 14 yo son and I set off to New York heading for Hilton's Embassy Suites. We had booked this through booking.com. The booking was guaranteed with my Halifax credit card.

I e mailed the hotel saying I would be there around 17.00. 

The check in was 16.00. We got to New York at 15.30. There was a text from Halifax saying my card had been declined text back yes if you want this to go through and get them to try again. Being that it was before check in I thought it would be fine so I text back yes and rang the hotel.

They told me they had cancelled the booking. I ask could they not rebook it. No but they could put me in one of the other Hilton's at nearly 3 times the cost of my original booking. I said no.

So I got in touch with booking.com hoping as I booked through them they would not be able to help. I was in a mad panic by now. In New York with my wife and son. Booking.com reassured me they would sort things. After about 60 mins on hold they said sorry the room have gone. We could booked these other rooms. I said would that be at the same price I booked originally as it was not my fault. No they said you'll have to go onto the website and book yourself. 

We did this and we booked a Hilton Doubletrees in the hope that using the same companies then maybe it would be easier to deal with them hoping either one would have the compassion to refund us the difference.

Thus so far neither have. To add insult to injury Hilton Doubletrees put a hold of $800 more than what we got quoted by booking.com and Embassy Suites to payment for the first night. We sorted that but but after the day we had then that was the last thing we needed.

title: Muy bueno
text: Estuve con mi familia en setiembre , muy buena ubicacion,  muy buena atencion del personal,como tambien el desayuno  y el Happy hour  La unica queja y por eso no le pongo excelente es que paso mas de un mes y no devolvieron el deposito de la tarjeta, cuando en otros hoteles lo hicieron rapidisimo

title: Recensione non positiva, non tornerei qui
text:
Ottima posizione ( l’unica cosa) . MI. ASPETTAVO QUALCOSA DI PIÙ’ DA UN HILTON MANCA UN  DIRETTORE Prenotato una suite per 3 persone .( le suite in genere sono diverse)La terza persona dormiva in un divano letto ( di vecchia data) appena arrivati ci hanno fornito UN SOLO LENZUOLO x fare il letto , ABBIAMO DOVUTO CHIEDERE IL LENZUOLO  SOTTO XCHE’ NON LO FORNIVANOIn una settimana MAI hanno rifatto il letto singolo, MANCAVANO SEMPRE LE SALVIETTE  per la terza persona. NON SI RIUSCIVA A SPEGNERE L’ARIA CONDIZIONATA QUINDI CAMERA SEMPRE GELIDA, LO SCIACQUONE SI INCANTAVA E CONTINUAVA A SCORRERE L’ACQUA. VENERDÌ SI SONO DIMENTICATI DI FARE TUTTA LA CAMERA ( quindi letto matrimoniale, letto singolo , bagno). Fatto le foto  x le mie dimostranze Luogo colazione : ambiente piccolo x la quantità’ di persone presenti nell’Hotel a rischio covid. Infatti non posso dimostrarlo , ho sempre tenuto la mascherina tranne quando facevo la colazione ed ho preso il covid.Prenotato tramite Booking , chiesto visto i disagi avuti nella settimana un po’ sconto , la nostra recensione fatta non e’ stata pubblicata su booking.
Personale contrariamente ad altri hotel non ci dato alcuna informazione sulla città’ , piantina, consigli

title: Go elsewhere. Please!!!
text: Nice LITTLE room. Good location. Other than that a complete shambles. No finesse. No atmosphere.   Not a clue how to run a hotel. The happy hour is a joke. Still got to experience breakfast. Here’s hoping!! Normally I don’t leave a review until I’ve left the establishment, but had to let people know how poor this place is ASAP.

title: Beautiful hotel with amazing amenities and customer service!
text: Upon arrival, the room was beautiful, clean, and spacious. Celebrating an anniversary, the hotel had a variety of programs and events complementary to guests such as breakfast, the sundown reception, and the outdoor cinema! Overall, a great experience, and would highly recommend it!

title: Good location but cramped room
text: This hotel is in a good location. Easy walk from Grand Central. If you check in early using the mobile app on your phone, you can even choose yorur room. We picked a corner thinking it might have more square footage...I don't think it did. The room was quiet which is rare in many hotels, breakfast very good with lots of choices and gluten free bread availabel if you ask. Check in was easy and front desk helpful. We were 2 adults and 1 child. We had a king bed and a sofa bed. The room was very small and cramped, with every usable space accounted for. The bathroom was good, had a great shower. King bed was comfortable, but I cannot say the same for the sofa bed. It was fine for a child ,but maybe not for 2 adults.

title: Value. Comfort. Convenience.  Wonderful breakfast and staff.
text:
This is a WONDERFUL hotel.  I cannot say enough things to describe how happy we are with the experience.  This place is packed with value and comfort.  

But let me give you a few reasons: 

1.  The location is fantastic in mid-town near Macy’s and the Empire State Building.  

2. The breakfast is wonderful for a hotel, especially one included in the rate.  The  selection is huge, with fruit, scrambled eggs, meat, breads and all the fluffy omelets you want. (My only “complaint” is that the rooms they serve the breakfast in are very crowded.  So get there early to get a table!).  

3. The staff are amazing. I travel monthly and I was amazed  at how the staff were so  welcoming, happy  and very flexible.  They let us check in early when we got there at 9 am and gave us a free upgrade on the top floor.  They even greeted me with 2 bottled waters for being in their loyalty program. (And I have  only level 1 status.)

4. The rooms are pretty big for NYC, especially at this price point.  The furniture is pretty good. 

Bottom line - Many hotels these days are short staffed and their quality has vastly diminished. (I have overpaid for 4 and 5 star hotels 3 times in Miami, Nashville and Savannah in the last 10 mos. They  have all been disappointing/underwhelming compared to their massive cost.)

I am new to Hilton brand. (Always been a Marriott girl.)  But I am profoundly happy and already got the Hilton branded credit card. I will be staying at more of them in the future.

title: Nice location
text: Nice location. Adam salvaged my stay. I would give it another try because if Adam. Front desk was good as well. I had a slow drain in the bathroom and it was resolved in a timely manner. The bar staff, however, wasn’t very accommodating.

title: If you stay here you should lower your expectations
text:
OK. Let’s get the good part about this place taken care of upfront.  All the staff was wonderful. Never had any issues with any of them. 
Check in was a challenge as there was only one poor guy trying to take care of everything. 
If you stay there and expect to have a nice room by reserving a suite, better lower your expectation. Yeah, it was clean, but it’s cramped and pretty basic. Small, but I know in NYC that’s pretty normal. 
If you stay there and plan on having a nice dinner with a cocktail, stay away. Doesn’t exist. There’s a bar in the lobby that is also used to stage peoples luggage. Noisy and tiny. Then they have something on the third floor that makes McDonald’s look upscale. Different bartenders each night and not sure what they are doing or making. Order something to eat off the menu (ha) and between the language barrier and understanding, don’t plan on getting what you ordered. Take it anyway as it could be a long time before you will see what you ordered. You will still get changed for the wrong order. Meanwhile you have to deal with the throngs of people going in and out of this tiny space as they make their way to free movies outside. Noisy, cold, bench seats.  For all of that you get to pay a premium for very mediocre food. I know, it’s NYC, but come on folks….  Again, the staff were wonderful. 
The complimentary breakfast was good, but you had to fight for a table and share it with other people. Complimentary cocktails were interesting. Limited choices with only one poor bartender who was working her butt off. Crowded room and struggle to find a place to sit. 
Being a Hilton Honors member didn’t mean anything. 
My advice…..Keep looking.

title: A 2-star hotel with a 5-star price
text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights recently, and it was very underwhelming to say the least. It is not what you expect from an Embassy Hilton or any property managed by Hilton group. First off, the rooms are tiny, even compared to a room in other NYC hotels that are similarly priced. Front entrance is cramped. In addition, they had Very poor customer service. The front desk workers are young  and don’t seem to have much experience nor care about the customers. I paid for two rooms , and we were initially placed in the wrong room. I complained and asked to be switched to another room, which they denied. We also asked the front desk and manager SEVERAL TIMES to clean our rooms, but they never came by. They never replaced our towels, so I had to call several times just to get some new towels after our second day there, and they NEVER cleaned the room! How disgusting. We complained about the terrible service and got no where. We could’ve had a better experience staying at a VRBO or even at the Marriot Marquis (similarly priced). We paid around 450-500/night for each room, and this felt like staying at a 2-star hotel. Please do not stay here unless you like wasting money and feeling like garbage.

title: Ferien
text:
Tolle Lage wir hatten eine super Aussicht aus dem 34 Stock, leider war der Empfang nicht so freundlich und sie geben keine Information ab, dass man um 17:00 bis 18:30 gratis etwas trinken kann. 
Ansonsten war der Service gut und unser Zimmer täglich gemacht.

title: Rateros
text:
Después de no poder embarcar en nuestro vuelo,contacté con ellos para exponerles el problema,el cual obviaron y me cargaron una noche sin haberla disfrutado.
Booking intentó mediar pero no sirvió de nada, sólo ven el dinero..
Opten por hoteles que puedan arreglar tus problemas ,y sean comprensibles y cercanos.

title: Oasis in Manhattan
text: Just off busyness of 6th avenue is oasis of Embassy Suites. In NYC where space is limited and extras rare, this hotel felt like a boutique hotel - with welcoming staff, room with sitting area, complimentary breakfast and evening reception.

title: We would recommend this hotel
text:
We had a great experience, no problems with the room.  We asked questions at the desk for suggestions on where to eat , which way to go , etc… and we always had very friendly people helping us like Laura and Adam .. Super friendly and helpful.. we just didn’t like the bartender not sure if he just didn’t like us.. but it didn’t ruin our amazing experience.. 
We give it 5 stars

title: AVOID AVOID AVOID
text:
I came here for a business trip and it has to be one of the worst experiences I've ever experienced. I should have known problems were ahead when I tried to get into my room and the card reader on the door was broken. I didn't notice this after checking in due to back-to-back meetings and crashing but the room toilet and sink were broken. When I woke up the next morning I called to have it fixed and left for another round of conferences. I came back at around 11PM with nothing fixed. When I called down, it took two calls down to the front desk because no one answered. Once they finally answered they said, "our 'engineer' had left for the day". I don't know what they would do in a real emergency if they don't have someone around the clock since the 'engineer' fixed my door to get in. I requested a plunger to fix the problem myself which came an hour or so later (after midnight).

If you want a thin wall room that you have to conduct maintenance on then this is for you. I will never stay in another again. This situation was made 10x worse as I had to travel up and down on crutches trying to resolve these issues. For ~$600 a night, much higher expectations were expected.

title: Overall Excellent Stay
text:
I was a little nervous about our stay here - as some of the reviews (especially regarding breakfast) were a little sketchy.  
I don't know what these people are complaining about!

Lovely clean rooms, with a GIANT bed.  I know its not the biggest room in the world - but I don't know what you expect in Manhattan. 

The water pressure in the shower could be a bit stronger - but that is me being pretty picky. 

The location was excellent - only a few minute walk to Times Square/ Madison Square Gardens/Empire State and even closer to the closest subway stop. 

There was loads of choice at breakfast.  Yes you might have to wait a little for your omelette - but that is hardly a hardship. 

I didn't fully understand the resort credit deal - and if I am honest feels like a scam!

That being said - I will definitely stay here again. 

Thanks for a great trip

title: Short but sweet
text:
Great service from ADAM and honestly, most handsome!  friendly and most informative! Shout out to Lobby staff as well, however I cant recall all there names! Annabel  from custodial services was lovely too! 
Had a great time. See ya New York! If your ever in Chicago look me up! 

Sincerely,  
Susan Mellema

title: caution...
text:
re: embassy suites Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square

I went to the skylawn rooftop at 9:35 pm EST on 9/13/2022 and the rooftop was closed, although it should be open till 11 pm EST. I asked the bartender what are the hours of operation, and he rudely replied "its closed" (not my question). 

I asked him again and he repeated the same. Some other employees were leaving and he said "ask them". And I did ask them and they said "check the website". 

This is the not the level of service I expect when I spend $700/night for 4 nights. I am writing my first days experience, I wonder what else is in store...

title: Had a overall good stay
text:
First off  I have read so many posts prior to staying at this location and knew that the rooms would be small. In fact you cannot book 4 in a room on Hilton’s site , it only allows 3. I had called the hotel and you can indeed have 4 in the room but you need to know that 2 will be sleeping on a pull out couch sofa and 2 in the king bed. 

I wanted to add this on my trip report since no one had commented about allowing four to a room in all the reviews that I had read. I thought this would be helpful for families .

We were travelling with two teens and they were OK with this idea since we were doing so much sightseeing -it was a place to crash. It worked out perfectly there was plenty of space for the four of us.
 As other posters said they do give service towels and toiletries for two to a room,you have to request more . When we did make the phone call to the front desk immediately Concierge came up with services .(towels , soaps , tv converter repairs) 

We always stay at Embassy suites on travels as we love the full  breakfast(omelette bar )  and happy hours. 

Happy hour was defiantly lacking . 
Day 1 brownies and a spinach dip with natcho chips . The dip was not appealing and brownies and chips had to wait for as gone right away with the crowds .some people grabbing 6 at a time - they must of been really hungry :)

Every night only two drinks were allowed per person most embassy suites they have unlimited drinks for two hours not the case at this location.
Day 2 cheese, crackers and package shortbread cookies  2 drinks only.

Very tight to find any room to sit on the weekend once we hit Sunday and Monday things freed up. We then went on our way to sight see in the evening or dinner .

Let me get to the movie part on the upper deck , first off this is a offsite company that does this and you have to pay for the popcorn and your headphones definitely not worth it. Watch a movie in your room and relax . 
So we had Hilton honour points for 3 of our 4 evenings therefore we didn’t have to pay the $25 resort fee but Hilton honours paid for this portion so we were entitled to this for three evenings. 
We went to the rooftop patio where the movies were being played . I went to order a glass of wine and it was $19USD !!! $25 Canadian ! I said is this not for the two glasses of wine ? he replied nope it’s New York City.  So your $25 usd  Resort fee only covers a glass of wine so we opted for 2 beers and even that they give you 355ml cans and that’s your $25 gone  ! Biggest rip off 

Or you can let your kids have a grand time in the pantry area and buy snacks! One little bag of chips that you get maybe eight in bag is $7 . Frozen lemonade $7 
At least you can buy something with your $25 resort fee but it sure doesn’t get you much.
Breakfast 
When you come in there’s a table that you have to fill out your form what you would like in your omelet . You then go to the kitchen area and drop off the form. We waited the first day 40 minutes and they still had another 20 minutes to get to our omelet so we cancelled our order. Sunday I was able to get the omelet and the cook was fantastic ,very friendly and funny. 
Repeat like other guests say it’s  hard to find seating and then lack of staff trying their  best to be able to clean quick for the next customers, The morning staff were fantastic very friendly and tried their best. 
One of 4 days had bacon the others were Turkey or pork sausages. Overall breakfast was nice to get you on your way for sightseeing. 
Front lobby was very inviting clean modern complimentary water infused with lemons.
The rooms were compact but had a small fridge , microwave with a dishwasher. 2 tvs. 

The washroom was roomy and the water pressure was fantastic. 

It was a quick walk to Macy’s , central on train station , Times Square, library , and so much more .
If we returned to NYC We will stay again at this property.
Thank you to all your staff for our enjoyable family trip

title: Great experience
text: Super clean and very nice amenities. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. Loved the $25/ day voucher and food and drinks were excellent. Within walking distance of Times Square. Highly recommend!

title: Great Location - Service and Overall Hote
text: Great location - Clean and Friendly staff - seamless checkin and check out. Will surely be back - only reason I gave four stars is the elevators while they had 3 - it’s seemed each time we went to use they would take much longer than traditional hotels. May be me however they were not moving g as quickly as I would expect. However would highly recommend you check out this hotel.

title: Not a great experience
text:
I am a Hilton Diamond member for over 15 years. 

Checked in at hotel and booked 2 rooms, as we had 2 kids and 2 adults travelling, we got to hotel and they had one on the 21st floor and one on 17th floor, I asked if we could get 2 on the same floor and was told NO, we even checked in before 4pm which was the official check in time and I asked if we could wait for 1 room to be ready later and again told NO as everyone has checked us which I knew was u true as check in time was 1hr later. 

The person who checked me in was rude and unprofessional and I was shocked as would not expect that from any Hilton properties. 

We then went to evening reception and to get a seat was near impossible, the only food they had was Corn chips and chopped up cookies. I have been to other Embassy Suites and they are a lot better in food and drink, also they give you 2 coupons for drinks. 

Next morning breakfast food was cold, selection was ok ran out of apple juice and sausages was cold. Also all smoke detectors on the 4th floor were all covered up and I would think that’s against Fire safety in the US. 

I also asked for a late check out as a long flight and was told to 2pm and if I wanted any longer will cost me $100, what a way to look after Loyal members especially as I have stayed at Hilton ls over 120 days this year and the hotel was not full that night and to charge an extra $100 is an insult. 

If you can stay at another property I probably would and I am not recommending this to anyone I know at all.

title: Very frustrating experience
text:
As a Diamond member, we check I at 12:30. Check in is technically not until 4. We wondered and came back. Even after 4 the rooms were not ready and they ended up picking different rooms.  Why didn't they just do that at 3 of earlier?  Went to breakfast at 7am. Sausage was cold, oatmeal was nothing but water, no one available to make an omelet, and eggs so runny they would gag a bussard.  Ridiculously long elevator waits no matter the time of day, but especially in the morning and in the evenings.  Only 2 towels per room and no shampoo.  They were supposed to clean our room every other day, but only cleaned it once and then after calling for fresh towels, they came a second time to clean it at 7 pm.  The shower door was not installed correctly, so the doors wouldn't stay closed and water got all over the floor.  Definitely do not recommend. 
Do yourself a favor and stay at the Doubletree or some where else for the same price or less.  One good note, the bellmaen were very kind and helpful.

title: Albergo brutto e personale poco trasparente.
text:
Albergo abbastanza vecchio nonostante il prezzo non sia popolare, in camera abbiamo dovuto preparare il divano letto perché era chiuso, inoltre il lavabo non scaricava l’acqua perché era otturato.

Il giudizio fortemente negativo è dovuto al fatto che ho richiesto un taxi per mia figlia verso l’aeroporto, e le hanno rifilato un transfer che è costato 120$ anziché il flat rate di 53$ di un cab.

Ovviamente il responsabile l’ha fatto evidentemente per prendere una commissione sulla corsa, si è scusato dicendo che non ci eravamo compresi e che avrebbe chiamato la compagnia per farmi ridare indietro 24$.
Mi sono rivolto alla reception, mi hanno ascoltato in silenzio, scriverò in direzione.

Non è un servizio degno di Hilton.

title: Embassy Suites Manhattan
text:
Staff at front desk is very good and helpful. Concierge Adam is excellent, knows the city and is a great resource for restaurants, attractions and general how to’s. 
The rooms are not large and ours was a little time worn, clean but needs a  makeover. View from 30th floor was great. 
The free breakfast is very good, the venue is crowded and a little crazy but the food is good.

title: Family trip to NYC
text: We booked a family trip to NYC in July to see all of the sites and wanted something that provided a little more room and that was centrally located near Times Square.  Like most NY hotel rooms, this "suite" was tiny but was fine for myself, husband and 11 yr old.  Breakfast was chaotic and there is not enough space for everyone to sit so we only attempted it once and skipped the rest of the days we were there.  We did the managers reception once which was not as crazy. Location is great, just a few blocks from everything.  If I were to stay again, would love to book one of the balcony suites which were booked for our stay.

title: Hôtel bien situé mais pour le reste à éviter
text: Hotel assez bien situé proche d’une station de métro. Le check in est particulièrement tardif à 16h. Pour avoir un ascenseur il faut parfois attendre 10 minutes. Le petit déjeuner est de qualité très médiocre la propreté globalement dans les chambres et particulièrement la salle de bain est dans la salle de restaurant laisse vraiment à désirer avec un sol qui colle sous les chaussures. Le rapport qualité prix est vraiment pas à la hauteur d’un quatre-étoiles j’éviterai à l’avenir

title: Not the Embassy Suites experience we were expecting
text:
Our stay at this location was...okay... but we were expecting better.  It felt like we were staying at a low budget version of Embassy Suites.
The positive: The staff was friendly (especially Adam), the location is good and the breakfast was good.  
The negative:  They have cheapened all the things that make staying at Embassy Suites pleasant, such as:
-The rooms are small.
-You have to request room service.  They did not tell us this at check-in.   I cannot believe any decent hotel would put this policy in place.  Nothing more disappointing than coming back to your room after walking around 10 hours in a heat wave to find out that you have no clean towels etc. 
-They are cheap with amenities.  Only two bath towels per room.  If you have a third person in your room, you have to call and ask for a third towel and sheets for the pullout bed.  Why don't they automatically send up necessary items for a third guest when you check in?  We had two rooms for 3 nights, and received two small soaps (one for sink, one for shower) and one small bottle of shampoo and conditioner.  They did not replace these items, even when room service finally showed  up.  We were showering with slivers of soap, and ran out of shampoo.  We also ran out of toilet paper and Kleenex, and had to call to have some sent up.   
-This location's manager's reception is the saddest I've seen.  The snacks were wiped out when we got there, and they give each guest two coupons for a drink.
