We were yelled at by the hostess because there was nowhere to sit and we tried to bring our drinks to our room.  All the other locations we've been to have an open bar, and a fun relaxing atmosphere.  The fun vibe was definitely missing here.
-Our key cards stopped working twice.  This is not the biggest thing, but was yet another frustration we didn't need.
-You should also be aware that this hotel charges a $25 Urban destination charge, which is really just a thinly veiled attempt to gouge you for more money.  You can spend it in the hotel, but you have to spend it each day or you lose it.  They won't tell you this at check-in, probably hoping that you do not use it.
Overall this is an ok hotel, but it could be so much better with a little effort.

title: Horrible experience
text:
Hands down the worse Embassy suites I have ever stayed at. Everything went wrong. Check in took forever, even though, we checked in at 11pm with no other customers around, yet somehow the front desk found a way to take over 30 minutes.

We got to the room, and even though the room was small, it is not much smaller than other hotels in the area, the problem was that half the lights didn’t work, none of the outlets work, the toilet didn’t flush properly and the tv didn’t work, we were tired and just when to sleep.

The next morning, while my wife was taking a shower, the sliding bathroom door got stuck and wouldn’t open. I tried to force it open, but didn’t want to push it too hard, I called front desk and it took more than 1 hour to get someone to open it for us. When we asked to change room, we got a dumb argument that only the manager could authorize the switch and the manager would not be in until 4pm.

We decided to go about our day and deal with it after coming back. When we came back the manager would not talk to us and instead one of the employees gave me new keys and told me to give the old one back. we got no apologies, no upgrades were offered, the room we got was not much better than the first one. Completely disappointed. 
Next time will stay at the Westin instead.

title: Family break in the heart of the city of NYC
text: The hotel is in the heart of the city. All attractions are very close by and a walking distance to so many attractions like brant park, Fifth avenue, times-square etc. The value for money was perfect. The rooms were spacious enough for a studio room. The beds and sofa beds were comfortable. The bathroom was good. Everything about the hotel is modern. Complimentary breakfast and complimentary evening snack was a bonus. All good. Service was great both at the restaurant and at the reception during check-in and check-out.

title: Great place
text: First time staying in Manhattan and this place was GREAT.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Within walking distance to many places but also close to subway station.  We felt very safe and the noise level was minimal.  Offers breakfast and nightly reception.

title: Excellent Hotel with Excellent Staff
text: Shout out first and foremost to Vanessa, who worked hard to get me an early check-in, and Steven, who endlessly provided "service with a smile" despite a busy NY week and endlessly packed lobby. It was obvious that the establishment is being affected by the labor shortage. Yet Vanessa, Steven, and the hotel staff magically projected an effortless sense of calm, expertise, and sincere service every time they faced their customers. Thank you for making a little slice of NY feel more like home.

title: Highly recommend
text: Great location, Adam, concierge was amazing and gave great recommendations, Michelle, front desk, so professional. Staff always had a smile on their face and eager to assist you.  This is a little gem of a hotel and so convenient location to times square, empire state. Definitely be back. Thank you

title: Only one might, but I'm coming back!
text: I'm always looking for great places to stay when I come to NYC for business. My stay was awesome. The staff was friendly and genuinely happy.  My Margherita Flatbread was delicious and my room was super clean.

title: Bad Trip turned around thanks to the Staff!
text:
Words cannot even describe the experience I had at this Embassy Suites. For starters, this is the perfect location to get around the city and I was lucky to have a wonder view of the city especially at night. The room was very clean and extremely comfortable for my needs. The very best part of my trip was the AMAZING staff! I unfortunately became ill during my trip in NY and was unable to make it back home and the staff was beyond accommodating and extremely helpful. The customer service I have received is the reason why I love staying at Hilton properties and with me being ill, they made my not so great trip that much better! I can go on and on about the service but experience it for yourself. 

A very special Thank you to Vanessa, Favian and Graciela for being patient, friendly and helpful during my stay while I was not my best. They are the perfect example of GREAT customer service which truthfully you don’t experience very much anymore in this day and age.

title: The very best of EVERYTHING
text: We stayed for two days prior to a cruise.  EXCELLENT location, room size, and made to order breakfast.  The staff was friendly and very accommodating.  Very good value for Manhattan.  Great location, we went to Little Italy, Battery Park and all the taxi rides were $30.  Good price again.  Easy access to Brooklyn Cruise Terminal.  Walking distance to restaurants as well as the heart of Times Square.  Next NYC trip we will stay here again.

title: Mixed Feelings
text: City hotel with small rooms are expected but the dead flies stuck on the ceiling wasn’t. Paid for upgrade and staff changed room to lesser valued one, feel a bit cheated. Made this known right after checkin and it room was not corrected. Lovely late evening staff and nice outdoor movie theatre. Location is convenient and short walk to Times Square.

title: Super Preis Leistungsverhältnis
text:
Das Hotel besticht durch seine Lage, super Service und ein kaum zu toppendes Preis- Leistungsverhältnis.
Unbedingt ein Zimmer mit Blick auf das Empire State Building buchen.
Frühstück ebenfalls super, es wird immer nachgefüllt!
Das Zimmer war sehr geräumig und sauber.

title: Buono
text:
Ottima posizione, vicina alla metropolitana e a pochi isolati da Times Square (raggiungibile anche a piedi). Il check-in indicato alle 16 (già tardi). Siamo arrivate 16.30 (dopo 9 ore di volo e 1 ora per arrivare in hotel) e la camera non era ancora pronta. Ci hanno fatto lasciare le valigie e tornare dopo più di 1 ora.
Al check-in ci hanno trattenuto dalla carta di credito 1000€  di caparra, verificate il vostro plafond prima di partire.
Camera sufficientemente grande e silenziosa.
Colazione varia, non eccellente ma buona.
Nel complesso vale la pena.

title: Great stay in the middle of it all!
text:
PLEASE NOTE... This is NOT your average Embassy Suites -- this hotel does not have the classic 2-room suites nor does it have a swimming pool

I knew this going into the situation. These hotel rooms are much like any other standard hotel room. We stayed in a King Size bedroom with a pullout bed. This worked fine. The room is a little cramped, but that is to be expected in the heart of New York City, where space is a premium.

This hotel is located a few blocks away from the Empire State Building as well as Time Square. There is parking, at a premium at I-Park located around the block and there is no valet service.

The hotel lobby is small, but adequate. This hotel does offer free breakfast faire -- each day we were there, the breakfast changed. One day there was pancakes and bacon, another day there were waffles and sausages. There still is the classic omelet bar, fresh fruit, cereals, danishes, etc

The hotel does have a solid "manager's reception" where drinks are free from 5 - 6:30 pm. It is also great that they have an outdoor space where they show movies! 

We visited the workout facility. Next to the workout facility is a balcony with chairs and a view right down West 37th Avenue.

It was a good stay. I wish the hotel had 2 rooms, such as the other Embassy Suites, but we still had two TVs, a standard bathroom and a GREAT view of the Empire State Building

title: Worst visit ever for a Hilton
text: People have reviewed this hotel and it’s not up to Hilton standards. First the room and hall ways and a smell to it like worst than trash. Second when I complained the wanted to give me 5000 rewards points which is not even close to a free stay at Hilton. The hotel would not even discuss this issue by giving a call back. Ruined  my Father’s Day trip to see the Yankees. Don’t stay at this hotel or you will be unhappy.

title: Good location needs work.
text: The rooms are small but it is NYC and most hotel rooms are small.  The happy hour is a joke.  Wine, beer (no mixed drinks), taco chips with some kind of awful spinach dip, popcorn and churros.  Breakfast was not much better.  The first morning we were there they had no eggs.  There is not much room for the clients to eat and the hotel didn't open up any more space.  It's the same room as for the happy hour.

title: Stay at Embassy Suites Times Square
text: I stayed here one night with my daughter, she wasn’t feeling well and staff was so kind to us. Special shout out to Adam, Laura and Gracela! They were so helpful with directions, baggage, you name it!

title: Nice hotel in a convenient location
text:
Great location.  Easy walk to MSG, subways, buses, etc.  We opted for an upper room with a view and had a nice view of the Empire State Building.  Movies on the patio was fun.  Breakfast area is ridiculously small but we managed to find a table each day.  Room is tiny, nothing suite about it, but we were aware of this beforehand.

Only complaint is that I left a couple shirts by accident in the tiny closet in the bathroom.  I discovered this about 4 days after we left while doing laundry.  Might not have been able to recover them, but very disappointing that I could not even get anyone to even return my multiple phone calls.

title: Great setting really small place!
text: This place is well located right close to everything! Easy to access and fairly priced it is a good option if you want close to the action but not too close! Our flight was delayed and they waited for us till 4 am! Its only really small to be an embassy suites!

title: Employees Incompetent or Do Not Care
text:
Is the staff incompetent or do they just do not care? I was in New York as my daughter graduated. I am disabled and I take special medication that must be kept at a specific temperature. I have special gel ice packs that I needed to be frozen before departing New York this morning. I gave them to the front desk staff last night and I was assured that they were to be put in the freezer overnight. This morning, I was given the special ice packs and they were not put in the freezer overnight! They were put in the refrigerator. The person just did not care. So today during my 800 mile journey, I had to stop every 2 hours to place fresh ice around my medication. This added 4 hours to my trip and I now had to stop overnight and stay at a hotel.  A waste of money. I really should be home tonight instead of a hotel.
Why don't your employees care? 
Furthermore, I am trying to load my car with luggage, yet you fill the sidewalk with laundry so I am unable to pull the luggage cart to my car. Why do you do that? Why do you make it impossible for your guests to load their cars?
My 3 night stay at your property has left me with such a bad experience that I do not know if I can stay with Hilton again.

title: Embassy Manhattan Great Location & Friendly Staff
text: Embassy Suite is located on W 37th & 6th Ave. Great location walking distance to Macy’s, Subway ( 34th Herald Square) Time Square is 42nd & 8th Ave. Front Desk staff very efficient, Doorman very helpful and pleasant!

title: A comfortable 9 days in NYC.
text: Stayed on choice of co-worker, my 2nd visit to Manhattan. Arrived late on a Friday night,  while busy check in was easy and professional.  My room 3117, was as I expected for NYC, not large,  yet I was also pleased it was bigger than expected abs included a fridge and bonus microwave. It was clean and well presented. For me the cooling was not  great I asked and it was fixed promptly the next day and was great all week. Notice said limited housekeeping though it was done more than I expected,  so missed leaving tip. Breakfast included was good with omelette made to order, some items  (waffles/pancakes) were average, yet overall for an included breakfast in NYC it is good.   Location is good, only short stroll to Times Square, metro subway, Macy's, Bryant Park  whole foods grocery. On 6th ave you will find  Main Noodle House, good Asian food. Microwave cane in handy to reheat.  Would I stay again  yes.

title: Pleasant stay at the perfect location
text: The location is very close to Bryant Park and Times Square, Broadway lively area and not as laud. The area is also good for shopping. The breakfast was free, and there is a free reception event every afternoon 5-6:30pm very you can get two free drinks (cocktails, wine or beer) and snacks. You can also order regular meal if you want (not free). The staff was pleasant and helpful. I had a king room with the coffee/tee available, empty refrigerator and a microwave. As Hilton Honor Gold member I also got $25 to spend every day on different areas (small shop or bars/restaurants).

title: Very nice
text: The location is perfect.  By NY standards the room was large. Anywhere else this would have been 2 separate rooms but it’s NY and they make it work. Staff friendly, everything was clean.  Again, location, location, location. Could walk to Herald Square and Times Square. Food options were many and felt safe day and night. Close enough to action but not seedy at all.

title: Pontos positivos X negativos
VERY small but great location
text: This property is VERY small to be in NYC. It’s the worse Embassy Suites we’ve ever stayed at. The food wasn’t even good not to mention the small dining area and three small elevators were a nightmare. The only good thing about this property is the location. You can walk to several attractions and there’s plenty to do and see

title: Slecht ontbijt en drama bij de liften
text:
Wel goede locatie, maar de liften kunnen het aantal gasten niet aan, de ontbijtzaal is heel onhandig opgezet en het ontbijt is ronduit slecht.
Geen broodbeleg, geen cruesli, geen verse yoghurt, geen lekker brood. 
De kamers zijn ok, maar worden maar om de dag schoongemaakt

title: Tenía buena opinión, pero me han cobrado lo que han querido.
text: Mi opinión es buena pero con un pero muy grande. Se me ha cargado en mi tarjeta un importe erróneo y no se dan a razones para devolvérmelo. Yo contraté una cosa por booking, confirme con el hotel que se me haría ese cargo, y en mitad de la estancia se me cargo otro importe superior diferente al acordado. Me dijeron que es una pre autorización que en 3/4 días me lo devolverían. Ha pasado más de un mes y no me lo han devuelto, me dicen que hablé con mi banco. También me dieron en el hotel dos tarjetas de dos responsables por si había problemas, les he mandado varios mails a cada uno, y no he obtenido respuesta. Es una pena porque me pareció un hotel perfecto, pero esto hace que me lleve mal sabor de boca. Ojalá recupere ese dinero y pueda cambiar mi opinión.

title: Unforgettable stay !
text:
We stayed for 7 nights in Embassy Suites in May and we loved the hotel for its good amenities, cleanliness and staff courtesy and had great room with best view ever and even better service.Our room was very clean, bed comfortable and fluffy pillows. 

 On arival Front desk provided bottled water and snacks to bring to our room .

 Hotel is close to Times Square and walking distance from many attractions like Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre, Madame Tussauds, and is also walkable from Grand Central Station. Breakfast options were very very  good !

The reception was wonderful. Staff were incredible to all guests welcoming them !

Free drinks and nibbles at the evening reception 5-7 pm .  I would definitely stay here again . 

This is a great value and good location !

title: Perfect Location, Amazing Rooms
text: This hotel is ideally placed for someone looking to experience NYC.  You're 3 blocks from the Empire State Building, and with easy subway access you can quickly be anywhere in Manhattan.  The rooms are on the small site (it's NYC after all), but were very well setup.  A large comfy bed, a small couch, 2 TV's, and a well equipped bathroom.  It was all immaculately clean, and the staff were super friendly.  My work takes me to NYC quite often, and I've found my home away from home.

title: No existe el aseo en este hotel
text:
No se realiza el aseo de las habitaciones salvo que uno lo
Solicite; esta situación se debería advertir antes de hacer la reserva y no enterarse cuando uno ya está en la recepción posterior a un largo viaje.
Cuando finalmente se hace el aseo es de pésima calidad, no se limpia el piso, no desocupan los basureros, no ordenan el sofá cama, etc.
Podrán observar que el piso de los pasillos está constantemente sucios.
Respecto al
Sofá cama que hay en la habitación; solo sirve como sofá, no como cama;
Imposible que un adulto duerma en ella.
No deberían ofrecerlo.

title: Good location but poor value for money
text:
Really below average for a Hilton hotel and very expensive for our the service.

The good:
- good breakfast 
- good location 

The bad:
- first room wasn’t cleaned 

- second room shower didn’t work properly. Reception wouldn’t change the room despite me showing a video until maintenance looked to see if they can improve water pressure. Waited 2 & 1/2 hours after arrival just to unpack.

- fridge was broken in room

- Asked for more shampoo 4 different times and it was never sent to the room. Reception staff really weren’t helpful

- not enough elevators, queuing for 10-15 mins to get an elevator space after breakfast 

- Rooms are basic for the price 

- breakfast gets very samey after 3 days

- not enough tables for breakfast, waiting for space despite going at different times to try and avoid this

title: Très bon séjour
text: Suite très bien équipée, réfrigérateur et micro ondes, très appréciés quand on voyage avec 1 bébé et 1 enfant. Hôtel très bien situé 10/15 mins à pieds de Times square, 5 mins de Macy's. Toutes commodités à 2 mins de l'hôtel. Personnels agréables, accueillant et professionnels. Petit déj sympa, omelette délicieuse faite à la demande avec le choix des ingrédients.

title: Fun stay!
text: Had a wonderful stay, staff is extremely helpful and the hotel has a buzzing atmosphere and walking distance to main attractions around the city. My room had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building.

title: Nice hotel in a perfect location
text:
The hotel is located close to Time Square and therefore perfect for city trips to Manhattan. The subway can be reached in 2 minutes, to Central Park it is a walk of about 20 minutes.

The rooms are quiet big, given the limited space in New York and Manhattan itself. They are clean and very well equipped with all essentials needed, They are also very quiet. The only demerit: there is only a sliding door between bath room and sleeping room, which is not very sound proofed.

We did not use the breakfast option though it was included. We knew already that breakfast can be quiet chaotic and crowed unless you arrive very early, so we decided the skip this offer and ate outside. There are plenty of good food options close by.

The staff is friendly, but sometimes they seem to be tersely. As we needed to depart very early in the morning, we wanted to pay the bill already the night before. The front desk clerk told us, that this is not possible and we shall pay when we leave as the desk is staffed 24/7 so this will not be a problem. When we came for check out at 4 am it was - of course - not possible, as there was apparently some issue with the IT and the night manager was totally unable to cope with this situation.

To sum up, a nice hotel, perfectly located in the heart of Manhattan.

title: Broadway and NYC for Mother's Day
text: We stayed here on our last trip before covid. Finally being able to come back to New York is wonderful. But what makes it even better is the staff of this hotel! We never wanted for anything. And the helpfulness and politeness of the entire staff is something I have not witnessed in a long time. They truly care about their guests

title: Perfect in so many ways
text: The hotel is in an ideal location and is close to Time Square, the subway, theaters, and many  wonderful places to eat. Staff is as good and friendly as it gets. Staff members do everything possible to make you feel welcome.  Rates are fair and the facility is clean and well kept. There are no negatives at this well managed hotel.

title: Très bon emplacement mais attention aux étages des chambres
text:
Hôtel idéalement placé mais attention aux étages pour ne pas avoir la vue sur les bureaux de l’immeuble voisin à moins de 10 mètres et donc être obligé d’avoir les rideaux en permanence fermés pour éviter le vis à vis.
Pas de ménage dans la chambre durant les 5 nuits !! Fallait aller se chercher les savons et papier toilettes à la réception.
Bon petit déjeuner…

title: Solo trip
text: Location, Room size, cleanliness and staff were great. Adam, concierge,  helped me every day with arrangements. Front Desk Michele and Laura were also nice and helpful. Beds comfortable, room AC great. My only complaint is the breakfast setup. 630 to 930am. Even if you got there at 630am, every table was full. If you got up to get a coffee refill, leaving your belongings at your seat, people would take your table. This happened to me 4 mornings. Very stressful way to start the day. Food itself and variety was good.

title: Nice!!
text: Pretty pricey for the size of the room and the amount of amenities given. However if the room is just to sleep and your going to be a tourist this should not be an issue. The staff and management are wonderful kudos to Kenneth! Breakfast is pretty packed in the morning so I suggest you ask about good hours to go. Overall would come back.

title: Lovely yet expensive property in a good location
text:
I very much enjoyed my stay. As previously reviewed, rooms are on the small side for an Embassy Suites, but certainly above average for Manhattan and definitely spacious enough for a short stay. Common areas are very crowded during peak times. View was amazing, entire property was spotless, all staff were friendly and helpful, food was good. Other than the crowding, the price would be my biggest complaint. After all the taxes and fees, I was paying $370/night for a standard King on a Tue/Wed/Thur in April. Luckily an upgraded room was available to help ease sting to my wallet AND it was ready when I showed up to store my luggage at 7am!! Great bonus, thank you!

Evening reception = light snacks (chips, guac, cookies or churos) and two tickets for a free beer/wine at the bar. 

Breakfast = your standard full Embassy Suites breakfast.

The hotel also charges you a "Mandatory Urban Destination Charge" of $25/night and then gives you $25/day to spend on food at the restaurants or pantry.

title: Idéalement placé
text:
Durant les vacances de Pâques nous avons séjourné 1 semaine à l’embassy ( 2 adultes et 1 ado 15ans ) . La chambre était propre et la taille satisfaisante . 
Nous étions au 17ème étages avec une vue sur l’empire ( très sympa la nuit ) . 
Le petit déjeuner est plutôt sympa et les omelettes préparées devant vous sont très bonnes . 
C’est juste un peu compliqué pour trouver une place et c’est  même annoncé par la direction au moment du Check in . Néanmoins nous avons toujours réussi à nous asseoir à côté d’autres personnes . 
L’emplacement est excellent . Proche time square , Macys, métro , , empire etc…
Nous pourrions y retourner sans problème 😆 
Le ménage est réalisé à la damnée du client mais cela ne nous a pas posé de problème . 
Coffre fort à disposition, frigo  et micro-ondes .

title: Great location- great service
text: Embassy Suites was the perfect place to stay! Dinu was a tremendous help! He was always there to arrange transportation or give us directions- with a smile and “enjoy your day “. I hope Embassy Suites know what a great employee they have in Dinu.

title: Centrally located
text: Great place, great price, great fine. The bellman,Dinu, was another reason this place is great. We were meeting friends here and they were delayed and he help arrange transportation for them. Everyday we had something to ask and he was always there with a smile and friendly face.

title: Absolute Katastrophe
text: Dieses Hotel ist eine Katastrophe, nur die Lage rechtfertigt den Preis. Absolut unhöfliche, überhebliche Mitarbeiter die nie lächeln. Das Frühstück ist eine Zumutung und besteht aus einer täglichen Schlacht um den letzten der 5 Bagels oder das letzte verfügbare Messer! Vom Platz ganz abzusehen. Absolute Katastrophe und keinen Mitarbeiter interessiert, dass man sein Rührei mit den Fingern essen muss oder im stehen

title: sheets too small
text: The bottom sheet on our King bed was so small all 4 corners were off by morning. We asked for another sheet, but that also was too small. We opted for using a flat sheet tucked in bottom corners. Be aware that Housekeeping will only enter your room on the 4th day. We stayed only 3 nights, so we had to call the Front Desk for more coffee pods and creamers and cups. We had no fresh towels (not that important) and had to make our bed every morning (also no big deal to us). We also had to wait over an hour to get our dinners in the lobby restaurant. Would not go back.

title: Décevant
text:
Très déçu des prestations de cet hôtel qui n est pour moi pas digne de l enseigne Hilton dans laquelle nous avons séjourné plusieurs fois aux USA auparavant. Nous sommes arrivés et la chambre n était pas super clean et manquait draps pour lit d appoint et serviettes de bain. Nous avons dû également réclamer un sur matelas pour le canapé lit dans lequel notre fils a dormi car sinon absolument inconfortable/désagréable. Concernant le petit-déjeuner, allez y avant 8 heures sinon très difficile de trouver une place. La qualité s est améliorée au fil des jours mais le premier jour nous avons eu droit à des sandwiches car pas les plats chauds habituels n étaient juste pas disponibles sans que l on sache pourquoi. 
Personnel réactif mais ne suffit malheureusement pas à améliorer l impression générale. 
Donc en résumé allez y juste et uniquement pour l emplacement.

title: Who Forgot to Plan this Hotel?!
text: The rooms are clean, sometimes oddly laid out and NYC small. They are fine. But who decided to add amenities such as breakfast and happy hour and then not provide anything close to adequate space for guests? It’s an unholy mess in the morning and at happy hour. It’s not a stretch to make an educated guess about spacial needs based on the number of rooms. The rooms aren’t big enough for a table and chairs, so no taking breakfast back to the room. As one moves on to free happy hour, same if not worse issues. We were told by a staff member we could get our happy hour drink at the third floor bar. Then were told “Oops! Two mediocre free glasses of wine actually would be $32.” None of these things are a catastrophe, but it indicates how poorly planned and executed service is in this hotel. Of the 3 couples only we had our request for servicing our room actually done yesterday. If you want a clean room and minimum or spotty service, this is the hotel for you.

title: Superior Location and Great Customer Service make this a Top Pick
text:
Thr Embassy Suites has a known reputation and so I went with them due to reputation.  I traveled with a child (toddler) and I am dairy free, gluten free. 

I did have one big issue during my stay. For me, its not the issue that matters (issues will happen every where) but how it is handled that counts.  Their delivery food service had a serious issue with delivery.  That means that I only got sccess to a full breakfast one day.  The other days they apparently improvised providing something hot (tator tots, mixed veggies) and a somewhat contiental breakfast (toast, orange slices, juice).  The customer service of staff, like Vianel, was still superb in very frustrating conditions.  They worked hard with very limited resources and many guests were more than frustrated.  Managers were immediately available to discuss the issue with the guests, which is exactly what I did. I spoke with Anthony who allowed me to vent without interruption and then worked to understand my needs.  We problem solved to come up with a win-win situation for msyelf and my toddler and he delivered on his promises.  It was not an ideal situation but it really shows how this hotel will handle issues as they come up (and in a pandemic issues will arise!).  Since it was a one time issue I will not include this in my loved and not so much loved section.   

Here is what I loved and not so much loved:

Loved:

They always have fruit instilled ice water and restrooms in the lobby.  For someone with a toddler it's nice when they are asking for something to drink or to use the restroom and you just left the room.

They had food I could enjoy. The first days Breakfast included turkey sausage, potatoes, juice and pineapple.  This meant I could eat breakfast in the hotel with my restrictions.  For those without, they also had a bakery section, made to order omlettes, cereals.  They had gluten free dairy free lemon cookies and pop chips in their snack pantry. (MAJOR)

They provide a cocktail hour with free wine and beer and $5 selected drinks.  Sodas are free.

They provide a $25 credit for each day to use in the pantry.  Granted the market pantry is expensive ($4 for a canned soda or for a Nutella snack pack).  They had mommy-toddler favorites- pop chips, Nutella,  yogurt). 

The location... literally just a few blocks from the center of Times Square.  There is a subway, Macys (largest store in the world) three blocks away on 34th.  Food chains like Chick Fil-A, Give Guys MC Donald's and Taco bell within a block.  Coffee shops on the same  block.  And wonderful special to NY only food places that offer gluten free, dairy free options within walking distances.  It was perfect! (MAJOR)

Service: They have fast service.  When I asked for towels, they came up within minutes.  The reception always smiled even in difficult times.  They offered advice and quick tips. Loved loved the service. (MAJOR)

Not so Loved:

The rooms are smaller than typical rooms in other Embassy Suites.  (Remember this is Times Square). The suite is separated by a partial partition rather than a wall.  It makes the room feel closed.  I am guessing they did this as a way to provide an element of privacy and a separate TV to two spaces. There is very little walking space in the room.  If you have a toddler and plan to spend a good amount of time in the room, this may not be the place for you. 

The only drawers are located under the bed.

This Embassy Suites doest have the typical layout. And there was  no indoor pool.  (I only mention this because if you are accustomed to Embassy Suites they often have an indoor pool and a very specific layout.)

title: Petite déception
text:
Un peu déçue ! Je trouve que l’accueil n’est pas digne d’un Hilton, 
Nous avons réservé pour 3 et le lit de notre fille n’est pas prêt. Il a fallu demander des draps et demander à ce que le lit soit préparé (cela paraît prétentieux mais je n’ai jamais eu à faire mon mot dans un hôtel). De plus, nous n’avons que 2 serviettes (nous sommes toujours 3) et que 2 mini échantillons de shampoing. 
Sinon l’hôtel est bien placé, le petit déjeuner correct. 
J’attendais juste un petit peu plus d’un Embassy.

title: Muito bom
text:
Quarto e muito confortavel

Cafe da manha muito bom

Sala de cafe muito apertado
Limpeza foi a desejar.
Tem diA que o quarto nao foi limpo.
Sempre falta toalha.
E alguma coisa de banheiro.
Credito de 25.00 dolar diaria foi muito
Bom . Pois pegamos agua tudo dia
Sem ir mercado

title: Entspricht nicht den Erwartungen
text:
Die zwei Punkte bekommt das Hotel für seine absolut gute Lage, der Rest war nicht so zufriedenstellend. 
Zimmer: abgewohnt, bad: könnte sauberer sein, Frühstück: es schmeckt. Aber viel zu wenig Platz, jeder Zentimeter muss erstritten werden, keine Gabeln verfügbar, einfach nur Chaos

title: Great First Time Visit
text: I was there with my adult sons for five days and we will be back to this property due to the amazing staff.  One stand out Hilton "ambassador" was Adam who was there no matter the time of day, everyday ready to serve the guests with a smile and a true sense of joy in his job!  Top notch staff at all areas of service.

title: Bien placé mais c’est tout
text:
L’hôtel est bien situé . Nous avions pris l’option vu sur la ville . Nous avions vu sur la rue en face de l’hôtel , qui n’a rien d’exceptionnel mais qui est par contre  assez bruyante comme rue , situé juste à hauteur de la soufflerie des hôtels avoisinants . 
La chambre n’était pas propre à notre arrivé , présence de mousse sur le passage d’eau du  robinet , poils et cheveux dans la salle de bain . Nous avons demander si c’était possible de la nettoyer , on nous a répondu pas avant 4 jours . 
La chambre semblait plus grande en photo , il n’y a qu’une planche coulissante qui la sépare des WC , sans aucune fermeture. . 
Pour le petit déjeuner : pour pouvoir se servir il faut faire la queue car il y a énormément de monde dans une petite salle . Pour trouver une place pour s’assoir ou encore avoir des couverts il faut faire la queue . Pour repartir de la salle et reprendre la salle il faut .. encore faire la queue .
Le wifi est gratuit oui mais de très mauvaise qualité , il faut sans cesse se reconnecter . 
Nous avions déjà fait un hôtel du groupe Hilton , à Londres où nous avions été très satisfait. En prenant ce style d’hôtel et en payant ce prix nous pensions vraiment pas s’attendre à ça . Déçu

title: Emplacement au top, très bon rapport qualité prix
text:
Hôtel très bien situé, proche de Empire State Building, Herald square, Bryant Park, 5th av et Times Square.. A 5/10min à pied de Penn station ce qui est très appréciable lorsqu'on arrive de l'aéroport par le metro !
La chambre était un peu étroite mais confortable. Le petit-déjeuner est très correct, seul bémol la salle qui n'est pas adaptée, mieux vaut venir avant 8h... 
Consigne bagages possible, très pratique.

title: Decent facilities, great staff
text: Great and friendly, helpful staff. The rooms are very small, the breakfast is wonderful, but the evening reception "snacks" were mediocre at best. The pullout sofa beds are excruciatingly uncomfortable.

title: Great location
text: This hotel is in a great location. Breakfast very good but a bit chaotic due to no where to sit sometimes. Evening social excellent .Allen  behind reception was fantastic we had a bereavement in the family while away he is a credit to the Hilton team and can definitely teach his bosses a thing or two. Hilton  should be very proud of him.

title: Good place for short trip.
text:
Good room, good price for such location, amazing views, i was in 38th floor, good breakfast.

No cleaning, you have tea and coffee but no cups  !!! Called explicitly to ask for them, they said they will send some and they did not.

Still good place to stay.

title: Great service and value
text: I wanted to give special recognition to the service that I received at this hotel. Adam and David who work the front desk and concierge provide top-notch service. They are always friendly and are very willing to provide suggestions, directions or a friendly smile. The breakfast provided was excellent with something for everyone. The evening reception had free snacks and drinks and you could use your $25 daily credit to buy appetizers. This is my second time staying at this hotel and have nothing but good things to say about it.

title: Overall a great hotel
text:
We stayed for a week and had two rooms between us. One on the 33rd floor with a wonderful view of the Empire State Building that was very spacious, the other was on the 8th floor that was more cramped. 

The rooms: 
Both rooms were very clean and the one on the high floor had a great view. One room was very spacious but the other less so, but for NYC I think this is fairly common. 

The rooms were only cleaned once during our week stay but that did not bother us too much. 

The room on the 8th floor along with the whole corridor however stunk of smoke during check in, but this smell seemed to disappear after a day or so. 

The hotel: 
It is in a very convenient location close to Times Square, the Empire State Building, penn station and herald square meaning it is a perfect base for exploring the whole city. 

We appreciated the $25 per room/per day credit to use in the pantry but this was sometimes not well stocked and so we didn’t take advantage of this as much as we’d like. 

The free breakfast was nice but very limited. There were no allergens marked so one member of our party with a gluten allergy did not know what they could eat. The space available to sit was very limited, so it is very difficult to find a place within the breakfast after to eat. The breakfast also started to get packed away 10/15 minutes before breakfast finished so if you wanted to go down to get a quick croissant/slice of toast before heading out this was not possible. 
Because of this we often skipped the hotel breakfast and chose to eat elsewhere. 

The staff were all very friendly and attentive. Could not fault them. 

Overall we had a lovely stay and would consider coming back in the future if we were ever in NYC again.

title: Guest
text: Absolutely amazing stay. Adam went above and beyond to ensure we were taken care of. They have absolutely everything you need... Happy Hour, free breakfast and luggage storage!  Will definitely stay again

title: Property stolen by hotel driver - Avoid this hotel
text:
This is my first time ever writing a review but I felt I had to,

I stayed in this hotel from March 16th till the 20th of March - On the 20th of March the hotel arranged for a driver to drop us to the airport, we had a bag of shopping with us worth approximately $600 - we got out of the vehicle and forgot the bag, my partner ran after the driver however he kept driving and did not stop, we then contacted the hotel and explained the situation to a number of different people, I explained the urgency and that the driver had left in the last 2 minutes, I was transferred from staff member to staff member and finally a man called Kenneth understood what was going on, he said he would make contact with the driver to return to us with the bag - We stood outside the airport for over a hour waiting on the driver - he did not return we called the hotel and they said they where having trouble contacting him - I have contacted the hotel over the past week on numerous occasions and they have told me they can’t contact the driver - today they have responded saying the driver never seen the bag - so therefore I now assume it has been stolen by him - this was my 3rd time staying in this hotel and I will never return due to the dishonesty of there staff - How could they possibly not be able to contact a driver who drives for them on a daily basis for over a week and surely they shouldn’t be giving him business if this is what he does! I am aware he is possibly employed by another company who the hotel use for cars to drive persons staying at the hotel however I still 
would not recommend anyone to stay there - avoid it at all costs if you don’t want your property stolen!

title: Location, location, well maybe location
text: The hotel heading says it is in Times Square, and it is not. The location is nice for other NYC attractions but is located on 37th street and the theaters are 45th-51st. We changed hotels because of this.

title: Connecting Rooms
text:
Connecting rooms at an affordable price was the reason I booked this hotel.  I found other things I liked but also some drawbacks.

PROS
-Connecting Rooms: NYC hotel rooms can be small - having connecting rooms gave our family some room to spread out.  Plus, two bathrooms!

-Room Amenities: There was a desk, iron, refrigerator, microwave, closet, plus one TV across from the bed and one by the sofa.  The bathroom was a good size and had nice fixtures, though the shower door handle setup baffled me.  There is an outlet and USB charging port by the bed and desk.

-Lobby/Entrance/Elevators: The lobby has a number of seating areas, particularly as you move back from the front door.  Restrooms are at the back of the lobby.  The three guest elevators were relatively quick (with the exception of breakfast time or the early evening hours, which is typical).

Outdoor patio: The third floor has an expansive outdoor area that would have been wonderful to enjoy had the weather been nicer.

-Breakfast: I was really impressed with the breakfast.  There were at least 4 hot options per day plus the made-to-order omelets, as well as cereals, toast/bagels/breads/rolls/etc., fruit, yogurt, juices, and more.  Seating was limited in the fourth floor breakfast area but you could also take it to the third floor indoor seating area as well as the massive outdoor 3rd floor deck, weather permitting.  As you might guess, seating gets to be more limited later in the morning.

-Staff: We encountered many helpful and friendly staff members.  There were a couple less-than-cheerful front desk attendants on the last days of our stay but fortunately they were not the ones that greeted us upon arriving for our stay.  I’ll mention two especially helpful members of their team: Allen greeted us upon our arrival and took great care of us, and Adam was extremely helpful at the end in taking care of our luggage and helping us as we departed.  Thanks to both of them for their work!

CONS
-The “Urban Destination Charge”: I knew about this $25 charge per night, but didn’t fully understand how it worked.  I figured with 2 rooms and $25 per day that I would never fully spend the total at the pantry (you can also spend it at other locations in the hotel).  However, as I now understand it, the fee only applies to the “days” of the “nights” that you stay.  For instance, if you want water for your departure day, you should pick some up on one of the previous days of the stay.  With 2 rooms for 3 nights I had what I thought was $150 to spend at any time over my stay, but that was not the case.  :(

-”Suites”: If you were expecting an actual suite, you will be disappointed.  The “wall” between the bedroom and living area is about 5 feet tall and is essentially the back of the sofa.  It does do a good job of dividing the area but it is not truly divided.

-Key issues: On the third day of our stay one of our keys stopped working.  The digital key didn’t work either.  Fortunately we could use the door to the other room, though that deadbolt malfunctioned periodically.  We didn’t mention these to the front desk because it was in the last days of our stay but I thought it was worth mentioning in this review.

—--------

*Overall, I would return to this location and stay here again.  The location is great near the Herald Square subway stop and just blocks from Times Square, Bryant Park, and Grand Central.  Hopefully this review helps you enjoy your stay in NYC!

title: Enjoyed my stay
text: Close proximity to MSG, macys, Times Square, Bryant park all places I was interested as a tourist. Staff very professional and very generous. Breakfast was ok. Loved the daily credit especially how expensive things are in NY. Will be coming back.

title: Great Location. Dirty Room
text: My mom and I spent 5 nights at this hotel. The location was great. The price point was great. The room was filthy. The housekeeping staff and the front desk staff did not seem concerned. Towels was limited. There were no drawers as advertised.

title: Great location.
text: It’s a good hotel in a great location near Times Square. Food/breakfast is great. Rooms are a decent size but certainly not the suite size as advertised. Overall is a good place for a couples and/business trip.

title: Would do it again
text: Adam was an excellent help getting our luggage taken care of and the ride to the airport. Enjoyed the bartender and front desk staff as well. Room was clean and sufficient. The free food and spending allowance was also a nice touch to our stay.

title: Basic but ok
text:
Definitely more of a 3*.

Room is basic with a dodgy shower door. 

We requested a cot that arrived after we had gone to bed and the hotel worker just let them self into our room whilst we slept! Didn’t bring any bedding for the cot, we asked 3 times for bedding and it didn’t arrive so we just put the cot in the corridor eventually and our daughter stayed in our bed. 

Breakfast was just an unorganised chaos! No one on the door manning it so just have to hope for the best with getting a table. Again, not very baby friendly! 

Only thing I would say is that the location is amazing, so close to everything.

Probably wouldn’t stay here again with a family but probably ok for couples or single travellers.

title: A Trip to the Big Apple
text: Good trip to New York.  Stayed at the Embassy near Times Square. Nice place to stay. Staff was very nice.  Everything within walking distance.  Walked ALOT and rode used the subway for 90% of my transportation.  Felt safe the entire trip.  Look forward to returning.

title: Amazing hotel with awesome breakfast & manager's reception
text: My daughters, my sister and I stayed at this amazing hotel for 4 nights for a long girls' weekend and it was just fabulous. The location was incredible - just a short 10 minute walk from Times Square (safe walk to and from hotel at night too).  The staff was so friendly and went out of their way to help my family and I.  The morning breakfast was wonderful - so much to chose from and the food was all delicious.  The evening manager's reception was also spectacular with 4 options of snacks (healthy snack, sweet snacks and salty snacks).  My daughters loved the soda machine and the bar tenders were so nice to make Shirley Temples for them.  The room was very spacious compared to other hotels we have stayed in while visiting NYC.  The sofa bed was comfortable and the room was sparkling clean.  We felt safe and clean the entire time.  The hotel staff was terrific and so friendly and helpful when we asked questions or needed help.  I highly recommend this hotel and we just loved every part of our 4 night stay.  We will definitely stay here next time.

title: Affordable, comfortable, great location, and BEST STAFF
text: Reliable Hilton in great location--close to 5th Ave and theatre district without being in the middle of the Times Square chaos.  Everything you need including free breakfast but the staff is what makes the hotel.  They are so helpful, nice, and really care about the customer.  Adam, Allan, Steven, Wendalise, and Mauricio all made family's stay easy and positive.

title: Pleasant Surprise
text:
This was indeed a pleasant surprise and people like Adam made us want to return. The entire staff was phenomenal but Adam was a stand out. We will be returning to this one. 

The one issues is that the breakfast area needs more seating. It was a bit crazy trying to find seating some days.

title: Good location! Friendly and Responsive Staff
text: Enjoyed a night at this Embassy Suite location- we parked at IPARK which had a direct access into the hotel (and a $10 discount) -very convenient! We requested a room with a view and was initially given room 2516 -the room had an awkward layout. Entry was a narrow hallway w/ a bathroom on the left and desk on right. The bed is tucked into a nook basically the width of the bed-  and the picture window gave a hint of Macy's. We requested and got moved into 2518 -which I would advise folks to ask for, floor to ceiling window along w/ the open layout gave the room a bigger feel. Complimentary afternoon reception and breakfast were nice touches along with the food credit -and the staff was very friendly!

title: Perfect location with incredible views!
text: I stayed for business and the wifi was great for all my Zoom calls. I was lucky enough to have a suite with a large terrace - the outside space and views of NYC made it truly incredible!!! The hotel is in the perfect location for tourists (truly you are in the center and heart of Manhattan) and was great me me wanting to be walking distance to midtown offices. The breakfast was excellent quality every morning and appreciated that it started early at 6:30 am. And can I mention a FREE wine/beer reception daily for guests. The hotel staff and crew were super friendly. I highly recommend you stay here for business or pleasure! I’ll be back.

title: Will stay here again!
text: From parking, to happy hour and everything in between, Adam and his team at Embassy Suites were top notch. The staff was really warm and welcoming, without being contrived. We will definitely be staying here from now own.

title: Best Stay Ever
text: The staff at this Embassy was Extremely Friendly, Helpful and Catering! Adam was especially attentive, very sweet and went above and beyond to make sure we had a pleasant stay as well as safe transportation to and from the airport! Will definitely stay here my next visit to NY!♥️💯

title: Solid Midtown Hotel
text:
Second stay at Embassy Suites NYC, first stayed not long after they had opened back in 2018).  
Hotel is perfectly located between 5th and 6th and within short walking distance of Penn Station, Macys, MSG, Times Square, Bryant Park and numerous subway lines. 
Arrived early and were checked in efficiently and quickly.  Room was clean, albeit small as is the norm in NYC, but had all the amenities needed - safe, tv, fridge, microwave, coffee and a hot shower!  Breakfast is served daily and has every option hot and cold covered, however, this area does get very very busy so go early.  Evening reception is a great touch and who doesn’t enjoy free beer!  Once again this area can get busy.  Daily $25 destination fee can be used in corner pantry / Heist bar. My purchases weren’t credited back so check final bill carefully - hopefully this matter is being resolved by hotel. 
Adam in reception / lobby is an asset to the hotel and handled our requests for taxi and baggage storage and nothing was too much trouble.  
Overall this hotel will continue to be my go to in NYC - thank you again for another good stay.

title: Excellent staycation!  Will be returning!
text: This was my 1st time here at this brand of the Embassy Suites and from check-in to checkout was very welcoming and warm. Allen was excellent and friendly and placed us in an great room with a great view of the Empire state building. The room was clean and comfortable...more spacious than the average nyc hotel room which was great. Happy hour had wonderful cocktails and the food by the bar was delivered fairly quickly. Checkout with Karley was a breeze and efficient. I am excited to have another mini getaway back here at this location ! 🙂

title: Bell Man
text: Adam, at the Embassy Suites by Hilton in Manhattan NY has exceptional customer service skills.  He is very professional. He ensured my belongings were secured while I waited to be checked in. He did not hesitate to inform me about the benefits I could receive during my stay.

title: Great place in a great location
text: The hotel was in the perfect location for our trip. The staff where great especially Adam and Allan at the reception. Would highly recommend this hotel for a sightseeing holiday in NYC. Will be coming back.

title: Associate
text: My husband and I had a lovely stay at the Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square. Adam, an associate was very professional, helpful and pleasant. He made our stay quite enjoyable and look forward to visiting again.

title: First Time Hilton Honors Guest In Non-Smoking King Room
text:
This beautiful hotel is located near Times Square (about a 12 minute walk)!  The check in process was really easy and if you arrive early or will be leaving late you can have your luggage held downstairs.  We requested a room with a view of the Empire State building and received one without an additional cost on the 17th floor.  The view from the video was obscured by other buildings because we're high enough but still great nonetheless.

The room was small for an Embassy Suites but expected in New York.  There was just enough space to walk around the bed and to and from the bathroom.  It would have been cramped with a third person using the pullout bed.  

The room has a microwave and mini refrigerate in addition to a cofee which we did not use because of the full breakfast offered every morning.  

The closet and safe are located in the bathroom.  The bed was comforable but the pillows were too soft.  It would have been nice to have a firm option.  The fitted sheet didn't appear to fit the bed and basically was laid on top of the bed and couldn't be tugged into place.  

Instead of having Housekeeping Service our room each day we opted for a daily towel service. 

You MUST have proof of vaccination with identification to enter the space for breakfast and the manager reception; the staff do check.  There was only complimentary beer, wine, and snacks for the manager reception with a drink limit of two per guest.  If you go to breakfast anytime around or after 8:30 am be prepared for larger crowds and hard time finding a seat.  You can't take food to your room from breakfast. 

Being on the 17th floor we tookt the stairs alot because it was faster.  You get a $25 credit for the pantry each night.  Thanks for night price gouging during the Nor'Eastern Snow Storm.

title: Great Location and Warm Hospitality
text: Its my first time in NYC and being the first hotel i stay in, overall i am satisfy with the convenience location,most of the place in walking distance. Not to forget my man Dinu hes the best,so friendly and very helpful..Well done!

title: Absolutely best hotel experience I’ve ever had!
text: My wife and I enjoyed a three night stay at the embassy suites Manhattan from Feb 3rd- 6th and I have to say it was the best experience I’ve had in a hotel! The hotel it’s self is beautiful, yummy breakfast but the staff truly made it a great experience. Anything we needed the got to right away. From a last minute room service request, to restaurant suggestions, to allowing a late check out. We were greeted with a smile every time we came in the front doors, it felt like visiting family! I would like to specially shout out Karley, Adam, David, and Allen, they were so friendly and helpful and I believe they all need a raise! The whole staff gets gold stars for making sure people have a great experience despite they trying times we live in. We won’t be staying anywhere else when we visit New York! Thank you to all the staff!!!

title: Excellent accommodations!
text: First time traveling to NYC and I had a wonderful stay at Embassy Suites New York Manhattan Times Square from check-in ‘till check-out. Location is walking distance to Times Square, Bryant Park, Grand Central Terminal, Herald Square and lots of attractions in the area. Really worth my money; hoping to stay here on my next visit to the city.

title: Ruidos desde otras habitaciones y falta de limpieza
text: Al solicitar limpieza de la habitación, está no se realizaba del todo bien ya que el piso se encontraba sucio y con polvo, por otro lado la acústica de la habitación es muy mala, ya que se escucha todo el ruido emitido por los demás huéspedes en sus habitaciones

title: L’emplacement idéal
text:
Hôtel bien placé au coeur de Manhattan, proche de toutes les activités.
Un très bon petit-déjeuner complet qui s’adapte à chacun.
Personnel agréable, chambre au 31 étage avec une vue superbe.
Rien à redire

title: 3.5 Years Later and Still Excellent
text:
A return to this hotel about 3.5 years after the original visit and it's still excellent.  The staff is still superb.  David, who checked me in, was super friendly, as was everyone I encountered.     It's still super clean, comfortable and quiet.  Love the "small suite" setup" especially in the junior suites. Nice to have the separation

The only thing I'd change is getting rid of the resort fee but given this is now standard in NYC *AND* I knew it going in ahead of time, this wasn't an issue...plus I gladly put that credit to good use at the small on-site convenience store.

title: BEST STAY EVER
text: When we got to the hotel, the front desk staff was PHENOMENAL,ALLEN, DAVID, ADAM AND KARLEY. ( HUGE SHOUT OUT)  I travel quite a bit and i was just totally impressed by this group, not only did they assist in every way, but they remembered my name and used it it EVERY TIME walked through the lobby. The rooms were clean, breakfast was delicious, the happy hour magnificent. i i was there for my birthday with my family who had never been to NY. BEST WEEKEND EVER. Even with the snow, they maintained the lobby floors. I can't wait to come back in May.

title: Super location
text:
Amazing breakfast - so many great options
Great bellhop for storing luggage
Room was super - ask for one looking out at Empire State Building!
We loved the bed/sofa bed/2 tv setup
Great bathroom
Super location to go out at night - Macys right there - very lit up area
Close to subways
Will stay here again and again!
Worth the $$$$$
Pics are views from our window

title: Will stay again!
text: I stayed during hotel week, so I got a good price on the room. I LOVED the digital key, and picking my room. I arrived in Manhattan at around 11:30, and shortly thereafter I received a notification that my room was ready. When arrived around 12:30, I went straight to the elevator, used my digital key to get to my floor and then again to get into the room…..it was so convenient! I was very happy with my room, it was roomy, clean, and the view was amazing. The breakfast each morning was quite good and I loved the complimentary wine and snack each day between 5pm-7pm. I had one small issue with my digital key on my 3rd day, when apparently someone accidentally checked out with my room number, but the gentleman at the front desk fixed it immediately. I also asked as a Hilton Honors member for a late checkout, and they kindly obliged. My interaction with every staff member was positive, and I will definitely be back.

title: Just ok
text:
Pillows and bed are uncomfortable. There is no access to attached parking lot from inside hotel. If you are depending on a frig  or microwave these are both so small they are barely usable. 
Bright spot was daily reception although I didn’t have any food it was nice to get a glass of wine.

title: We will be back
text: Stayed a weekend on points this time around but will definitely be back. Location is convenient to all of Times Square. Got upgraded and the room was ready early for us. Their Garage is on 36th (found that out a little too late, while checking in I got a $115 parking ticket). The room was smaller, clean and fresh. They have a managers (drinks and snacks) special daily 5-630pm. Full breakfast buffet with omellete station and offered us a $25 credit per day in their on-site store. The staff was friendly and responsive to all of our needs. Enjoy!

title: Excelente ubicacion, calidez en general del personal.
text: Muy bueno, deberia mejorarse la limpieza y la atencion inicial. Llegamos y debimos buscar ser atendidos, despues de que nos dieran el espacio, la atencion mejoro. El resto del personal amable y dedicado. La limpieza de la habitación deberia mejorarse

title: Great stay
text: We had a great stay, the location is very convenient and the complimentary breakfast was great! The only thing I would argue is that we had to wait a while to check in in the beginning and they failed to tell us that our card wouldn’t work since we made two separate reservations. But overall I enjoy staying here. We have stayed in the same location twice now.

title: Poor cleanliness
text: The room was not clean all day, the general cleanliness was poor, we bought shampoo and toilet paper during our stay! We asked for cleaning but unfortunately without any results! I think during the reservation they should advise if the cleanliness is an extra!

title: Good hotel but...
text:
We were traveling as a family and found the rooms te be of resonable size, breakfast ok, location good.
But the service level on this establishment is low, we had to remind the reception 3 times before getting our rooms cleaned, even if their service offer says that rooms will be cleaned after the 4:th night, we had to wait until the 5:th night.
The reception does not give the feeling of caring for their guests, and when ordering a car to take us to the airport no one told us that it required cash to pay for the ride, which forced me to hunt for an ATM at the airport.

title: Urban/resort fees
text: Never explained what they were for or what I was entitled to.  Did not use internet or phone survive from hotel.  Research fees, other hotels says you can get restaurant or pantry credit.  None was offered

title: Amazing
text: Bob/Robert was amazing and he over and beyond what customer service does. Thank you for hiring him. Food was amazing and the views were to die for. I will be coming back next NYE. I can only image the next experience I will encounter.

title: Small rooms
text: Rooms are really small. A king size room looks like a standard room. Not much amenities in the room, and rooms are very close to each other. However, the rooms are clean, and they have a really good free continental breakfast.

title: CAPODANNO A NEW YORK
text: Hotel centralissimo e strategico per girare Manhattan a piedi. Personale cordiale e disponibile molto scrupolosi nei controlli anti covid. Colazione ottima e abbondante con servizio espresso per omelette farcite. Al piano terra ci sono frigo bar a disposizione degli ospiti dove potersi rifornire di bevande o snack che verranno addebitate alla stanza. L ' ACQUA È GRATIS!!!!  Unica nota negativa è il fatto che se non viene richiesto espressamente non rassettano e puliscono la stanza ogni giorno ma ogni 4 giorni.

title: Not Happy New Year
text: Poor communication after calling the hotel several times to find out if everything was normal. Never said we closing everything and there wouldn’t be any New Year’s celebrations at that hotel or any evening reception but we will still charge you the same price that you booked. Raise the prices for the holiday they didn’t have any of the amenities available other than breakfast.

title: Not Hilton standard
text: Stayed here on the 20th floor after booking and paying for a room with a view. We paid a lot for this 5 night stay and it was so basic. No hand wash in rooms. Empty sanitiser in the lobby. Cold breakfast.no refills of tea and coffee facilities in the room  .Rude reception staff. Bar and skylawn closed. Only good things were the concierge, location and the pillows.

title: Buon soggiorno
text: L'hotel si trova in ottima posizione, circondato da molti locali dove poter mangiare. A pochi metri si trova il grande magazzino Macy's, in circa 10 minuti a piedi si possono raggiungere Time Square o Brynt Park. Le camere non sono molto grandi ma accoglienti; la colazione è compresa e buona. Da alcune camere si ha una bellissima vista sull'Empire State Building. La fermata metro più vicina è 34 th Street Herald Square. Unica nota negativa è che rifanno le stanze ogni quattro giorni. Noi eravamo un gruppo è l'agenzia ha sollecitato per un cambio giornaliero.

title: DELUSIONE
text:
Sono stata in questo hotel per 5 notti con il mio compagno che dire un hotel così sporco non lo avevo mai visto. La pulizia della camera dovevi prenotarla il giorno prima, nonostante lo avessi fatto sempre la stanza non veniva mai pulita .supplicando ogni volta alla reception dopo veniva"pulita" o meglio rifacevano solo il letto senza mai cambiare le lenzuola e mettevano asciugamani nuovi senza pulire x terra.
Ascensore lento e sempre sporco, sala colazioni sporca, cibo di scarsa qualità. 
Questo sarebbe un hotel 4 stelle? 
Io sono già stata a new York in altri hotel e devo dire che qui manca la cosa fondamentale cioè la pulizia e la comodità.
C'è di meglio.  
Sconsiglio anche perché non costa poco visto i disservizi che offrono.

title: Beautiful view of Time Square and the the Empire State Building.
text: We loved waking up to see the Empire State Building and Times Square every morning. The view was amazing. It was our honeymoon and first Christmas in New York City. We will definitely be coming back. But this time it will be a family experience here. The staff was excellent. They helped us get around by letting us know where to take the subway and which trains to take. Thanks for everything guys we will be seeing you again in the future.

title: Enjoyed our stay with a mesmerizing view of Empire State building
text: Felt very homely and loved our stay. The staffs were very helpful and welcoming. They truly understand the need of their guests. For sure will stay at the same place during our next visit to the NY. Cheers

title: Un hotel con buena ubicación, pero servicio regular.
text: Este hotel se destaca por su ubicación al estar muy cerca de la 5a Avenida, Bryant Park y el Times Square. Sin embargo, las habitaciones no son lo suficiente amplias si se piensa en un viaje familiar. El servicio no es el mejor.

title: Unauthorised Debit from my bank card
text:
Embassy  Suites took over a $1000 extra from my payment card AGAINST my consent.

While I was at the hotel, I found out the hotel had debited $740 + $350 extra from my card IN ADDITION to the full payment I had made for my booking. I complained 3 times and was told one was an error and will drop back into my account while the other was a holding deposit. 

I was advised both will drop back in a matter of days. 

I checked out on the 20th and confirmed at reception there were no additional charges to my account and I did not need to make any further payments. I raised the case of extra charges again and was advised it will be rectified. 

I arrived at the UK on the 20th December only to be informed by Natwest Bank that Embassy suite debited an ADDITIONAL $200 on my payment card on the 21st December AFTER I HAD LEFT THE COUNTRY

I did not give consent for this payment. I did not expect Embassy Suites to hold on to my card details. This is not right 

Its Christmas and I am out of pocket due to this incident. How on earth does a hotel continue to take money off my card without my consent or indeed hold on to my card details?

This is totally beyond me and I am still trying to resolve this.

title: An absolute disaster!  Do not stay here.
text: The hotel staff is totally incompetent. Our stay was riddled with problems from the second we stepped on the property. It was a major pain to get anything fixed. I will absolutely not stay at this hotel, and maybe not even another Embassy Suite, because of this.

title: So much good - a few negatives.
text:
We came in for the Army/Navy game and stayed here.  I’m going to break this down to pros and cons.

Pros:
- Adam!! I can’t emphasize enough how great this young man is. From the time we walked in to our very last moment, he was there. He took care of our luggage, got taxis for us, recommended good places to eat and just made us feel like family.
- Bar and bar staff. I wish they had longer hours, but when they were open, we had great service and drinks. The food was also pretty great! We had buffalo wings and they were so good.
-Location! We were right down the street from Bryant Park and about 3/4 mile from the theatre district.
-Price - we thought the price was great for NY! $307 for a junior suite.
-Cleanliness - both in our room and in public places.

Cons:
- We were supposed to have a junior suite with a view. We got a junior suite with a view directly into the office building next door.I guess that was a view; just not the one we were expecting.
- I really can’t stand the “room cleaning only on request” policy. We aren’t needy people, but I make my bed at home every day and I, at least, want my bed made. However, I forgot to ask. We did ask one day and it did not get done.
- I know it’s NYC and they can’t spread out like we do in the Midwest, but the breakfast/nightly cocktail reception area was just not big enough. No matter what time we came for breakfast, there were no seats. And, it was so incredibly hot in that area and in our hallway. Not sure what that was all about.
- I like a softer bed, so I found the super firm mattress very uncomfortable. The pillows were not great either- they were super squishy.

Overall, it was a very good stay! Be aware that check-in time is not til 4:00 here.

title: Great stay
text:
Great stay ate the embassy suites 
Manhattan NYC.   Staff made my stay wonderful.   I would stay there again with no hesitation.   Very welcoming staff with an outstanding breakfast spread.    Breakfast area is a bit small so come early to to find a seat and enjoy!!!

title: Fabulous Visit and will definitely be retuning!
text: I arrived on Friday 26th November for a 7-night stay travelling alone and I have to say it was one of the best hotels I have stayed in.  The hotel has 39 floors and I stayed in 2408 (first 2 digits is your floor) and I loved my room (King Room with View) and had an amazing view of the Empire State Building.   Each floor only has 8 rooms.  There are 3 lifts which at peak times can get busy – breakfast especially, but any other time of day or night I had no issues. Now onto my room, 2 locks on the door which I really liked, Bathroom was glorious – walk in shower, large sink and lit up mirror, thick white towels and a hairdryer.  Just off the bathroom was the closet with hangers to hang your clothes (2 very large drawers are at the end of the bed), iron and ironing board along with the safe.  Room had full length mirror, luggage rack, heating control (the actual system was in the room and could be quite noisy, when I arrived the room was quite warm, so I set it to cool down whilst I went out, I then switched it off whenever I was in the room, especially during the night).  There is a Fridge, Microwave and Tea/Coffee maker, Dressing Table/Desk with lamp and large TV – I loved this as it had the Lifetime and Hallmark channel, so I even managed to watch a couple of Christmas Movies when settling down for the evening.  The bed I found was soooo comfortable, top sheet with thin duvet, I had a great nights sleep every night, there is a small bedside shelf which has plug and USB socket each side.  Due to Covid rooms are cleaned every 4 days (if you stay that long), I came back to find my room immaculate.  The window has a black out curtain aswell as normal curtain and you can open the window slightly (obviously restricted due to height).  Breakfast is on the 4th floor, I had breakfast and it was lovely, it can get busy so go down early.  I could also see Macys from my room, a short walk away with a Target opposite which sells travel size toiletries.  Nearby there are many restaurants, takeaways and fast-food shops like McDonald’s, Chick-fil-A and Five Guys. Toast is just around the corner which sells drinks, water, milk, and deli style counter food options. Bryant Park is 3 blocks north and had the Winter Village which was great.  Nearest Subway is 34 St - Herald Sq Subway Station.  As I say I enjoyed my stay massively and will definitely be returning in 2 years’ time!

title: GREAT LOCATION, GREAT STAFF, room not great
text:
We booked this hotel based on location and the ease of making the reservation and obtaining a virtual key for easier check in process. There is happy hour (I believe weekdays only) from 5:30-6:30 so good for anyone in the hotel during that window. Breakfast is provided in the morning on a specific floor. 
Now for the room, we booked a standard king room with sofa bed. The layout of the room is a accommodating for our group of 3. But here’s the things I really didn’t like: 
- sofa bed is a very hard mattress provided with one sheet
-king bed spacious but sheets provided are paper thin and feel hard, no comfort
- the AC does not function at all. We slept in 80+ degree Fahrenheit and tried cracking the window open for fresh air but very small opening. 
-the bathroom is a tight space with rough feeling towels provided and the sliding door to the shower doesn’t completely close so you have water leaking into the bathroom floor

I’m not much of a complainer, I tend to roll with the punches, but man, at this price point you would expect just a little better.

title: Excellent Experience Staff so accommodating and friendly. Thank you ALLEN
text:
I can't rate my stay highly enough from check in to check out from Breakfast to Happy hour everything was brilliant. I would like to especially mention Allen for helping us with all our needs printing our covid tests and helping us with everything. Plus a massive thank you to ANTHONY ROSARIO. Who checked us in smoothly gave us a fantastic room with a view of Empire States building and made everything so smooth on Check in. 
A massive thank you to everyone and all the staff at the Embassy Suites by Hilton. We will definitely be back. 
Many thanks 
Warren

title: Great hotel
text: This hotel has a great location.  It is close to Penn Station, great restaurants, and Broadway.The staff was so helpful and friendly.  We have been coming to NYC for years and think this hotel was the one we have enjoyed the most.  The hotel was clean, beds were comfortable and although we did not eat at the breakfast bar, the other guests seemed to enjoy it.

title: Adam’s Place
text:
Sometimes a single personality rises above an entire hotel property and makes the whole better than all of its parts. That is the case of the EmbassySuites Times Square. 

The bellman Adam made every return to the hotel  “Welcome Home!” At the beginning of our stay, we asked Adam to put our bags in our room, since we had arrived before check-in. Not only wet our bags there when we got in, but every time we arrived back at the hotel, Adam greeted us by name, with a friendly smile.

title: Girls getaway to NYC for my two daughters Christmas present.   Went with my sister and sister in law with us
text: Adam was fantastic.   He took care of any car we needed, questions we had, luggage storage, etc.  He was extremely fast and friendly.    Great employee for the hotel. Whenever we came down unsure of what to do or where to go or how to get there he was right on top of it.  He helped us decide locations and the best routes to get there.

title: Very pleased with this hotel.
text: The hotel staff were very friendly, the room was clean and nice, and check-in/check-out was quick and painless. My only complaint is with the breakfast. At 8:00 am all the tables were taken and they didn't replenish the self-serve food in a timely manner. Otherwise, my overall experience was very pleasant.

title: Poor service Good location
text: Poor service Reception of the reception Poor, unpleasant, inefficient and unprofessional. Small rooms booked Suite We received a small room not clean Dirty and sticky floor. Good location. Good breakfast and excellent service at breakfast

title: Loved it!
text: Enjoyed the hotel in general. Loved the attention when asking questions. Adam was great with directions, room was small to what we are used to back home but I see space in New York isn’t the best. Very busy hotel but the time of year which hotel isn’t.

title: Gran servicio y comodidades
text: Muy buen servicio. Impecables instalaciones. Personal atento y amable, ágil en las gestiones. Desayuno de cortesía muy variado. Y servicio de consumo adicional por día (USD 25) muy aprovechable. Ubicación conveniente para moverse hacia todos lados.

title: Disappointed Guest
text: I was extremely disappointed with my stay at the Embassy Suites!  The bedding has hair on it that didn’t belong to me!  When I took off the sheets I noticed stains on the mattress pad!  When I took off the mattress pad I found stains on the mattress!  It took 12 hours from the time I originally requested new bedding to receive a complete set to make the bed up and finally get some rest!  I was told the hotel was full so there were no other rooms available!

title: If you are expecting customer service stay somewhere else
text: If you are expecting customer service and an attentive front desk staff that works to resolve problems, don’t stay here. Preselected room was given to someone else and when there was a mechanical issue with the room provided, they said there wasn’t another room they would give me. Also she. Requested to speak with the manager, the manager ignored the request. Had to call Hilton corporate services to start a complain resolution process.

title: Great Midtown hotel!
text: Great location in Midtown Manhattan! Walking distance to Bryant Park, Herald Square/Koreatown, and the Javits Center! Friendly staff and nice modern rooms! Can’t use streaming device on TVs, need to call an engineer at the front desk.

title: Would come again
text: Very nice hotel. It’s New York so we call know rooms are small. Room service has to be requested but nothing new due to new pandemic measures. Front desk very inexperienced (I can tell from my hospitality experience). One of the very few properties where management is always visible which is a good thing (once again been a GM for 22 years)

title: The most overpriced hotel in NYc
text: Tiny rooms (even the suites), dirty bathrooms, uncomfortable beds, towels and sheets had stains. I really don’t know how worse it could get. And it was ridiculously expensive. Worst hotel stay of my life.

title: Nice hotel with conveniences.
text: Very nice hotel. Pet friendly which is very important to me. Convenient to all shopping , food, etc. Felt safe. Crowded over thanksgiving but still very enjoyable. Great view. Was able to watch the parade from my hotel room.

title: Excellent Value in the heart of NYC
text: We just finished a week long stay at this hotel. lt is really an exceptional value.  Fabulous location; staff was extremely helpful and friendly; great breakfast and happy hour; rooms are more than adequate;  very reasonable price.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: best located hotel in NYC
text:
well it was hard ti explain when you arrived after 10 hours flight  waiting your room prepared for you  at 4 pm even 20 minutes after. However when moved to my terrace room and have a great view took all my negativeness away thanks i have choosen the right room. 
Room is not latge and a small wardrobe in there make you feel you are in America. Checkin and checkout is not wasy at all because btoo crowded with people in the queue . staff is friendly Adam is the person arrange all taxis you need . One thing is strange you should have request for house keeping one day before otherwise you should do your bedding by yourself. 
Anyway it was good to be there and enjoyed during my stay

title: Nos hicieron un cobro de 1600 dólares en la tarjeta de crédito!!
