text: Con mi marido nos quedamos desde el 8 al 14 de noviembre, reserva hecha a nombre de Patricio Cossio, la estadía fue pagada antes del viaje (en octubre). Cuando hicimos el check in nos hicieron pasar la tarjeta de crédito, nos dijeron que de ahí iban a descontar los 25 dólares diarios; sin embargo, el cobro que nos hicieron fue de 1600 dólares!!!!!!! No entendemos ese monto, pues la estadía fue pagada antes del viaje, y la señorita que nos hizo en check out nos dijo que cualquier cobro a la tarjeta de crédito se iba a anular y que sólo nos iban a cobrar los 25 dólares diarios. Necesitamos una respuesta y que anulen ese cobro!!!!!!

title: Girls getaway
text: Our stay was fabulous!! The location of the hotel is perfect and walkable to Times Square and Madison Square Garden. The hotel was safe and clean! The breakfast with made to order omelets was a great way to start our busy days. Allen at check-in and Dinu the bellhop were the BEST, going above and beyond to assist in anyway. I cannot sing their praises enough. We will definitely stay at this hotel on our next trip to NYC!

title: Almost perfect stay
text: We enjoyed our stay in Embassy Suites New York Manhattan Times Square. It’s just unfortunate that our reserved rooms were sold out for the first night and we were given rooms in different floors. We were happy with the amenities and free breakfast. The hotel location is excellent, it’s walkable to most New York attractions.

title: Poor customer service
text: When I first checked in, they put me in the incorrect room even after I pulled up my confirmation email stating what type of room I had.  I had made 2 requests for them to place me on the highest level they could prior to our travel they did not do that.  I had to go back to the front desk after checking in to be put in the correct room.  The guy was rolling his eyes And everything.  He didn’t tell us the correct information about the breakfast and bar.  We could not eat or get drinks from the bar.  We had to go out every day to eat breakfast and get drinks.  I spoke to the manager and he was not helpful and honestly did not attempt to help.

title: They left us without a room on the first night
text: We had prepaid our reservation and advised that we would be arriving late and they had overbooked and given away our room! We were traveling with an 80yr old woman and it was freezing that night and they left us with no other options.

title: No A/C, had to leave, awaiting resolution
text: I really wanted to like this hotel, truly. The location was convenient for me and the front desk staff were all polite. However, my first room yesterday (2011, I believe) had no A/C and smelled faintly of urine. I switched within an hour or so. The second room, 2908, smelled better, but still no A/C. A visit from the maintenance technician and multiple calls to the front desk yielded no resolution, just befuddlement as if no one else was having this problem, even though staff later admitted to many A/C-related calls that evening. Finally at 9pm with the room temperature exceeding 76 degrees, I went downstairs and told a member of staff (Willy, I think) that I couldn't take it and moved to a hotel down the street with proper A/C. Yet, as of now, my credit card has not only been charged the full amount for the room, but also the snacks I bought, which were less than $25 and thus covered by the food and beverage credit for Diamond members I was told about during check-in. A call to the hotel's accounting department to resolve all this has yet to be returned. Very disappointing and not up to Hilton standards.

title: Very nice hotel
text: I loved the staff. Especially Kenneth. He was amazing! The breakfast was good and the room was clean. Lobby was a little packed however that’s not the staff fault it’s good for business. I would recommend this property however if you are looking for space please remember this is New York.

title: Wonderful stay; Great location
text:
My wife and I stayed at this location for the New York City Marathon, and we had a great experience.

We arrived shortly after noon, and were told our room was not yet ready.  Understandable, and they were able to hold our luggage for us.  We returned after 4 because we had not received a notification our room was ready.  When I inquired at the front desk, we were told the room was still not ready, but a similar room was available that had a great view.  Needless to say, this room was on the top floor and had a great view of the Empire State Building.  Wonderful service.

The room itself was not overly large, but this is to be expected in NYC, and we were quite comfortable.  

Both the afternoon reception and full breakfast were running as normal.  Plenty of good breakfast food.  The seating area is not real big and can get crowed pretty quickly.  They do tell you at check in that the busiest times are prior to 8:30, which did seem to be the case.

Since we were running the marathon, the location was great for us.  It was a quick 5 minute walk to Bryant Park to catch the bus out to Staten Island.  Plenty of subway options were also available nearby.  Times Square and the theaters were 10-15 minutes away depending on where you had to walk to.

Highly recommend this hotel, and we would not hesitate to stay here again in the future.

title: Great Location and truly friendly Staff.
text:
Wonderful stay.  Loved the breakfast, and cocktail  hour.  
Also , Adam the Valet at the property was the most friendly and helpful attendant we have ever dealt with.  He truly is a Super Employee.  The lobby was very busy on our check out day, and he handled everything with a Smile.

title: Poor service
text: This has been by far the poorest experience I had in a hotel so far. I stayed for 5 paid nights for Halloween weekend. Their housekeeping service is NONEXISTENT and forget about getting room service, they won’t clean it for you. Upon check in, the agent briefly and barely mentioned the amenities of the property. I had to ask her about gym, breakfast (which she provided me wrong times and caused me to miss it). I called to get my room cleaned on the 3rd day and I was told by the front desk I needed to make that request one day in advance, I told him I was told by the agent upon check in I could get it serviced on the 3rd day which I accepted, in the end they never sent anybody to clean my room and I had to call twice to get some basic toiletries. I am not the type of guest who needs his room serviced every day but when I do I expect the property to deliver. Management is doing a terrible job at running that facility. You can notice front desk understaffed and overworked but they keep on selling 100 % of their rooms. As a matter of fact, despite being Diamond I wasn’t upgraded at all upon checking due to the house being fully booked but they keep on saying their service is impacted due to “COVID”. However, there’s a huge contradiction when you see more than half of the staff unmasked, even the ones on the breakfast area (you’re required to show proof of vaccination to dine in or use the gym). This property has huge potentials not only because it’s located on a prime location but also because its breakfast was good too and offers a wide variety of options. It’s sad that Management has not done a better job at hiring more staff in order to provide a good  service according to the price they charge a room / night. You can’t charge someone 300 / night when your service is below standards of a candle-wood suites.

title: Price doesn't match Quality
text: Spent three nights at the Embassy Suites. Spent about $1K. The room was quite small. There was a $50 parking charge daily. The staff was friendly however, they don't provide enough information beforehand (ie. vaccination requirement to participate in complimentary breakfast & no food take-out). The room service closes by 10pm. Due to COVID they don't service the room daily however, nor do they offer complimentary refills to items such as cups Keurig tea/coffee. I just don't understand how you charge the same price pre-COVID if not more money but don't provide the same level of service or quality!

title: Disappointing service and questionable Health Protocol.
text:
Was staying in this property from 10/31 to 11/4. 
Hotel was full, lobby was completely packed when we checked in. No health protocol or whatsoever being enforced.  As I understand, NYC has face mask mandate for all indoor facility, which I didn't see this in this hotel. Even on the hotel lifts, there is a sign that Face masks required for all in all public places.
In fact, I didn't see this being observed , by either majority of the hotel employees and some  guests. (photos provided)

Also, we supposed to receive the following as part of of our stay benefit : Premium guest internet access; daily $25 food and beverage credit for use in all hotel outlets (including Corner Pantry); daily $10 self-parking credit.  
We didn't receive this at- all, having said that, this cost us at least $140 worth of benefit.

Breakfast was OK but lacking of variety. Location was excellent.

Really shameful for Hilton to have this hotel under their system!

We will not stay here again!

title: Great hotel for NYC visit
text: Enhanced my overnight visit to the city.  Beautiful centrally located hotel.  Complimentary happy hour and made to order breakfast.  Adam, the first employee we dealt with, could not have been kinder, friendlier or more helpful both days We were there.  Front desk staff also kind and helpful.  Would stay here again “in a New York minute”.

title: Wonderful and modern hotel
text:
Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in the end of November.
Modern hotel rooms, lots of room amenities (sofa, fridge, wifi, safe, desk, coffee/tea, ice).
The room is rather big, modern, fairly quiet from outside (you can hear the sirens so probably lower floors will be loud), but you do hear noise from adjunct rooms (and from the floor above).
A lot of the TV stations had annoying "bumps"/lags in their broadcast.
The wifi isn't safe (the mobile devices warn about it), make sure you're using a vpn if you're using it.

The staff is quite okay, the concierge is very nice.
Downside- no masks are used, especially for housekeeping, but not only.
Also, the luggage is stored in the middle of the hotel's bar, which is a very crowded area, not safe for the luggage.

The location is quite central, but in a VERY touristy area, keep that in mind.

Included in the price are a big breakfast and a nice happy hour. If you're looking for healthy options, they're both not for you.
HHonors members get a nice daily credit in the hotel's convenience "store".

title: Excelente atencion
text:
Excelente hotel. Linda habitacion buena ubicacion y muy buen desayuno.
Pero lo mejor es el excelente servicio!
Te resuelven todos los problemas.
Mencion especial para Graciela,  Steven y Anthony.

Gracias por todo. Volveria sin dudarlos

title: Great service by Dino
text: I rated our stay at Embassy suites a 4 for a lot of reasons. But our service from Dino should be rated 5 for his concern and assistance. He is one of the better employees there. His bright smile and caring attitude was a bright spot in our otherwise so so stay. We have been staying at Embassy Suites for over 25 years all over the country so we have a lot of experience with this company. Promote Dino to Desk services! LisiB

title: Location and Service Fantastic!
text:
Having a central location that is within walking distance to almost everything in NYC that I wanted to see and visit is a big plus. The staff was kind and helpful during my check-in process and the rooms were awesome -  big for NYC.  The breakfast and reception were great and we even had a drink on the great outdoor patio/terrace (in November!) 
I Will definitely stay here again

title: Nice hotel in a great location
text: We stayed four nights here and had a great time. First the only minor not so great things are the room is small but definitely nice and that’s about it. Easy walk to Times Square, Central Park and Broadway shows. The staff was very helpful. We were on one of the top floors so the view was amazing. One day we caught a free bus to the midtown ferry which was like 3 blocks away. Others days we walked to surrounding sites. NYC has a lot of great places to eat some are very expensive but others may not be cheap but they are not that costly. We enjoyed our stay very much and would definitely stay here again.

title: I have stayed in many hotels in NYC. This is a keeper
text:
This place was awesome. On so many levels. The staff at the front desk were amazing and friendly. I got to the hotel 2 hours before checkin and the room was ready. They say you need to book housekeeping if you want it, but housekeeping came every day to see if we needed anything and if we weren't there, cleaned and left fresh towels. NOTE: if you intend to use the sofa bed, you do have to bug them a few times to send the linens. The breakfast is wonderful - made to order omelets and so much more. Reception at night with a free drink. We got a credit for the bar or pantry daily which came in handy. Very quiet and staff so friendly. BTW I have stayed in many many hotels in NYC. While this is not the Algonquin, it checks all the boxes for a lovely stay. Will stay here again.

A word to the hotel: If you know there are two or more people in the room, put a few more towels and shampoo/body wash in the room. But really, that's not a critical thing, so ya'll are doing it just great. LOVE your staff.

title: Excelente relación hotel-precio-ubicación
text:
Excelente relación hotel-precio-ubicación. Personal de atención siempre dispuesto. Bonus diario de 25usd para consumo
interno. Habitaciones grandes y cómodas. Único único inconveniente casi nula opción de desayuno gluten free.

title: Kind service and good place
text: Dinu down in the lobby was so kind and helped us out multiple times! He personally took a very nice hotel, quiet with clean rooms and went a step beyond and made it kind, accommodating and very personable.

title: A great hotel
text: Three of us, friends visiting the city, found this great place! The hotel was in a great location, close enough to Times Square to easily make the 12 minute walk, but not in a noisy area. A king size bed and a sofa bed were perfect for three people — and there was a bit more space than other places at comparable prices. Breakfast every morning was excellent- a number of choices and it included made to order omelets. And a happy hour!  Also, with a bar area- a nice place to sit and enjoy a delicious cocktail or glass of wine. But for us, the best part was the kindness and helpfulness of the staff. Lorena at the desk and Dinu, one of the concierges, could not have been nicer! We stayed 7 days/nights and each and every day these two people, as well as others, went out of their way to ensure we were served well. Our group said we would definitely stay here again!

title: NYC Mini-vacation
text: Great location for shows - individually-owned coffee shops around every corner. Hotel rooms were decent size for Manhattan- clean too. Staff was very courteous and helpful. Dinu was exceptionally friendly and efficient and a shout-out to Ivan also.

title: Pésimo Servicio y Limpieza
text:
Ha sido la peor experiencia de mi vida respecto al servicio de limpieza de la habitación, desde ya es un pesar tener que pedir que limpien tu habitación un día antes pero mucho peor es que habiendo coordinado no lo hagan y peor aún 3 veces!!! 
es realmente preocupante el servicio de este hotel, inclusive reforcé el pedido con el
front desk para la limpieza de mi habitación y no lo hicieron.
Se imaginan llegar después de hacer turismo y caminado 13 km en NY para llegar a una habitación totalmente sucia con basura acumulada de 3 días y sin reposición de artículos de baño. Pero lo peor!!! habiéndome quejado y solicitado lo en 3 ocasiones!!!

title: Terrible experience
text: The room wasn’t cleaned. TV didn’t work. We didn’t get the room we had reserved. The front desk lacked communication. The rooms were very small but I guess that’s understandable since the hotel is in Times Square area.

title: Great Stay-Great Location
text: Staff was great, room was nice, view was phenomenal, location was perfect (within walking distance of Times Square, Empire State Bldg, 9/11 Memorial and Museum, Rockefeller Center…) I can’t wait to go back!

title: Average hotel....amazing staff
text: Hotel was clean and location was nice, set just away from the chaos but near the fun. Nothing was catastrophic about our stay, just small annoyances. The elevator wait can be very long, we have to ask for bedding for sofa bed instead of it just being stored in room, the internet didnt work most of our stay, the bed was way too firm and the bar was only open in the evenings. However, every single staff member I interacted with was nothing but helpful, friendly, and smiling. They are fantastic. I wouldnt discourage someone from staying here, but I dont think it will become our regular spot.

title: Less than very good
text: By far the biggest and most inconvenient part was there was no internet as advertised. It supposedly was down but being worked on by engineers. With their engineers working on it for 3 days I think they need new engineers. Four times over our first three days I was told it would be fixed within a few hours. After the 3rd day I stopped asking. My business requires internet as well as my child. The tv programming wasn't worth even turning it on. Due to limited space in room must be the reason we had to call housekeeping to get a blanket and pillow for fold out bed. Housekeeping was only by request. Having no internet cost us more money because we spent more time away from room than we would have if there was wifi. I wrote their corporate office and the hotel themselves but my communication was ignored. Lastly, the included breakfast is a great idea but the food was horrible. This has been our experience. Very disappointing.

title: Dino the Concierge
text: The hotel l  was nice and clean. The staff specifically Dino the Concierge was very nice and full of useful information about New York. We really appreciated his customer service skills. Abcdefghijklmnop

title: Perfect location with great views and comfy rooms!
text:
You can easily walk to Times Square, Theater District, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, Macy's, Mood Fabrics, Bryant Park, NY Public Library, Empire State Building, hundreds of restaurants, and on and on. Uber was easy to use, but be mindful that 37th is one-way going toward 6th Ave, so traffic gets backed up. Plan to walk a block or so toward your destination to order your Uber. Rooms are on floor 5 and above. Each floor only has 4-6 rooms. 2909 (king jr suite with view) had corner windows and beautiful views of Empire State Building and Macy's Herald Square. 2807 (king jr suite with view) had similar views but a much smaller window. Yes, rooms are small, but it's NYC. We heard zero noise from the street or other guests. Great cold, quiet air conditioning.
No managers reception. Breakfast really crowded so we got something from great choices around the corner. I still don't understand how the $25 credit guests have to spend at the little lobby market really works. 
We previously stayed in the Upper East Side at Garden Suites which has much bigger rooms, the option of 2 queens, a very quiet neighborhood, and nicer subway stations. I like the convenience of Embassy Suites, but we saw IV drug users shooting up in broad daylight right outside the Embassy Suites entrance on 2 occasions.  We intentionally did not want to have to use the subway as often this trip, so we chose a busier location. Embassy Suites does not offer 2 beds in room - only a king and sofa bed. 
COVID has some NYC activities/attractions/shopping not open or open fewer hours, so check websites before you go anywhere.  Dinner reservations were much easier to get than previous visits. The city was definitely less crowed than pre-COVID. Most people outside wore no mask, but inside most were masked.

title: bad hotel
text: Upon arrival at the hotel, a security deposit was requested, which was paid directly and we were informed that there are products on the side table that are offered free of charge at a value of 25 dollars per day.  The table was together three times and the cost was deducted from the insurance amount for the entire period of the stay, although I was informed that the products were free Also, the process of organizing the rooms is very bad, and the room was not cleaned until four days after the request to clean the room

title: $25 resort charge w/ no restaurant/bar until 5 pm
text: This would be a 4, except for limited restaurant / bar service. Tiny bar not open until 5 pm, yet added a $25 “resort fee” per day. While you can use it in the pantry, it had a limited stock (no wine). Breakfast (free)  is good, but no afternoon hospitality (& bar not open until 5). Rooms are nice, but small. Not like typical 2 room suites you expect at ES. Tight for a couple in one room! When it’s busy, it can take several minutes to get an elevator. All front desk staff are friendly, helpful,  & pleasant. Few taxis come to the entrance. You’ll have to walk to a cross street. They will reserve a nice car service to the airport ($60 cash, not inc tip). Subway is 2 blocks, most theaters are 1 - 1.5 miles. We specifically booked to have guaranteed adjoining rooms, but had to move 2nd night as they weren’t. Maybe due to confusion when I asked for a view, too.

title: Хороший отель в самом сердце Манхэттена
text: Гениальное расположение, изумительные разнообразные завтраки. Приятный номер с шикарным видом (оплачивается отлельно)) в номере лично мне не хватало тапочек тк полы они явно не моют. Пешая доступность ко многим тур объектам

title: Adam is the BEST, and unbelievable view of Empire State Building for our Broadway adventure
text: From the moment we pulled up to the curb in my car, Adam (the concierge/bellman) took unbelievable care of my mom and me!  He is truly a valuable asset to this hotel and singlehandedly made our stay the best.  We felt **SO SAFE** at this hotel and that our car and luggage was in good, secure hands when we checked out and had to have it held for a few hours. Thank you Adam and the Embassy Suites team!!

title: Not Returning to this location
text: With a 4 pm checkin you expect access to your room.  With an hour wait and no hotel manager or staff seeming concerned about your wait. The fact that this was an Embassy Suite hotel I expected a larger room. I have had better singles than this room.  No dressers, just pull out drawers under the bed.  Closet in the bathroom. Broken ironing board.  Would not recommend.

title: Beautiful view. Fantastic location.
text: I’ve stayed here on a number of occasions. Doing business in the Garment District, and with Penn Station just five blocks away, not to mention the Empire State Building just three blocks down, this is fantastically located. It’s very clean, fully staffed, very friendly. Not to mention, great rates!

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Ubicado en la calle 37, las habitaciones tienen muy buenas vistas de la ciudad. En el piso 4 hay una terraza para comer, con mucho espacio. Ofrecen un servicio de bebidas y snacks para llevar a la habitación, con un crédito de 25 dólares diarios. El desayuno es excelente y el trato del personal muy bueno. Hablan español. La wifi de muy buena calidad.

title: Nice stay in the heart of New York
text: The Embassy Suites has a hotel room that offers a divided area for privacy for a couple to enjoy different schedules with out disturbing the other with two big screen TV sets.  We booked that room and were happy with the floor plan.  Our view was acceptable but the hotel has better ones for a price.  We enjoyed the location and the breakfasts were available early and were acceptable.  This hotel offers good value for New York.

title: Service might be why it’s cheap
text: Property is nice and clean, reasonably priced especially for New York, and conveniently located. The staff however, not so much. Getting soap in this place was like trying to strike gold! We didn’t have any in our room when we arrived. After several calls (over the course of hours), we finally got some only to have it swiped by housekeeping and not replaced, starting the whole cycle over again. There’s only 3 tiny elevators that serve like 14 floors if I remember correctly and one of them was always out. The roof top space was closed due to COVID but there was no notice of this. My wife and I brought back nice carry out that we planned on eating in this space only to find out it was closed due to covid which didn’t make much sense because the indoor breakfast space was always packed to the gills. To top it all off, our last day (a Saturday) we were awoken to a false fire alarm at 530/600am that had no instructions. Our room was then barged into by housekeeping at 7am (literally the lady came into our room while we were sleeping, forgot to latch after the fire alarm), and subsequently awoken and visited by housekeeping 3 more times when checkout wasn’t until 11am.

title: Creepy terrible experience. Cigarette stench by staff entering room when we were out of the hotel.
text: Awful experience.   While out a show last night someone entered our room and it was filled with cigarette smell and stench when we return. The front desk clerk was clueless and said they were full and he would not be able to find us another room or a different hotel. House staff came to room and confirmed cigarette stench. My daughter is an asthmatic so we had to leave and could not stay at the hotel. I sent an email to manager Coral Castillo but did not receive a response yet. Two other people were trying to check in to their reserved room but clerk told them sorry -11 rooms so you can’t stay here.  A total mismanagement and terrible experience

title: Excelente hotel y servicio.
text:
Muy buen desayuno , completo y variado. La atención del personal en general muy bien.  Principalmente Lorena y Willy que siempre estuvieron predispuestos a resolver algún inconveniente que pudiera surgir. 
Única crítica es el espacio de desayuno que es un tanto pequeño.

title: Affordable, location and breakfast
text:
Highly recommend! Safe location easy walking to midtown sites or subway. 
Friendly go the extra mile staff
Amazing hot or cold breakfast 🧇 on designated floor away from lobby traffic .
It’s NYC so room is small by some standards but restroom is large.
COME STAY

title: Excepcional
text: Excelente hotel, amplias habitaciones, limpias. En recepción súper amables todos, en especial Lorena del Lobby es amorosa, muy atenta. Desayuno excelente y U$S 25 dls por habitación por día para gastar en el mercadillo del hotel. Súper bien ubicado y cerca de todo!

title: Just ok
text: Complementary breakfast was nice, as advertised. There were no complementary beverages or drink reception, as was advertised on the website when booking. Also the outdoor patio area Was not open as advertised and had very limited time availability. There was really no other place for the group to come together and socialize.

title: Terrible hotel: GO SOMEWHERE ELSE
text:
Diamond member with hilton for years, been to hilton properties all over the world. This may be one of the worst. 

From the sloppy housekeeping, to the cheap touches in rooms. 

As one of many example: the thermostat in the room has been programmed to show a incorrect temp. And it has a settling where it cannot be changed below 68. Therefor, in the summer when it’s warm outside, you’ll come back to your room and sweat. All night as well. The thermostat will say 68, however, it will be will above 75. Ask to get it looked at, and you’ll be ignored. Or better, told they will do the best they can. 

Lastly, pay too dollar for a suite. Good idea, until you get to the room and find the small window (single half window). For the view you’ve paid for is so small you can’t see much. The standard rooms have better windows and views. 

P.S. pillows were great 8 years ago, and forget about the fitted sheet to stay on the bed. You’ll be sleeping on the bare mattress when you wake up. 

Hilton should take their flag off this hotel. Turn it into a motel 6.

title: Lorena is the best!!!!
text: I stayed at the Embassy Suites on W 37th for a week and Lorena helped make my stay carefree and enjoyable. She  is super nice and very good at her job. I stayed an extra night just because she was so helpful. Lorena you are my all time favorite Hilton employee!!!!

title: Terrible service and response to a lost item
text: Terrible service. My girlfriend left a coffee thermos in the room when we checked out on Saturday 11 September.  It took 4 phones calls  over 4 days and a return to the hotel before we were told it was not found. This is unbelievable. I have stayed at Hilton all over the world and it has never taken this long to resolve an issue.

title: Terrible Service
text:
Unfortunately I can't rate this hotel lower. My girlfriend and I stayed one night, Friday to Saturday. When we got home to California on Saturday she realized that she left a coffee thermos in the room. She called the hotel immediately and was told to call back Monday when the housekeeper would be there, called Monday was told to call back Tues, called Tues was told to call back Wed. Called Wed was told someone would get back to her after 3 hours no one did. I happened to be in NYC and went to the hotel, the front desk tried calling housekeeping, no response. All told I was kept waiting for over an over before I was told nothing was found in the room. 
The fact that it wasn't found is upsetting but the fact that it took 4 days to find out is unbelievable. This is the worst service I have had in all my  years at Hilton hotels. I won't be going back and recommend no one else patronize this hotel

title: Horrible Service-Ruined Trip
text: Reservations were messed up, room was filthy, staff was rude and very uniformed even after calling ahead of time to ask questions about parking.  As restaurant owners recovering from Covid, our chance to get away just this once was completely ruined. As a Hilton Honors member, I expected better even with the understanding that staffing and getting up to speed after Covid has been tough. We had to cut our trip short as a result and it cost us much more trying to find edible food and parking accommodations.

title: Simply The Best
text:
We would like to highly recommend 
Embassy. 
The room was big and extremely well equipped. 
Great location, good buffet breakfast. 
The Pantry credit we received was such a nice surprise and the pantry was full of fresh snacks and drinks all the time. 
Great service epecially from Lorena who is so kind and helpful professional and efficient 👏
👏 She alone is a reason to return to the hotel.  We would surely book again

title: Great location/No Bar
text: Hotel in great location. Walking distance to most MUST SEES. The customer service provided by Willy, Mister and Kenneth was exceptional. We were able to navigate subway lines and enjoy the few amenities thanks to their guidance. Now on to the bad. The bar is not open, the rooftop space did not open until after 10 and closed at 8. The cleanliness of the room was below what I expect of Hilton brand. I understand due to the pandemic there are staffing issues but at the same time during a pandemic cleanliness should be the number one priority.  We had to clean our room and purchase washclothes because none were available during check in. I didn’t get to enjoy breakfast because no safe spacing was observed and all the food wasn’t properly covered therefore I didn’t feel safe. I suggest Hilton try operating at lower occupancy to maintain some sort of standard. Overall the friendliness of the staff and location would make me recommend this hotel.

title: Charged extra amount in my card!!!
text: I had to stay in NYC because my flight was canceled and we missed our bus to our city (in Pennsylvania). Thus, we went to the Embassy suites aiming to stay there until our next bus (later at night, same day). The receptionist told us we could stay until 10pm and that our total would be $125+tax. Then, at the check in he asked for my card as a security (they charged $201). At the check out, I demanded a receipt because I wanted to pay in cash and need a proof they would give me back the amount hold on my card. I’ve called them several times, more 2 weeks has passed and they haven’t still given my money back. I even tried to contact over the chat on their website. They open a case and still haven’t done anything!!!! Horrible service and be careful so they don’t charge you wrong! In the end, if they don’t give my money back, I will have paid almost $400 for less than 12h of use! It’s absurd!

title: Very mediocre
text: I’m my opinion Embassy Suites has gone down hill in the last couple of years, some properties are great and some are not, this one is not. They make you spend 25.00 on food items but the only place to get food items is the pantry with chips and sodas. The breakfast is on the 4th floor with loud music playing and very dis organized, we ate there once and that was enough. The rooms are about as small as you can get, However it is in good location.

title: My experience was enjoyable and a relaxed one. Very happy with the personalized service from the front desk staff.
text:
The experience at the Embassy Suites was phenomenal since my wife and I enter the property.  The front desk personnel, especially Lorena Tolentino was so kind and helpful in multiple things such as transportation to the airport, places to eat around the area, among other activities.  My wife and I thoroughly recommended it. Ask for her at the front desk to make your stay a pleasant one. Very happy with her service.

Also, Willie Blake was another professional at the front desk that assists us during our stay, and he was very helpful too and efficient.

title: Great hotel in an excellent location with great service and a good breakfast
text:
We had an excellent stay. The hotel is located in a great location. Everything was spot clean and a good breakfast was included.

Lorena at the front desk provided us with an examplary service during our check-out helping us with storing chocolate in good AC area until we were ready to go to the airport.

We will come again!

title: Très décevant!
text:
L'atout principal de cet hôtel est sa localisation, à distance de marche de toute destination dans le Midtown.

Toutefois, plusieurs problèmes gâchent le plaisir du séjour :

. le ménage n'avait pas été fait correctement avant l'arrivée, de longs cheveux noirs tapissant le plancher de la douche; cela a été corrigé, à ma demande; toutefois, par la suite, sur 8 nuits, le ménage a été fait 5 fois alors qu'il avait été demandé quotidiennement; sans insistance de ma part, il aurait été encore moins fréquent. 

. la salle à déjeuner est inadaptée à cette fin : plafonds bas, manque de lumière naturelle, multiplicité de locaux, absence d'un parcours clair pour aller d'un comptoir à l'autre; il n'y a aucun contrôle sur le port du masque; pire, le personnel semble dépassé et désabusé, la plupart des employés ne prenant pas la peine de saluer les clients. 

. l'insonorisation entre les chambres et le couloir est carrément absente; deux nuits de suite, on a pu entendre des scènes de ménage vers 2h du matin. 

. il y a une étrange entente exclusive en matière de transport qui exclut les taxis jaunes; si on souhaite en prendre un pour aller à l'aéroport, on se fait répondre par la réception d'aller en héler un soi-même dans la circulation (avec ses bagages!) car elle affirme ne pas disposer du numéro pour en commander un par téléphone!

title: Could be better
text:
The location of the hotel is very good.
The staff are very friendly and trying their best.
The breakfast is not that good and no precaution for the Covid19 are taken into consideration!!
I believe this hotel is still not 100% following the Hilton specs.
The rooms are not as described and smaller than the pictures, but still good.
The housekeeping needs to be improved.

title: Excelente
text: El personal fue atento y muy amable en todo momento. La habitación limpia y comfortable. Me agradó que el personal hablará español y que nos diera toda la información necesaria. El desayuno muy bien aunque es el mismo todos los días por lo que tiende a aburrir un poco pero siempre estuvo muy bien.

title: Excelente en general
text:
La habitación era pequeña pero cómoda , tenía secador de pelo, plancha y mesa para planchar, un frigobar (vació) pero que sirve para poner lo que quieras, una cafetera.
Creo que le faltaría una red de wifi para hacerlo mucho mejor. Lo demás todo bien

title: Loved my stay!
text:
Just returned from a 3 day stay in NYC, the staff was very helpful and checkin was easy. The rooms are modern and the view is amazing from the higher floors. The location is great, only a few blocks from Bryant Park, Penn Station and Empire State Building. 

Try to go a little early for breakfast, it starts to get crowded around 8:30am.

title: Ужас
text: Отвратительно, не одной уборки, смены белья, вместо одеяла простыня с пледом, ужасные подушки, отвратительный завтрак, из искусственной, не вкусной еды, огромные толпы людей, за столик не сесть, вообщем никому не рекомендую этот отель

title: Great Stay Great Location
text:
I honestly had a great stay during my 3 day visit to the city.  I had a great room 2416 that faced south with a great view of the Empire State Building.  The floors of the room were a bit dusty but everything else in the room to include the lobby and common areas was very clean and  comfortable.

My digital key popped up on my phone around noon so I was able to go straight to my room early and start my day.  The lady from housekeeping was in the hall and I asked her for extra towels and she was happy to help.  However, I could tell she looked EXHAUSTED.  I know hotels across the country are short staffed so when I see that they are still managing to keep the place clean I appreciate it.  I was sure to leave a tip.

I had issues with my digital key working in the elevator and the front desk staff were very nice and courteous to me.  Overall I had a wonderful stay and will make this my go to hotel the next time I'm in the city.  Clean and quiet, great location and friendly staff.

title: OK but not great
text:
I regret to post not-so-positive comments rather than good ones here.

- Check in time was 4PM. Our room was not ready until almost 5PM, and front desk person worked on incorrect room type, we could've checked in earlier to the correct room type I booked. (we had to go back and get a key to the correct room) 
- Front desk staff, especially women, were not friendly.  Perhaps they were all tired from working long hours as I saw same people anytime I pass by, morning, day, and night. 
- No bar soap in the room. I had to stop by at the front deck to pick up some.
- No lines for sofa bed. I first called the front desk and inform, waited for more than 1/2 hour, stop by at there in person but unfriendly staff (lady)  just told me that "only 1 house keeping is working, there are many requests".  OK.  Waited another 2 hours, no one knocked our door to deliver linens. I called the front desk, different person answered and he sent someone with linens within 3 minutes.
- Making sofa bed,,,, so many dust and small trash all over on the mattress.. disgusting ! 
- Room was very small, although we had view of Empire State Building. 
- Only one front desk person recognized that I am Hilton Honor member during check in/out/other interaction. 
- No afternoon reception.

Good things were
- Breakfast buffet was good as other Embassy Suites, though it was high volume of traffics after 8:30 AM or so. Better to grab some early. 
- Concierge guy, I believe lot of reviewers here mentioned is the same person, was really nice and helpful, and always smiling.  :) 

 Will we stay next time we visit to New York?  Perhaps yes, as we know what to expect, what not to expect.

title: Overall a great place to stay
text: Rooms were small but very comfortable, staff was very friendly, professional and helpful throughout my stay. Breakfast was pretty good. It was very busy, a lot of traffic through the lobby which caused the elevators to run very slow. Overall it was a great place to stay. Please book a room with a view though, otherwise you will be staring into someone’s office building or a brick wall

title: Great Visit! Thank you Lorena and Dinu!!
text: We had a great time staying at this hotel!! The staff was especially helpful.  Lorena specifically made us feel very welcome and helped us with multiple problems. Dinu also helped us by carrying our bags (there were a lot), giving us directions, and was especially kind!

title: A hot minute in Manhattan
text: This Embassy Suites is gorgeous, the staff are amazing and the location is perfect!  Dnu is the best and most helpful concierge I have ever met, everyone at the front desk is professional and friendly, especially Allen and Lorena.  This might be my go to Times Square hotel destination!

title: Great Location and Excellent Service
text: I'm a single mom traveling with two kids. The breakfast buffet in the morning is a great way to stay on budget and the location of the hotel made it easy to hit all of the iconic spots via walking and/or subway.

title: Central location, helpful staff, squishy pillows
text:
Neighborhood: Midtown, within a few blocks of Penn Station, subway, shops of Fifth Avenue and Koreatown, the New York Public Library, etc. Good views of the Empire State Building from the south-facing elevator lobby on each floor.

Verticality: Hotel floors numbered to 39 (this review describes my stay on the 32nd) with six rooms per floor and three guest elevators, which get busy during breakfast.

Room features: Hot water quick and plentiful. TV is a 48-inch Samsung, and the bedside clock has displays on three sides. Mini-fridge and microwave are in a desk-side cabinet, hence hidden in photos. The room safe (in the closet) is sized for a laptop. Large closet with plenty of hangers, and drawers are *beneath* the bed. Mind the bedframe; it's bulky, easy to stub your toes. Individual thermostat for fan and A/C; windows open for ventilation. Black-out curtains. Pillows are very squishy.

Amenities: Complimentary buffet-style breakfast has hot items (pancakes, sausages, etc.), cold cereals, fruit, many breads and pastries; extensive seating. The "Skylawn" rooftop patio is located on the south side of the building (i.e., facing away from the street) and is quiet/relaxing. 

Design flaws: Kohler-brand sink fixtures are a little weird (the drain plug is actuated by a switch on the back of the spigot), the sliding shower door is tough to move from the inside, not enough towel bars (bring suction-cup hooks). Bedside clock three minutes slow (guest can set alarm but not time). The lobby is a little cramped, what with pillars, seating, and guests loitering.

Hotel helpfulness and current conditions (July 2021): Upon check-in you're given a one-sheet summary of current amenities (floor and hours: breakfast, limited housekeeping, etc.). Initial allotment of towels was inadequate, but when I asked the front desk, Housekeeping showed up within a few minutes. Wifi was down for a day but the hotel called in their ISP immediately (suggestion: since *everyone* was asking, could've broadcast status to room phones). For the pandemic, there are signs in the elevators re: masks and distancing; staff and guests generally wear masks; the two bars are closed, but breakfast is extensive. Front desk can call a taxi. If using bell service, bags will be stashed in bell closet or the inactive lobby bar.

title: Great location and staff was great!
text: I would recommend this hotel. I will definitely return the next time I return to NYC. Staff was stupendous. It was a shame that the restaurants were closed due to covid. Breakfast was not the best. But location and staff will definitely have me return.

title: My stay
text: The room was very dusty , the plates at breakfast were supper dirty with dried up egg, I couldn’t park in the parking garage like planned and had to park in a different more expensive one 5 blocks away

title: Great place to stay in NYC!!
text: Perfect location to Times Square, Empire State Building, Moma, and Central Park.  Clean rooms, excellent hot and cold breakfast, great price. The hotel was clean and the rooms were very nice for the price.  We would definitely stay there again!!

title: BEST New York City hotel ever!!!
text: Our stay at the Embassey Suites was absolutely amazing! We were lucky to have won the winter giveaway and were so excited to use this as an opportunity to take our honeymoon that Covid-19 had cancelled.   This hotel is stunning! The entire hotel was clean, modern, and offered a great atmosphere. We stayed in a balcony room and the view was AMAZING!  We had the best experience from check in to check out. During check in we got to meet the hotel’s manager Julie Torres and she is so wonderful! She made our trip extra special and had a bottle of Prosecco waiting for us in our room! All the staff at the hotel (especially everyone at the front desk) were so friendly, welcoming, and helpful with whatever we needed! The hotel has an absolutely perfect location! It was close walking distance to everything we wanted to do like Time Square, Central Park, Grand Central Station, etc.  The hotel also has a delicious complimentary buffet breakfast. We also used the guides the hotel put together on their Instagram page to find some awesome restaurants (LouLou, Artichoke Basille’s Pizza, & Black Iron Burger). The guides were super helpful and everything they recommended was close to the hotel and had great food! We will 100% stay at this hotel again for our next trip to the Big Apple! Thank you Embassey Suites Manhattan for an unforgettable experience!

title: Unfortunately not as described
text: Shop around. This hotel was described as a great place when in fact is poorly maintained and the staff is not very concerned about you complaints. As if, they hear it all the time and there’s not much they can do about it.

title: Excellent customer service
text: The staff really shines here. Location is excellent to everything you want to experience in New York City. Everything is a short subway ride or walk. Staff is excellent , very hospitable and make sure you are comfortable. Hats off to the staff!

title: Not a fan.
text: This hotel was such a disappointment from start to finish. We arrived exhausted coming home from an oversees trip to spend a few days apartment hunting for our daughter. We had reservations for two junior suites that were not available at 3:45pm. (Checkin at 4 : I know I know rules are rules) Even though I paid for a view we were pooped so I asked them to put us in any available junior-suite which the front desk clerk did. They did not welcome me as a Lifetime Diamond and forgot to give our welcome gift. I was stunned to find out the bar and restaurant were not open as I specifically booked a hotel with in hotel restaurant as I knew we would be exhausted. Their pre arrival email did not mention it was closed and the app listed as open. One of the two rooms had a weird smell to the sheets, and the smoke alarm fell off the wall in the middle of the night. They then charged me $500 for smoking due to alarm falling off the wall (which left glass on floor on which my daughter cut her foot). I called the front desk each day to ask for housekeeping to come as instructed and the phone just rang and rang until it disconnected- this happened each time I called FD. I then approached front desk to ask them to take off $500 charge - the clerk met me with blind stare and told me I was charged due to smoking. I told him We do not smoke and that alarm fell if they would like to come inspect. He looked at his manager who looked at our account - wordlessly took it off no apology- assume he did as he saw our Diamond status. Many more smaller incidents to mention but last straw was that I received 0 points for my stay. Took me 2 calls to Diamond desk to get them credited. No thank you we will not be back.

title: Vacation to New York City
text: Upon arrival at this Embassy Suite, we saw a very average old looking hotel lobby.   The room was not at all comfortable. Housekeeping service was hit or miss.  I would not recommend this hotel to friends or family if they were going to New York City!

title: Hardest Work Staff, Piss Pour Management
text: I checked in during the mid week so I did not have this problem or the CEO of Hilton would have been on the phone.  1 staff member checking in people during the weekend.  People standing in line for THREE hours, for hour each night  Your vacation was over before you got your room key.  Pour guys at the front desk were catching hell but the manager was at home having dinner and could care less.  She even parks her care and it blocks the handicap ramp.  As a shareholder of Hilton A follow up letter is to each member of the Board of Directors.  This hotel is the STAIN of the HILTON BRAND.  Handicap ramp was always blocked with something.  One day it was laundry and the pick up service wanted to argue so I reeved up my scooter and boom it is now out of my way and laying in the street.  He was still yelling so I gave him something to yell about, HE WOULD GET IT WHEN HE GOT IT,  a person like that will never really get it.  Would have done the same with the mangers car if I could have moved it but she is blind to the problem or just does not care, I think both.  Also it not like your regular Embassy Suites, if you need that type of room you better book two room like we did.  It's New York City.  I have closets at home I could rent for $1000. 00 per night up there.

title: Embassy Suites
text:
The staff at Embassy Suites in New York were very friendly and helpful. They’re very efficient as well. 
The outdoor terrace was nice and relaxing.  The location is great! Very close to PennnStation/Moynihan Trail station,Times Square, and Empire State Building.

title: Great stay in a great location!
text: Perfect location to get a true NYC experience!  I had a great experience and great room....thank you Embassy Suites!!  I couldn't have asked for a more easier check in or appropriate room for what I needed for my business travel  Put your great location on top of your great service and you have a great stay!  Thanks for taking care of me!

title: Totally disappointed
text: I really like staying at embassy suites hotels until now. The rooms were extremely small like red roof inn it was very tight with just me and my wife. On top of that there are as hair all in the bathrooms

title: Dirty
text: Very disappointed. This hotel was not clean. We are not obsessive people about everything being perfect, but this was not okay. Everything was dirty, I mean everything! The floors in the lobby and elevator were never mopped the entire stay. Our room floors were also not cleaned prior to check in. They were hardwood and I’m Not sure they were even swept with a broom. We were very disappointed with the property. I’m a diamond member and travel often for work, and I have stayed in cheaper hotels that were cleaned than is one.

title: DISAPPOINTING!   SET YOUR PRIORITIES WHEN DECIDING ON A MANHATTAN HOTEL
text:
Incredibly inexpensive for Manhattan but you get what you pay for, it seems. There is a 25.00 per day urban charge, like a Resort Fee.  However, for that we were to have access to daily cocktail hour, a bar/ restaurant, an outdoor bar/ lounge deck, WIFI and daily housekeeping service. None available.  WIFI died half way into our stay.
in lieu of above we were to get 15.00 worth of items from the hotel store but that was almost empty containing only a few bags of peanuts and snacks., and they had the Gaul to pcharge us for that one day.  We disputed the bill and the fee was reversed.Breakfast was available at a tiny room with few tables.  We brought it to our room after waiting for elevators. It didn’t help that they closed a portion of the breakfast room for a private meeting removing even more seating space.
Front desk seriously understaffed.  Snaking lines at all hours and too busy to answer phones.  With no housekeeping we ran out of shampoo and soap.  Didn’t mind drying and reusing towels. An answered call to desk responded that someone would bring it up but never did.  I went to the desk at an odd hour and was able to get a shampoo.
many negative reviews have been responded to with the same lame excuse that they’re recovering from COVID and having troubles. I can understand that .  Think, if a restaurant had room for 100 patrons but only staff to serve 50 would they accept reservations for 100 or 50?  I guess the brand doesn’t care about repeat customers
The king size mattress was on a platform that was almost three inched bigger than the mattress.  The corners of that platform were covered by the bed covers.  The clearance between these corners and neighboring furniture and walls was about 12”.  I have some nice bruises on my shins.

In fairness, they packed a lot ( too much?) into a tiny room. There was virtually noplace to store anything. A tiny closet in the bathroom could not be closed unless the hangers were angled.  The bathroom itself was quite roomy and nice.  FUFU sink with no mechanism for removing the stopper other than placing your hands in the dirty water.  Excellent shower stall with good water pressure, though the doors may have been put on backwards.  The lighting and mirror were the best I’ve ever seen. In fact, all the lighting was great.  Additionally, there were more and better placed electrical outlets and USB ports than I’ve ever seen.

All in all, despite some excellent qualities, the room and experience were second class and it would be a long time before I ever returned., 
i

title: Nice staff
text: Our rooms were not available until 8PM because of cleaning issues. After traveling the whole day with 4 children it was awful to have to wait that long. The breakfast was good and the staff were friendly and nice but they were clearly overwhelmed.

title: Trying Hard
text:
I thought about rating this a 4, as they are trying their best to improve amidst covid and hiring struggles, however I felt that wouldn’t give a full picture.   Just know that things may improve in the near future. Every person I dealt with was obviously trying very hard and was quite pleasant. 

Pros: For NYC, the rooms are nicely sized and the views cannot be beat— we had the Empire State Building RIGHT outside our window. Additionally, they charge you $25 a day resort fee but you can use it as a credit toward snacks in the lobby pantry. In my experience, the front desk was swamped and never cared what we took. The staff is polite and hard working and trying very hard to get up to speed. The breakfast also seemed well rounded and the hotel is near good squares and parks for people watching or downtime.  Also room AC is great and many people wore masks. 

Cons: The hotel staff is SWAMPED and getting towels or other things takes hours. The AC in public areas is spotty and we often encountered very warm areas. Elevators are on the slow side and you need a room key to access them. The wifi went out during our visit, so that was challenging, and many features were closed, like the outside deck (maybe due to covid staffing?).   At breakfast there was an odd rule that you HAD to eat in the dining area, which made us nervous due to number of unmasked people. 

Tips:
Rooms that end in “09” have awesome views! If you need housekeeping things like towels, ask for them between check out and check in time as that is when it is least busy.  Definitely get your money’s worth of snacks (you DID pay for them). Also, join honors and you can check in online to skip the massive check in chaos downstairs.  Finally, if you are vegetarian be aware that the number of good restaurants in the area is slim. 

Overall, I’d say this is a perfectly good budget hotel for a quick stay. Go into it knowing that some things won’t be comfortable or run as usual due to covid and appreciate that the staff is trying hard.  If you are ok with that, you can’t beat the price. If you’d prefer more prompt attention and well rounded experience this probably isn’t for you.

title: Not ready for prime time yet. Don’t stay here yet. Wait until they properly staffed and offering full service again.
text:
People were waiting hours to check in. Staff was professional al but not properly supported by hotel management.

It was impossible to get any type of cleaning service without jumping through hoops. Trash was littering the hallways.

title: Great stay
text: Just as New York was opening up we spent an evening at this location. We were surprised to be served a hot meal as many locations around the Country you were lucky to get a bottle of water. The room was decorated nice just small but functional. My wife was happy to walk to Macy's.

title: No ROOMS available !!!!!
text: If i can give no star I would. we arrived after 6 hours drive and my parents 20 hours flight to be told there are no rooms ready right now as house cleaning are falling behind, that was 7 PM. Asked them when will it be ready they said we do not know when, and when asked for the manager to come talk to me, the girl at the front desk said "she left me alone here and it has been like that since 3pm when I started my shift." The lobby was stuffed with angry customers who do not know what to do. And when asked them to cancel the booking they said they will charge me one day stay for each room because cancellation is less than 24 hours notice. complete BS.

title: Not the usual service of an Embassy
text: I know we are in the next days after a Pandemic, but the hotel staff needs HELP. We arrived at 11am, check in was scheduled at 4pm. We came to the counter at 4pm, we were told at 5pm there were going to have our room ready. We arrived at 5:45pm. No room still and they didn’t have information of when it was going to be available. A really long line at the Front Desk. Finally,  after an exhausting wait of more than an hour manager came in apologized and offered a room. When we went upstairs they were NO towels in the room. We asked for them and they didn’t knew where they going to have them.  We had to take a shower without towels. I know things happens but according to other reviews this is something that happens often. This is not the expectations you have for an Embassy Suites. Location is great, but for your peace of mind go somewhere else.

title: It was alright
text: There were several issues - such as lacking staff members and cleanliness issues. The room was spacious and had a great view. Good location, close to many restaurants and attractions. Great walkability.

title: RIP OFF HOTEL, SNEAKY FEES, LYING STAFF MEMBER KENNY ASST. FRONT END MGR.
text: PLEASE WATCH these people ! They will charge you $15.00 per day for food store which had little to no food this past weekend and only junk food left. Coffee machine was not working as well.  Also watch out for " Urban destination Fee " on your bill for $25.00 another rip off , Front end mgr. Kenny said it would be removed and gave me update copy of final bill with it removed , then sneaked in $27.22 charge.   Please watch these people close they will steal your money , Please do not let them Rip you Off !!  This weekend they had VERY little food and drinks and what was left was ALL junk food ! STAY AWAY !!

title: Bait and Switch
text: Booked a trip for three of my business associates. Asked specifically if there was early check in for a fee-"There will be no problem" tell it like it is and then you don't sound desperate when you can't deliver. They are now walking around in 95 degree weather after traveling all day (totally embarrassing)Yes, I see the policy on the website but don't bait and switch. Really, My need for places for my associates to stay in NY will be huge in the next few years. Guess where they will not be staying.

title: If you like good service avoid this place
text: Absolutely horrible! I booked this hotel specifically because of my birthday. I wanted to come up to New York I haven't been there since the pandemic I wanted to come back do some shopping see some friends and family have a good time. I was experiencing issues with my card so I called Hilton Hilton directed me to the property and I spoke to somebody. I have no clue who I spoke to but I spoke to somebody who worked at the desk. They confirmed that I could come in and I could use an alternative form of payment. Fun fact, I recorded that phone call and I know one of their side they recorded it too just to protect myself so that there will be no confusion. I also informed them that I will be arriving late they told me it was okay. I get to the hotel late there is a gentleman behind the counter and he immediately starts barking orders at me as if I'm a child demanding for my name. He didn't even give me time to walk fully into the doors he's demanding that I tell him my name or I leave the building. So I asked him what's the problem and I give him my name. He does some clicking on the computer and tells me that I no longer have my guest here he gave my from to somebody else. That I should be more responsible adult and have money. I didn't know that's what we said to people who spend money at a place especially when I told them about my situation. He kept constantly telling me how he did not care he was very nasty and he was embarrassing me in front of two other gentlemen who were checking in. He boasted on how he gave my room up to one of them so I would have to sleep somewhere else either the train station he didn't care and when I didn't respond he started trying to talk to me as if I was a child demanding that I respond or acknowledge Him. I told this man I'm a grown woman I'm 30 years old not a child suddenly his little mood change especially when I told him that I recorded the phone call confirming from his coworker whoever they are that I could ride and pay with a different form of payment. The movement of indicated that I recorded the call he wanted to be friendly but mention the phrase that nobody even told him about any changes and because he has to do his audit sacrifices had to be made and I was one of them. As if this is some weird ritual. He wanted me to get away from him give him six feet he vocalize that. He expressed intense doubt that I was a Hilton Honors member and that I probably booked off of a third-party website I build my phone to him which I'm certain their cameras seen everything where I'm turning my phone and I'm showing him that I booked off the Hilton website and I'm currently using the Hilton app and he told me he didn't want to see it. It is now 2 in the morning I just came from Philadelphia I'm tired and very agitated. What took me over the edge was the fact that I had to rebook a room but I couldn't get the room originally picked which was room 1706 I had to book a junior suite. And I had to pay junior suite prices. I gave him the last four digits of my credit card number and he say when he has to do his second audit he will confirm all of my booking information would make me so angry was the fact that he said that at the time he does his second audit if my car does that work he would personally come into the room and kick me out with the police. I did not know this is what Behavior is at any Hilton property. I never even experiences at a Hampton Inn and now I'm experiencing this at Embassy Suite? This matter was supposed to be handled privately with management but apparently I'm not worth the time of day it has been five days since I checked out nobody has answered my call every time I call and I asked to speak to apparently somebody by the name of coral suddenly I'm either hung up on or put on hold until Oblivion and then I get a random voicemail so there you have it folks if you want to be treated like your garbage if you want your money and value as a paying customer to be diminished to next one non-existent level you should look your stay here. But! I will say the rooms are nice. The elevators are a little bit unreliable but the look of the hotel is nice by room was clean I didn't really need service for anything I tried my best not to get service for anything I didn't even accept his offer of a bottle of water after I got my room key and a threat

title: Worst Hilton stay
text: The worst Hilton stay I’ve had. Fire alarms blaring at 8am in the morning. Terrible room. No one picks up your call. Had to cut short my stay from 7 days to 1 day. Business traveller who is never coming back to this atrocity of a hotel. Save your money and go elsewhere.

title: COVID-19 changed this hotel not in a good way
text: This is my third stay in this hotel and first since COVID-19. I have to tell that it is different now than before. It looks like personell is so stretched that they don't pick up the phone and don't answer any questions. They don't clean rooms unless you requested 1 day in advance. We asked to get trash out and change towel at 9 am and it was not done until I asked for third time at 6 pm. Also, they charge you $25/day fee for something and you have to use $15 a day to buy junk food at their pantry. And there is nothing you can do about it. Also, I am Gold Hilton Member and they did not offer any water or snacks when we checked in. Breakfast is not the same as before. Less food options. Previously, when there was no evening reception, they would offer voucher in near bar. Now they just canceled this reception. On Sunday morning they decided to check fire alarm system and did not warn anybody... They only made announcement after my wife went from 36 floor to the lobby and told them about it. What else can I say! However, hotel is still in a very good location and you still can get a room with fantastic view.

title: Bad experience
text: This hotel is horrible. Bad service from the start. Problems checking in, staff really didn’t care about service. 3rd parking parking arrangements were as bad. Employees really didn’t care and just treated you with out a care in the world. I noticed at least 5-6 other guests with different problems while waiting to fix my check in issue.

title: Great location, but terrible hotel!
text:
Without a doubt, the only reason to stay at these Embassy Suites is the location. Close Times Square, subways, museums, and restaurants. 

The hotel right now is terrible: understaffed, no cleaning service ( even on request),no made-to-order breakfast, no left luggage space, not enough linens, towels or toiletries in the suite...

title: friendly & perfect location
text:
We just want to say Thank You for a Warm Welcome. ..  Your hotel staff are amazing and we really appreciate the help and level of service we received with every request and interaction.  Wille, David and Roberto and staff did not disappoint us.   From booking my reservation/information with David and checked in at the hotel with Willie and departing from the hotel by Roberto. 
All 3 gentlemen are friendly and professional. 
Embassy Suites at Times Square

title: Couples New York Trip!
text: The hotel was in a prime area in Times Square which allowed us to walk to many places, but the room was so much smaller than I expected…especially for the cost. There wasn’t even any tissue in our room when we arrived!! AND there were some hidden fees which I didn’t expect from the initial reservation!

title: Good location, acceptable quality
text:
We stayed at the Embassy suites Manhattan for four nights around Fourth of July. We booked before the Covid restrictions were lifted so got a very good rate. The hotel is very centrally located, near Herald Square and Times Square and within a short walking distance of several subway stops.  

The hotel itself is really not an embassy suites. The rooms are small, as almost all New York rooms are, and many of the typical Embassy suites amenities are not available.  Breakfast looks  pretty good, but the breakfast room was jammed and I still didn’t feel comfortable with that much of a crowd.  I am not sure I would’ve eaten breakfast even pre-pandemic given how crowded it was. 
Standard rooms are acceptable, with large TVs and a decent bed. Rooms on the northside have big windows but are right on the street. Rooms on the southside have smaller windows you seem to be quieter.Our southside room on the 14th floor had almost no street noise and the air conditioning noise was not too bad.  We also had a nice view of the Empire State building. 

I’ve seen recent reports of long lines at check-in, but we did not experience that nor did I see that other times.

title: The A/C goes off the whole night. Very RUDE management
text:
The room A/C has a motion sensor which located next to the door. When you slept at night, the A/C will go off the whole night and the room became very hot. 
I only had 4 hrs of sleep every day because of the heat.
The Front Desk Manager was extremely rude and unprofessional. She said “if you are not happy with the hotel, I can give you a no-penalty cancellation for the rest of the days. You go find another hotel.” I said it’s not my responsibility to find a hotel because Embassy Suite fail to meet my very basic requirements, which is be able to sleep at night. She said “I don’t know what do you want me to do, I feel like you already win. Because other guests are paying $200+ per night now and you are paying way less”.
She basically meant because I paid less than other guests so I should suck it up. I am very disappointed at Hilton and will never book their hotel again. I still don't understand why was it my responsibility to find another hotel and why should I being treated like I was a greedy person because I booked my trip 3 months ago when the fee was still very low.

title: Great location but poor service
text: We visited New York just a few weeks after the ease of COVID pandemic. We love NYC, so came back to visit. The location is great. The hotel is short staffed and has poor customer service. I have never stayed at this facility in New York City but have always had good experiences with prior stay at Embassy Suite in other locations in other states. Not sure if it was due to the pandemic that lots of staffs not returning to work???

title: Exceeded our expectations
text: When we visit New York we look for one of two types of hotels.  Either we go for the BIG and opulent grand experience or we go for a no frills room thinking that “eh, it is a room to sleep in” we are here to see the city, not stay in our room or the lobby.  So this time, we were here for the room, not the opulent experience.  Three nights at the Embassy Suites.  Clean, spacious (for Manhattan), speedy elevator, decent complimentary breakfast, free snacks,  it certainly met or exceeded everything we hoped for. At the front desk, Willy was so very helpful in answering any and all of our questions.  I would definitely return to this place.  We were able on the 30th floor to have an incredible view of the Empire State Building!

title: No soup on the room.$25 credit charge for 1 day
text: No soup in the room.1 shampoo and 1 conditioner was provided only.$25 credit per 1 day that is really hard to use because the snack station doesn’t have any good options.very unnecessary to charge $25 a day

title: ADA disabled room
text:
No storage for the luggage When you arrive early before 3:00 PM before check-in.
And you need to ask for room service the day before to get your room service 
and you get after 8:30pm
Rolling shower small.

title: Waited over an hour to check in
text: Waited over an hour to get checked into the hotel. When we finally got to the front desk we were told that the room was not cleaned and had to wait an additional 20 min. We are Diamond members too and they showed no urgency at the front desk. Check-in for the embassy was at 4 PM and we were there at 7 PM. Had to push back dinner plans because of the poor service and under staffed. We booked the room in advance online but still took forever to check-in. Not recommended if you’re with family or friends and want to explore the city.

title: Stained room
text: It looked like someone threw up on the cushions and curtains. They cleaned but the stain was still there. The wall was also dirty.  We did not complained because we were there for a short time and it looked like it was cleaned but you can still see the stains. They should have replace the curtain and cushions.

title: Understaffed
text: I arrived early in the day and was able to drop off my luggage. I returned around 330 to see if if could check in and was told my room would be ready in a few minutes and to have a seat. The “ few minutes “ turned out to be 2 hours. I was seeing people who came in after me getting their rooms.  When we finally got into our room I found 1 large towel, a face cloth and hand towel, for two people!!!!!!!  I requested more towels around 8 and no one ever came.  I requested towels the next morning, again at 4, 7pm and again at 930!!!  I was then greeted at the door with two towels!!! I explained this is not going to be enough.  I received a call saying they were out of towels!!!  How is that even possible!!!!  I understand with Covid and being understaffed, but possibly the hotel should not consider booking to full capacity.  The hotel is also very hot!  The lobby and the breakfast areas I felt had no AC on at all. The hotel was clean, breakfast was ok, they just need to work on their customer service skills. If you are planning to stay here in the next few weeks, I overheard staff saying they are booked full. Be prepared for long check in lines, possibly no towels and a hot hotel.

title: Highly Recommend!
text:
Everything was perfect! Great experience. No stress, everything worked, was clean. Great staff, thoughtful layout of rooms, perfect location.

What a pleasant surprise! Overall highly recommend with nothing to complain about! Glad we found it!

title: Embassy Times Square 👍🏻
text: Property is clean and well maintained. Staff is helpful and friendly and the location is perfect. Breakfast is delicious and easy to obtain. View of rooftop seating area is lovely. Would stay at this location again.

title: Totally not what they say they are
text: Got to the hotel and they charged me way more than was quoted to me in emails and wouldn’t tell me what they were putting on my card. Then when I questioned the cost they lied to me. Also the bathroom was not cleaned very well as there were hairs in the shower and one in the sink. They claimed to be in Times Square but we’re about 8-10 blocks from Times Square!

title: Not a Suite....
text: We booked this hotel because we wanted the space and are used to Embassy SUITES but at arrival about 15 to 4pm we were told we had to wait until 4pm but he took my CC and check me in. but I still had to wait 15 min. We gave him our luggage and he gave us a ticket and he stick the other ticket on the suitcase which we are still not able to take it off... When we finally got our ROOM it was so small and it was not a SUITE. The view was nice.  As far as been clean and disinfected not even close.  Just because you put a sticker on the door it does not mean the it was clean (hair on the floor, an old ticker was left by the bed one he floor next to a blue pill :-), the side table was dirty.  The breakfast was a disappointment  and the are was dirty too. The only one good thing about the hotel is the location.

title: Jackie G
text: David Beckles @ front desk was awesome💯 He went above and beyond expectations. The only gripe I had was about 2hrs after check in, I think he is from the maintenance dept, opened the door without knocking 1st. He apologized and quickly left without telling me who he was. Other than that incident everything was great.

title: The Sofa Bed is a SQUARE!!!
text: I don’t even think an elf can fit in the sofa bed. The room is smaller than a broom closet and I almost died on the taxi drive here. I know that the cab ride isn’t the hotels fault but it’s a been a long day and I forgot to take my antidepressants.

title: Missed the Mark for this Chain
text: We requested room to be cleaned every day of our stay. This never happened even after multiple calls to the front desk and actual visits.  All hotel bars and restaurants were closed although everything in the city was open so no reception and no onsite dining.  Breakfast was abbreviated with no made to order.  Food was lackluster at best a d they were out of OJ for most of our stay.  The complementary allowance for the pantry was a nice gesture- not sure if for all or just honors members but $7 for a Gatorade, please.

title: As good as it can get in midtown Manhattan in covid times
text: We stayed at Embassy Suites Times Square in mid May 2021, around the time that covid restrictions were relaxing in New York City after the vaccination drive in the US. The hotel had reasonable covid-related rules in place (mask required in common areas), restaurant closed, providing a collection point for food deliveries from external restaurants, but they also provided several amenities as best as they could in the circumstances. The breakfast spread was great, though it is in an indoor dining location and can get somewhat crowded in the morning; the hotel staff were ok with guests taking their breakfast plates to their rooms though, so I guess they were being flexible. Finally, we had booked a room with "view", and they did not disappoint on that - we had an amazing view of the Empire State building out our window! Plus the place is close to Penn Station, so taking the train into NYC wasn't a problem

title: Mrs. Andrea G
text: At Embassy suites by Hilton at time square didn’t began with the right foot, but Anthony took over the situation and made our stay truly enjoyable. He made us feel special, important and well taken care off. Sometimes mistakes can happen and when someone as professional and capable as Anthony can turn things over to the better. I hope the company appreciates him and sees in him an enormous potential, any service company would be grateful for someone like him. Thank Anthony for making our 7 day stay at your property an enjoyable one.

title: No laundry room
text:
The main reason for a two-star review is that this embassy suites has no laundry facilities. a coin operated laundry room is fundamental to a long stay hotel.

The smallest embassy suites room on the planet. The room was reasonably comfortable, although nothing about the room was a suite. And the room looks absolutely nothing like the online photos.

WiFi barely fast enough to use Google maps. 

Staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

title: Great mid-town location
text: We had an excellent stay... Courteous hotel staff, very clean and updated hotel room, generous free breakfast, a perfect mid-town location within easy walking distance of many attractions.  Lots of great restaurants close-by.  We were disappointed that the outdoor seating spaces and gym were still closed due to COVID restrictions but that was not the fault of the hotel.  We would definitely stay again.

title: New York
text:
The Rooms were great and view from the room was excellent.
Breakfast was fair
Elevators were slow
