We were told rooftop deck was closed yet there were people on it every night, we were just unable to utilize it.

title: Worst experience in New York City...Details below
text:
It's certainly not that my expectation was too high.  I didn't expect much, only the usual Embassy Suites treatment--that's why we booked this hotel.  It failed in almost way.

The night we checked in, there was only one person at the front desk.  He was busy answering phone calls, while three parties were waiting, for more than 15 minutes.  Once we got into the room and found that something was missing, we called the front desk and no one answered.  We had to call more than 5 times in a 40 minutes span (finally answered by the same front desk guy) to get our supplies delivered.  So the whole Embassy Suites only has one person working on the service/check-in/front desk duty on a Friday night?  Unbelievable!

The room is small, which is understandable.  But they called this room "Junior Suite" and charged a premium when it's smaller than a regular hotel room?  Come on!  Even worse, the room, despite having the sticker on the door saying "cleaned and sanitized," was dirty when we got in.  There is dust all over the place, crumbs on the floor, and the phone headset was very sticky to touch.  There is no way that the room was thoroughly cleaned before we checked in.

On the second day, we called front desk and asked for housekeeping service.  We were then told that it has to be arranged the day before!  OK, then right there we asked for housekeeping service on the following day.  the manager wrote it down, but of course they never came!  So for the three nights, we never got the trash taken out or room cleaned (despite putting in the requests); all we could do is to request new towels!  Then to make things worse, on the day we're checking out, housekeeper knocked on the door at 8 am in the morning!  So they never wanted to clean our room during our stay but wanted to clean the room on our checkout day BEFORE we check out? Ridiculous!

I went to the "limited service" breakfast and was completely disappointed.  It was truly limited; there was really not a whole lot of items.  (It's good that other guests told me that I could ask for yogurt and bananas, which were not present.)  The toaster were broken, and the server just shrugged his shoulders and said "yes, it is."  Then at 10:15 the servers came out and cleaned up.  By 10:20, everything was gone, including coffee!  A woman came in then to ask for something to eat and was told they're closed, fully 10 minutes before the published closing time of 10:30!  I have NEVER seen anything like this, let along in an Embassy Suites!  I never bothered to go to the breakfast again during my stay.

We did get a room to sleep for three night in a good location, but that's about it.  I can't think of ANYTHING good about our stay.  This is truly a very disappointing experience.

title: Fun
text: We had a great stay at the Embassy Suites! Arrived early & exhausted from a long trip. Stephanie greeted us and allowed us to check in early without hesitation, she was very kind and compassionate. That really meant a lot. The rooms are small (it’s NYC!) but very nice (windows open! Clean carpet free flooring! Fridge and microwave!). Breakfast was good and location is great :)

title: Great stay!
text: Our room with the view was fantastic! It was definitely worth the splurge. I came here on a quick weekend trip to NYC. Everything was clean and very nice staff. Definitely would recommend to anyone! And close to a subway for easy getting around.

title: Horrible
text: I wish I had words that would be sufficient to explain the absolutely terrible stay that I had at this location.  Having traveling internationally for business for 20 years I’ve experienced a plethora of hotels.  This was the worst-worst service, worst room, worst everything.  Run away!

title: Value for money
text: Great location. Courteous staff at front desk and other service areas.   Questionable cleanliness in rooms… found other peoples clothes, stains on comforter and chairs. Excellent value for money. Good breakfast, would benefit from some type of traffic flow system in breakfast area.

title: Good hotel
text: Stayed here for 3 nights. Room was decently clean and had an okay view. Bathroom didn’t have a fan and room would smell kinda mildew-y after after coming back from being out all day. So we would leave our window open during the day. Extremely small room, and difficult to move around even with only 2 adults and a toddler. Very odd elevator encounters at night, mostly drunk people stumbling around and not remembering where their rooms are and making weird suggestive comments to other guests. Breakfast was awesome and the hotel staff was extremely nice and helpful! Close to the subway and restaurants, stores which was nice!

title: Great room great stay
text: Clean room, great staff, we came in and the room was cute. Not too small and I liked the sectioning with the little couch and tv. Almost like a little living room. We were able to check in early so we could drop our bags and explore the town a bit. I will definitely stay here and their other locations again

title: Dirty Rooms But Great Location
text: When we arrived, the room was not clean. Bring your cleaning supplies. The staff was good and the location is great. For breakfast, arrive early because they do not cook much. The staff was really nice and housekeeping responds when you call for towels and other things.

title: Nice and clean Hotel
text: Pretty nice and clean hotel we enjoyed the experience, good breakfast and good customer service, it has a good location, plenty of stories, restaurants is close to everything in Manhattan, nice view from the room we love it

title: Hotel to choose in the Times Square area!
text:
Great hotel, great workers, great location, simple! 

:) 

Couldn’t be in a better location.

Felt comfortable, clean, well maintained and friendly. I would highly recommend this property to any & everyone

title: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square- PERFECT & HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!
text: I’m extremely satisfied with my recent  Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square stay experience. The property was very modern and well designed, impeccably clean, spacious, and ideally located. The Front Desk Associate (Diana) was professionally phenomenal and a perfect Hilton global brands representative! Overall, I’m both impressed and grateful for my recent stay at the Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square. It was perfect, I would highly recommend it, and I look forward to a future visit!

title: Covid-19 Interruption of Breakfast and Evening Reception
text:
I may cancel my upcoming May 2021 reservation due to these two renown amenities being canceled and replaced by a $25 fee that is supposed to be "credit" for snacks at the "Pantry."   I cannot find an explanation of this arrangement and do not know how to manage a healthy diet without the breakfast spread.
- Senior citizen coupe (Retired Military Family)

title: Best Hilton Hotel I’ve Stayed At
text: The Embassy Suites Times Square was incredibly clean, quiet and accommodating. Their strict COVID cleaning schedules and over-the-top friendly staff made my trip a 10/10. My search for a favorite hotel in Manhattan is complete.

title: Not very clean
text: I requested an early CHI, and my experience might be linked to this however there’s not excused, especially with our current pandemic situation to place someone una room that has. It been cleaned to standards (see pictures). I am not a clean freak and didn’t mind the hairs, the old toothpaste on the sink but what got me was when I got up this morning, due  of the limited services they are only doing cleaning if requested and since I am only here for two days (0422-0424) I didn’t want service, so when I got up I was making my bed and saw this huge black stain on the comforter. It game me goose bumps knowing that I slept on this bed with this stain on it, was it changed from previous guest? I don’t know.

title: Room not thoroughly cleaned...
text: Room had items from the previous guest in the closet. They moved my room but couldn’t understand why I was upset. I spent the entire first day in a room that wasn’t cleaned properly. How can I believe that they  did i thorough job when the closet had a dress and four boxes of shoes in it.

title: Muy buen servicio
text: Muy buen servicio, habitaciones limpias, el desayuno no fue lo que esperaba pero tengo entendido que es por la cuestión de la pandemia, solo eran waffles, donas, pan dulce, cereal, café, jugo en caja y era el mismo desayuno los 8 días que estuve

title: Business
text: Well informed and courteous staff. Bed was very comfortable and hotel was clean. Location was ideal for business trip and the price and value was exceptional. I would stay here again as felt the overall stay was excellent

title: Great location and hotel
text: I read a lot of reviews and decided to go with this hotel. I am very glad we did. The location is perfect!  Close to 2 subways, eating options close by.  A good walk to central park and a short walk to Times Square.  I took my son by myself so I wanted a safe area, and I felt this met the requirement.  With covid, the patio and food isn't totally open, but they do their best and give you a 15 dollar a day credit for their small store. this is great to grab some drinks or snacks. The rooms are clean and I like that there are only about 6 rooms on a floor.

title: Отвратительный опыт. Бегите, если хотите спать ночами.
text:
Начну с того, что в номерах при заезде очень грязно. По всему полу валялась грязь, волосы, чипсы. Попросили на 5 день убраться. Естественно никто не пришел.
Но, это не самое ужасное. 
 Прямо под нами номера с балконами. Под нами заселились какие-то дети. И орали всю ночь, громко играла музыку, и что самое ужасное-они курили марихуанну. Я беременна, и у меня бронхиальная астма. Мне нельзя дышать травой.
Мы раз десять звонили на рецепшн. С третьего раза к ним пришел мужчина, видимо попросил быть потише. Естественно, никто тише не стал. По-прежнему кричали, буянили, пили. Мы стали звонить опять! Попросили переселить нас в другой номер.
Я не понимаю, почему мы за свои деньги должны не спать????
Отвратительная работа персонала.
Надо было ходить до тех пор, пока они не перестанут шуметь. Но, на рецепшн людям было все равно. Никто не извинялся.

Не советую приезжать сюда, тк вашими проблемами заниматься не будут.
Элементарно, не могут убрать номер.

Желаю всем приятной поездки в НЙ. Очень надеюсь, что с вами не приключится такой проблемы.

title: Dumpster
text: The hotel was not clean. In the hallway leading to our room the floor looked like it hadn’t been swept in weeks. There were garbage cans outside of the doors. I’m assuming because it’s hard to have your room cleaned now because the hotels are understaffed and blame COVID for not cleaning daily. The hallway also had a pungent odor of marijuana despite it being a smoke free building. I guess marijuana is ok with them. The room itself was unkempt and the pull away sofa bed was wafer thin and I had to take it upon myself to get linens because once again no room staffing due to COVID. The windows looking outside couldn’t have been cleaned in the last five years maybe 10. You could barely see the great city of New York. This place is an absolute dumpster and I will never return. I had to switch to a Marriott property to get proper service.

title: One of the best hotels for an affordable price
text: Despite I have stayed just one night, I can definitely recommend to consider this hotel if you’re visiting NYC. The location of the hotel couldn’t be better! Employees are super sweet and helpful. And the room had everything what I could like to have for my stay. Definitely will come back again.

title: Great
text: Everything was great food location close to time square a lot of food easy to get in and out of hotel I would stay here again staff does a great job rooms are fine I stayed by myself and I felt safe even if you’re staying with your family or a large group I’d still recommend you can’t go wrong here

title: Overall very Happy
text: I was very happy with the service and how clean the room was .. the room was a little small but other then that very happy location was amazing. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone trying to explore New York 😊

title: My bedroom was dirty!
text: On my bedroom I find a gum on the floor, it had something dark like pup on the walls of the shower, the floor was sticky, and also the sheets had and stained. Also it’s better to book through apps, because I called the hotel to add one more night and they made me cancel my booking am with booking.com that was cheaper and the guy told me a different total price, when I arrived they told me it is a Mandatory fee and bla bla 🙄 then they voided because nobody told me about that before

title: Best customer service and views! Amazing! Stay here!
text: Wow! It’s been a long time since I received such kind and caring customer service at a hotel.  I have traveled the world and this experience was one of the best. My daughter and I arrived at around 8 am after delays from AZ and we’re exhausted. We planned on storing our luggage and wandering the city until check in at 4. Nope! Much to our surprise Coral took perfect care of us...and more importantly my teenage daughter who was in the city for her first time. We were able to get into our room right away and had the most perfect view of the Empire State Building. Not sure if Coral knows what this meant to us! Thank you...you made our trip magical. This hotel is in a great location and we will be back! My daughter loved the snacks available downstairs. Stay here if you want to be taken care of in the heart of the city.

title: Nice Hotel near times Square
text: This hotel is a few blocks form the Empire State Building and the heart of Times Square. The hotel was clean and practiced the proper safety protocols for Covid. The staff was pleasant and helpful. You can walk to the heart of times square in about ten minutes

title: Lieutenant
text: Dahiana is an excellent manager. She always goes above and beyond to make sure that my stay is problem free and enjoyable. Dahiana is always pleasant and extremely helpful.  She is a real asset to embassy suites.

title: Excelente Hotel encantando
text: Increíble lugar, excelente ubicación, muy limpio, impecable la habitación y con todas las normar de seguridad de Cobi19 que es muy importante en esto tiempo. Pero lo mejor que tiene el hotel es las atenciones de Antony e de Dahiana.

title: Great Customer Service!!
text: Great hotel. And fantastic customer service by Diana. she values Hilton members and makes sure that your stay is top-notch. So I will be back very soon and thanks for the excellent service. Embassy Suites, keep up the fantastic job!!

title: Amables
text: Mi llegada fue a las 7pm aproximadamente el dia 23, la recepcionista me atendió muy super amable. Todos los empleados que pude hablar saben hablar español (por si no sabes inglés). Cuarto según descripción con vista a la ciudad. Lo único malo fue el desayuno a eso le doy 1/5 estrella.

title: Fantastic stay in Midtown - Great Spot
text: We visited NYC to see the annual holiday decorations during pandemic. Junior king suite with view was $119 Honors rate. $25 mandatory fee too but gave us a credit in the market cafe. Terrific location between 5th & 6th. Very quiet entrance. Friendly welcoming staff. Easy check in. Room is tight but the pullout sofa made for a double bed. Front desk had someone come to the room to make up the sofa bed. Two TVs. Comfortable king bed. Lots of phone chargers. Fridge and microwave and safe. Decent sized bathroom with large walk-in shower. Very quiet floor. Quick elevator. All Covid rules. No hot breakfast - bagged to-go (yogurt, granola bar, fruit cup, bagel, waffle, OJ, water). Neither lounge/bar was open. Would stay again.

title: Coral Castillo
text: Day two of the three day trip from Boston to New York there was no parking spots for my Usv outside the hotel and with 5 kids all tired and my wife being tired Coral Castillo helped us with the parking. She was also very friendly. This not only helped us be at ease with the car but it also showed us that they are willing to help people who stay at their hotel. Thank you Carol Castillo!!

title: Outstanding experience!
text: I stayed at the Embassy Suites by Hilton NY times square and could not have been happier with my visit. The room was extremely clean and tidy, not too mention very roomy and cozy.  The service at the hotel could not have impressed me more, from the door person to the front desk, housekeeping, and management. Everyone was so welcoming and going out of their way to make my stay feel like a true home away from home.

title: Overall good
text: The hotel is quite new and the rooms are well appointed with the bathroom and most of all the walk-in shower really well designed. Good lighting and room layout as well as very comfortable beds. Anthony at the front desk was extremely courteous and accommodating as I wasn't completely satisfied when I first checked into my room. Location of the hotel is great near Penn Station for all subway lines and trains to jfk. A few things to improve on: housekeeping knocked on and opened my door at 6:10am during my last day, waking me up. This should not happen regardless. There was a constant noise coming from the AC riser, even while the AC was turned off. Either upgrade the breakfast boxes to a higher quality or discontinue all together. Overall I would stay here again and recommend to my friends and colleagues.

title: Horrible
text: I see that they are letting the homeless stay in 5 star hotels which is no longer running as even a four star hotel, my son got bite up by some kind of spider from sleeping on the pull out sofa, they also said a hot breakfast comes complimentary but in stead they gave us a bagged breakfast which they pass out to the homeless which has a bagel orange juice. Y’all need to disclose this info before ppl stay there and are actually paying !

title: Coral is the best!  Also, the hotel is good too. :)
text: So, first of all, the hotel:  we had a "suite" (for very cheap, btw - upgrade if you can).  It's not very big but cleverly divided into two "rooms."  My husband and I were both able to work without bugging each other.  The view was extraordinary of the east side of Midtown, and in particular, the Empire State two blocks away.  Bryant Park, one of the most beautiful parks in the city is also only two blocks away - the rest of the neighborhood is Midtown, so not so charming, but central.  The bed was GREAT and totally silent room with a great shower.  But the highlight was Coral.  We are in town from Chicago for a few weeks to visit out daughter who lives in Harlem and is sick. Our airbnb doesn't open until tomorrow, so we stayed here.  In addition to that stress and worry (during Covid), I am a teacher and teaching remotely (8th grade!), and was struggling to find a place to teach all day today.  Coral (front desk) seemed to intuit the stress and worry we were under and COMPLETELY took care of us in the most gracious way.  She gave us a late check-out so that I could teach, and when she first saw us this morning she called out "Good morning 2707 (our room number)!"  How she remembered that I have no idea.  Anyhow, she was the bright spot we really needed to start this time with our kid and all the unknowns.  Thanks, Coral - you really took care of us more than you'll know. :)

title: Amazing welcome at Embassy Suites Times Square!
text:
Coral at Embassy Suites front desk was sooooo awesome!  When she heard it was our 12 yr old daughters first visit to Manhattan, she went out of her way to put us in an room with an amazing view!   Our 17th floor balcony room had THE MOST incredible views, it was spectacular to sit out there at night and see all the lights and Breathtaking views!
Hotel location was great too,  Close to everything and well maintained.
Thank you Coral for going above and beyond,  it was a stay we will always remember!

title: Dirtiest hotel I have ever been
text:
We got in the city really late with a little toddler. After searching multiple hotels we saw this one. Called the front desk the lady seemed really nice. So booked 1 night to give it a try. I am so glad I only got 1 night. 
The first room we got, the toilet seat has dirty stuff on it, to make sure it wasn’t some brown residue, we used a wet napkin wiped it, It was so gross and it fell right off. I couldn’t stand the thought of a dirty toilet, especially a gross toilet seat. what if someone had stds just used it...and it is clearly not even been cleaned at all.  The front desk lady was very nice and helpful and she gave us a different room. Oh man, the second room doesn’t have a Dirty toilet issue, the sofa has white stain and nasty stuff on it, the part you pull to lock the door from inside literally has white sperm looking sticky thing covers it....I can go on with a list all day, but seriously in the middle of a night with a tired toddler, I am here. 
The front desk lady was nice and kind, but I don’t think anyone is cleaning this hotel. With the same rate, you can stay somewhere clean and safe for you and your family.

title: Great stay!
text:
My favorite ES!!! Happy hour and hot breakfast is perfect. Best location-near Macy’s but walkable to Time Square. My favorite place to stay in NYC. 
Staff is friendly and we were able to store our luggage prior to check in and head to ground zero.

title: Love It!
text:
Our stay was really good. Coral(manager) was awesome. She put us in a great room with a view of the empire state building. She was kind, informative & her customer service was perfection.
*I promise I don't work for the company & I don't know Coral personally...lol
A few weeks ago we stayed at another Hilton property in the Manhattan area & our service was very poor for the quality of the Hilton brand so this stay was refreshing.

title: Coral Saved Me! + Night Manager Rocks
text:
Coral saved me!
Aug 4-6, During Covid, plans changed. Despite Diamond, other Hilton’s turned me away. However night shift manager/lady accommodated me. 

When repair/issues occurred, Coral expedited repairs/solutions, even my weird schedule/food.

At check out Coral assisted with logistics and alleviate stress by accommodating me. Coral even helped me procure a last minute bottle for a hostess gift for my next destination.

It was a happy accident I stayed at this embassy suites and I plan to stay there again.

Thanks
-L Smith

title: Adjoining Rooms - Great for family trips!!
text: We had a great stay!! Great views of the city. Polite staff (Coral and Stephanie) and great service!! Beautiful lobby and great views of the Empire State Building from our room. Parking is connected to the hotel. In the city with easy access to everything, especially for folks that love to walk to everything. #5Stars

title: Extremely Memorable Experience
text:
We were on day 3 without power after the damn tropical storm and COVID had already ruined plans we made for my girlfriends birthday. I decided that we needed a break from the heat and burned up some of my Hilton Honors points at this hotel. 

We were greeted by Coral and helped get us to our room right away. When we got there I realized that it didn't seem to fit with the description of the room I booked so I went back down to try to clear up the mistake. Coral seemed a bit surprised to see me so quickly and when I told her about the mix up she asked me to just wait a minutes in lobby while she took care of it. It was clear she up to something. 

She walks back over a few minutes later and says "I see in the reservation notes that it's someone's birthday. I guess everything happens for a reason, please enjoy your new room and I sent a little something up to your room to help you celebrate".

I guess when I came back down she was in the middle of having a bottle of wine sent up to the room and I almost ruined the suprise. We went to the new room which had an unbelievable balcony and view of the Empire State Building. I was so close to picking one of the smaller boutique hotels and I'm glad I didn't. Coral at the front desk truly made our little one night getaway an unforgettable one. 

I don't think our treatment was because I am a diamond member either. I believe that Coral saw an opportunity to make our unfortunate situation better, and she did. If you ever read this, thank you again Coral!

The hotels location was amazing. We didn't get to experience all that it had to offer because of COVID precautions, but it was a fantastic escape for two locals from Queens. 10/10.

title: Goede locatie, lekker ontbijt en heerlijke zachte bedden.
text:
Ik heb afgelopen november een aantal nachten in dit hotel geslapen. Het personeel dat achter de receptie stond was vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Het hotel ziet er modern maar sfeervol uit, vooral de 'waterval' in de receptie is indrukwekkend. 

Er is een leuke bar en in de middag kun je een aantal uur gratis drankjes en hapjes nuttigen, dat is erg welkom in een prijzige stad als New York! Zo kan je even bijkomen van de dag vol indrukken voordat je 's avonds weer de deur uit gaat. De metro zit om de hoek dus je kunt hier gemakkelijk gebruik van maken, maar ook lopend is er genoeg te beleven. Zo loop je snel richting the Vessel, the High Line en andere omliggende bezienswaardigheden.

De kamers zijn fris en schoon. De badkamer ziet er goed uit en de kamer voelt heel fijn. De kamers zijn niet ontzettend groot, maar dat heb je eenmaal in New York. Je hebt in ieder geval genoeg ruimte om op een normale manier je koffer neer te zetten en nog door de kamer te bewegen. 

Als ik nog een keer naar New York ga, weet ik wel waar ik zou overnachten!

title: Fantastische locatie en hotel! Een rustpunt midden in hectisch New York
text: De ontvangst was heel hartelijk en professioneel, de kamer brandschoon en modern en sfeervol ingericht. Een heerlijk ontbijt elke ochtend is inbegrepen, en dan ook nog 's middags een gezellige borrel met snacks! Waar vind je dat?

title: This was a great visit to NYC
text:
This hotel have an adorable entrance,Coral(the girl on the reception) was very welcoming and gave us an amazing room on the 21st! Floor with the Empire State Building view! She also done an early check in which we really wanted,because we were super tired after a long drive. 

So far highly satisfied!

title: Thanks
text: One of the best hotels I have stayed in ever I highly recommend you stay there if you need a hotel in the city the staff is nice and makes sure your stay is as smooth as possible and the rooms are amazing

title: Great customer service family friendly
text: Great customer service was provided to me and my family during my stay. Carol and Patricia was very helpful and professional during my check in and during my stay provided me with information about my charges and services provided

title: Stay in NYC
text: We love this hotel for my daughters birthday. They had a great time and they liked the hotel.  The host Dahiana was amazing. I will stay here again. I give her five stars.Central in midtown Manhattan  NYC

title: Great stay
text: We all had a blast the Embassy Suites. My daughters birthday was every thing she wished for. The staff was exceptionally wonderful especially the front desk Clerk Dahiana helped us out from arrival to departure. I'm definitely coming back and recommendations will be given out about this establishment

title: I love embassy suites!!!
text: Room was beautiful and the balcony was amazing!! Great view!!!! Will definitely return. Dahiana was so helpful and made me feel right at home. Definitely created memories that will last a lifetime. Thank you

title: Amazing stay
text: Had a wonderful time very spacious rooms, modern amenities, and great customer service. Lots of restaurants and bars in close proximity to the hotel. Our receptionist Dahiaha was amazing. Would DEFINITELY come back again.

title: Fantastic
text: There is not enough praise that i can give to the staff at the Embassy Suite. From being incredibly supportive, friendly and and utmost professional, they made a stay during trying times feel like being at home. Ms Castillo and Ms Dontis and all the staff went above and beyond to make my stay as pleasant as it could be. Room was always clean and privacy was honored.  The location is very convenient to subway and dining, and staff always helpful with suggestion on what to do in a city that was locked down. I can not thank them enough for all they do.

title: Stay at embassy suites
text: Absolutely great hotel with the best staff who go above and beyond with customer service. Credit mainly goes to Dhiana for her hospitality, understanding and good nature that made my stay that much better.

title: Stay in NYC
text: I stayed here with my boyfriend. We had such a good stay. It started off crazy but ended the best. He and I just wanted to have a good time in NYC. We were not expecting the niceness from Dahianna and Patricia

title: Friendly Accommodating Staff
text: This hotel made sure first responders had what they needed to stay safe during demonstrations. The staff kept us  well fed, cleaned our rooms and room cleaning was phenomenal! I would recommend this hotel. Parking was easy and Chick Filet is right across the street. Close to Times Square.

title: Great stay
text: The people working were very friendly and helpful. When something was wrong with my room they gave me a new room that was even better and gave me no hassle. It’s in walking distance to times square and bryant park.

title: Get Away Weekend
text: Came up to NYC. For an Anniversary weekend. Wasn't expecting much but the team at the Enbassy Suites New York Manhattan Times Square made it feel like home.  While practicing safety it made us feel like the "old days" I will stay here always. Coral is a super star, her amazing grace and customer service is beyond. Every body should have a person in their team like her.

title: Best staff ever
text: I stayed in this hotel for 3 days. Everyone was so nice and helpful. The location was convenient and the room was rather large for NYC. Patricia and Stephanie were the best. A few more words.. if you have to chose this is it.

title: Excellent stay
text: Clean and comfortable room with a great view. I traveled here to assist NYU hospitals with COVID-19 influx, so i payed special attention to the cleanliness of the hotel. The location is also convenient as you are close to just about everything. Diana and all other staff made the place feel like home away from home.

title: Awesome wonderful friendly staff, very safe during Covid / post Covid
text: Absolutely friendly and dedicated staff while maintaining appropriate social distancing measures. We stayed here for 4 days preparing for our move into an apartment. Patricia and Stephanie went above and beyond all expectations. From daily packaged breakfast bag to a cheerful hello when we returned late each nite.. they made our stay feel homely. When Patricia learned that this move was in connection with a new job opportunity in the city, she was so happy to welcome us into NYC, give some tips and a bottle of bubbly. We were totally taken aback with her hospitality and warmth. Will surely recommend this place to anyone looking for a comfortable stay.

title: Great friendly wonderful staff
text: I have stayed here for over a month and the best part about my stay is the staff. Everyone is extremely helpful and friendly. Seriously love them!!Everything is very well maintained and stocked. Our room has a great view of the empire state building. The location is very convenient.

title: Best staff.
text: I came to NY to help with COVID as a medical provider and stayed here. The staff was amazing. The most hospitable people to stay with. Rooms were clean and I had a great view of the empire state building.

title: Mark schneider
text: Had a fantastic stay. The staff was amazing! During the Coronavirus pandemic staff was still available to help with anyone need even though I'm sure they were short staffed. I would highly recommend staying here and would come back here first anytime I'm in the area.

title: Best hotel in New York!
text: I'm here for the COVID crisis response working as a nurse practitioner. I've stayed at 3 different hotels and this location is by far the best! I love the decor, cleanliness, staff, and view. I also like the elevated bed! Lol. And Im located in the center of it all! Special shout to Patricia, Stephanie, and Coral!!

title: Amazing stay!! Highly recommend!
text: I am a nurse practitioner arrived from Iowa to help out in the frontlines of the COVID crisis response in April but ended up switching hotels. I arrived in the month of May and was pleasantly greeted by the hotel staff, Coral.  Check in was a breeze and the rest of the stay has been nothing sheer of amazing!  I’ve spent almost 2 months here for my COVID assignment and will be leaving July 8th. The staff, Patricia, Diana, Vanessa and Stephanie has treated me with the utmost kindness and welcomed me as part of the Embassy Suites family!  Housekeeping staff have been amazing and kept my room clean and tidy!  I will definitely miss their kind bubbly personalities. They have set my new standards high for future hotel stays which now will be definitely hard to compete!  Thank you Embassy Suites staff for being so good to me while in NYC. Being away from home for such a long time can be hard but you have made my stay feel like home! ❤️❤️❤️

title: Embassy Suites have been good to me!
text:
I wanted to write about the amazing staff at the embassy Suites especially Vanessa and Coral.  From the moment you walk into the door, they make you feel like family and it is so appreciated. While the world is experiencing so much hurt and sadness, they bring out the sunshine and smiles.  They are always willing to answer any questions I may have and they gave me the hook up to the much-needed laundry services available. I actually moved to another hotel for two weeks and literally ran right back because it could not compare to the amazing staff onsite.
I am a fellow frontline  nurse and had the pleasure to spend time on and off since April and I have extended my contract into September and could not be happier to stay here.  I feel so comfortable and so secure ( Any hints on who makes the pillows? Love them )!
Another complement to your amazing staff, I had not seen my dad since April, and he came to visit. They found us a room right next to each other so we close and comfy. 

thanks Everyone !!!
Renata

title: Great stay always!
text: I love the staff and always welcoming. Great great people and stay. Rooms are comfortable and spacious for NYC with excellent views. Microwave and refrigerator are helpful also. Close to everything in NYC. I will always stay here.

title: COVID 19 FIRST RESPONDER - TOP CHOICE
text:
My stay in NY has been an interesting one to say the least. Arriving as a pandemic responder in April I've been lucky enough to stay at a variety of hotels during my contract with the Embassy being at the top of my list. 

All of the staff ( special thanks to Coral & Patricia ) were extremely pleasant and down to earth. Always greeting us by name and wishing us safe shifts in passing to work. 

The cherry on top were the cozy yet spacious rooms that came equipped with 2 TVS, microwave, fridge, and a  sofa for guest. The location is perfect.  Walking distance to all major train lines, Herald Sqaure, and Fifth ave, just to name a few. Definitely a must stay if you're in the city and I can't wait to return under better circumstances 🙌🏾🤎!

title: Gorgeous views and great customer service
text: I stayed here as a healthcare worker during the month of May,  what ever I needed to make me feel comfortable as in sanitizer, clean linens/ housekeeping services, laundry services, they provided. Stayed in a very spacious room on the 36th Floor. The view is gorgeous, the staff is so down to earth/friendly. Anything you need to help ease your stay just reach out to them.  I also had lovely conversations with the staff daily about New York stuff. Had a very comfortable stay in my home away from home.

title: NYC native and frontliner loved this hotel
text: I was born and raised in NYC. I am also a frontline worker. This is how I was able to stay in the hotel during the pandemic. The location is literally close to everything. Food and transportation. The room was clean had a respectable size and felt new and modern! Two HD TV's perfect amount of lighting,  not just lamps like every other hotel room. The bathrooms are big and just perfect. This place felt like home and i would always come back if i could. Above everything else was the customer service. They were the best. The thermostat stopped working and i was given the room next door and was able to keep my current room with no extra cost.

title: Review
text: As frontline workers we have stayed here for atleast 60 nights! Never had better staff, Hospitality, cleanliness & service and unbelievable in the midst of the pandemic. This place made us feel like home!!

title: great location, amazing staff!
text: Stayed here during a deployment with AMR/GMR for Covid-19. The staff was always friendly, and by the 3rd day, they all knew what rooms and most of our names by heart. Everything was very clean, rooms were well cleaned regularly. The restaurants and bar were closed due to the virus, but the staff had a little breakfast, or lunch bag packed for us each day to make sure we were eating and getting good nutrients. I would highly recommend this hotel, and plan to stay here for any future vacations to NYC!

title: One of the best in New York
text: Been staying at the hotel for over a month and it has been nothing less than amazing. Everyone at the hotel is so kind and welcoming. It is perfectly located, steps away from the 5th Avenue. Rooms are spacious compared to New York standards and Top recommendations for staying at this hotel.

title: First Responder
text: I stayed at this hotel for a month while deployed to NYC for the covid pandemic. The staff was extremely accommodating and helpful with every aspect of my stay. The customer service is impeccable. Thank you for making a difficult time away from my family a little less difficult.

title: perfect business hotel and also perfect for location
text:
This hotel gives people exactly what they want----location, cleanliness, good service and a good price! 
The staff  is very attentive ---they are always there to assist. The rooms are very clean and nice. Wasn't so important to me because as long as it's clean and the location is perfect, this works quite well for me.

title: Registered Nurse
text:
I just wanted to take a minute to let you know how much I have enjoyed my stay at Embassy Suites thus far, during the pandemic. From the time I checked in, I was made to feel at home. Stephanie greeted me with a kind word and warm smile and offered to change my room when I complained that mine was too small. I realized later that, in New York, it isn't small at all, I think they call it "trendy" and the fact that it has a microwave, mini refrigerator and coffee pot makes it the perfect place to stay!

I came back to my room yesterday, after a rough day at work, and my room was so sparkling clean and I had fresh, clean, sheets. There is something special about clean sheets that is very comforting. 
Housekeeping has done an excellent job of keeping my room clean and has accommodated any request I might have. 

The front desk staff treat me like family and make me feel like a valued guest. They always greet me with a smile, morning and evening and when I get mail, we all celebrate together because I look so forward to cards and letters from home. The breakfast and dinner meals have been a Godsend and much appreciated.

I am truly happy to have chosen Embassy Suites for my stay while working the pandemic in New York. I feel very blessed to have discovered a little home away from home while I'm here.

title: My 2nd home for 4 weeks, with very much love from an ICU nurse :)
text: Embassy Suites became my second home away from home for 4 cumulative weeks. You made my stay very comfortable and enjoyable. Customer service is always consistent: friendly, warm, and always ready to help. Location is a great advantage, either I can take Q32 bus to home from K-town or less than 5 min walk to Herald Square train station. Area here is very safe to walk around, even late at night despite the recent protests in the city. I always look forward to go sleep on my heavenly bed after a busy Covid ICU shift. Fave in-room amenities: a laptop-size safe, microwave, mini fridge, 2 LCD TVs in the room, and Pure Wellness air purifier. Thanks a million for letting me use the Pure Wellness room for my last 2 weeks. I enjoyed my stay here a lot I even told my dad to book here for a week as well. Kudos again to Hilton/Amex/AACN partnership for free rooms for healthcare staff.

title: Security Officer
text:
I check in May 29 check out June 5, 2020 (Room 1510), most of the  hotel guest Staying there at that time are healthcare workers. 
Despite limitted services due to Covid 19, 
Front Desk Staffs still very good service and very professional too. And so is Housekeeping staff who clean and maintain my room. Good and Convinient location too. Overall I rate it an Excellent Hotel

                 hhss2013
                 Queens NY

title: Registered Nurse
text: I left for a family emergency & came back to my hotel room given up to someone else & my belongings missing. There was no explanation. Hotel staff & manager Mr. Anish Patney were disrespectful & unhelpful. FYI my checkout date is 5/31. #crisisRN

title: Blood Stain found in my bed
text:
I checked into my room Sunday evening on 5/3 and once settled into my room, I noticed a blood stain inside my duvet, covers, and mattress. I called the front desk regarding immediately. She offered a room change or a change of sheets. I had already unpacked and did not want to change rooms as I was tired from completing my 14hr shift as a healthcare worker.  Front desk stated someone would come change my sheets. Unfortunately, I was informed the handyman that was available could not change my sheets personally and instead would drop off the new sheets and I would have to change the sheets and make the bed myself. I had waited almost an hour for his arrival, I called the front desk twice because of this.
I removed the stained sheets for the handyman to take with and noticed the blood stain had seeped into the mattress cover as well, which had to be replaced.
While making the bed, I noticed I was missing the appropriate bedding.  I called and requested the front desk to have housekeeping change my sheets the following morning while I was at work. I have called over the phone and asked in person numerous times to the housekeeping, front desk, and the manager about this matter each day and night that it was not resolved.  I am frustrated, upset, and disgusted not only because of finding stained blood in my bed but also because no one addressed this matter sooner and it took 3 days to have this matter taken care of.  It was resolved on 5/6.    
Is this Embassy Suites/Hilton’s hospitality and/or customer service experience?

title: Posizione strategica
text: Ottimo hotel nel cuore di New York, senza dubbio la posizione risulta essere la caratteristica migliore. Di recente costruzione, modernissimo e molto pulito, le camere funzionali ma un po’ piccole. Consigliato anche per il rapporto qualità prezzo.

title: Excelente
text: Localização espetacular, próximo à todo tipo de comércio possível, próximo à Macy’s, do Times Square, mas longe da “muvuca”. Funcionários extremamente atenciosos. Café da manhã estilo buffet, completíssimo, com uma estação de omeletes feitos do seu jeito. Happy hour com aperitivos e bebidas liberadas. Cobra taxa diária de 25 dólares, mas é revertida em créditos para restaurante ou lojinha do hotel. Quarto pequeno, mas dentro do padrão NY. Recebe compras pela internet sem custo. Tive um pequeno contratempo na cobrança final, mas liguei para o hotel e a funcionária Dahiana Castillo resolveu brilhantemente e fez os acertos. Recomendo e ficarei de novo em próxima viagem.

title: Manhattan dream
text: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for several days in March.  It was wonderful.  The room was clean and modern, the service was perfect and the location was minutes away from subways and Time Square.  All the front desk people were very helpful, especially Anthony. He went out of his way to make sure all of my questions were answered. I   strongly recommend this hotel.

title: Muy buena opción
text:
Es un hotel muy lindo, con una ubicación inmejorable (a pocas cuadras de Times Square), un desayuno excelente y una atención muy buena.
Al ser un hotel con muchos pisos se junta demasiada gente tanto para desayunar como para tomar el ascensor.
Lo que menos nos gustó es que teníamos una habitación para 3 personas (2 adultos y un niño) pero la cama para nuestro hijo era un sofá que debíamos armar y hacerlo cama nosotros mismos... cuando estamos de vacaciones queremos disfrutar del viaje y no trabajar armando camas (creo que nos dieron una habitación para 2 personas pero nos cobraron una habitación para 3).

title: Quick trip to NYC
text: Excellent check in process, Anita was extremely welcoming and did a great job of helping us pick a room with a view. Property lobby is spotless and room is nice and updated. Overall, great first impression!

title: Comfortable Stay!
text:
If you are looking for a typical Embassy Suites, this is not it.  The rooms are small, we didn't even have room for a couch, so know ahead of time there isn't the typical space.  
With that being said. The hotel was very nice, well updated.  The bed was comfortable, the breakfast was delicious, the staff was very friendly, the evening reception was nice.  My husband and I enjoyed our 3 night stay. 
The location is great.  It is a short walk to so many things.  Times Square is close, Union Terminal and Penn Station are within 10 minutes.  
I would recommend this hotel for couples or smaller groups.  

One thing I did not agree with is the mandatory $25 daily fee that you must use before midnight in their gift shop, bar or room service.  $6 regular Kit Kat, $4 small bag of chips.  Most nights we were spending it on stuff we didn't need or use just so the money didn't go to waste.

Getting there...  We flew into JFK, took the Air Train to the Jamaica Stop, and took the E train to Penn Station where we walked to the hotel.  It takes a little over 1 hour total to get from airport to hotel entrance.

title: Disappointment at Embassy Suites Times Square
text: What we experienced was different to what was advertised on the website. We felt cheated by a €25 add-on to each room per day. We were forced to purchase items with the €25 add-on and considering one glass of wine was €14 it meant two drinks and tip would screw you further. One or two front desk staff had attitude problem and don't like when someone asks for explanation.

title: Greta staff and location!
text: The staff, especially Anthony, was amazing and gracious! Rooms are quaint and clean. Breakfast was plentiful and happy hour hit the spot! Greta location and nice choice! Near the both herald square and Times Square. Great views of Empire State Building. Over all positive experience!!

title: Excellent hotel, excellent location.
text: The breakfast was wonderful and the staff super helpful.  The room was very clean, I lacked some cupboard space. The view from 31st floor was a plus. Will definitely return to this hotel next time I'm in NYC

title: Nice Hotel
text: Very new and modern hotel, short walk from Times Square. Great breakfast and happy hour, consistent with the Embassy theme. The dinner restaurant was good, but very small.  Total capacity maybe 20? Given the options in NYC, I'm not sure why anyone would eat here other than to use the $25 Urban Destination Fee, which is applied daily and can be used as a credit towards food and beverages in the hotel.  However, as I said, with so many amazing dining options in the city, the $25 fee is just another tax.  I only ate in the hotel once and the other days, I (and everyone else I spoke to in the bar) was having a quick drink at the bar to "use" the $25 credit. The hotel should discontinue this practice.  Otherwise, very friendly staff and a nice hotel.

title: #Amazing stay, Friendly customer service, Near Great place you can walk too or 🚕. Very Clean . Delicious Breakfast
text: It’s a place that you would feel comfortable to stay and bring your loved ones and enjoy NYC with near by attractions. Amazing customer service. Parking is Pricey if you have a bigger vehicle. # Thank you! 😘😘😘

title: Excellent Staff and Location
text: The staff and location of this hotel are excellent.   Upon arrival I was warmly greeted by friendly and professional front desk staff.  Check-in was a breeze and  my room was ready upon arrival.  I had an early morning flight so I was especially appreciative of being  allowed access to my room.  I arrived much earlier than check-in time.   This courteous behavior continued throughout my stay.   Kudos to all staff members I had the pleasure of meeting.   I stayed in a king room with a view that had a pull-out sofa.  I found the room to be tastefully decorated, roomy by NYC standards and most importantly clean.   There is a safe and refrigerator in the room.  There isn't the usual  lobby area normally found near the front desk.  There is a recessed seating area off the lobby.   The hotel is within walking distance of many major attractions.   To name a few, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Macy's, Art Museum, Cathedral, transportation  and restaurants.   The breakfast was  very good and the dining area was clean and well maintained.  The breakfast area does get very crowded.  The bar where Happy Hour is located is also very crowded but staff very efficient.  I felt safe staying at this hotel and this will be my hotel of choice when visiting NYC.

title: Right in the heart of it
text: This location is perfect it was less than 10 minute walk from penn satiation , 7 minutes from Times Square and the theater district. It’s tucked away in the block but it’s such a beautiful location. The staff was extremely professional and friendly and the lobby was immaculate. I will definitely comeback here and stay.

title: Nice property, dicey location
text:
This is fairly new construction and everything was neat and clean. The legendary omelette breakfast was terrific, but the dining areas are very crowded, with disastrous traffic flow.

The location on 37th street is not great. When returning late at night from Lincoln Center, the walk from the bus stop is dicey. 

Space is always at a premium in NYC and rooms were a little cramped, but okay. Wifi worked great. Nice big TV. Huge safe in the closet. I always appreciate coffee maker, small fridge, and microwave and all worked fine.

I had a great view from a high floor, and recommend paying a little extra to get that. You'll feel less claustrophobic. 

The mandatory $25/day fee seems to be taking hold at many Hiltons in Manhattan. You can't accumulate but must spend each day. You can buy from a limited selection at the snack counter or use at the bar/restaurant. But you pay tax and tip at the latter and that doesn't count. I'm told this fee also doesn't count in base points for HIlton Honors. I guess you should just think of it as a surcharge to the otherwise excellent room rate.

title: Great Friendly Experience in NYC
text: Embassy Suites was the first vacation hotel we ever stayed at 30 yrs ago on our honeymoon in Maui. A great chain, the reception and breakfast take the edge off of having to go out multiple times a day. Getting in the room early was a blessing. Thank you

title: Vacaciones
text: Excelente hotel, excelente ubicacion! El desayuno es muy completo y el hotel muy lindo. En especial la atencion de Graciela en guest service! Excelente experiencia. La ubicacion es muy buena a dos cuadras de time square

title: Could be better
text: Great location easy walking to sites and subway check in was awful it took 45 minutes checked in online but room was not ready so took room on 20th floor big mistake elevator was slow and when you went to breakfast there is not nearly enough seating so if yo want to go back to room it takes a long time rooms are small for embassy suites which we tend to stay in a lot but it is nyc staff was nice in breakfast area nice hotel and clean it’s okay

title: Exceptional hotel
text:
We had 4 nights here and found it a great base for our New York stay. The room had everything we needed and was well appointed. The breakfast omelettes/eggs to order were fabulous and very quick, supplemented by the usual continental breakfast fare.
The evening happy hours were outstanding and we really enjoyed meeting new people, there.The location was so convenient to Macy’s shopping, Times Square, and our explorations to all the sight via the nearby subway stop.
We will definitely stay here again if we return to New York.

title: Had to search and fix many things
text: After arriving to what we thought was a quite small room we found the internet would not connect, safe would not lock, and tv so large it was hard to use the hand control. Staff was excellent about trying to fix things and we got to know one young tech/maintenance man quite well. The free breakfast was in a small enough room that omelets to order took over 30 minutes, short staffed, and they refused a request for hard boiled or poached eggs (I had been ill before trip). Fitted sheets would not stay on the bed and the shower head was a bit large for the small shower that had to be turned on from the other end....I got a cold shower wake up each time! However we have to admit location was outstanding.

title: Sejour Embassy sute New York
text: Hotel tres situé, très propre, le petit dej excellent et varié et les chambres au top avec une super literie et une grande salle de bain propre et clair. J ai passé un excellent sejour et je vous le conseille.

title: Good spot.
text: Arrived way too early to check in, but they set me up for early arrival at 2:30 and took our bags so we could start our day.  We walked to the hotel from Penn Station. It was an easy walk. Room was nice size for 2 people. It was modern and clean. We were on the 36th floor and had a nice view. Breakfast was good. It was crowded but the food was good. We didn’t go to the 5:30-7:30 reception. Had a so-so burger and a drink at the small bar are adjacent to the lobby. No real restaurant in the hotel. There is a weird $25 charge that you must use in the hotel or lose the money. You can use it at the bar or to buy overpriced snacks and/or sundries.  I was told at the front desk I had to use it by midnight or I would still be charged the $25 and not get anything for it. We only stayed one night. I would stay here again. Skyline view is from our 36th floor room at dawn. There was also an incredible view of the Empire State Building  from the window near the elevator on the 36th floor.

title: Great for my visit
text: Business trip in the city. Great location to our office across the street. My room had a separate area with a desk and couch where I could get some work done. The bed was comfortable and service was great! Only negative was lack of counter space in the bathroom but I made it work. I had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building as well.

title: Not a suite
text: The Embassy Suites may have rooms that are suites, but they are playing pretty loose with the term "suites" if they want to call the room we got a suite.  The room was small and was a single room.  Not a suite in any sense.  It was clean and modern.  The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was ok.  But the room is not a suite.

title: Girls' Celebration
text:
We went to NY to celebrate a 60th. There were 3 of us, great friends and we decided to stay at Embassy Suites as we have had experience with them before. We went for 3 nights and decided to share a room. Although the room was not large, and there was little space to store suitcases etc, it worked for us. 2 shared the bed and one had the pull out couch which had a very high back, as a type of separator for the room. There was a fridge and microwave. Breakfast and an evening reception was included. The breakfast was superb! We did not care for the wines offered at the reception as they were very limited but, as there was a bar downstairs, we were able to enjoy our choice of wine.
The hotel is in a great area close to Herald Square/ Macys as you head to your left, and Bryant Park/Times Square as you head to your right on 6th Ave. There are many shops /restaurants around. We used the subway, it was so easy! 
The hotel staff were so helpful and always had a smile. We chatted daily and went to the bar a couple of times where Tom kept our wine topped and chatted happily with us like we were long lost friends! We ate there the first night and the food was delicious!
All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel as the area, staff, accommodation cannot be beat!
Thanks for everything - until we meet again!

title: Inverno no Embassy Suites Times Square NYC
text: Otimo serviço, bom café da manha apesar de muito cheio. Funcionários atenciosos, excelente custo beneficio. Infelizmente o Terraço estava fechado, mesmo em dia sem chuva. A recepção muito atenciosa, tratamento bom para Hilton Honors.

title: Nice Hotel for short visits
text:
The hotel offers everything that most of the travelers look for. Very nice position close to times square, offering many dining and entertainment options around. 
The rooms are clean and well-equiped but if you open the sofa-bed there isn't enough space left. 
The breakfast is good although it can be crowded. 
The luggage storage room of the hotel is too small, making it difficult in case you want to store too many things or for long. We do appreciate the help of the front office supervisor who found us a solution. All employees are helping and smiling.

title: Great Time
text: Front desk crew Friendly, upbeat and personable. Great relaxing area with two bars and lounge areas.  Rooms spacious and clean. Two TVs in the room which was a plus. Technology all up to date and within the century.

title: Fantastic location, great hotel
text:
Great location. 5 min walk from most of the sights. 

Managers reception was a bit rubbish. Like a cheap all inclusive with 25% vodka & tasteless beer. 

Breakfast was fab. Hot & cold, all the types of bread for toasting although how well the item is toasted is pure luck. Omlettes, bacon & sausage. 

 Front office staff were a bit meh. They seemed more interested in their phones than customers. 

Tom on the bar was great. He earned his ££ remembering our names & persuading us to have a drink. Lovely to meet you Tom. 

The $25 a day is great, spend it on the bar or room service (be aware of the food cost + tip + tax). 

We found a drink each + tax & tip was around $25

Nice touch to have iced fruit water in reception. I can imagine the lifts are a nightmare during busy periods.

title: Perfect location
text: This hotel is in a great location to get to all of the sights to see through out the city.. Great customer service and rooms! The bartends took the time to get to know you  and the food and drinks was great!

title: Not worth it!
text: Internet, room heating and Lifts will be a pain here, if you want a relaxed stay don't go for this hotel. Heating is automatic and keeps reducing the temp if it doesn't detect any moment of a person so you basically die in the cold when it's already 30F in NYC

title: Excellent hotel
text: This is excellent hotel in great location. It’s not your typical Embassy Suits with huge rooms, but it’s very nice and comfortable. They check people in early, if rooms are available. We had room on 39th floor with great views. Breakfast is great. Night reception is very good too. Stuff is very nice and helpful. This was our second stay and we will be back.

title: You're better off somewhere else
text: I have always been a fan of Embassy Suites but after this stay I am strongly considering never staying in one again. I have never been spoken to and down by omsdone more than the general manger did to me. She wasn't willing to listen or compromise and made me feel extremely unwelcome.

title: viaje de negocios
text: Excelente ubicación, cerca de todo, excelente atención y amabilidad del personal, la comida muy buena, las habitaciones impecables, lo recomiendo para viajes de negocios o vacaciones en NYC.... Graciela, muchas gracias por tu atención.

title: Perfekt läge hotell med supertrevlig personal
text:
Bodde 4 nätter i januari - perfekt läge att utgå från - promenadavstånd till shopping och Times Square 
Nära till Penn station (tåg från flyg) och Herold station (tunnelbana)
Frukost helt ok - inte massa pålägg som i Sverige men omelett på beställning på skärm 
Rummen var fina och fräscha och bra städning 
Sköna stora sängar med tv framför  - perfekt med kylskåp och micro 
Rekommenderas starkt - betalade 1200kr/natt för 4 nätter i januari via Hotels.com då ingick allt inga extra avgifter 
Bara deposition som återbetalades direkt efter utcheckning

title: If You Get A Good Rate and Can Appreciate the Breakfast and Reception
text:
As Mariah said below, this is not what you might be expecting. Our room (not suite) was compact. Although on a high floor, window was small, so not great view. Location is very good however, and staff at the lounge and breakfast room friendly. They asses a bogus destination fee $25 which can redeemed at the bar.

So comes down the rate you can get (ours was quite good) and how you value the included breakfast (good) and evening reception (a madhouse on Friday, ok the following 2 nights).

title: Outstanding Service just small
text: The location is very convenient to everything. We were only there 3 days and could walk to most places. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We loved the complimentary breakfast and cocktail hours! The only complaint is that the rooms are extremely small.

title: Great room good location
text: Been to this hotel and love it.  Only issue the price is so changing sometimes base price is 110 and other times high as 350 dollars won't stay at that rate. Love the location.  Rooms good size could use more easy drawer space.  The draw space is mostly under the bed.  So I used the safe and luggage holder so I do not have to bend over os much to the bed drawers. Staff right there if you need them.  Rooms love the comfy clean crisp white bed. The comforter is so comfy cloud like.  The breakfast everything you want plus fresh omelte if you want. Love the choicces of meat, fresh fruit, juices, cold ceral, oatmeal bar with all the fixins, and so much more. The night reception is good enough nothing gourmet but enough to get you through till dinner.  The lobby is so beautiful and seating area alos very chic and yuppie but drafty as when the main doors open and close the cold draft comes in .  Such a shame to have a lobby and can not use as much as should be used.  Lucky for us guests the hotel knows this so they allow you to go to the fourth floor area to sit, lounge, relax, read, and be with other people if you want to be soical or if you privacy then back to your lovely room.

title: Favorite stay in New York
text:
This hotel offers an excellent location and great accommodations.
My family enjoyed our clean rooms, breakfast, afternoon reception, and room service.  We are already planning our next stay to this location.

title: NYC type of Embassy
text: Keep in mind this is NYC so this Embassy is definitely different from other Embassy.  The hotel is location is great!  Rooms are very small but very nice.  Please remember that the drawers are located under the bed and very limited closet space. Food was good and service was great from the staff. Jasmine at the Front Desk definitely represents Hilton at its best!  I would recommend staying here but not with kids.

title: Trip to NYC
text: Trip to NYC. Excellent accomadations. Staff was extremely attentive, helpful, and courteous. We took my daughter for her first NYC TRIP, she loved every second of it and thought the hotel was outstanding.

title: Great Location but TINY Rooms!
text:
First off, Craig Brereton, the Assistant Front Desk Manager, is amazing and especially helpful. The entrance to the hotel is somehow a mistake- there is no lobby to speak off and all waiting luggage is kept by the bar to the side (not very attractive nor safe). 

The rooms are smaller than a cruise ship- AND there is absolutely no storage. They are quiet and the bathroom is quite large (really strange) and everything was spotless.

The location is wonderful...breakfasts were satisfying (you can bring to your room since there are never any seats) and the bar food was quite good (burgers and wings were most excellent). 

Will definitely stay here again in the summer when we bring less luggage :-)

title: Fun Time in NY
text:
Friendly efficient staff, Nice Room size for NY and comforatable bed.
Bar was small but great service and friendly atmosphere.  Primary visit was to go to a Broadway show and Stepen Colbert show.  While a 10 minute walk to Times Square, the cheaper rates more than compensated.

title: MALA LOGISTICA DE HABITACION
text: mala logistica, me dieron una habitacion menor a la que pague y la unica solucion del personal fue que bajara al dia siguiente a ver si ya se habia desocupado una del tipo de la que habia pagado, jamas me regresaron nada

title: My Stay
text: I enjoyed the view from the room. The bed was very comfortable. Didn’t get to experience much of the amenities like evening cocktails as my only interest was seeing the city. But overall I enjoyed my stay. Would definitely recommend

title: OUTSTANDING EXPERIENCE!
text: This particular Embassy Suites was recommended by a friend, for all that it offered, plus convenient location; I'm also a Hilton member, which helped.  We had no complaints whatsoever - staff, rooms, meals. . . everything outstanding!

title: AMAZING VALUE and COMFORT
text: This hotel has it all: location, safety, incredible breakfast buffet, and evening manager's reception! The staff is very friendly. You can walk to shopping, restaurants, Bryant Park, the NY public library, Rockefellar Center, Times Square, and the theater district.

title: Nice rooms
text: Hotel nearby Times square, a few meters and you were there. Although placed in the middle of the city, we could not hear the noise at night - soundproof Windows and good AC. Very nice rooms, good space, very comfortable bed. Small breakfast area made it very crowdy. Not enough elevators made us sometimes wait 20 minutes to get up/down.

title: Stayed here for New Year's Eve..
text:
Not a "suite", it was a pull-out bed next to a king bed. Literally no room to walk on one side of the bed. The other was blocked by a humidifier. 
Hotel charged wrong credit card after receiving the correct one..Took a week to partially resolve it. STAY AWAY

title: Marijana Stay
text: This was an awful experience.  We had the smell of marijuana for the entire stay in a nonsmoking hotel. The TV did not work and the sink was stopped up. It was difficult to pull out the sofa bed and I hit my ankle on the corner of the bed no matter how careful I was.  Not enough space in the room.

title: Exceptional location and room!
text: We chose this hotel for been a Hilton but mostly for the location, walking distance to pretty much every major attraction in midtown. The room was a good size for NY city, with a small sitting area with a pull out couch, divided from the "bedroom" by a half way providing some privacy; there was also a safe,  2 TVs, microwave, mini fridge, great bathroom. Breakfast was great with made to order omelets, plenty to eat, crowded between 8 and 9, happy hour outstanding! And free!!! Bartender at the lobby bar was excellent. Reception staff very good as well.

title: Great location
text: It’s easy walking distance from Penn Station' as well as Times Square and Rockefeller’s Square. The hotel was clean and the front desk staff helpful. The rooms are typical NYC size - small. Breakfast was chaotic and hard to find a seat.

title: spectacular
text: How many very comfortable, very clean and very well located, it is only 5 minutes walk from times square. Lots of dining options around. The reception service is very good and the bar at the entrance is wonderful.

title: Meh....
text: We are in NYC annually at the holidays and understand small hotel rooms and crowds at check in/checkout. The staff at the bell stand was great with our luggage as we arrived well before we could check in. We left for lunch and upon our return to the hotel after check in time, our room was still not ready. We were given keys but no information regarding breakfast or evening receptions (front desk staff was mediocre at best) and after receiving electronic notification that we could go up, they were still cleaning the room.  Our “two room suite” was smaller than a regular hotel room in most other hotels we’ve stayed at in the City. There was only walking clearance around the bed and very little storage - definitely not enough for two adults and a child. We had to request extra bedding for the pullout even though we indicated we had a child staying with us and with the couch pulled out, there similar walking room around it. The shower leaked at the door regardless of how the shower head was pointing.  Fortunately, each room had individual temperature controls but no rhyme or reason to its accuracy. Thermostat would be set to different temperatures but it always read at 72 degrees.

title: Have had better at Hampton Inn
text: Just stayed 5 nights at this hotel, which, for us, was not so great.  The  breakfast area was too small to handle all the people trying to get breakfast.  Then trying to find a seat is almost impossible unless you get there when they open at 0730. The  'nightly reception' was a joke.  Unless you're gonna gulp down as many drinks as you can in 2 hours, it's not worth paying the extra money to stay here.  And every night was either chips and salsa or chips and popcorn to eat.  Embassy suites used to have a nice selection during their evening reception, but no more.  The room was clean, but we had literally 1 drawer and a small hanging space for our clothes. Shower only, no bath, which was ok.  We just kept it in our luggage that we had to put on top of the desk. The elevators were super slow.  Location not so good if wanting to walk to Central park, the Rock, etc. I usually choose Hilton brand hotels, and will stay at a cheaper hotel with free breakfast next time. Nothing special here, as far as the hotel or room. And the breakfast and evening reception is a circus.

title: Posizione fantastica
text: La posizione è perfetta, nel cuore di Midtown, a pochi passi da ogni punto focale. Si trova tra la 5th e la 7th, vicinissimo a Broadway e a Times Square. Camere spaziose e silenziose. Pulito. Wifi gratuita e ben funzionante. La nostra camera guardava direttamente sull'Empire. La colazione è perfetta per chi mangia salato, per chi è abituato al dolce è scarsina, diciamo che è tipicamente americana. Un pò di ressa quando ci sono arrivi e partenze, ci siamo ritrovati con una valanga di valige lasciate in hotel in attesa del check in, che è stato fatto alle 16. Nei giorni di massima affluenza servirebbe maggior flessibilità

title: Great, but beware the rip-off fee
text: Everything was great except the hidden "fee" and the broken promise to refund it. Terrific staff except rude woman at check-out who insisted they would refund only half of what I was told was a refundable "deposit".

title: Don’t expect to stretch out
text: Smallish rooms ( I understand it’s NYC ).  Not enough room for clothes, luggage storage.  There’s not enough room for two people in the room without bumping into each other.  There was too many pillows on the couch that took up space.  At the price point, I wouldn’t recommend to anyone with a family of 4 trying to stay in one room

title: Good hotel, tough parking, crowded social spaces.
text: We visited NYC a few days before Christmas with our eight year old daughter and my mother in law. We were celebrating my mother in law’s birthday and were in town to see The Rockettes Christmas Show. The hotel is perfectly fine but you have to kind of think of it as not an Embassy Suites. The lobby is cramped and you will likely arrive to a throng of people and a ton of luggage. The line to check in was huge and the room wasn’t ready until 4pm. All of this was as expected in NYC Christmastime. The surprise came when we tried to park at the hotel. There wasn’t available parking at the nearby lots. My husband drove around Manhattan for about an hour searching for a garage and eventually found one. The room worked out well but it was on the smaller side. The furniture was in good shape and the bathroom was newly remodeled. We paid for a room with a city view. It was a tremendous view of the Empire State Building. The elevator situation was rough. There was a lot of waiting for available elevators. The other two problems are the lack of seating at breakfast and during the evening reception. Overall, it is a nice hotel in a great location with a warning light about parking and overcrowding. The staff was kind and professional. The view on the higher floor was spectacular!

title: Excellent
text: My stay at the embassy suites was a home away from home. It was five minutes walk from time square, empire state building and so many beautiful places, there are stores where you could shop few minutes walk away, I would definitely visit again!

title: Loved Location and Staff
text: Stayed for 4 nights during mid-December.  Arrived in SUV-Tahoe, neither self parking lot would allow us to park in their garages, so we had to park in Myers Garage for additional fee, then pull our luggage to the hotel.  The manager, Craig wasn't happy about this and made every effort to make corrections to make us comfortable.  Enjoyed all the comforts of a Hilton Embassy and so loved the location, as I travel to NYC a few times a year and this location is one of the best.  Hotel clean and nice, personnel fabulous, will say we had two other mild room issues and management got them fixed (broken sink plunger and door bolt lock) but I will definitely stay here again during my next visit if they have space.  Breakfast was nice, busy but it was Christmas however, no complaints with that as they kept it moving and the night reception was accommodating also.  Quiet room on the 6th floor and for a "sisters" trip we had a blast.

title: Excellent location, comfortable & clean hotel
text: Party of two stayed here for several days during the holiday season. The hotel was full and the breakfast room was very busy each morning, but the food selection was great. Our room was small but clean & comfortable and had great views (28th floor). It conveniently had a mini fridge and microwave. The location of this hotel cannot be beat; it is very central and we were able to walk to most of our destinations, including Port Authority bus station. Would stay here again!

title: One of the best valued hotels in NYC
text:
This place is beautiful and clean. Looks like it's been recently renovated. The room is very spacious for this price range, with a nice couch as a divider between the bed and the office area. 

Perhaps the best part is the included breakfast buffet. It has made to order eggs dishes and is simply great value.

title: Clean and convenient
text: Great location! Easy to get to the subway or walk to several neat things (Macy’s, Bryant Park area). Really good breakfast and the evening social is a great snack with drinks included. Rooms are clean and comfy.

title: Disappointed!
text:
I was looking forward to staying here for 2 nights. To my surprise the room has no drawers and a useless so called closet.
The rod for hanging your clothes is without any exaggeration 2 feet off the ground, is this a joke I thought. All my life I've stayed at many hotels and I have never experienced a room with no place for your clothes. Had to lay out my suits on the sofa. How can they get away with this design. I called the front desk multiple times with no response. I literally had to walk down to the front desk to ask questions, how annoying. They claimed they were fully booked and could not give me another room. The only good thing about this room was the bed, it was comfortable.
Expedia apologized for this hotel and gave me $100 credit. The hotel offered nothing for my troubles.
Never again will I stay at this hotel again.

title: Book here if you want to me over charged and not helped
text: The stay here started off with a locked garage for the hotel. The garage staff were completely unprofessional the front desk staff was frazzled constantly. Supervisors and lobby staff did not greet staff nor smile it seems it was foreign for them to have basic manners. Book with Hilton up the street or a street over.

title: Beware of your bill...
text: I am tired of the poor service I am receiving from the Hilton Brand. People need to be aware of the way they bill for your stay....a $25 urban destination fee is charged, and I was well aware of when booking. We were told to use it or lose it and that the best way was with the hotel pantry for beverages and snack, so we did. I had 2 reservations the same week at this hotel and the 1st reservation I was charged the $25 (ok) and also for stuff (less than 25$) we had from the pantry....when I pointed this out to the staff they corrected it and I asked if they would make sure not to do the same thing on the next reservation that I had, apparently that was too much to ask because they did the exact same thing, and I specified what the error was but the just didn't care to do it properly. Upon check out I asked them to correct it and they said they couldn't?My ride to the airport was waiting I didn't have time to argue the mistake they made yet again. So I contacted the Hilton site and they looked into it...they said they don't have a handle on the destination charge yet...funny I don't work there and I figured out the mistake of charging people twice!!! I tried through a few different "Specialists" to explain their mistake and how with the exchange rate I would be losing money (not a lot,but that's not the point). I was given a few Hilton points for my trouble and when I responded that they didn't seem to be getting my point, they just never responded anymore.  Terrible service!

title: Wonderful place to stay
text: Close to everything including restaurants, mass transit, events and shopping.  Staff is wonderful, rooms are clean, managers reception is an added bonus. Movie nights in the summer are fun! Centrally located to so many things!

title: Hidden gem
text: Nice hotel tucked away in garment district that you can walk to Bryan Park, Rockefeller Center, Macys. Times Sq. Plus hot breakfast and cocktail reception at night. Fridge and micro if needed. DD next door. Very easy to hail cabs right in front of building if needed. Great stay.

title: Really nice hotel and great reception/breakfast
