text: While the rooms are typical NY and small this room was bigger than the Doubletree room i had earlier in the week.  Staff was very good and Tom at the reception was amazing..remembering everyone's name.  In a pretty good location for subway and other things so a great place to stay.

title: Not bad at all - just some room for improvement
text:
I was excited to try an Embassy Suites, as I've stayed at many Hiltons and other group brands. I wasn't quite sure what to expect, but the evening reception and cooked-to-order breakfast both sounded enticing. 

Some good points - I liked the location. Away from the serious hustle and bustle of Times Square, but a short walk to loads of points of interest or the Subway. The hotel was very busy with long lines to check-in, but the concierge soon called me over to his desk to check in there instead. 

The evening reception is a nice idea, but it's much less than an executive lounge you'd find in some Hiltons. There were a few bar-snack nibbles, and drinks on offer - not quite sure what was included, but I had a beer so I know that is. It was very busy and noisy, with few seats available, so we only stopped for one quick drink on one night. 

Breakfast was really good - nicely cooked and a good selection. The staff were also working hard to keep tables clear. The space is quite small, however, and the hours quite limited - 06:30 to 09:30, with warnings that it's extremely busy towards the end of service. We 'chose' to wake up extra early every day to avoid the crowds. It's all a usual buffet, apart from eggs and omelettes which are cooked fresh - which is what most hotels offer anyway. I was only here for two days, but each day the breakfast choice was slightly different - a very nice touch. 

The room was comfortable and clean, although the bedroom itself is quite small - just enough room to open the door before you hit the bed. The bathroom is nice and spacious, however. The whole hotel is very modern and clean. 

Long wait to retrieve our bags when leaving, so we ended up just having to go into the bar area where they're stored to retrieve ours.

Generally, I got the feeling there aren't quite enough staff or facilities for the number of rooms or guests. The breakfast and evening reception should possibly increase the hours, so that there's less of a crush at peak times.

Overall - not a bad hotel at all, just not quite what I'd expected or hoped for. All the staff are working hard, and are pleasant enough - especially most of the breakfast staff, I thought.

title: Over priced even for the area
text: Dirty room. The bathroom was left with someone's hair all over the shower walls and the bathroom floors. No room to enjoy the breakfast or evening reception. Way to many people staying at this hotel to fit into the tiny space they have for evening social and breakfast. There's much nicer hotels to stay at in Manhattan for the money in my opinion.

title: Too small for the money.
text: If you like Embassy suites for the spaciousness prepare to be disappointed. Smallest room ever! For any Hilton property! Much less an Embassy Suites. I'm a Diamond member so I know my Hiltons. Breakfast area is too small. Had to wait 30 mins just to get access to the buffet.

title: This is going to be our Favorite!
text: We stayed November 30 over night. The Hotel is amazing. Such a great location. All the staff was so helpful. We were able to check our bags in so we could walk around before our room was ready. We arrived at 10:30 a.m. . Our room was ready somewhere around 2:30. We enjoyed their free social time. Which included light snacks and drinks. (Wine, beer, soft drinks and cocktails). Free breakfast in the morning which was more then just your typical hotel breakfast. It was wonderful. We are definitely returning to this hotel. By far the best hotel we have ever stayed in NYC.

title: Excellent Staff - Rooms OK - Location Perfect
text: First, I cannot say enough about the staff.  Everyone we encountered was very happy and helpful. Kudos to the team! The rooms are smaller which is not a complaint because that is fairly common in NYC.  However, we had no storage for close except for a TINY closet to hang a few things.  Otherwise, no drawer space which meant we had to keep our suitcase out in the tiny space. The location is close to everything you would want to be around including two short blocks to the subway.  If you are sensitive to noise be sure to ask for a room that is not street facing.  Overall, we would stay here again.

title: Disaster stay...
text: Check in was not a welcome, staff seemed overwhelmed and scattered. Pull outs didn’t work, over an hour to address. No blankets or pillows for pullouts. TV didn’t work properly, kept freezing up. I had two rooms..same problems in both for our family. Elevators were slow and overcrowded, all guests were frustrated. Crammed breakfast area, food was good but no where to sit to enjoy it. We were all called after 10 pm by management on check in questions/errors. One of worst stays ever and I travel a lot! Will never return here and Hilton is not standing by their promise on making it right...1st time I’ve been so frustrated with Hilton after almost 8 years of loyalty to their brand and being a diamond member...this one has me shopping elsewhere!

title: Great hotel at a bargain price
text: Great hotel for our family of 3.  Small, like most hotels in NYC, but enough space for my husband and myself, and a pull out for our teenage son.  Great location, staff was helpful and friendly.  Provided us with free drinks to compensate for the $25 mandatory NYC fee.  Only complaint was at checkout we were looking to store our luggage and they did not have enough staff on hand.  Waited quite some time to have our bags put in the bar area which didn't feel all that safe.   Other than that, I highly recommend this hotel and check prices -- we found a great one on hotels.com.

title: Look elsewhere
text: Room could be in a capsule hotel.  The staff made a minimal effort for an early checkin for us after 5 hours on the the road.  The free included omelet was dry and thin.  The hotel is  notreally in Times Square but a short block away.

title: Great location
text:
Wonderful hotel close to Herald Square,  Bryant Park, 5th Av.
Lots to do as soon as you step foot out of hotel. Best to become a Hilion Honors member so you can partake of all the benefits.  Lots to do at this location

title: Disappointing Rooms
text:
While I expect rooms in NYC to be compact, the space in our suite was poorly designed.  The room had a tiny closet with one small drawer.  No room for 2 people in the city to hang their clothes or unpack their undies.  I have been on cruise ships where the cabin was essentially the same size but had ample storage space.
A big plus and thanks to the registration clerk who on check in gave us a room with a view of Herald Square from which we were able to watch the Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade.  If you want a room with a similar view our room number was —07.
A final note, due to large volume of checkouts or room was not made up until after 5pm making it hard to come back and rest or change before going out for the evening after a day of sightseeing & shopping

title: Great location for Macy's parade and shopping
text: We arrived on Tuesday and have enjoyed our stay.  We have a room with a view. The Empire State Building and Macy's are right outside our window. The room is nice, perfect for a family. A king size bed and a double pull out sofa.  Breakfast is included, which is great. There is also an evening event. His hotel is within walking distance to all the stores, Time Square and Bryant park.  It is also quiet at night. There is no nightclub thank God. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the middle of everything.  The hotel staff have been professional and helpful. We will return next year!

title: Waiting for service
text: Checked into the Embassy Suites Manhattan and everything was good until we could not get linens for my daughters sofa sleeper. We were tired from the drive but after calling and waiting for over 2 1/2 hours and 3 calls to the front desk we still had no no blankets. This is ridiculous and we have never had such Poor service being Hilton Diamond members for over 10 years

title: Should be called "Embarrassing suites Times Square"
text:
I had to go to NYC on a somewhat urgent basis for a series of meetings at a major hotel in Times Square.  Unfortunately there were no rooms in the (massive) host hotel, so I had to find another facility.  I saw "Embassy Suites Times Square," on the Hilton Site, so I registered there.

When I arrived, I was at first struck with the fact that it is actually no where near Times Square - over a half a mile away.  This eventually became completely inconvenient, and really represented nothing less than false advertising.

Upon arriving, I learned that there is no valet parking offered, which was a first for me.  So I had to unpack my bags, leave them in the lobby where I was told they would "be OK," and was given the wrong directions and wound up in the wrong garage.  There was no "handout," telling you the address of the garage or more efficient directions, just verbal directions from a friendly desk person who unfortunately was not a New Yorker.

When I arrived, I then learned there was a major problem with my booking.  Apparently, I was booked to arrive the night before.  Although this may have been a mistake by my staff, there was little of no attempt by management to assist me.  I was initially told that it would be removed from the bill, but later was told that was not correct, that I would be billed for it, and that there was "nothing the staff could do."  This was from a very nice desk person who had no authority to assist in any way.  No one from management ever contacted me to discuss the situation with me or give me any further advice.

So after I got to my room, I put the "Do Not Disturb," sign on for a half hour.  As the result, I could not get my room serviced for the next two days.  On both days, I had to go down to the front desk to ask that my room be serviced.

In terms of the "free breakfast," yes it is offered, and one morning when I went early was able to enjoy.  But as many other things about this hotel, it is poorly organized, such that from 8AM on it is too busy to actually be able to take advantage of this benefit.

It is "Embarrasing," that such a facility by associated with the Hilton organization.

There were other problems, but I cannot bother with some of them

title: Stay here!!!
text: This hotel was Clean, comfortable, professional, complementary breakfast and evening cocktail reception "included"  WOW  Given the staff, location and for the price there is not a better hotel in New York.

title: Great location
text: This hotel is in a perfect spot close to shopping and subway. The breakfast was the best and one of the reasons I booked this hotel. We got a great rate and I would return again. One recommendation is if you want to eat at your leisure you want to be there within the first hour. It can get extremely busy. Rooms are small but that is typical in New York so I wouldn’t think of the room as a suite.

title: EXCELLENT Stay and Location
text:
Located this hotel on hotels tonight app and so glad I did!!!! Hotel just opened almost 2 years ago so has many modern updates and amenities that many NYC hotels do not. We stayed for a Fri-Sat weekend getaway to sightsee and this was the perfect location. Hotel is on W 37th just off 6th Avenue so is right around the corner from 34th street, 42nd street/Times Square and close walk to the subways. Our check In was quick, Anthony at the attached A1 parkIng was friendly and helpful, the key operated elevators made us feel safe and our 8th floor room, although not a great view was wonderful!!! We had a king size bed, pull out couch with huge headboard/divider thing that had 2 tv's, a fridge, microwave and coffeemaker... although small the room was maximized for space and amenities and is unheard of in nyc in a room (if you want spacious rooms, don't stay in the city!) Hotel has a nightly reception with free snacks AND drinks, a free breakfast buffet with made to order omelet yes and eggs and a rooftop  area that I'm sure is fab in the spring and summer. 

Customer Service: Manager on duty Craig, bartender Karen, concierge Dinu, and Anita and Vanessa at the front desk we're phenomenal  ! The manager went above and beyond with a check in issue that was not the fault of the hotel, Karen really made us feel like old friends, I watched Dinu work hard and providing excellent customer service to every customer he came in contact with (although they don't tip?? What's up with that, please give him a raise!) and the front desk ladies were great! So glad I found this gem - they have a loyal customer!

title: Nice hotel but really dishonest about fees
text:
This hotel, upon check in, told me that there was a "new $25 per night tax" imposed by New York City on them per room as per some date in November that they had to pass onto guests. This is totally, unabashedly false. And it's really not nice to take advantage of out-of-towners like this.

There is no tax from New York State, from New York City, from New York anywhere. It's one thing to have a fee, it's another thing to lie and call it a tax from the city to make it look like you're not charging a fee. It's dishonest and I reported it to the NY Division of Consumer Protection so hopefully it stops.

Pros: nice hotel rooms, spacious with nice layout. Breakfast is free and pretty spectacular for a free breakfast. 

Cons: Elevators are a disaster, not enough capacity, guests who seemingly have never used elevators before, you often have to wait 5-7 mins for an elevator.

title: Perfektes Stadthotel
text: Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral gelegen. Das Frühstück ist sehr gut, es werden Omelettes nach Wunsch gemacht und es ist sehr vielfältig. Wir hatten ein Zimmer mit Balkon, wobei Balkon eine Untertreibung ist. Es war ein große Dachterasse mit seitlichem Blick auf das Empire State Building. Die Angestellten waren alle sehr und extrem hilfsbereit. Wir würden das Hotel nochmals buchen.

title: Fun weekend
text: Well located near Time Square. Very clean hotel,very friendly and helpful staff. Very good amenities. Every request made were handled promptly. Looking forward to staying there again on our next visit

title: I'd do it again....
text:
I am always weary of hotel properties in Manhattan that brand themselves as a specialized chain. Residence Inns or Homewoods not really having a traditional kitchen, etc. While this property didn't have a huge 10 story sprawling atrium, they did a great job delivering what I would expect from an Embassy Suites hotel.

Centrally located near Times Square, very easy walk to the theater district, and multiple Subway lines.

They unfortunately did not have a true "suite" to offer me upon my arrival, but my room on the 32nd floor was comfortable and had a beautiful view. Because it's Manhattan, the closet was small and stuck in the bathroom, and the only drawers to put away clothing were under the bed, but overall I tend to anticipate these type of modifications in Manhattan.

I was not able to enjoy their breakfast secondary to my early morning departure from the hotel, but I did stop by their evening reception each night on the 4th floor. There was always a nice array of chips, dips, and a crudite. The bartenders were friendly, and poured a nice complimentary cocktail. Of note, you can choose to upgrade to some top shelf cocktails and wine during the reception. I found the complementary offerings quite satisfactory.

Lobby was welcoming, and there was always a couple of containers with very fresh fruit waters, sometimes with cucumber sometimes with mixed berries, and once with fresh pineapple. A great welcome when walking home from the subway.

The front desk staff was not the fastest and most efficient I've ever seen, but also far from the worst.

I look forward to visiting this property again during my next trip to Manhattan.

title: Gets the job done, I guess.
text: It’s a place to come after a long day and lay down. I wouldn’t want to spend a lot of time in the small room as it’s extremely claustrophobic. No hot water for two days, but continued checking people in with no warning. The last day we tried to go down to the breakfast at 6, when it should have been started, but most of the hot items still weren’t out as we left at 6:30 to get to the airport.

title: Excellent value in a prime location
text: One of the best combinations of value, interesting space/designs, and great locations you can find.  Very modern, this property has a restaurant, a bar, complementary breakfast (which is much better than most other standard hotel breakfasts), and a complementary happy hour.  There is a super cool rooftop/ outdoor garden that would be wonderful to relax in.  We did not use it because of cold weather, but it is very nicely designed.  The staff is professional and friendly.  Overall, this is a fantastic option for a short weekend getaway or a longer trip to the city.

title: Great Room, problems final night
text: In general it was a great lace to stay for New York. Staff was nice, room was beautiful, had a good view, butbthe last night of the stay there was no hot water. It was a known issue and the people staying at the hotel were not notified in any way. After a 16hr day of work and no way to take a hot shower not a good way to end the week. I got some points thrown my way... that’s it. I would stay here again but if something like that happened again I would push harder for for a better reaction!

title: Great location in midtown
text: Wife and I had a night out in the city and enjoyed our stay. Room was very clean. Interesting to find the rooms are not carpeted. Clothes closet is in the bathroom. Spacious modern shower was great. Breakfast area very crowded. Good value and would stay here again!

title: Double charged, poor service, poor accommodations
text: I was double charged for my 1 night stay. The checkout receptionist was incompetent and untrained. The phone goes unanswered when I try to call to correct this. The one time someone answered someone said hello and then hung up, more indications of the overwhelmed and poorly trained staff.  No hot water in the room. Elevators were overwhelmed making entrance and exiting very difficult.  Signs indicate it takes 39 to 45 minutes to get the “free” breakfast.  So many choices in this area...avoid this one.

title: No hot water
text: Nov 15 there is no hot water again and the annoying part is that every time we ask they say “ we are expecting it in about an hour.” Do not come here. They did offer us a chance to be moved to another hotel as we were checking in but they also said they fully expected the water to be back on.

title: No hot water for two days
text: Came into town for a college visit.  Checked in and noticed no hot water.  Called down to front desk and was told it would be on soon.  Next day, no hot water.  Called down and they said they did not have an eta.  Came back at 2 PM to take a shower, no hot water.  It has been two days without a shower.  Called desk and said I thought I was owed the room comped, was told since I went through a major online site to book the room, they were not sure what they could do.  Really????   I called the site’s customer service number and they offered $100 which is totally inadequate for a hotel without a working shower for two days.  I understand things happen, but they have to treat guests better than this.

title: No hot water as of November 15.
text: They have no hot water and are not alerting anyone to it. Just keep checking people in and deal with it later. No customer service at all. No idea when or if this is going to get resolved. Just an alert.

title: WORST HOTEL!
text: We got to our room and Unpacked our belongings and about an hour later they called asking us to switch rooms as they said many of the sofabeds were broken and our room was one. I said I was leaving to go to dance events with my kids so we couldn’t move.  When I came back they offered a discount for the night and said I could switch tomorrow since they are sold out of rooms.  Next day I asked and they said a room still wasn’t available.  I said my son had to sleep on their uncomfortable couch.  They called me three times while I was busy with my kids asking I now come back to switch rooms but I had taken a subway to Long Island City and couldn’t and they were spending time trying to bargain a price and not switch rooms.  I finally said my priority is my children and I don’t have time for this!  When I returned around 6pm, they apologized and emanated to now give me less than $100 off the first night ($58 off a night) and O became upset.  The manager said “Well those Europeans came and broke all our beds!”  I ended up getting them to agree to $100 a night (so I thought). They said the next night I was required to switch rooms since now I know it is broken.   Next day that bill comes and it is $58 a night off not $100 so I went to front desk very upset so they made the change. I stood with my two kids in lobby and they said sorry we don’t have a room available for you but u can leave luggage here and we will put it in your new room.  We then went to eat their free breakfast and couldn’t because they had taken our keys and we couldn’t get in breakfast rooms.  We then went to more dance events and when we came back, got our new room cards and arrived at the new room and our luggage was not there!  I had to call and ask someone to please bring it up.  Talk about the worst stay ever!  I normally stay at the Comfort Inn where so far after a year it’s always been great (and we go there like once a month) and don’t care to try Embassy Suites ever again!  And...I still haven’t gotten over the Europeans comment!!!

title: Overnight in Midtown Manhattan
text: Overnight in Manhattan - room was large and comfortable.  Dining area/reception area is small, but adequate.  Tom at the bar was very good - service excellent.  Could not get the room heat to really go on, but room was warm enough and bed very comfortable.

title: Convenient, accommodating
text: Blocks from Macy's, Times Square, Grand Central. Extremely convenient. Rooms clean and well-appointed. There's a sense of suite even in smaller rooms with separation of sitting area and sleep space. Breakfast and evening reception included. Also very reasonable for this quality in NY.

title: Sunrise Experience
text: I really enjoy my experience and stay at the Embassy Suite I wouldn't change anything about the experience but it would be even better you would change your snack selection at the complimentary happy hour but overall everything was excellent

title: Good Hotel
text: This hotel is in the good location and safe in the central NY city. They offers an excellent free breafast, staffs are very professional. Their Room is clean, my kids were enjoy the hotel very much. We would like to come back in the future

title: gOOD lOCATION, Great Breakfast
text: in the middle between EMpire State Building and Rockefeller Center and close to TImes Square. The room space in not big but the room is OK and we got a nice view on the Empire State Building! and as well the room of breakfast have small places and is always full of people, but the the food is very good!

title: Poor elevator service and no storage space in room
text: Many trips to NYC so we know the hotel value proposition. Had good experience with Embassy Suites in other locations and decided to try this property. Biggest issue was the elevator service. There are only 3 elevators for a 39 floor hotel. The elevator cars are small and elevator traffic management system was clearly not capable of efficiently assigning cars. Wait time’s of 5-10 minutes we’re common. We were on the 25th floor and experience several times when fully loaded cars would stop on the way down requiring additional wait time.

title: Convenient and comfortable
text:
I was at the one on 37th near Broadway. It’s a great location for midtown and close to subways and trains. It’s tall with 30+ floors but has a narrow profile. It only has 3 small elevators which caused long waits. The free breakfast is good but very popular. I ended up taking my food to the room because it was so crowded. I liked the room which had a nice view and wasn’t too small. It had a good number of power outlets. The bathroom was roomy with a nice size shower. 
This was ideal for midtown.

title: Great amenities and friendly staff
text: Ladies trip with six of us celebrating a 50th birthday. Our flight arrival was pretty early in the morning, so we didn’t expect to get checked in right away, but the staff was very accommodating with holding our luggage and making sure we had connecting rooms once they were ready. Matter of fact, the staff was very helpful and friendly the entire stay, taking our pictures, opening up a private conference room for us to sit to eat the breakfast as well as providing great recommendations. As far as the hotel, it’s certainly not the biggest and seems tucked away a little, but was exactly what we needed. The breakfast buffet and cooked to order omelets were excellent, the evening reception provided tasty snacks and drinks and the rooms were plenty comfortable for 3 of us in each room. The area is a little more laid back then being right in the middle of Times Square, but still close enough to walk to it and many attractions. With that said, I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend a stay at this hotel.

title: Mycket bra hotell!
text: Fantastisk hotell! Bra läge och fantastisk utsikt över staden. God frukost buffét, men behövs flera bord och större utrymme för gästerna. Annars en fantastisk ställe att bo på, mycket prisvärd! Jag tänker boka hotellet nästa gång jag reser till New York City!

title: My stay
text:
Room is so small; with 3rd bed open is impossible to walk around. I discourage more than 2 people to get there.
Breakfast room (and access to )was so crowded ; I wonder how minimal safety requirements can satisfied

title: Good weekend
text: Will recommend as a good hotel for Midtown events! Was easy to get to if using GPS. Had no problem without it though. Back entrance and one way streets can be tricky if you don’t know your first time.

title: OCTOBER 2019- Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan
text: Overall I loved our stay, everyone was very polite and courteous. The parking situation was horrible, they could use some customer service training...I'll definitely stay again sometime in the near future

title: Flott hotel - kan anbefales.
text:
Flott hotell rett i nærheten av Times Square. Vi fikk rom i 31. etg med flott utsikt fra rommet. 
Skulle egentlig bo på U Hotel 5th Avenue (Hotel.com), men var misfornøyd med Hotellet pga feilinformasjon og ikke korrekt bilde av hotellet. Venter på å få refundert beløpet fra U Hotel 5th Avenue pga reklamasjon. 
Anbefaler Embassy Suite Hotel. Hotellet viste vilje og interesse for å hjelpe til med et flott rom og i tillegg et rom med utsikt. Rommet var stort og trivelig. Rommet hadde flott TV skjerm, lite kjøleskap og en stor safe.

title: Great Location, Excellent Staff
text: The staff here is superior.  The hotel can be busy at times and the people are unfailingly  friendly and supportive to guests.  The location is near the Theater District and other attractions.  Our room was clean with good bedding and HVAC.  WiFi worked well.  There was a string area with a screen between the couch and the bed.  A small fridge, microwave and coffee maker were available.  There were two flat screen TVs with lots of channels.  A few of the channels suffered from tiling and sound problems.   Bathroom had a shower and was large enough for one person at a time.  The breakfast offered has a buffet or guests can also order a freshly prepared omelet.  Food was good.  In the evenings (5:30-7:30pm) guests may attend a reception with drinks and food.   These are popular daily events and can be very busy.   Hospitality at this hotel is excellent and could be a model for all Hilton venues.  We will go back.  If you find this information to be helpful please click the link below to let us know.

title: GOOD LOCATION, COMFORTABLE ROOMS, GREAT BREAKFAST AND EVENING RECEPTION
text: Located midway between Times Square and Penn Station, the hotel is walking distance from relevant sights and subways. By NYC standards, the room is spacious and comfortable. The made-to-order breakfast is delicious, with warm and cold options, and the evening reception includes good wine and provides the opportunity for interesting conversation. I would have given five stars instead of four if some of the reception staff were less abrupt in the way they speak to patrons; I wonder if it's a matter of poor training.

title: Not what as advertised
text: When things are not open for the season like the restaurant and outdoor seating area then they should update their website to indicate such. The breakfast area for the size is inadequate to handle the crowd. The breakfast was otherwise fine. Before social hour ended they placed reserved seating signs on tables when vacated for some group or meeting. The doorman and the front desk personnel some of the best in our years of going to Embassy Suites around America.

title: Everything you expect from a Hilton plus more
text: I need it a room for just a couple hours long layover to Amsterdam from NYC. We found this gem by mistake and I couldn't be happier. Rooms are great for NYC average plus BREAKFAST was bomb.Staff is also A+ and location is perfect.

title: couple getaway
text: location is only a few blocks from Times Square.  Rockerfeller Plaza within walking distance. Hotel very clean and everyone friendly and professional.  Happy hour nice with wine/beer/mixed drinks, snacks okay, some nights better than others

title: Clean and friendly hotel
text: Great hotel.  Walking distance to Times Square and all theaters. You can’t go wrong at this location. Modern rooms recently updated. Nice bed and bedding.  Fantastic complimentary breakfast. Excellent staff

title: A Few Tips About this Embassy Suites
text:
This 300 room plus 39 story Embassy is located near the corner of 37th Street and 6th Avenue.  The walk is doable to this hotel both from Grand Central and Penn Station.  We prefer Penn Station, but a taxi will get you there in no time.  

The front desk is friendly.  There is no problem if you need to store your gear before or after your hotel stay.  I did inquire about having a “fan,” as I like the noise and circulation.  This hotel does not carry fans. The AC system is cold enough to your liking on those hot days in NYC. 

The room is smaller than your normal Embassy Suites due to location.  The comfort you expect is quite evident with comfortable beds and a modern bathroom. There is even a small refrigerator.  

We stayed at this Embassy twice over ten weeks.  Both times we selected a room “with a view.”  Our first experience we were on the 38th floor with commanding views of the Empire State building, World Trade Tower in the distance and you could see the largest store in the world—Macy’s—down below.  It was quite an experience to view a storm coming over NYC.  We felt totally safe.

Our second experience was not so thrilling.  We were placed on the 24th floor facing a building.  

One of the highlights of all Embassy’s is the breakfast. Jorge cooks one superb omelet and even better “eggs over easy.”  An Ecuadorian, he is indeed friendly.  I am so glad that the computer machine on the wall was not working on our second visit.  You could actually converse with Jorge. Ordering by the grill is much better than the computer on the wall.  

Breakfast has all your favorite meats—bacon and sausage—and different types of cereals and yogurts.  It did not have, though, hard boiled eggs or even poached eggs—my wife’s favorite source of protein.  I brought this fact up to the manager who called the kitchen.  She learned that they do not cook these styles of eggs.  

The Managers “Happy Hour” is well attended. For a solid two hours, beer, wine and many cocktail drinks are on the house.  You may not get a seat if you get there too late!  

If you are not so lucky, the ice-machine may be on another floor.  This can be a hassle.   The elevators for the most part, are quick. You may have to wait longer for one of the four elevators in the morning.  

Overall, we were pleased.  The hotel is centrally located to many attractions and to metro stops.  You can get a comfortable night’s sleep. The only major complaint is they don’t have my wife style of egg’s—which is commonly carried In Hampton’s and many European style hotels.

title: Great location and reasonable pricing.
text: Stayed there for four nights last week attending a business workshop. There were myself and three colleagues. Service is fantastic, as is the check in and check out process. If I can fault anything it is the quality of the 'food' at the complimentary Happy Hour, and the low strength beer they provide. I stayed 10 minutes on my first evening there but didn't go back.

title: Small space; good location; very expensive
text: Very tiny rooms - not really a suite.  We could not even walk around the bed without turning sideways.  When the sofa bed is pulled out, there is no room at all.  Breakfast area is very crowded - no room to sit.  Too overpriced for what you are getting except that it is in a good location.  I would not stay here again.

title: Utmäkt läge
text: Hotellet har ett utmärkt läge nära Bryant Park o Times Square. Trevliga rum, dock ganska små och med begränsade upphängningsmöjligheter. Frukosten, som ingick i priset, var OK för att vara i USA. Dock lite trångt om man åt lite senare frukost.

title: NYC Embassy Suites - good location, wonderful hotel & amenities
text: While rooms are a little small and prices are not cheap (but this is New York City!), it was very nice to have a complimentary breakfast which included made-to-order omelets & other fresh food.  Nice bar with an outside movie theatre (April-October) - not free.  Hotel is very clean & staff very nice.

title: Great location and breakfast
text: Great midtown Manhattan location, and close to Penn Station. Really good complimentary breakfast. Bartender made some excellent drinks at the small ground floor bar and eating area. Only ding would be the breakfast area gets really crowded by mid morning, and could use more tables.

title: The "Suites" Are Not Really Suites
text: The suites are even more cramped than some regular doubles. The room was very narrow and if you had a 3rd person and pulled the couch out, it was about half the size of most double rooms of comparable hotels. The staff was great and the breakfast very good except the coffee, which was truly horrible. This is kind of important to have at least good coffee for guests in the am.

title: Great location
text: Great location and rooms are good for two people. However, if you have 3 people in a studio it will be tight quarters because the NYC rooms are limited in space. Complimentary breakfast is excellent and evening reception is pleasant with a decent drink selection.

title: Near Madison Square Garden
text: This hotel was clean and staff was for the most part exceptional. Beware there are not too many places to eat nearby especially late night on a Sunday. The evening reception food consisted of tortilla chips, guacamole, crackers and cheese. They did have 3 drinks available plus wine and I think beer. Room was oddly setup with no drawers apparent and closet located in the bathroom.

title: Great place
text: It was very good to stay there, central, clean, quiet, good breakfast, but the only thing missing to get excellent rate from my side would be more smiling people at the front desk. Still an effort and it will be perfect.

title: nice hotel but poor staff attitude
text: room was very clean, buffet very nice, check in was a nightmare....staff was on a power trip.....not nice at all....they need a crash course in smiling, lack people skills, location was great. especially if looking for formal or bridal wear. close to subway. I would have given 5 stars except for teh terrible check in staff

title: Stay at another Hilton Hotel
text: We stayed for the first time at the Embassy Suites mid town in NY. The people working the counter are lazy, not willing to help and not interested in your stay. Please stay at another Hilton in Manhattan as there are many wonderful options.

title: Great Experience
text: We primary stayed at the hotel for the location, however if I was again going to the theatre in NYC I would definitely stay here again.  Suite was beautiful and new.  Service was excellent and the made to order breakfast was delicious.

title: Overall ok
text: Service was not great at check-in, especially for a diamond member but fortunately we didn't spend much time in the hotel. We got to breakfast but they didn't have hot options until an hour after they opened. Location is great, only a 10 min walk to Times Square and close to Empire State Building.

title: Great visit,  fabulous location
text: Great location in Manhattan.   Fabulous breakfast.   Helpful staff.  Easy access to lots of attractions,  including car rental and Manhattan Fencing School.   Only complaint is water pressure is a little low, but otherwise a great place.

title: Poor Quality Reservation system and Service
text:
At over $500 you’d expect consistency in service and a reservation and check in system that works. 

We have 2 reservations because we used travel points for one booking and cash for the second. Despite multiple contacts via email and telephone conversations with Hilton to ensure our reservations were linked and we still had to check-in a second time because they deactivated our room card. Then they couldn’t find our reservation and took even more time to fix it. The staff were very helpful but everything that the Hilton’s reservation operator told us was wrong and misrepresented what we would have to do to ensure there was no disruption in our stay. 

Every day there is something that housekeeping forgets to give us. Day one- no coffee and no sweetener. Day 2- no hair conditioner, bar soap, and Kleenex.  We are here for two more days and hoping that they can get things right. 

Unfortunately we’re staying at another Hilton later on this month in New York which we can’t change!  Fingers crossed they are better. 

We have a future bookings in Florida in December which we will be cancelling. 

We will not consider a Hilton for a long time!

title: Excellent Customer Service and Location
text: Check in was a breeze!  Staff was super helpful and worked around our schedule of shows on check in day, even sending us notification when our room was ready.  Our bags were securely stowed even though we hadn't checked in yet.  Tim at the front desk was especially awesome throughout our stay.  We are Hilton Silver members but were treated like diamond.  Room was perfectly appointed, clean and had a spectacular view.  The free made to order breakfast was an added perk and one that we had not expected. Free evening reception with drinks and snacks also made our stay all the better.  Georie at the bar made evening reception great!  He worked magic on keeping the line at a manageable level but not once made us feel rushed.  I have worked in all level of food service and hospitality management and Georgie is a prime example of what the future management in this hotel should look like, pure professionalism.  We could not have been happier with our stay in any way.  Thanks for making us feel so welcome!

title: Abysmal customer service.
text: I have been a Hilton diamond member for more than 10 years. I arrived to the hotel at 7 and was told that check in is at 4 pm and they didnt have any clean rooms but that housekeeping gets in at 8 am and as soon as they got in they would work on my room to get me checked in as quickly as possible. We left our phone number for them to call. We went to breakfast and came back and our room at 11 am was still not available. It's now 2 pm, no phone call, no email no I'm so sorry your room isn't available yet. The gentleman in the morning was great but then 2 ladies took over that were terrible.

title: The view was amazing
text:
We stayed on the 35th floor and the Empire State Building was right there outside of our window. I really liked that you could open the window a little bit to listen to the sounds of the city. 

I wouldn't recommend the king bed room with a view unless you are going solo. I really wish I had gotten the king studio because we were constantly bumping in to each other. The room itself was nice and modern and the bed was comfortable (and that is coming from someone who almost never finds hotel beds to be comfortable). 

The breakfast room was a bit crowded but it was good with a decent selection.

The location was okay. Very close to Times Square if that's your thing. It is directly across the street from a strip club. It didn't bother us, but might bother someone else.

title: A great place to stay in Manhattan.
text:
This is a grreat place to stay in NY.
Nice room, affordable price, great central location and the complimentary breakfast is a real treat in Manhattan. Close to all the tourist mambo jambo, easy public transport nearby, clean and very helpful staff.

title: Best of the best
text: 10 out of 10 ... From the manager Craig , who is always on site , giving a helping hand , to the cleanliness of the hotel , the rooms and the site in general ..the rooms are spacious , bathrooms spotless and updated .. The bed was beyond comfortable and the pillows were amazing ... Three separate areas to eat or drink , the outdoor-lawn chair movie theater very Uniquie.. .All the staff is friendly and the Am breakfast , include was off the charts delicious ...I highly recommend this hotel , pricing is fair , service spot on and the hotel is close to everything unique about NYC ..

title: Modern and great location
text: Our room was small but so well thought out.  Very cool design. Both the  Breakfast and  the cocktails were substantial.  In our many trips to NYC, we had never stayed in this part of town.  We found it a fun location with easy walks to Times Sq. Etc. Subway stations were also close.  Thoroughly enjoyable.

title: Easy to like
text: Traveled solo so New York room size was no problem. I think it would work very well for a couple. Front desk was always helpful. The free breakfast and manager's reception (free drinks) both had plenty of time. The room was modern and clean.

title: Bumped me without notice
text:
I had a confirmed reservation (a month in advance), but at checkin time they said they had no room for me because of "overbooking".  As a result I was stuck in New York in the middle of the night with nowhere to go.

They didn't even offer me any kind of voucher or recompensation for the inconvenience.  Just directed me to another Hilton half a mile away.  Then the other Hilton charged me a $200 higher rate for the night.

Altogether a terrible experience.  I'll be going with Marriott from now on.

title: Times Squareの近く
text: 設備は新しく快適に宿泊できる。私が宿泊した部屋は、シャワールームの部屋でバスタブなし。ロビーには、ビジネスルームが併設されていてそこでプリンターも使用可能。帰りのShuttleが車での待ち時間に使用した。

title: Nice hotel located in a great area but rooms are sized for a child.
text: This hotel is located close to 6th Avenue. It's about a block from Herald Square, 5 minute walk to Bryant Park and a 10-15 minute walk to Grand Central.  It's clean and the staff is friendly and helpful.  Breakfast is good.  The rooms are very small.  My husband, son and I were on top of each other for 4 days. All I heard was complaints from my family.  Once the pull out couch is unfolded, there is no place to walk or sit except on the beds.  We could not even invite our older son who is going to college in the city to come up to our room to visit.  I will not be staying here again.

title: Localização maravilhosa e estádia fantástica!
text: Localizado à alguns metros da Times Square e à poucos metros do metrô que te leva em qualquer ponto de Nova York. Café da Manhã maravilhoso! Ficaria novamente nesse hotel com toda certeza! Simplesmente fantástico!

title: NYC trip
text:
This hotel is well located.
Our room was small but very clean.
The staff here are courteous and helpful.
Complimentary breakfast is great!
Our room had a view of the Empire State building.
Walking distance to a lot of shops, restaurants, and important sightseeing places in NYC.

title: Anniversary trip
text:
Enjoyed our trip to New York and the location of the Hotel.
Greatly recommend this location and the Hilton brands.
Housekeeping went above and beyond to assist any needs.
Heist Restaurant is outstanding

title: Bra läge och helt okej frukost
text: Var i New York och firade min 40 årsdag i 4 dagar. Hotellet ligger nära Time Square och lätt att hitta från Penn station. Receptionen var bemannad dygnet runt och hade en liten bar, dock så stängde den 11 på varje kväll. Rummen var trevliga, men bristen på upphängningsmöjligheter drar ner betyget. Blöta handdukar hamnade tyvärr på golvet. Inte så miljövänligt att få nya handdukar varje dag. Sköna sängar. Frukosten var trevlig med många valmöjligheter. Undvik rusningen mellan 8:30 tills frukosten stänger, finns inga sittplatser då. Var ibland svårt att får tag i hissarna, 3 stycken på ett 40 våningshus är inte optimalt. Bjuder på vin och tilltugg på eftermiddagarna.

title: Home away from home!
text: Great customer experience! Great location, safe neighborhood and walking distance to parks, including Central Park, Time Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Plaza and garment district. The staff at hotel are professional, helpful and friendly!

title: Ok hotell
text:
Var her i 4 netter. 
Hadde rom i 25 etasje. Fin utsikt. Bra aircondition. 
God seng. 
Stol på rom var særdeles skitten. Har foregått litt av hvert i den stolen tror jeg. 
Hadde lest at det kunne bli kaos i frokostsalen. Så jeg var der ved åpningstider og hadde ingen problemer. 
Gratis snacks og drikke på kveldstid. Men trege servitører så mange som ikke ville vente på servering. 
Hotellets temperatur var kaldt. Da mest i frokost sal. Folk satt med jakker. 
Hotellet ligger sentralt.

title: Manager Called the Police
text: My family’s stay at this hotel was uneventful until checkout. I got my car from the garage and parked it in front of the hotel on the loading area. I made several trips from the 12th floor and back bringing my family’s luggage to the car, helping my wife’s grandmother (she has disability and needs help walking), and bringing down my two babies (23mo and 4mo). The manager decided that It was too long and called NYPD Lansing me a $115 parking ticket. I came to the front desk to report the ticket and I was informed the hotel had nothing to do with it. Another guest who overheard the conversation about my car and the decision to call the police told me about it. Not only did the manger called the police to get me fined, but he also lied about it.

title: Great For a Quickie to The Big City
text: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Manhattan Times Square, Friday 9/13 - Sunday 9/15/2019 and found the hotel to be more than adequate for our needs.  The party include my wife and her brother and the room configuration made the stay quite enjoyable.

title: Made in Manhattan
text: Came for our anniversary (37 years!). Location was right in the middle of everything we wanted to do from the Broadway shows to the Today Show and just a couple of blocks from the Empire State building. Free breakfast and reception took the sting out of New York's high prices. Walked to most things saving some money while getting a little exercise. Hotel and staff were great. This was a great find living up to the Embassy Suites name. Will come again.

title: Great Location
text: Great location in walking distance to all the attractions. Nice hotel and good breakfast. The private terrace was amazing. Would stay here again and again!!! The service was good, rooms clean and very comfortable. You can walk to all the sites and shopping.

title: Comfortable, clean and friendly service.
text: The location of this hotel between Penn Station and Times Square was perfect for our purposes during this trip. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the well designed room, though not large,  was larger than many in NY. The quality of breakfast was excellent, and space used for breakfast and evening reception was adequate. The staff here were very friendly as well. The rooftop bar on the 3rd floor was also a pleasant experience.  All in all a very nice stay.

title: Outstanding Front Desk service with a smile
text:
I stayed to visit friends in the city & I could not have been happier with the excellent front desk staff! They were all friendly and helpful despite how busy this hotel was- I want to especially shout out to Dahiana & Anita for always helping & chatting with me & never rushing me- Always with a great big smile on their faces. Often times in other properties, check-in is not always met with very sociable staff!
Thanks y'all & can't wait to return to your fabulous hotel!

title: Pésima atención
text: Nadie habla español ni te ayudan, estamos alojados y es lo peor que hay, no saben lo que es servicio al huésped, el desayuno horrible, cuando tenes que solucionar algo vas a recepción y no te entienden ni tratan de ayudarte, jamás volveremos

title: Consigliato
text:
Hotel moderno in posizione centrale, nelle immediate vicinanze si trova la 5 Avenue, Bryant Park e l’Empire State Building. A Dieci minuti Time Square.
Il personale all’arrivo non è apparso particolarmente empatico: oltre all’assenza di un atteso “welcome”e un sorriso di accompagnamento, non è stata data alcuna spiegazione sui servizi dell’hotel al check-in.
La camera assegnata differiva da quella prenotata (King con vista): segnalato l’errore abbiamo ottenuto quanto spettava. 
La stanza era di dimensioni adeguate per 3 persone; il bagno era dotato di ampia doccia.
Nota negativa: in tutto il tempo di permanenza al contrario del letto e del bagno,  i pavimenti della stanza non sono mai stati puliti, nonostante una puntuale segnalazione al personale.
Colazione sostanziosa e di buona qualità con piatti espressi, su richiesta. 
Possibile gustare un aperitivo in terrazza panoramica.
Struttura sicuramente consigliabile, nonostante i difetti rilevati, che non dovrebbero trovarsi in un quattro stelle: motivo per il quale attribuisco un giudizio finale nella media.

title: Good stay
text:
Enjoyed our stay here. The breakfast was very good and I especially liked how you could order eggs/omelettes on a screen and come back for them.
The beds were comfy. However the rooms were small (to be expected in NYC) but they should not be advertised as suites, there is absolutely no privacy from one side of the room to the other. 
Most of the front desk staff were friendly, not all of them. 
Location was good... about 10 mins out of the centre of times square.

title: Great stay and fantastic location!
text: I had a wonderful stay at this hotel.  The location was unbeatable, and the accommodations exceeded my expectations.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again.  The hotel staff were extraordinarily responsive to my requests for assistance.

title: Not the best Embassy Suites
text:
As others have mentioned, as an downtown NYC hotel, the rooms are smaller than an average Embassy Suites. I get that. But to have the front desk trick you into an even smaller room, is severely disappointing to this Diamond. Some staff are less than customer service oriented. Maid service not occurring until 5pm, when you are trying to get cleaned up for evening plans...

The pluses...good location. Standard breakfast and Manager's Reception, although the room and facilities are small and crowded. Rooms seem very new or recently modernized. More employees in breakfast/reception area than I have seen in other ES operations, doing a really great job keeping up with the flow. However, bartenders were a bit surly, and weren't fully ready to start serving when the reception started.

I doubt we will stay here in the future. There are better Hilton family members in the area.

title: A jewel in Times Square
text: This was a lovely hotel. Very comfortable with great location.  Our room looked out at the Empire State Building. Wonderful happy hour and breakfast buffet. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I will stay here again.

title: Smaller size embassy suite.
text: This embassy was located in the fashion district, close to Empire State Building, Bryant park and more. Macy’s is within walking distance. This is not your typical suite. It is one room separated by a 3/4 wall with bed on one side and couch on the other. The couch is supposedly a pull out though I can’t see how there was enough room ( it probably was) . I shared the room with two other people. They took the King size bed and I just slept on the couch without pulling it out. It was very comfortable. The hotel had a free buffet which was very good. The staff was nice . I would stay here again.

title: Great hotel
text: Great location close to shopping as well as Pen Station. The room was spacious and a very comfortable bed! Great breakfast and evening reception with drinks and snacks. Will stay again if we go back to NYC.

title: Embassy Suites by name only
text:
Second time at this hotel. Not a typical Emb S. Small room with pullout bed divided by a fabric wall which is part of the pullout. OK for 2 adults and young child.
Good location between 5th and 6th on 37th a few yards to 6th ave.

Cocktail hour on 4th floor is free with decent selection-two bartenders when we were there. Seating for the CH and breakfast is very limited.
Breakfast is also free and made to order ( buffet also available with good selection) if you can figure out the on the wall I - pad type ordering system. Took me some time to get it. When I asked the cook,  which is next to the ordering system,  whether he has egg whites he kept saying press enter-this went on a couple of times. Many others were having trouble which held up the line and added to the situation. On our last day-a Sunday -a very helpful; young lady stood by the ordering  system and helped . Be aware that the seating is very - very limited mostly for breakfast. You may end up with trey in hand and no place to sit. Send the kids to hold a table!

Tip: when booking ask for a floor no higher than the 6th so you can take the stairs to breakfast and the CH. 3 elevators which are very slow and at peak times packed.
 
You may be surprised on how long you will wait if on a mid to high floor.

All in all,a decent place considering that most hotels offer less.
Hotel front staff, maid staff  were always acomodating. Not sure about the made to order cook-he needs bedside manner training!
Remember this is NYC and space is limited.

title: DA CANCELLARE
text: L'esperienza peggiore della mia vita, per tutto il nostro gruppo. nonostante avessimo saldato interamente l'hotel dall'italia, al nostro arrivo non si trovava la prenotazione, le stanze sono state rese disponibili dopo diverse ore (in tarda notte), le stanze (2 familiari) sono claustrofobiche, la mia famiglia per errore ha dovuto soggiornare in una stanza con bagno per disabili scomodissimo per chi non ha queste particolari necessità, i "sofa bed" che in realtà sono poltrone letto non erano neppure preparati e anzi neanche le ragazze dell'hotel riuscivano ad aprire la scomodissima poltrona che poi ci siamo dovuti preparare noi. ma questo è nulla in confronto al branco di persone che staziona alla reception: TUTTI i dipendenti di questo hotel sono persone più che maleducate ed ineficcenti. al nostro gruppo sono state addebitate per errore due volte degli importi sulle carte di credito a titolo di fantomatiche "cauzioni" ed oltre a ciò all'altra famiglia che viaggiava con noi è stato riaddebitato INTERAMENTE il soggiorno che invece era stato regolarmente pagato dall'Italia. indisponenti, maleducati, menefreghisti ma soprattutto incapaci di svolgere il lavoro che dovrebbe essere quello di cercare di soddisfare il cliente. da sconsigliare a tutti.

title: ロケーションも良し、テレビも大きい！
text:
Embassy Suitesですから、朝食は無料です。
Hampton Innなどと違い、卵料理やソーセージなどもあるので少しは食べる気になるかと思います。
ロケーションも良く、エンパイアステイトビルなどの観光場所、色々な食事場所も近くにあるので過ごしやすいと思います。
大通りからは少し入っていて、ホテルの前でもタクシーはやっていないので、タクシーは捕まえにくいため、UBERなどのアプリを使って呼ぶ方が便利です。
300m以内にはWholefoodsやTarget、CVSなどのお店もあり、お土産も買いやすいと思います。
さらに、ブロードウェイのショーも歩いて観に行けるロケーションです！
ただ、シャワーの水圧が弱いことや部屋が狭いのが難点ですが、価格もリーズナブルなどで総合的には平均点かと思います。

title: Encantada
text: Ha cumplido todas las expectativas, excelente ubicación podíamos ir andando a muchos sitios, el Empire State,Time Square,la zona muy segura algo muy importante para mí ya que iba con mí hija, la habitación con unas vistas espectaculares en la planta 34, muy cómoda, cama súper grande, siempre limpia, muy completa con microondas, cafetera, nevera, la atención del personal excelente, completamente satisfecha

title: Not a great stay
text: My friends and I stayed at this hotel in 2018 as we were attending the US Open and we had a great experience. However, this stay got off to a bad start from the beginning. When we checked in, the front desk clerk said they were overbooked and we couldn't have a suite (which is the entire reason we wanted to stay there). We agreed to just have a King bed instead (really no choice). The clerk said we could switch after the first night to a suite, but we were going to be gone the entire day so when would we even have been able to switch? It was just too much hassle. The next day when we came back around 7:30pm, our door was propped open (I assume by housekeeping). We walked in and luckily nothing had been stolen, but of course I made a complaint to the front desk about it and told them to let the manager know. I didn't receive any other communication from them during our stay. The other reason we stayed there was because of the free breakfast, but each day we tried to go it was a literal madhouse; you could barely squeeze by and get your food. It was like the entire city of New York was trying to get breakfast for two hours. We gave up after the first day and never went back. We won't stay here again; the prices were higher than comparable other Hiltons in the area, and attempting to get a free breakfast as part of the deal just wasn't worth the higher price. And as I stated, you cannot count on getting a suite at Embassy Suites! Oh, the only good customer service we received were the bartenders- they were great!

title: baseballe
text: I took my son and brother up there for a Yankees game and it was nice. The location was great not too far from the subway or anything else. 3 blocks from time square. The service was ok just wish they had computer written directions to the subway and other areas. Hand signalling is not the best was of directions. breakfast was crowded  but the did there best at helping everyone.

title: Nice Hotel, But Not that Close to Broadway!
text: Like Hilton Hotels and am a Honor Member, but will choose a different hotel next time. We were on the 28 floor and had a nice view of The Empire State Building & Macy,s! We were, also situated right in the garment district. Close to some great bargains. The hotel offered a morning breakfast. The rooms to sit for the breakfast were very cramped. The room itself had a queen bed with an oversized large useless chair, a desk and small bathroom. For what we paid per night, I felt the room was snug. The hotel staff were very welcoming as was the morning breakfast staff.

title: 4 Sterne nicht gerechtfertigt
text:
4 Sterne Hotel völlig ungerechtfertigt! Zimmer werden nicht regelmäßig gereinigt! Frische Handtücher mit Flecken! Kaffee aus Pappbechern! 
Klimaanlagen im Haus auf 15 Grad Celsius eingestellt! Alles in Allem keine 4 Sterne wert! Lange des Hotels 
empfehlenswert, wenn man keinen Wert auf Sauberkeit und Klimabewusstsein legt!
2 Punkte nur für die Lage und das Frühstück an sich!

title: Great deal
text: We'll located hotel with a few extras that make a difference. The free breakfast is outstanding with made-to-order omlettes, a buffet, and so many other items. There hotel also has a cool outdoor movie theatre which I've never seen before. Check it out!

title: Fantastisk beliggenhed
text: Dejligt hotel - super centralt beliggende. Rart at komme tilbage til efter en lang god dag i byen. Pæne og meget rene værelser og god morgenmad inkluderet med fantastiske omeletter lavet efter bestilling.

title: Good location, but just OK hotel
text:
Chose this hotel because of the location at Herald Square, where we have stayed at another hotel earlier. Close to Penn Station where you can take the train to/from Newark Airport. Also close to the subway station, about five minute walk, and five-ten minute walk to Times Square. There are some good restaurants in the area, and also short walk to Macys. 

The hotel is clean. The room was a bit small, but was OK for staying five nights. There is a small frigde plus a microwave in the room. Bathroom was clean, but the pressure in the shower could be better. We also had some problems with the toilet. It wouldn't flush when we arrived late at night, and told the reception in the morning. Still wasn't fixed when we came back in the afternoon. On the positive site, they fixed in fast when we told them the second time. Nice people at the reception, and very friendly.

The first morning at the hotel, a sunday, the breakfast area was very crowded. We even had so stand and wait for a table. The room is very small, and way too crowded for a breakfast area. They did not have a gluten free area, and there was noe GF bread (ps. I did not ask for it either - so they might have it in the kitchen), and the food was not marked for allergies. They have a omelet station which was really nice.

The elevators was very slow, especially around breakfast times. This was very disappointing, using so much time just standing and waiting. The doors to the rooms also make a lot of noise, so this woke us up a couple of times when the neighbours left/arrived at their room. 

Would problably try a new hotel next time, even though this was OK.

title: Great hotel.
text: We like Embassy Hotels, so we chose this one because of location.  It did not disappoint.  The reviews showed long waits for the elevators, but we never encountered long waits.  The breakfast area can get crowded, but in the elevator there is a notice of busiest times.  Avoid the busiest times and it is not bad at all.  Normal hotel crowds.  The breakfast is very good and they had choices.  Made to order or buffet.  Always very good fruit.  The room is not your typical Embassy Suite, but a New York hotel room, but was very adequate.  The couch is a high back divider.  The room was very clean and surprisingly very quiet. No hall or street noise.  Staff was very helpful and friendly.  I would definitely stay here again.  They also have an evening reception.

title: Bel emplacement
text:
Hotel super bien situé. Rue tranquille mais près de time square. Presque tout se fait en marchant. Chambres bien insonorisées, on n'entendait rien dehors.
Nous avions une chambre avec un lit king et un lit murphy. Nous étions 2 adultes et notre fille de 11 ans. Lit confo, mais chambre petite... Pas beaucoup de place dans la salle de bain non plus. Notre chambre était au 2 face au gym... Un peu bruyant, si on y retourne, on demanderait un autre étage.
Belle terasse sur le toit.
Déjeuner inclut avec buffet chaud. Mais beaucoup de monde... 
Pas très bel acceuil cependant. Personel pas trop intéressé... Pas de concierge non plus.
Stationnement à côté, public mais relié à l'hôtel, on paie à l'hôtel. Il y a des escaliers, pas évident avec les bagages. Et cher, mais bon, c'est NY!

title: Friendly staff & Great location
text:
We stay at various hotels in NYC but this was the first hotel where we received great service and a smile from every staff member we encountered starting with Nick and Anaya at the front desk.
Guests are greeted at breakfast and evening reception with a warm welcome. Despite how busy both times were, the staff worked hard to replenish food and clear tables while maintaining a cheerful disposition. A special shout-out goes to Freddy the bartender for his upbeat and friendly attitude! We looked forward to starting our evening with him (and the complimentary beverages were an added bonus!)
Cheers to all!!

title: Good location, small rooms, slow elevators
text: We are Hilton loyal and usually stay further uptown, but we tried this location for a change.  The reception staff were all very nice.  The elevators were always crowded and, and you had to wait forever for them.  The rooms were fine, but they were a little cramped.  The table was broken in our room, and there was barely enough room to open both of our suitcases.  Free breakfast was ok, but it was very poorly designed in there for people to move about without running into each other.  They had trouble keeping the food stocked in the chafing dishes.  We enjoyed the location for a change.

title: Great location and hotel
text: I read the other reviews and had none of these issues! The hotel location is amazing, right next to subway... 7 min walk.. I never had to wait a long period of time for an elevator... the happy hour was great... the room was small but it’s NY!! Who cares how big the room is, I am not there to hang out in a room...

title: Location, Location, Location
text:
We were warmly greeted, by the front desk, upon arrival at The Embassy Suites, in Manhattan. Our room was a corner location, on the 38th floor with a great close up view, of the Empire State Building and in the distance, the
 1 WTC (World Trade Center Building). They also offer a free breakfast and an evening cocktail reception, The hotel  is conveniently located a few short blocks from the theater district and Restaurant row.  We will definitely be returning for, a future stay.

title: Nice hotel, great location, friendly staff
text:
In the garment district, and only 3 blocks away from Herald Square (short blocks at that), this is an excellent location to both Herald Square as well as Bryant Park (4-5 blocks) and Times Square (roughly 5 to 6 short blocks). The hotel has been recently renovated- grays and purples in the interior, which are beautifully done. The rooms are nice, with microwave, mini-fridge, desk, updated bathrooms. We stayed in a "studio suite", which was a bit small/tight, but was fine for three people. The sofa in the "living room" was a nice-sized pull-out sofa. The only complaint was the comforter on the bed. The material on the back was really slick which made the covers slide onto the floor 5 minutes after getting into the bed. Very annoying, but otherwise, it was a nice room. You couldn't hear outside noise or neighboring rooms at all- 37th street is not that loud in the evening, but it's at the corner of 6th street which is really busy. Our room was very quiet.  

The front desk staff were nice and they held our bags when we arrived a few hours before check-in so we could explore the area w/o baggage. 

As with any Embassy Suites, full breakfast was available and a nightly reception with snacks at 5:30. The breakfast area gets REALLY CROWDED, so go early - like 7am. Any later than that, and it's just so crowded. 

We'd stay here again when travelling to NYC.

title: NY Hilton
text:
Struttura in buona posiIone ma non adeguata al costo pulizia scarsa e sala colazione inesistente Si è dovuto mangiare in Stanza per due giorni per mancanza di spazio.
Inoltre sono stati detratti 350 Usd quale caparra per eventuali danni senza alcun preavviso Cosa che avrebbero dovuto esplicitare al momento del check in

title: Excelente ubicación. Habitaciones cómodas y desayuno espectacular. Kosher friendly
text:
El hotel es muy cómodo por su ubicación (pocas cuadras de times square, y del subte) media cuadra de la 5ta av. Cuenta con un lobby ameno.
La habitación que teníamos era una suite con un sofa cama y una king size, el tamaño era reducida pero correcto. El sofa generaba una "división" y se sentía como dos ambientes. Hay una mesa pequeña que se puede comer, microondas y heladera. 
El personal es agradable (principalmente el BellMan que se encuentra en la semana y los sábados, que su nombre comenzaba con D.. no lo recuerdo exactamente) que fue muy amable y me respetó y acompaño a mi habitación para abrirme la puerta en Shabat. 
El desayuno es muy bueno! Hay de todo para comer, comida caliente, omelettes hechos en el momento, variedad de panes. Para mí que como Kosher habia pan, queso Philadelphia, cereales, variedad de frutas. De 10!!
También hay un happy hour de merienda, en la que hay tragos, bebidas libre, y comida y fruta para picar.

Para alguien que come kosher es muy cómoda la zona, ya que a media cuadra se encuentra Pizza Bravo y Mr.Brodway.

Lo único incómodo y malo es que el servicio de mucama lo hacían muy tarde (aproximadamente 16hs), lo que nos interrumpía el momento de descanso y había que salir para que hagan la habitación

title: Très belle expérience
text:
Litterie de grande qualité, serviettes de toilettes neuves et très propres. Belle chambre avec très belle vue sur l'Empire State Building. 
Petit déjeuner copieux, varié et bon.
Personnel à l'écoute et réactif

title: Otel iyi fakat resepsiyon çok  zayif
text: Otel genel anlamda iyi. Odalar temiz ve cok buyuk olmasa da yeterli büyüklükte. Otelin geneli bakımlı. Konumu gerçekten çok iyi. Kahvaltı oldukça başarılı. Otelin en büyük eksiği başlıkta da yazdığım resepsiyon. Otele giriş yapmak için resepsiyona geliyorsunuz ne bir merhaba ne bir selam. Ödemeniz gereken ücret bile söylenmiyor, sadece kredi kartı isteniyor. Otel hakkında hiç bir bilgi verilmeden oda kartı veriliyor.  Her seyi sormanız lazım. Sorularınızı cevaplamak resepsiyon çalışanlarına resmen sıkıntı veriyor. Yine de yukarıda saydığım diğer sebeplerden dolayı oteli tavsiye ediyorum.
